content:
Posted: June 13, 2014
												I've had my heart broken several times in my life. Once, on Christmas Day 1989, I eagerly ran downstairs and gasped at the sight of what was clearly a crudely but lovingly wrapped skateboard. A skateboard that I had wanted ever since I had seen Marty McFly cruise through the streets of Hill Valley as a stowaway behind an unsuspecting SUV driver. A skateboard with a custom deck, with artwork that would cause my fellow skaters to shout "rad". A skateboard whose wheels would send me gliding across the streets as I headed for the nearest half-pipe. A skateboard of majestical proportion.I grabbed it, and with shaking hands and a heart beating against my chest, I tore that festive wrapping as hard as I could. Through an intricate web of sticky tape, ribbon and ever expanding wrapping paper, I dug through. Years later, I wondered that this is what Andy in The Shawshank Rdemption must have felt like as he dragged hinself through the tunnels. My own redemption was in sight. My prize was near. Finally, the last shred of packaging fell away to the floor. And there it was... a plastic skateboard from the local store. With stiff plastic wheels. And a picture of a clown on the deck. That's what playing Aliens: Colonial Marines felt like.

number of helpful: 764 of 835 people (91%) found this review helpful20 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 2, 2015
												MORALS AND IDEALSAs most of you know, this game was basically announced as an AAA game with next gen graphics, and ended up a (at the time) bug-ridden B-list game with last gen graphics. Many people were understandably upset about this, especially those who pre-ordered. If you don't wish to do business with a company that found itself in a lawsuit claiming false advertising, more power to you for your ideals.THE GAMEI played this in Jan 2015 after some massive patches, and after the game was on sale for $5. At this point, I experienced the game as practically bug-free, except for the astonishing fact that the game still won't let you go: When I quit the game, it is immediately restarted (wrong exit code or something?). Restarting Steam too helps, but it's a bit ridiculous. On the upside: no game-breaking or fun-killing bugs while I played.STORY MODEThe game is pretty straight forward in that there are no optional side-missions, and the level design is such that in campaign mode, it is extremely rare that there is more than one way to get from A to B. Gameplay-wise, it's a squad shooter in that your avatar is hardly ever alone, yet you cannot give orders to non-player squadmates. The campaign is open to 1-4 players, but incomprehensibly, players can't configure their avatar; they're assigned a premade one even though only one of them appears in cut scenes or has any dialog. The loadout however is still configurable.VERSUSTwo teams of 1-5 players each can face off in various aliens vs marines modes; for this, you can configure the look and loadout of your avatar (including male/female - there's also a Movie Characters DLC with 4 chars none of which is female. Maybe Ripley was too expensive to license, but where's my Vasquez??).CHALLENGESApart from Steam Achievements (some of which are for the sole story DLC, Stasis Interrupted), ACM features challenges. Proceeding in the story or meeting challenges results in more customization options (some purely cosmetic, others ways to make the various guns more powerful, though squads with players on different levels seem unproblematic).These suffer from having a required order -- you won't get credit for a challenge that isn't up yet. Also, there are challenges that require other players outside the "Versus" challenge category, implying that as a single player, you can't even finish the "General" category. Meh.You'll revisit a lot of the story for the Challenges/Collectibles, but since you can only jump to Chapters but not savepoints within them, you'll waste a lot of time getting to the scene you need.THE GRAPHICSThe graphics are serviceable. The texture resolution could be a little bit higher, but then, it could always be a little bit higher. Considering that this is after a 4 GB patch that included better textures, I'm scared to imagine what the game may have looked like at release. Now however, it does its job; as long as you don't expect Alien: Isolation, you might be satisfied; just keep in mind that this is Dead Island to Isolation's Dying Light. There are some enbseries presets for this game that amplify bloom and color grade in favor of blues, as you would expect from an '80s movie -- especially Aliens. (Apparently, one preset even adds a "VHS look".) I find this to slightly improve the graphics, but only so much -- nothing like the drastic results I had with presets for e.g. Fallout New Vegas etc; it may or may not be your thing.THE SETWe meet pretty much everything you'd want from an Aliens game in ACM: loaders, dropships, the Sulaco, various types of alien including the queen, and hey, you get the shoot the pulse rifle. (I'm easily satisfied that way.) You also get to deploy auto-guns, use the smartgun, etc. You get to shoot aliens in Hadley's Hope on LV-426, in the space jockey ship, on the Sulaco, and various other beloved sets. You pay for this with some inconsistencies -- some understandable and even welcome  (for you to frolic in Hadley's Hope, they had to downgrade its destruction level from vaporized to condemned); some incomprehensible (the dropship and consequently the APC look subtly, but noticeably too narrow, and so does the Sulaco's hangar). I remember Aliens very, very fondly (while at the same time not being enough of a fanatic to notice that e.g. the individual crewmembers' cryo-sleep booths on the Sulaco weren't in the same order as in the film, or that someone's locker opened to the wrong side), so for me, the set alone was worth the price of admission. (The engineer's ship is a bit boring, but then, we never really saw much except for the space jockey and the eggs in Alien, either. It's big and empty, and I guess it's supposed to be.)THE STORYThe story isn't outright horrible, and it ticks the expected boxes (some people get "impregnated", some people get cocooned, lots of people and lots of aliens die; the marines are good, the company is bad, and the usual gear is used etc.), but it is hardly material for a movie that might stand alongside Aliens. The main plot motivates a lot of shooting, and traversal from one set piece to the next, but does little for me beyond that; the story ends very suddenly, giving away what might have been an emotionally satisfactory coda; and it can be a little non-obvious in the heat of battle which of the identical twin ships your captain is on at any given moment. It's not horrible, but it could have been so much more. It could, arguably, also have been longer, with the main campaign clocking in at less than 10 hours.Some plot points are cleared up in the prequel DLC "Stasis, interrupted", thus continuing the worrying trend where you have to pay extra for closure as it's no longer part of the main game (cf. "Broken Steel" for "Fallout 3", Tina's DLC for Borderlands 2).VERDICTSo, is it justified?As an excuse to revisit beloved sets, it certainly is. As an excuse to do much shooting with fun guns, it is, too. As plot and production values go, it is a wasted opportunity, though in all fairness not on the level of Alien^3 which instead of taking us to earth, or the home planet of the aliens, or that of the engineers, gave us the stakes of the lives of few dozen ugly killers and rapists, and then didn't let us root for the alien because the SFX looked so pitiful.While I'm normally a "strictly co-op" girl, some of the vs maps and modes were surprisingly fun. Due to the lack of maps, you'll need DLC quickly: Bug Hunt is a fun new mode with 3 maps and a friendly community.If you're an online player, factor BH into your budget; it's where the game shines. If you're strictly single-player, get Stasis Interrupted instead, to beef up the very short story mode of the main game.If you want to shoot fun guns in familiar, beloved sets and you can get the game on sale, ACM should be fun for a few hours -- as long as you don't expect a AAA title with brilliant writing and next-gen graphics, which I'm sure nobody does after the massive backlash. It's definitely a can-have, but no must-have. In the end, it's down to whether you believe that after the massive backlash and financial losses, the industry got the point that all the foul play of the early days wasn't on, or whether you believe we still need to make a point. In the former case, you may want to curb your expectations and give it a go; in the latter, you'll be right to give it a pass.Steam forces me to tick yes or no, so I'll go with "no", by a whisker, simply because while I had fun, it falls short of its announcement, there could have been more multi-player maps, more/better plots and graphics, etc. -- the patched version is never horrible, it's actually fun enough, but it's also noticeably lacking, just a bit, but in every category. "No" to lack of closure, "no" the charade around its publication, "no" because of what could've been, and now likely won't ever come to pass, or at least not for a very long time.

content:
Posted: March 23, 2016
												When this came out it was terrible. Absolutely terrible.   If you were a fan of the Movie, you could get alot out of it just for the nerd-out factor of being on-set, but other than that the gameplay was like a bad COD rip-off, the aliens were NOT scary or hard, and the WY Mercs were frustratingly good at soaking up bullets. The graphics were occasionaly pause-and-look-worthy but most of it was a letdown.I have now been modding the game for 2 months and I am up to version 4 of my mod at this time.I've fixed alot of the graphical issues with how the game was configured, removed Console related restrictions, and set things to match todays computers (this is an Unreal game). I've also spent time with some of the cooler set-pieces to make them even cooler.I have reworked the Xenomorph AI to be fast, smart, sneaky and deadly, the Merc AI to be less robot like and more vulnerable and the Ally AI better at combat and positioning.Weapons have all been reworked to feel like real world weapons and more varied and powerful.How you move, and how the first person view functions has been changed to give a better sense of motion and urgency, the HUD no longer shifts around the screen moving your cross-hair, and you can turn the whole HUD off.You get the Smart-Gun about 5 times now. That alone makes the game heaps better!If you are a fan of Aliens and see this on sale, buy it, install my mod and enjoy a fantastic Aliens experience

content:
Posted: January 23, 2014
												Are you a fan of the Alien franchise? Are you one of the many gamers that eagerly awaited the release of this game since it's announcement in 2004? If yes to the above, prepare to be severely disappointed.Aliens: Colonial Marines is a first person shooter that acts as a sequel to the 1986 sci-fi classic, Aliens. The game follows a USCM Marine named Winter, along with his utterly boring and unmemorable companions. The plot has Winter and the Marines of the USS Sephora returning to LV426 to investigate the disappearance of Ripley and her companions from the original film.The story of this game is a senseless mess, and at times, makes no sense whatsoever. A character that was explained dead in the film makes an appearance in this game ( his magical reappearance isn't explained at all by the way) and ridiculous events will occur to keep the game moving at Michael Bay pace. None of the characters are remotely likeable or memorable, and they certainly frustrated me to the point of turning the game off. All of these problems could have been fixed if more attention had been paid to the writing process of this game. Or the whole game for that matter.The gameplay doesn't fare much better than the writing of this game. Most of the guns feel like airsoft equivalents, and the shooting in question feels tedious and lacks tension. The enemy AI is woefully poor, and most of the time you'll face off against human enemies rather than the xenomorphs themselves. The level design is boring and linear, and all the indoor locations feel like the same grey corridor you went through just a few moments ago. The outside levels impress you at first, until you realise they are just as linear and restricting as the indoor ones.This game's only saving grace is its multiplayer mode. There are a variety of game modes, many of which are creative and innovative for the FPS genre; but although these are alot of fun, they're let down somewhat by the overall poor gameplay mechanics. It's a shame this doesn't provide the quality that'd easily help it compete with the likes of Natural Selection 2.As an Aliens fan, I am very disappointed. Save your money eveyone, there's an awesome Alien game coming out in 2014 called Alien: Isolation. Save your money. 4 / 10.

content:
Posted: December 1, 2014
												If you meet the following criteria, you will possibly enjoy this game:1) You paid $5 or less for this.2) You only bought it for the single player campaign.3) You can overlook that the game did not meet its launch expectations.4) You are a fan of the Aliens franchise.5) As a fan of the franchise you can overlook many of the implausible settings the game uses.If you can pass all that, then you have a chance at enjoyment.*Spoilers*The game is basically sticking you in the role of a Colonial Marine and having you retread the sights of LV-426.  You'll walk the halls of the U.S.S Sulaco, you will land at Hadley's Hope, you will explore Operations and in the end you will even visit the Engineer ship where the franchise began.  Each area is pretty much a giant easter egg filled with tiny easter eggs.  You'll stumble over the spent sentry guns from the Aliens director's cut, one still containing 10 rounds.  You'll find the room where Burke, Carter J. met his cowardly end.  The medical bay where Ripley and Newt were attacked by face-huggers is here as well, with overturned beds and bullet-shattered glass.  While crawling through the sewers you can even find the head of Newt's doll that we last saw floating sadly on the water.That said, a lot of plausibility of those easter eggs was sacrificed in the name of coolness.  Sure, it's cool to pick up Hicks' shotgun but why is "No Fate" carved into it?  Sure I get it, same actor but why would Dwayne Hicks scratch that on his darling for close encounters?As far as the gameplay itself goes, it is clunky but passable.  You will either overlook it because you like Aliens that much or you will turn the game off after 5 minutes.  Or perhaps you will do both - I myself played for 5 minutes before putting it down for a year.  When I played it again I beat it all the way through just out of curiosity.  Found myself slightly entertained though, I admit, more by the settings and the little things than the actual story.  On that note, the story - if you have played an Aliens game or watched an Aliens movie than you know the story already.  Weyland-Utani are bad guys, they want the alien and will stop at nothing to do their experiments.  Nothing new here.This is basically a game for fans of Aliens who can also overlook the disrespect towards that very movie's canon, shown over and over again via easter eggs.  If you fit the bill than I recommend this title to you!

content:
Posted: April 14, 2014
(This review contains major spoilers.)This one really hurts.As a lifelong fan of the Alien franchise, I've had to put up with some terrible uses of the license. The reason I got into this series in the first place was because of Alien 3. I've played through the janky platformer/shoot-em-up versions of Aliens on some of the oldest console. I even suffered through the 2004 Alien Vs. Predator film and Prometheus.Yet there was one game I was absolutely convinced would be great - Aliens: Colonial Marines. On the surface, it seemed like such a sure-win proposition: Gearbox Software helming an FPS that pays tribute to all the militaristic aspects of the Alien universe, wrapped up in the kind of quality they're known for. You can't miss with that, right?What a shame, then, that the final product is such a mishmash of ideas. I know about the accounts of development - the multiple developers all having a hand in it, the half-baked storyline that was rewritten continuously through production, the lies and disingenuous marketing - but for all that, is there any good to be found in the game?Colonial Marines puts you into the (combat) boots of Cpl. Christopher Winter, an everyman protagonist who is part of the crew of a combat warship called the Sephora. The ship is dispatched to intercept the USS Sulaco after receiving a distress call from Cpl. Dwayne Hicks, one of the survivors of Aliens. Sent into the Sulaco to rendezvous with other members of the Sephora Marines, Winter not only discovers another xenomorph infestation, but also the influence of Weyland-Yutani, who are working to breed a queen for their own needs.That's all the plot you need to remember, because the ensuing levels become an intermittent battle with both xenomorphs and W-Y mercs in Call of Duty-like shooting galleries via locations from the film.I consider this game to be an "interesting failure". There are some interesting concepts and ideas that could have been notable or innovative in a better game, but they're lost in a messy hodgepodge of janky-looking graphics, terrible AI and weak story hooks. And even worse, this is apparently considered canon (that is, an official part of the Aliens storyline) by 20th Century Fox, despite not making a lick of sense.This truly looks like a game that could have been made in the late 90's. In fact, it might even be built from the scraps of the supposedly-cancelled PS2 version that was supposed to be released way back in the early 2000s. All the worst vices of FPS games from that era are on full display here. Health and armor pickups (pick up seven chestpieces in a row to get max armor). A weird hybrid between "only being able to carry a limited amount of weapons" and "every weapon is on you at the same time anyway" that feels like it was taken from Duke Nukem Forever. Enemies that make a beeline towards you and act like morons in melee combat. Enemies that have health pickups explode like a pinata out of their body when they die. The list goes on.The characters aren't any better. Any sense of tension or drama in regards to whether Bella can be saved is moot, as you find out she's been impregnated with a facehugger even before you meet her. O'Neil veers between being alternately whiny and arrogant, and his bored facial impressions do nothing to endear him to the player (even though he's your main squadmate for the majority of the game). The sole standout is Ashley Burch's performance as Reid, a pilot who progresses from using clunky expospeak to being one of the few (the only?) supporting teammate who feels like they've had some legitimate development and you can understand their motivations.Then there's Corporal Dwayne Hicks himself, who has apparently returned from the dead. He's adopted a dour and sarcastic demeanor due to his experiences between the film and the game, but I can't tell if that's legitimate character development or Michael Biehn being bored. He handwaves his apparent survival with a nonsensical explanation that it's a "much longer story", and even the explanation we do get in the Stasis Interrupted DLC is at odds with just about everything we saw in Alien 3.That's not to say it's all bad, though. Going through the various environments and finding audio logs, collectible weapons and Easter eggs is a treat, even if it's short-lived. There are a few moments that evoke a far better game, like the "Raven" level, where you're forced to stealth your way past aliens that explode if you make too much noise. There's also patches that greatly increase the difficulty level, finally putting it up to the level of a modern shooter.For all that, though, they still horribly squandered the license. The new alien types look like something that were ripped from the Kenner toyline, without any sense of originality or thought process (you can't tell me that a Alien faction multiplayer mode wouldn't have been better over the bog-standard gametypes we got). The use of voice actors from the film in the game and its DLC (including Mark Ralston, Lance Henriksen, Al Matthews and Biehn) feels half-hearted and unappreciated. There's all these references to events from the film, but it's mired in mediocrity and/or so easy to miss that you don't care half the time. The lethargic and floaty animations (on both sides) take you out of the action and make you focus on the bugs, janky graphics and weak gunplay.In the end, Aliens: Colonial Marines is a terrible use of the license, and is only worth picking up if you find it on sale. I wouldn't recommend buying this game at full price.

Posted: November 24, 2015
Flawed & unfinished+ Franchise-loyal locations & set designs, virtually all are well-designed+ Several areas of the game boast a solid & tense atmosphere+ Great soundtrack & sound deisgn; most of the sound effects come direct from the films+ Weapon personalization is extensive; game is successful in making for a satisfying experience when unlocking & implementing features+ Collectibles are scattered throughout the environment; audio logs & legendary weapons (tips of the hat from the film) are the only ones that feel worth the effort, however- Aliens are like rigid automotons, with seemingly barren AI- Poor story & writing; several character actions are devoid of reasoning, & the 'plot twist' was shallow at best- Terrible characters & personalities, even for an FPS- Allies' behavior in combat is universally atrocious- Xenomorphs are little better than a side-note, with most of the game's enemies being humans- Limited replayability- Multiplayer appears to be effectively dead- Myriad bugs & glitches, seemingly never addressedLockeProposal's Big Day OutCommunity GroupCurator PageSerious Steam Reviews subReddit

content:
Posted: October 24, 2014
												This is difficult for me to say, but it has to be said. I've loved the alien franchise since i was 4 years old (26 now) so for me to say no on this hits home quite hard on this one. I shall explain why through pros, cons. and overall at the end. Before i start, let me say this. I Recommend this game but only for the die hard alien franchise fans and people that love playing the role of a colonial marine and also only if you are prepared to see the worst 'official' canon to a franchise in history (Seriously, the storyline is that bad).Now, onto the Pros and Cons.PROS:1. It's in the alien universe. Between colonies being based on moons, exploration into space, and the fact that the alien is such a terrifying creature by nature it's fun to have a go at killing them. And your a Colonial Marine with a Pulse Rifle and array of weaponry. Cool!2. Revisiting places form the 2nd film is cool (Even though the blast would of cleared everywhere that the game is set.)3. The music and sounds are true to the film and do slightly absorb you into the atmosphere (Where there is any).4. The multiplayer (If you can find a game) is actually quite entertaining and fun. It's slightly more biased to the alien side in my opinion, however it is fun. It is truly the saving grace of this game.5. Stasis Interupted and Bug Hunt are actually quite good pieces of DLC. Although many argue Bug Hunt should of been part of the actual game and not DLC it's actually worth the price (Fans + New Game = Money money money)  6. The Co-op Campaign is actually decent fun with friends/randoms.7. If your a massive aliens fan, you bare the game out (Pulse Rifles baby! lol). You go on the Sulaco, LV-42, the Derelict e.t.c. which is pretty neat.CONS: 1. The storyline (from the viewpoint of a hardcore alien franchise view) is pitiful and pathetically executed at best. It's disgusting to think that gearbox could do what they did to the franchise. 2. The gameplay is basic - it's a 'too linear' shooter which has nothing original or new to offer the aliens series or gamers in general.3.  The mulltiplayer died after 2 weeks of release. This was the games saving grace (As mentioned in pros) The only surviving Multiplayer is lingering among steam groups and they are only hosted here and there at best. 4. Nothing like it's demo trailer. This has been said over and over again website to website forum to forum - but really when it was released and your expecting this kick♥♥♥♥♥segment and it turns into poo...come on gearbox.5. Graphically it looks good...if it was released in 2007. This really isn't a pro or con, but come on SEGA/gearbox, the hell!6. It's such a cop out to the franchise. The alien is surposed to be this creature of terrifying appearance and presence, yet you do not feel scared by it at all. I get it, it's a shooter, but...the alien...and also the different types of alien are so bland (Drone Spitter Lurker) - i mean come on, AYFKM (Are You F**ing Kidding Me) SEGA/Gearbox.7.Given it's development history, it's no surprise that the game was in shambles. Between going from one company to another company to another company not all the blame can be put on gearbox, just 90% of it.8. To this day, i still say that the lack of dedicated servers are what lead to the true demise for the multiplayer. People copped the lack of authentic weaponry for the marines, the lack of not feeling like the same alien no matter the class, but some dedicated servers guys!! They could of at least done this for us.9. Sweet lord, the AI is absolute rubbish. I mean it's Daikatana meets COD AI. It's just.....ugh. The AI in the 1999 AVP was better than this.10. If your like me, and paid full price on release day for this game, you felt jipped. OVERALL:If you like/love the aliens franchise, you'll bare this game. It's worth $10, The DLC is great, the multiplayer is fun, but there are so many drawbakcs that it will halter the good time you have on it. P.S. - F*** you Gearbox. Eat a D*** Sandwich Randy Pitchford.

												Aliens: Colonial Marines is awful.This review is written after playing 'hard'... yeah it wasn't that hard.As a big fan of Alien(s), Colonial Marines sounded like it could've been awesome. But in the end what we got was another generic modern FPS. Aim-down-sights? Check. Fighting against generic humans? Check. ♥♥♥♥♥♥ regening-health? Somewhat check. Boring story? Check.The gameplay is repetitive, boring, generic, and painful. Like shooting at bland enemies with weapons, that sound like♥♥♥♥♥♥ in a bland level that offers so little in terms of design that in order to incentivize exploration the developers had to place pointless collectibles like dogtags, audio logs, and 'legendary weapons'?! (HA! Gorman's pistol and Frost's flamethrower are considered legendary weapons... like most people would even know who Frost is XD. Not to forget Gorman is far from anyones favourite Aliens character.) If you like any of this stupid♥♥♥♥♥♥ you'll love CM. But I don't!The AI in this game is garbage. Xenos just sprint in a straight line at you. Sound fun? Sound challenging? It isn't. Xenos'll even sometimes just stand in the middle of a room, staring at you, doing nothing. Great... not like the human enemies are much more challenging.Yes, you heard me right. You trade shots behind bland cover with bland, generic, human soldiers. At least half of the game is spent fighting these guys. Instead of... well... you know... THE XENOMORPHS.This game is way too easy. Did I die? Sure. But was it hard? No. Like I said before, the AI is stupid. Since the Aliens just run at you there is no challenge, just click on the bad guys a few time.You may be asking: "What do you mean by '♥♥♥♥♥♥ regening-health? Somewhat check'?"Well... You have 3 health bars, and each health bar can regen, but it can't regen above it-self. So let's say you are at half-health (in the second bar), you will regen the second bar full, but you won't regen the third bar. You can pick up medkits to regen lost bars. This is the same system from the ♥♥♥♥♥♥ AvP3. And yes, it sucks♥♥♥♥♥So how is the story?!So Colonial Marines takes place after Alien 3; and once again Weyland-Yutani are stupid (SHOCKING?! RIGHT?! It isn't like at this point in the series this must be like the fourth time they've failed at using the xenos... if we count Alien: Isolation of course). But I'll start from the beginning. So Hicks (voiced by Michael Biehn, who sounds as bored as♥♥♥♥♥♥ sends a distress call after the events of Aliens. So then a bunch of marines from the USS Sephora or some♥♥♥♥♥♥like that (This story is so forgettable so bare with me I don't remember much) are sent to investigate. They find the Sulaco, over LV-426, and are sent over to the Sulaco. They find the cryotubes holding Ripley, Newt, Hicks, and Bishop, which are ejected. (Oh yeah I forgot to mention that the Sulaco went over to Fury-161 then the pods were ejected. Then the Sulaco went back to LV-426 because we have to go to LV-426... Yeah this game's story is just ♥♥♥♥ing stupid) So then of course (SHOCKINGLY) we find out the Sulaco is infested with Xenomorphs. I won't spoil anything but just know the game's story is painfully predictable and boring. (kinda like... Alien: Isolation)Now does this mean there isn't any good parts of this♥♥♥♥♥♥teir game? No. I do actually like the part where you go into the derelict from Alien (Even if you do fight humans in this part), The Egg cargo hold is huge (And Awesome!)! You also get to see the jockey! (Which I mean... we've seen a thousand times in AvPClassic and AvP2... but it's still cool). I also enjoyed the level where you get to explore Hadley's Hope (even if that makes no sense... because wasn't it blown up?).But the negatives outweight the postives. The 3 dollars I bought this for, during a sale, wasn't even worth it. I haven't had the chance to play Multi-player yet, but I doubt it'll be anything special. The only game based off of Aliens I think is worse than this is AvP 2010.I can't even justify this game to hardcore fans of Alien(s). If you want a better FPS based off of Aliens pick up Aliens vs Predator Classic 2000 on Steam, not this generic modern-day garbage (or maybe even AvP2 if you can find a copy, just for the single-player though, the multi-player sucks in that game).♥♥♥♥ Aliens: Colonial Marines.-MandatoryAlcatraz

content:
Posted: June 29, 2016
												I bought this on the 360 when it came out, and it was an unplayable mess.I bought it on steam when I saw how much Gearbox upgraded on the PC that would never make it to a console. I got it on sale, so I didn't feel like I was getting cheated too badly, having to buy it twice. After the initial patches, it was a playable mess.Then the support dried up. The servers began to wither and die. Gearbox forgot about the game. Sega went on to release the admittedly and infinitely superior Alien: Isolation and forgot all about this little space shooter. So did I, for a time. I let it fall to the wayside, despite modders over on ModDB like Cilitbang, who managed to remove mercs from the Bug Hunt DLC. I just sort of...stopped playing. I moved on.But TemplarGFX didn't.Version 4.5 of his mod is a light in the darkness. It is a revelation. The game went from horrendous, poorly rendered crap to a beautiful landscape and smooth textures. The AI went from being the dumbest creatures to ever exist to ACTUALLY hunting you. You know, like a xenomorph would. The gameplay tweaks, the balancing, the improved difficulty, the visuals, everything about this game once you have installed the TemplarGFX 4.5 mod and Cilitbang's Bug Hunt (No Mercs/No Dino Heads/Welding Enabled) mod is what the game SHOULD have been at launch. A little sad that it's taken us four years to get here, but here we are. Finally.If it is on sale, snag this one. Hop over to moddb (dot) com and look for the TemplarGFX mod. Look for the Cilitbang Bug Hunt Mod. Install them. Tweak your .ini. Blow♥♥♥♥♥♥up.If you are feeling really frisky, download Cilitbang's ReShade profile for Templar GFX and your screen gets transformed into the helmet cam just like in the film.3/10 Console version5/10 without mods8.5/10 with mods.9/10 with mods and friends that actually play Bug Hunt.

content:
Posted: November 2, 2014
												Well OK, I just did - I played this whole thing from the start to finish and here is my verdict. If you´re not an ULTRA BADASS Alien Fan don´t waste time and the money for torturing yourself. I have to admit that in the beginning the game was fun. Really it was but the game has some technical issues. I don´t wanna talk about the graphical issues we all know about. Sometimes the level design is scarier than the Xenos themnself. The Weyland mercs are just a pain in the♥♥♥♥♥!! I don´t mind fighting against Xenos all the time, even if they look always the same that is what Aliens the movie was about. There were no mercs that look like a cheap copy of Half-Life2 Combines... Some levels are so long and boring just the achievements kept me moving on. Yeah the game features achievements lots of them some are quite easy to "achieve" some are insanely hard to get. The sound is quite good and sometimes the sounds down in the sewers are quite frightning. The Aliens in the sewers by the way are just a bad joke. They walk with a limp - that´s weird. I like how they crawl along the ceiling and the floor but you better not turn your flashlight on down in the sewers - this part of the game is just a joke and not funny at all. The voice acting from the main characters is quite cool - Bishop sounds best IMHO. Steam shows me a play time of about 18 hours I haven´t checked the time before I started my playthrough but I think it must have been about 6 to 7 hours I needed.  In the end I have to say that I will not reccommend the game due to the many flaws I encountered during the playthrough. Thanks for reading!  If you like this review please join my retro games group on steam: http://steamcommunity.com/groups/retrogames8090

content:
Posted: September 8, 2013
												Mediocre in every possible way.I heard lots of bad things about this, before i bought it on sale. Did i regret buying it? no. Is it really that bad? no.But sloppy execution, bugs, glitches and bad writing are breaking it's neck.I mean...how hard can it be to do a decent story with Marines vs Aliens in it?Well, this story doesn't contribute much to the franchise...actually...nothing really at all.The Story is not really worth mentioning.You will visit some locations from the second movie (which brings back some nostalgia) and the atmosphere was captured pretty well (throughout the whole game).The levels sometimes feel, like they were taken out from the movie (not graphical wise unfortunatey).Graphics are decent, no masterpiece, but good enough.The lightning is pretty well done in my opinion and does a lot to create a threatening atmosphere.The gamplay is...well "okay".If you fight against xenomorphs, it can be pretty intense. Fighting against soldiers from Wayland Yutani? Boring as hell...feels like any other shooter than an alien shooter.And seriously? Red-dot sight on the pulse rifle? Who had this stupid idea?Same goes with being promoted within the game to higher ranks as a Marine...All that totally breaks immersion, together with spawning A.I. comrades next to you, if you reach a certain point of the level and they are too far away.Anyway, as the gameplay is pretty okay and the atmosphere is good, you could give this game a try (if it's on sale) when you like FPS and Aliens.Man...just imagine how good this could have been if they had polished it, and created a better story....missed chance.

content:
Posted: May 31, 2016
												EDITED to reflect the 4.5 mini-mod. See below.I bought this steaming pile when it first came out, and even with sub-basement-level expectations it was a letdown. As of a few days ago, I'd clocked about two hours worth of five-minute sessions over four years.TemplarGFX's mod changes everthing.  Not only does the game now look amazing (no small thing in a movie license title) but battles with the xenos have gone from Unplayably Stupid to Flat-Out Thrilling. Turns out even fighting mercs is fun when you're mowing them down with a smartgun, which now appears in the game five times. And the large-scale outdoor battles really, really shine.If you've played this game already, the strategy's changed. A lot. Your motion tracker is no longer a cosplay prop, it's your new best friend. Watch as enemies circle the map looking using every vent, crawlspace and bulkhead to flank and scare the crap out of you.Sure, the story's still dumb as a box of dead facehuggers. Yep, it's still basically Borderlands in Aliens drag.Except now it's FUN. 9/10, would FUN againEDIT: I played through the campaign the first time without the 4.5 mini-mod on Rookie difficulty and it was really, really hard. (Which I loved. Check out my hours logged on Dark Souls.) Turns out this 2nd mod actually fixes the friendly AI, and with it the game balance. Squadmates are actually useful (if still poorly written), and the xenos will respond in kind instead of always immediately zeroing in on you. Fixes the difficulty, too; I did a victory lap on rookie and it was a fast-paced arcade-style blast, then tested soldier and it was plenty tough for my paltry skill level. Most importantly, the infamous Gravity Well sequence was playable without rage quits. I've added a star to reflect this, and will probably review again when v5 comes out.

content:
Posted: October 13, 2014
												Out of curiosity to see how bad this really is, I got it for $5, played it, & have now lost a lot of respect for Gearbox. It is easily one of the worst games I have ever played. I see why it got bad reviews and it deserves every one. This is a unacceptable tragedy. If it were given another name and marketed as a low priced generic shooter, it would still be sickening. My advice, forget about this even if it goes f2p and play the Aliens vs Predator game from 2010 which is decent, around a 6.5/10. This game was $50 or more when it was released back in Feb 2014, and now as of August 2014, only six months later, it is only $15 and you can find it constantly on sale for only $5. That is how horrible this game is. It is the prom night dumpster baby of Aliens games.Holy ♥♥♥♥ this game is something else. It would be a decent game with some fun shooter elements if it weren't one of the buggiest, most poorly coded, generic games of all time. Example of its incredibly poor design: fighting through a level in the dlc Stasis Interrupted (which despite some people saying that it is much better than the regular game, it sucks equally as much as the normal game does) with no health packs, then when the next level loads, there are 4 health packs at the beginning which is completely pointless because it gives you full health at the start of a level and you don't even need them because you have to walk a ways to even see any enemies. What they did to this game is laughable and becomes more of a joke the longer you play. I have alt+tabbed out of the game to amend this review probably about thirty times, each time adding more and more bad things about the game, never once to add anything positive. It just gets worse and worse the more you play. One of the biggest flaws and one of the dumbest coding problems I have ever seen in any game in my life, and actually this is the only game I have ever seen do this since I started PC gaming back in 1997, is that when you close the game, it instantly relaunches all by itself... lol. The only way to close it is to alt+tab out, run task manager with ctrl+alt+del, and force close steam then force close aliens........ what a dumb sick joke. In-game is glitchy too. Achievements reset for no reason. I was near the end of a mission and had 3/5 melee kills for a achievement to get 5 in one mission, which is hard as fk since melee sucks bad and you can't get close to anything without dying quickly because only a couple of bullets or bites from a alien kills you, and I died and when it reloaded me at a previous checkpoint the achievement progress reset... So I got 3 melee kills again from the checkpoint, died, and they reset again...I am skipping every cutscene because not only do the character models have god awful movement like puppets and their mouths look like puppet mouths, and the voice acting is some of the worst of all time and the script is one of the worst of all time, the game is just so generally awful I just want to hurry up and finish. That and the cutscenes also perform horribly, very stuttery and jerky.Friendly AI in single player is broken. Sometimes they follow me to an objective, sometimes they don't. I know it is broken because many times I will be going to an objective alone and when I die and restart at the checkpoint, the marines will then come with me, basically letting me know that they should have came the first time but didn't because it is broken. Enemy AI is almost non-existent. They charge at you blindly or stand still and fire.The game engine is very generic. It feels EXACTLY like the Blood 2 game engine which is very old and horrible. It is also only about 6 hours long (thank God) which is a 100% ripoff when it first came out, and even still at $5 since the game sucks balls and you will not find even one online game going at any time, ever. You need to go to video options first thing and turn the field of view option all the way up because anything less is way too low. The pulse rifle is gargantuan and takes up the entire bottom-right 1/4 of the screen, and then some, even on the highest field of view. That's right, changing the field of view does not change the weapon size lol. The pulse rifle takes up more of the screen than most giant rocket launchers do on some war games. You unlock all of the primary weapons quickly and they all suck nuts save for the pulse rifle and tactical shotgun. I bought the sawed-off double barreled shotgun extra for 99 cents and it is one of the worst weapons I have ever seen. It sounds like a BB gun when you fire it and while you are reloading it you get killed. You might unlock a few more later like maybe the flamethrower but who cares because the game sucks anyway. You die randomly and you die alot just because of how powerless you are to how extremely generic combat is and them flooding you with aliens. And the enemy AI is non-existent: they run straight at you with no thought or care in the world. The most laughable part of the game is when you die. The death animation on your guy is the worst I have ever seen. When you die it turns black and white, goes into third person, and shows you dying and the animation looks, every time, like a kid pulling the strings on a puppet flopping him around awkwardly. The Alien just gets in your face and gently swings his arm at you all prissy like "myeh!" then you die. Sometimes there isn't even a death animation; the screen just goes black and white and you are laying on the ground dead. And even when you have full armor and health, you can still die in a couple of hits from a alien. Dying in the game really only comes from trial and error. I have only ever died because of one single reason: being flooded with so many enemies to the point of not being able to reload fast enough to keep up then they get in close and I'm dead. On the second or third try though I get through it, but it is still the only reason you will die in this game. Zero skill is involved. You do NOT want to die because it will usually set you back pretty far and having to redo something in such a bad game is a cruel joke by the developers. It is a trend with all bad games: poor checkpointing. The checkpoint system is half broken as well: on mission 10 when you have to survive the attack of the queen, I died once and it put me back to the checkpoint, I died a second time and when it loaded it glitched me to the next checkpoint past the queen without having to beat her... I consider it a blessing. The way enemies gib is awful and looks very primitive and amateurish. The way they gib looks EXACTLY like Blood 2 and that is a game from 1998 and it blew hard. The sound and music are instantly forgettable. If you were listening to someone play and not watching, were it not for the sound of the pulse rifle and radar blip you would never know it was an Alien game. And unlike every other Alien game, the radar isn't on-screen. You have to hold down Q. Dead enemies sometimes get stuck in a doorway and start flipping out. I die constantly from the enemies just doing instant dmg whenever you are in view of them, instant massive dmg usually. One or two hits from any enemy wipes out the armor that you just scavenged for, and then your health drops very quickly as well. Ranged enemies with guns have pinpoint accuracy so your only hope is to run and dodge behind obstacles if there are any and close the gap to get close enough to hit them. Or stay back and snipe. Graphics suck bad, character animations suck bad, voice acting is God crap awful and their words don't match their mouths, effects are garbage, sounds are crap, and so on and so on. And when combat is this generic and dull it is very distracting.The fact that 54% of all the steam reviews for this game are positive just shows that there are a ton of easily impressed people out there and that you can't ever, ever trust the review system. A long review was needed to give this the bashing it deserves. 3.5/10

number of helpful: 70 of 100 people (70%) found this review helpful5 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: November 27, 2014
												The Aliens movie franchise stems back all the way to 1979. It spawned a 1986 sequel Aliens that gets regarded as one of the best sci-fi horror action movies of all time. Aliens: Colonial Marines is a first person action horror shooter that follows five new marines on Acheron (LV-426) after the Aliens movie. You'll take the roll of Winters fighting off both Xenomorph aliens and soldiers from Weyland Yutani ('the Company') as he goes from the spaceship Sulaco to the planetoid's surface, through Hadley's Hope and into the furthest reaches of the alien hive. The sound design, music and voice acting are high points to the experience. Music that feel straight from the Aliens film if not late 70s space travel movies. You'll visit scenes straight out of the Aliens movie even if a lot of it was blew up before your arrival. The effects, lighting, fog, sounds and atmosphere blend together to put you in a place that fits the Aliens franchise. The blue planetoid, the white sterile walls of 'the Company,' exhaust in the narrow corridors aboard the space ship and even the fog layer over greenish black resin made by the aliens. Luckily the 'video feed filter' can get turned off so you can see the game without having a grainy fuzz like in the movie. In cut scenes the game doesn't have the video feed filter, so why should you?Chained with you throughout the game are your allies. Sometimes none, sometimes one, and other times five of them. They'll do their best to kill enemies, but they're inefficient. Enemies will sometimes walk right by them and head straight for you. The best part about your allies is using them to distract enemy soldiers, so you can flank them. The game makes good use of flanking with cat and mouse maps. But not with the Xenomorphs, they're usually in hallways or out in the open with them running straight at you. Thankfully, your allies cannot die, since they're part of the story. When the enemies are dead, they'll always be ready to show you the way waiting at whatever door you're supposed to be at next. You can clip right through them, so they're never in the way.You have three bars of health in the game. Each bar regenerates unless you've lost the bar completely. Then you need med kits that give you full health. Over that you have armor that doesn't regenerate. You just need to find more armor lying around or from dead soldiers. Heavy soldiers drop full armors, so its easy enough to find it and lose it. Its a good system.You'll face off against a variety of different aliens. For the most part they'll climb on walls and ceilings. Then drop down and run at you or lunge a great distance. They can be deadly up close, but a shotgun blast takes them out. The rifles don't feel effective at all. There are acid spitters that stay away while spitting from a far. The lurkers are the intelligent ones. They'll use stealth to attack you. Climb through vents, disappear into the darkness and they take more damage. Then there are the Weyland Yutani soldiers. They can do everything you can do. Flank, hide, reload, shoot and throw a rare grenade your way. They drop random health, ammo and armor.The bosses are big and need you to outsmart them than just taking more damage. You'll fight one in a power loader, you'll outrun one torching all the doors behind you. The bull alien will chase you in circles, letting your allies shoot him in the back. Finally the queen is the most meh battle of them all. So meh I literally could clip through her and speed run the final battle of the game, doing all that was needed of me.For better or worse, the weapons are straight out of the Aliens movie. There is a variety of shotguns, pulse rifles, assault rifles, pistols, flame throwers and even the smart gun that tracks enemies to shoot. Throwable things like grenades are easily forgotten, because they need to be armed like a weapon and can't be quick thrown. To make throwables more forgettable is the fact that most weapons have alt fires. Assault rifles have incinerators, pulse rifles have grenade launchers and even those that don't can be upgraded later. There are a lot of upgrades for each weapon such as scopes, skins, alt fires, clips and so on. They unlock as you rank up from completing 'challenges.' These challenges are things like kill 20 enemies with any rifle. Get 5 melee kills in a single 'mission.' Headshot 5 enemies with the service pistol. They do switch things up, because otherwise I'd use a shotgun through the entire game. Damage > accuracy.By the end of the game you'll have an entire arsenal, complete with weapons found from characters in the movie. Each weapon has its own ammo so if you run empty on one shotgun, the pump handle might still have some shells. Since you have so many weapons, the game makes use of a weapon wheel. Every weapon has its own stats: Damage, accuracy, rate of fire and so on. Shotguns have more damage, but less accuracy. Pulse rifles have less damage, but high rate of fire. The problem is the rate of fire is weak, you can't just hold it. The gunfire will stop, forcing you to play in controlled bursts. The assault rifle will only shoot two bullets at once. Weapons can get upgraded mostly to increase accuracy, clip size and reload. The thing to most take into account is the accuracy stat. You need to aim to shoot with any accuracy. Not just that, because of the accuracy stat, you can shoot things head on and they have a chance of going straight through. To prove that, the game has DLC with a firing range. Aim straight on, fire and sometimes things just go through. It doesn't happen often, but when it does, it might kill you. Speaking of killing you. There is acid blood, but its never enough to kill you, even standing in it on the highest difficulty. What will really kill you is aliens clipping through you. Becoming you so your gun is outside of them. When you fire it will miss, because the alien has clipped through you. Since they can run faster than you. It caused frequent deaths.Its not all guns though. There are a few brief moments where you need to use stealth. First unarmed you'll have to quietly sneak past a new form of blind aliens that explode. Then you'll have to sneak past lights and sentries that will spot and shoot at you.Other glitches have been fixed with some patch a year into the game, but even when they were patched I still noticed glitches that had been fixed were still a problem. Nothing game breaking, just noticeable. Things like an alien coming off a wall and getting stuck in the floor. Getting hit by an alien while shooting only to have the gun still shooting. Texture popin was still here and there, mostly when reloading a level from a death. I guess its a way to speed up load times.The controls are simple for the most part. Aim, shoot, alt-fire, move, look, jump, squat and run. Use the D-pad for flashlight, grenade ready, weapon ready, pistol ready. There's a whole other button to switch between two weapons even if you can hold a dozen or so. Sometimes it didn't feel intuitive, but the game lets you bind keys and controls. While there is melee, it felt useless. Most things on soldier difficulty will easily kill you at close range. You also have a motion tracker, but it only feels useful when I was trying to find the location of the next checkpoint. Sure it tells you where enemy movement is, but when you can't use it and shoot it felt like a handicap. Plus, you hear a sound when you're in range of a new hostile.There is multiplayer, but there's nothing going on at this point without being scheduled. Overall, it was a good experience, even if its not the best first person shooter. While people call it the worst game of all time, it could have been much worse. The end left me with a sour taste. At the end of Star Wars, they blew up the Death Star and that was that. They didn't start the next movie and end it.

content:
Posted: June 18, 2014
												Genre - Sci-Fi FPSWell this is a game by Gearbox who bought us Borderlands. So to say I had high hopes would be an understatement. I love the Aliens films and had yet to find a good Aliens game unless there are also Predators involved that is. Unfortunately this game stayed true to form. The story mode is okay and you can play co-op but it is a game on rails (unlike Borderlands). There are upgrades you can earn for multiplayer deathmatch but most of the Aliens vs Marines games I played always ended up being one sided affairs with people just holding key points Zzzzzzzzzzz. Also the story doesn't really make sense (correct me if I'm wrong) when linked to the films. I think with a bit more thought and input from fans of the Aliens franchise this could have been vastly improved. This is a below average game for above average material.

content:
Posted: February 16, 2015
												After reading the extremely negative reviews here on Steam, I was not really expecting anything when I picked it up in January 2015 for less than 3.5 € (external retailer). I have to admit I was pleasantly surprised. As a matter of fact, I even completed the game in short bursts, which is saying a lot if I look at the current state of my game library. "So, how is the game" - you ask sceptically? First, forgot all about what the other reviewers here wrote: this game has been patched up so much that nearly all bugs are gone. Team-mates will not block doors, aliens will not walk through you, you will not become stuck, there are no crashes, ... The guy who wrote you only get to operate to power loader exo-suit for 2 seconds obviously got not far into the game, as the suit returns for a boss battle halfway. Seriously, some reviews here - even recent ones! - look like they are talking about a completely different game. What remains is an OK first-person shooter set in the Alien universe. Its best aspects are: Fairly good depiction of the colonial marines and the aliens. Marines operate in teams and that is exactly what you will be doing here. Sounds are excellent, especially the weapon and door SFX that sound like they were taken straight from the movies. Lots of fan-service: you will visit the movie-sets, find tons of easter eggs referring to the movies, music from the movies, ... Picking up the Smartgun had me giggling like a schoolgirl every time. Gameplay is fluently and entertaining, even though very simplistic. It is interesting to see how the game links "Aliens" with "Alien 3" and beyond. Then again, the game is by no means perfect: It is annoying that almost all aliens zerg straight to you, often completely ignoring your team-mates. Graphics were outdated even on day of release. While some sets are epic, there are also lots of levels that are forgettable and just plain boring. I mean, how many times do we have to walk between near-identical ruined buildings or through caves? The story is fairly rubbish and at some points hard to follow. The "Weyland Yutani is evil" card is being played far too much and becomes boring very fast. Difficulty is unbalanced: even the easiest difficulty still includes very high difficulty spikes. One common complaint is that at some point, the alien enemies are replaced by human enemies. That is simply not true: it is correct that about halfway, human enemies are added to the game, but you will be battling aliens until the very end. The aliens also remain the biggest threat at all times, while the humans are mostly pushovers for anyone with even a tiny bit of FPS experience. As to the DLC, most of it is garbage. I only care about the singleplayer part and found that all I needed was the base game + Statis Interrupted. The latter DLC starts of with a nice "Alien" vibe (seriously, it is a wonder that the makers of Alien: Isolation were not sued ...), before going back to the "Aliens" setting. Its FPS part is even more back-to-basic than the base game. If you prefer slightly more modern FPS gameplay and don't really care about the link between Aliens, Alien 3 and Alien Resurrection, you can just as well skip Statis Interrupted. All in all, I recommend the game to everyone who is even slightly fan of the Alien-universe AND who likes straightforward first-person shooters. No, it is not a horror game. And yes, it is an almost old-school FPS with health packs, point-and-shoot gameplay, secret hunting and not much else. But if that is what you are looking for, you will not be disappointed for 5$/€. However, if you want the ultimate Aliens-experience, I still recommend Aliens vs. Predator 2 over Aliens Colonial Marines any day of the week.

number of helpful: 29 of 40 people (73%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 1, 2015
												This game is a mix of first person shooter and survival horror. Sadly I can't really recommend this game. I had low expectations for this game so I just wanted to go through the story. But even on the easiest level the game is quite tough and very frustrating. A single alien or grenade or head shot can kill you instantly. Although the game supports a controller, you simply can't react quickly enough to survive between checkpoints. I had to play with mouse and keyboard to get through the chapters. I had to replay some scenes again and again learning where the aliens or humans are going to jump out at you. It is like a survival horror game (limited health, ammo and armour) but with tons of enemies that need to be killed to progress. It is mostly a very linear corridor shooter with scripted monster closets. There are 11 missions, but they look and feel very similar.   To me it feels like there is not enough ammo for you to kill all the enemies. So I tend to hang back and watch the AI characters play the game, which is pretty boring. Even on easy the AI characters get killed again and again and again, but luckily they always get up again. My other problem with the game is that it rarely actually feels like the aliens universe. The only good things are the motion tracker, pulse rifle and ending cut scene. They have even invented new types of aliens which just feel very, very wrong. The graphics are OK but are very generic future sci-fi. This is totally at odds with the aliens films which have a very retro sci-fi appearance. I forced myself to finish the game, but basically I did not enjoy it at all. I kept hoping the next chapter would be better, but is never really was. I did try and play multiplayer but I never managed to get a match even though I tried lots of different settings. The DLC is a little bit better and more interesting.

content:
Posted: November 26, 2013
												I've waited for this game since it was first anounced back in I believe 2006, i've seen all the movies, both the theatre versions as the directors cuts like a hundred times and played almost every alien game; Alien Trilogy, the old AVP, AVP 2 and the new AVP and I've played some Alien Ressurection but i couldn't complete it because of some bug.So did i like the game? Kinda. It has some good aspects to it. I really liked the map design of the maps that takes place on LV-426, the maps that take place on the sulaco have some great parts but aren't really that statisfying, they've added a cool new alien called the Spitter, the other new aliens are sh!t (i'm kinda hard to statisfy when it comes to new alien designs) and the weapons are cool, the all of the traditional weapons are there including some new ones that actually aren't that bad, and the weapons used in the movie Aliens can be found as collectibles and I love them all except for Hudsons Pulse Rifle witch is a burst rifle for some reason but the weapon itself looks great. and the Pulse rifle finally sounds like a Pulse rifle, it might not sound like a big deal but to me it actually is. the graphics aren't that great but I don't really mind, I play games not graphics.Besides all the things i just mentioned there isn't much to write home about. the AI can be really ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, especialy the AI of the weyland yutani mercenairies, and thats another thing, there are way too many weyland yutani mercenairies. I know fighting other people isn't new to an Alien game, Alien Trilogy and Alien Ressurection had some human enemies in it and AVP 2 also had a level where you had to fight humans, but why so many. there are a few boss battles witch are really, really bad, the ending is terrible. and there's the story, witch has been approved by Fox (probably by some f*cker who couldn't see past the dollar signs in his eye), it's just terrible.So what about coöp and multiplayer,i've heared a lot of people say games are much better when you can play them with your friends, but I liked A:CM more when I played on my own, multiplayer actually was really great, i really enjoyed playing multiplayer but unfortunately it took less than a month before the multiplayer was dead.unfortunatly the game wasn't quite what i expected, I kinda enjoyed playing through the campain once but once that is over there isn't really any fun in it, and the multiplayer was great but now it's dead, therefor I give Aliens: Colonial marines a 4,5/10

												Mother of god, this is a bad game. We're talking "they barely fulfilled their legal obligations with the season pass DLC" bad. "We released story DLC as a final patch for the title and abandoned it forever" bad. "Game now reboots on an endless loop whenever you close it and Gearbox doesn't give a ♥♥♥♥" bad.The gameplay's arguably worse. Ever wanted to be a marine who had to grind for weapons IN SINGLE-PLAYER? Seriously, though, you can't carry more than two guns until you start hunting for audio logs or other things to trigger XP gain. That is how bad this gets. It is also, and maybe this is my sucking at FPSes here, just hard in some mean ways. I'm pretty sure some enemies spawn out of midair in certain fights. Even using the motion tracker (hope you like juggling about 6 keys to do anything at a time, by the way) I'd be eviscerated when something was suddenly on top of me. Like, literally on top of me, it came off the roof or from the sky somehow.There's much, much worse in here. Let's not get into how dumb the plot is, or stealth segments where you hide from blind xenomorphs (this is a real thing and the animation is SO BAD), or that the only things you will remember when the game ends are going to basically be "remember X from the movies? we did that but you're nowhere near as cool as Ripley".I made a bet with a friend that we'd start this at the same time and see who'd beat it first. She uninstalled it a few levels from the end and never regretted it for an instant: I was much, much stupider to finish the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥. Don't buy, don't play, do not even think about this game, because it's not even the funny sort of bad, it's the painful, needles in your eyes bad variety, where every level is like pulling teeth. Your own teeth. With a claw hammer.

content:
Posted: January 1, 2014
												Gonna go the opposite of a lot of reviews here and give a thumbs up to ACM.  That being said I did purchase this during holiday sale off Amazon for $1.99 and several months have passed since relase date.  Gearbox has patched the game up to eliminate and improve some issues.  I can understand people that pre ordered and spent $60 on this game, I would def be♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥and upset as it is nowhere near worth that money, but for 2 bucks it surely is.  Being a fan of the Alien franchise and growing up in the late 70's/early 80's I can appreciate the tone of this game and the sense of art style seems to be a throwback to that era.  Graphics are terrible by todays standards and what we should be getting, however I thought the Alien models looked really well done and were true to Alien lore.  The sound was failry bad to, mostly the dreadful voice work, the ambient sound and alien hisses were good though.  Gameplay is really straight forward to the tune of run n gun, with a checkpoint save system.  I have certainly played a lot more trash garbage games than ACM and in my opinion should not be labeled as such, just a game that was falsely advertised and was way below potential on a galactic level - BUT if you can pick it up cheap its worth a run through, which I thought was fun and ok.

content:
Posted: November 27, 2015
												"Looks like some sort of secreted movie licensed game...""Secreted from what?" "My♥♥♥♥♥"The illegal alien of the alien franchise, Call of Duty: Alien Edition.A bit of a guilty pleasure, but a very disappointing entry to the series. For everything it does right, it does atleast 3 more things wrong. Three examples:The game makes you have to pull out your motion tracker to use it, rendering you unable to fire, but the motion tracker detects infront and behind of you, negating all tension as you don't need to co operate with your teammates at all.You can customize your weapons, making them your own, but you can carry them all with you at any given time, (and even edit them in mid mission!), meaning there is no real strategising in customizing.Ultimate badass difficulty attempts to give you more immersion and atmosphere, which it actually succeeds in doing. Ultimate badass difficulty removes all hud and makes the game more difficult, meaning you have to remember what you do (and don't) have. This goes well with the design and score, but is completely pointless as your teammates can teleport, and the aliens appear to be of a bootleg variety, with no acidic blood (it seems more like they are just spewing lemonade), facehuggers that cannot subdue anything, and aliens that forget they can climb on surfaces and use stealth.The game is also so contrtadicting in it's nature, it gives a "no marine left behind" flick, wherein the beginning of the game you and your squad are almost killed due to a fellow marine blowing himself (and others around him) up because a chestburster ripped through him.Or making it that marines don't know what facehuggers are, yet they somehow can identify different types of xenomorphs (even in pitch black).Not great, not bad, just unrelentingly disappointing.If you're looking for a action FPS, go look at AvP, a much better entry, not only allowing you to be a colonial marine, but also a xenomorph or predator.If you're looking for a more true to the series entry, go look at Alien: Isolation, as it gets almost everything right.

content:
Posted: April 10, 2016
												I've been playing this recently with TemplarGFX's ACM Overhaul v3.0 mod installed. Having never played the original unmodded version I can only comment on the modded version I am now playing.I've been playing on "faster weaker soldier" mod mode and the game has proven an addictive and satisfying followup to Aliens. The modded Alien AI has proven a wicked challenge and really makes it feel like you're reliving the film. I haven't finished the title yet, but there are a fair amount of bugs left, and another complaint would be the balancing issues that are the result of ACM Overhaul's tweaks. You're sometimes left with too little health or ammo for a "Normal" difficulty setting. Some of the alien gameplay definitely needs to be tweaked for optimal playability but I hear things are improving constantly.The story line is relatively straight forward and could have been executed better. The characters are pretty shallow, but this overall it doesn't detract from the game too much.I haven't put down the game since I've started playing and I recommend it to fans and non-fans alike with the ACM Overhaul mod installed. It looks like it's finally given this game the justice it deserved from a rushed release. If you, like me had only played Alien: Isolation and avoided this title due to the stigma then do what I did and you won't be dissapointed.

Posted: September 8, 2015
												★★☆☆☆ - "Average at best, Id give it a miss" PROS:- Very nice design true to the style of the movie and capture their essence very well.- Great sound, the guns, the aliens and even better with surround sound.- Fairly satisfying shooting.- Nearly every weapon has secondary attachments which are fun to let off.- The puddles are amazing in this game, seriously.CONS:- Pathetically lame and predictable storyline which is completely uninteresting.- Repetitive missions, saving the sorry asses of marines constantly.- Awful voice acting and generic script which is totally unimaginative. - Boring and stereotypical characters, which you feel nothing but hate for.- Dated graphics.- Can kill the aliens too easily, they went for action and quantity over tension and quality.- I found my experience riddled with bugs, usually off the back of completing something and it totally skipping an animation or cut scene, breaking any immersion you have.- Short single player, although not entirely a bad thing in this case.VERDICT? A very average game which is not acceptable for a AAA game with its potential. AvP and Isolation are both better options.

content:
Posted: December 25, 2013
												There seems to be a lot of negative reviews for this game, but I for one, enjoy(ed) it; for both the nostalgia of the alien franchise and the continuation of story from my favorite alien movie: aliens (the 2nd of the quadrilogy). I do want to mention however, that I bought this game on sale for $1.99 and after many of the patches that fixed the early glitches, which made playing through the story mode pleasant. The graphics are OK, but could be better. The gameplay can be sometimes unforgiving, but once you get the hang of it (don't let the aliens sneak up on you), you'll increase your odds of staying alive. Soundtrack: awesome. Story: great. A lot of people complained about the story in this game as well, but I think they forget that this is based off a simple action movie. If you want more story, play a game that ties into aliens 3 (definitely more drama and story driven) than the action driven Aliens 2. All in all, for $1.99, I have no regrets and I'm glad I purchased and played the game that brought back many good alien killing memories.

												The development process behind this game was interesting.interesting as in gearbox hired TimeGate a different devlopment studio to do the work for them. At the last moments of development gearbox took over and rushed the final stages of the game. This is evident.and it's not hard to tell who did what. Timegate knew what they were doing. They worked with the alien ai they created. They created claustrophobic levels with many walls and tight spaces and COVER for the aliens to utilise. This was great and i found myself getting overwhelmed and flanked quite often.but gearbox, tsk tsk tsktheir level design was near identical to their game borderlands (also the reason they weren't working on acm)Too many open spaces, not enough walls, not enough cover. The aliens didnt know what to do with it. And you would find them hiding behind nonexistent cover because all the rest of the little cover available was occupied by the other aliens. And this is why the would act stupid and rush into your bullets.its the same for graphics too. Early game there are plenty of dark, similar coloured crevices for the aliens to hide in and particle effects are abundant. But late game the aliens stick out like sore thumbs also contributing to their inability to flank late gameBut since the patches the game doesn't look too bad, its pretty good actually. There are still minor hiccups in the companion's ai as well but overall this games actually quite enjoyable.I just wish timegate got to develop the whole thing. im giving a positive review because timegate did a great job. This thumbs up goes their way.if I could though I would also leave a negative review saying Gearbox sucks.gearbox was that one guy who doesn't help with group project until the last minute and drags everyones grades down to a C with their crappy contribution.also, I feel like the majority of the negative reviews are just bandwagoning.

content:
Posted: June 14, 2014
												I actually first owned this game on the Xbox 360, it was a huge disappointment and possibly the worst edition. It was downright buggy and just comlete false advertisment of what the developers promised in E3 that year. Screw you Gearbox. Original demo gameplay which should of been the gameplay but wasn't.


YouTube™ Video: Aliens: Colonial Marines  - E3 2011: 11-Minute Live Demo Walkthrough 

			Views: 114,357		

			CEO Randy Pitchford freaks out that his Gearbox Software is making a proper follow-up to the Aliens movies in Aliens: Colonial Marines. Enjoy an 11-minute walkthrough of the E3 2011 demo.		

I bought the PC version on a whim, only because I had extra cash to burn. I played the PC version about a year later after the release of launch date. They did patch the game and with slightly better graphics. Still not as good as the suppose demo of the game but at least it was better than on launch.The graphics are passable but at times the game texture looks like a late stage PS2 or original Xbox game. Even with the improvements, the game still looks a bit choppy. The controls are actually very solid, mind you I played with mouse/keyboard. The enemy AI was improved from launched but still needs work.The gameplay on this game is just average and you don't really feel any tension like you should when playing a game like this. What I really didn't like about this game was half of the stages you are fighting Wayland mercs instead of aliens. Even Aliens vs Predator (2010) did a better job of this when you played the marine. Multiplayer co-op is at least fun but I would crank it up to the highest difficulty to get the most out of it. The game is rather short and the storyline is forgettable. As for online multiplayer matches, it's pretty much dead unless you find a Steam group or have a good amount of friends to play with.I would not buy this game unless you really really like Aliens or have friends to play with. If you are undecided, I would wait until it goes on sale for $5.Overall I would have to rate this game a 5/10, even with the improvements and patches.
