number of helpful: 6 of 6 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 6
												I do not understand what all of the negativity is about.  Check it out.I would like to clear some things up for future buyers.  ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s and elbows.Quick Note:  Install TemplarGFX Mod, makes things REALLY BADASSMy background:- Longtime Alien fan, I saw Aliens about a year after it came out and it scared the♥♥♥♥♥♥out of me as a kid - Enormous FPS player, played almost every FPS since Wolfenstein 3D (early 90s)- Big Bethesda player and I think all FPS should use the Fallout/Skyrim systems (by law!)- Former military with actual weapons, tactics, and combat experience- Sergeant Apone is still my favorite military leaderGame Review (short and to the point, express elevator):This feels a lot like the Doom remake of the early 2000s.  If you are looking for Skyrim or Fallout controls, you will be disappointed.  If you are looking for interactive environments, you will be disappointed.  This is a very linear FPS which is on a determined track to tell a story.  You will not be creating your story, but you will be following the story that is laid out as you go along.  There are no saves, so you have to reach those checkpoints.  There is no character creation.  There is no skill upgrading and there are only limited weapons upgrades.  The Aliens move and act just like the movies, they come rushing relentlessly, spin around walls, and give slight holds or retreats...just like in the movies.  The studio did a fair job in creating the alien and marine behaviors.  I read another review which apparently did not take the movies into effect.  Again, they applied the movie rules to the game.  The graphics, feel, and physics are definitely dated for its release time, but they are not bad at all.  It's all about perspective.  The soundtrack is awesome.  James Cameron should use this game's soundtrack to replace the Aliens soundtrack.  If you are used to superior games then you will be disappointed.  If you love Aliens, then you will love this game.  Just try to approach it from a reasonable point of view.They need to rework the characters and make them more military-like.  The character, Bella, should be deleted.  She looks and acts like she just came back from a Bayou rave party.  The "cool character" crap is so not USCM.  Really?  A USCM with fashionable neckband, makeup, no helmet, and pigtail buns!  The Colonial Marines that everyone loves in the movies were trained by actual SAS operatives and the Sergeant Apone actor (actual Vietnam Marine Combat Veteran with 2 purple hearts).  This is why people love the Colonial Marines, they gave the believable appearance of hardcore, but often jackass, military personnel, with even leadership flaws. It's definitely worth the reduced price and I do agree that the original price and hype was fraudulent.  It's worth a one time go.I'm going to play some more.  In the pipe, 5 x 5!

number of helpful: 7 of 8 people (88%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 10
												Aliens: Colonial Marines takes a popular IP and converts it into a soulless and dull shooter that continually mugs for the camera but lacks anything that made the movie great.  On a technical level, the game is plagued by graphics that looked dated on release, lazy and reused maps which include warping to the next location when the developers apparently gave up on adding hallways, guns that are no fun to use and the lamest fire/explosion effects I've seen in a game in a long while.  Beyond that, the plot is dull and often asinine, the NPCs you'll be saddled with the whole game do nothing to endear themselves and the bullet-sponge enemies make the combat a dull plod rather than the tight action you saw when the Colonial Marines first delved into the underbelly of Hadley's Hope in Aliens.  Oh, that's when you're actually fighting xenomorphs since you'll spend at least equal time shooting Weyland-Yutani mooks who are as impervious to bullets as the aliens.  Throughout you'll see locations from the Aliens film, find 'legendary' weapons named after characters (that are worse than your stock weapons), see film characters as NPCs and discover Easter eggs but all of it feels like "Eh? EH? See how this is an Aliens game? See??" rather than immersing you in it.There really isn't anything to recommend about this game.  There's better shooters and better games for capturing the Aliens experience.  This probably won't be the worst game you've ever played but rather one of the more disappointing.

content:
Posted: May 1, 2016
												If you have watched the movie "Aliens" aka "alien 2", you will find youself in a familiar environment. I immediately recognized the characters and especially the buildings I saw in the movie.The story connects directly after the movie, when a second team of marines answer to a distress call from Cpl. Hicks, one of the survivors of the movie.The story is simple. You are a marine and there are aliens. There are also evil humans you should "only fire at when fired upon". Those orders stand for almost full 10 seconds!It is very fast paced and the AI isn't too challenging. The aliens are not that good at hiding and prefer a simple assault, which makes them the inferior race. On some occasions the game has a little twist which made me quite enjoy it. Some sneeky parts for example where funny, especially in Coop.I played it with 2 of my friends on Hardened difficulty and we managed to finish it in about 6 hours.Some of the menus are quite hidden and I would've loved to play an alien campaign.All in all solid. Too bad there are no multiplayer games any more.

I decided to give it a go anyways because I guess I had to see for myself exactly how bad it truely was. So this is my literal 25 something minutes of playing this absolute♥♥♥♥♥♥game.Start the game and have a feel for the controls for the first time. I was getting use to the iron sights and started customizing the controls to better fit my liking. I discover a marine all snotted up on the wall, telling me to cut him down.  The cutscene plays of my character using his torch to cut this guy down. I hear the alien making noises during the cutscene and the alien just crawls up next to my character FNAF style and grabs my hand, then hisses.  The alien then glitches out on the wall spinning around in a circle allowing me to shoot and kill him really easily.... Lets just say that wasn't a very good first impression. Something I was supposed to expect in future battles im guessing.....So we reach a landing bay area where there is a big dropship sitting in the center. Theres two Aliens on top of some cargo containers next to the drop ship. There were also TWO marines, 1 with a smart gun and the other with a pulse rifle behind some cargo crates shooting at them. The person I had cut down decides the best corse of action is to throw a grenade at the ship...... Seriously? For two aliens you think to throw a grenade when you could have just shot them. The grenade blew up the whole drop ship..... It was such a stupid plot idea that Sega should be sued for writing such a terrible plot line.After I save the day with about 45 seconds of none stop aliens runing towards us while some idiot marine tries to unlock some door behind me. We finally set back off back to where we started this♥♥♥♥♥♥mess of a game. While traveling down this weird long space hallway..... The marine that I had cut down earlier starts having his predictable spaz attack before the chest burst. And im sitting here thinking. OK....The alien is going to pop out and run off towards the Marine's ship or something. NOPE! The Dude Alu akbarz himself with a grenade. Completly destroying the bridge and killing like 2 other marines with me..... You and some other loser survies the blast. Say some corny♥♥♥♥♥♥to each other, and I quit the ♥♥♥♥ing game out of RAGE.The end? No! You see.... After I quit the game, it had started itself right back up again! number of helpful: 11 of 16 people (69%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 12, 2014
												This game gets alot of flak, but honestly, I think it is what I call 'Duke Nukem Forever Syndrome' in action. The game took so long to release, was so hyped every step of the way and every change in developer, and was so rabidly sought after from the moment it was announced to be in the works that it was doomed to bad press the instant the overhype and anticipation were not 100% sated. People expected a masterpiece of modern gaming based in the Aliens universe, what they got instead was a decent example of more old-school shooter style gaming based in the Aliens Universe. Not the greatest, but good none-the-less and fun. Sadly seems too many people overlook that in favor of complaining that its not the Alpha-male of a game they expected.The story, while full of the passing plot hole here and there if your a devoted enough Aliens fan to even notice them, is par for the course when it comes to Alien franchise games. The conrols work, the xenos are relentless when they appear, Weyland-Yutani corp are♥♥♥♥♥♥♥and so are their mercs, and the multiplayer is fun as hell and lets you play as both Aliens and Marines with upgradable weapons and evolutions and unlockable costume bits for cosmetic appeal.Gameplay is the older shooter style when your marines, no cover-shooter mechanics here just straight up crouch and shoot logic where anything you can fit fully behind is your cover if it stops bullets or buys you a few seconds to reload while swarms of xenos decend onto you. Yeah I said stop bullets, good ol Wey-Yu has sent mercs to secure the place and elimate you pesky and nosey UMC Marines and while alot of people complain about that I point out the following: EVERY ALIEN GAME AT SOME POINT HAS HUMANS KILLING OTHER HUMANS. Why? See above: Weyland-Yutani Corp is a♥♥♥♥♥♥and Mr. Yutani himself is the biggest♥♥♥♥♥♥of all. Don't Beleive me? google the dude and look up his track record in the various games, movies, comics, and books. He is a horrible person...well...android who body jumps from andriod to andriod whenever he dies anyway because he is such a troll with such a need to contiue to troll that he uploaded his brain before dying into a computer and downloads himself into androids to make himself immortal to troll the rest of mankind for eternity.That there is the best in-universe reason to kill humans in this game there is. And its a good reason. Because ♥♥♥♥ Wey-Yu.Unfortunatly the multiplayer, which imo is AMAZING to play, is kinda dead. No one plays it so you can never find a match, but maybe someday it will come back. Even without it the singleplayer is fun and can get your heart pounding in spots, and for the first time in any aliens game the smartgun is not only 100% visually accurate with 100% accurate sound effects, but you get the propper smartgun eyepiece that tracks and highlights moving targets in range for you and auto-targets them based on whichever is closest to the crosshairs...just like the movie. That alone is a Plus even if you only use the thing once because until you run out of ammo and have to dump it you feel like a bad♥♥♥♥♥ You feel like your right in the movie when they break that bad boy out and its cutting down xenos by the dozens.Another great feature for single player is the motion tracker. It picks up ALL motion in its range not just living things, again just like in the films, and nothing will startle you more when its been far too quiet for far too long when that thing starts to ping because it picked up some phantom signal from a bit of shifting debris or a swinging cable. And nothing makes your heart thump and set you into panic mode like suddenly having the thing go into overdrive, making you pull it up to see what the hell is going on, then see just a massive blob of dots moving closer on the tracker but nothing in the hallway. Because you know its real that time, thats xenos not some random false reading, theres alot of them, they are close, and most teriffying is that you cant see them. So you start to backpeddle and pray they come out of the vents in small  numbers instead of all at once and that its not right in your face.And thats why I love this game, its everything an aliens game should be and nothing more. Its suspensful, atmospheric, heartpounding, and surprisingly immersive if you can get over some of the flatter voice acting bits in otherwise tense moments. You feel like a UMC Marine caught in a life or death surival situation with only a few people to help you out at best, only yourself more often then not, and your in over your head. But your a marine you have your duty to finish the mission AND get your♥♥♥♥♥and the asses of as many fellow marines as you can back home when your done.No one said life in the UMCM was a glorious one, and its a bughunt down there. But damn is it an exciting and Fun life.

number of helpful: 14 of 22 people (64%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: July 15, 2015
												Note: Single Player campaign only."Not the worst game ever." - about the best thing I can possibly say about it.  Actually, the music reasonably emulates the James Horner score from the movie... at times; in a made for tv sequel kind of way.If you ignore all the pre-release footage, trailers, PAX demos, vertical slices, bull-shots, and interviews with passionate developer/aliens fans, you can have yourself a perfectly mediocre 12 hour romp.  Is it better than un-offical duke or doom mods that I've played?  No.  Is it worth $10?  No.   Is this review 2 1/2 years late?  Yes.  I just felt compelled to post it with the recent comments about certain people being "proud" of this game.Spoiler alert - The game ends on a cliff hanger for the DLC.  Not the good kind of cliff hanger that leaves you wanting to know "what happens next?", talking about it for weeks, discussing with fellow gamers what happens after the 'exciting' conclusion.  No, this is the kind that gets answered for the low low price of $10 just 6 months later because they chopped off/shipped the game before the last 20% of the game was completed to sell as DLC, it contains the answers to the questions raised by the game's "story", and a majority of Michael Biehn's in-game appearance.It's a better condemnation of the videogame industry than a videogame.  Save your money, or better yet, spend it on something that deserves it./edit:  you can now only buy the DLC in one large bundle, not individually.  "Aliens Colonial Marines Collection"

number of helpful: 46 of 83 people (55%) found this review helpful3 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: November 17, 2014
												First off I sort of understand the vitriol aimed at the game, it SHOULD have been MUCH better. It's got flaws (but what game hasn't), it had a dodgy develpment (so do many games), a dodgy story and it was rushed out the door (also like many games). Luckily I didn't buy it full price and got it for PC not the shoddy console version (many of the games issues are probably because they couldn't get it running on console so had to drop volumetric fog and most lighting effects). On that basis I DO recommend the game, but NOT to mega FPS fans, there's better FPSs out there. But, if you're a huge Aliens fan and would enjoy walking around the Sulaco's hanger..see Bishops legs and the airlock that the queen was flushed out of (albeit a tad small) you'll enjoy the game for that reason. The gameplay mechanics are wooden and simple point and shoot with a few variations, I enjoyed the smart gun section (but would have liked the option to keep it, for balance the game could have doubled or tripled the enemy count), I enjoyed exploring the Derelict, walking around the "Gunner" from Alien was pretty damn cool! The sounds are all there, motion tracker..Pulse rifle etc. When you have the motion tracker you can't shoot so there's a bit of tension there. Ultimately as a gamer I'd give it 5/10, but as an Alien/Aliens fan I give it 2 more points for a respectible 7/10. The game is an example of most of the flaws of the gaming industry and some pretty shoddy decisions and practises (but similar stuff is going on in other industries ALL the time anyway). Oh and one tip...do NOT turn the gamma/brightness up, keep the game DARK and the lighting and atmosphere is much improved....Eurogamer did a comparison of the game v the demo and part of the problem was the brightness on the finshed game in their vid was WAY too high.

Gearbox messed up real bad! At least, thanks to TemplarGFX MOD, this game is worthy of a revisit! GET ACM CHEAP THOUGH!RATING:4.5 / 10

number of helpful: 7 of 9 people (78%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 5
Aliens: Colonial Marines ReviewA:CM picks up roughly seventeen weeks after Ripley, Newt, Hicks and half of android Bishop escape LV-426. A full platoon of marines aboard the US Sephora, responding to Hicks’ distress call, arrive to find the Sulaco back in orbit over the part-terraformed world, despite records (and David Fincher’s Alien 3) asserting its appearance above prison planet Fiorina "Fury" 161. It’s this mystery that forms the basis for much of the plot: how did the Sulaco get back to LV-426 – and why?Problems are further compounded when a private military company under the employ of Weyland-Yutani shows up and starts bombarding the Sephora, eventually leading to an emergency crash-landing on the wind-blown surface of LV-426. Weyland-Yutani have established a military presence on the planet, and they’re dug-in deep.In the game you play as Corporal Chris Winter, a hardened marine who ticks all the hero-boxes. He’s honourable, courageous, chiseled, and never leaves a man behind. The first half of the story sees Winter and his surviving crew – grizzled smart-gunner O’Neal, do-or-die CO, Cruz, and less than heroic pilot Reid – trying to find a way to rid mouthy veteran Bella of, shall we say, an unplanned pregnancy. The second half is more action-oriented, as the die-hards attempt to steal the PMC frigate and get the hell off a planet overrun with Xenomorphs.The biggest issue I have with A:CM is that it still thinks it’s 1986 where the script is concerned. Films have come a long way in the last quarter-century, games far more so, and what amounts to a lot of manly posturing, air-punching and swearing doesn’t make for a great plot. That said, what this game presents as a storyline is certainly no better or worse than its source material, but it lacks the instant quotability – but then so do Gears of War or Call of Duty. People expecting Colonial Marines to have the same level of quote-tastic impact as Aliens are going to be disappointed, but it’s an unfair demand. The story is fit for purpose, and though it lacks gravitas and emotional depth, it’s an action yarn, not Shakespeare.Likewise, I’ve rarely seen such attention to detail, not just in the guns and armour and vehicles, but in the world itself. Gearbox deserve a great deal of credit for their interpretation of Hadley’s Hope. I got chills when I entered the MedLab to find the remains of Hudson’s wasted Facehugger, or reached Operations to see the hole in the floor that he was pulled through some time later. The colour palette, the art style, and the detail is impressive, and I felt immersed in Cameron’s world, even if at times the bugs and glitches seemed determined to pull me out.As a shooter, Colonial Marines just about succeeds. The shooting is decent enough, guns are easy to aim precisely and pack enough impact – and there are certainly enough of them; a robust arsenal including pulse rifles, flamethrowers and shotguns alongside “legendary” armaments like Gorman’s service pistol or Hicks’ pump-action fill out a good-sized weapon wheel. Controlling Winter can feel a little loose at times, however, with little sense of size and weight.You’ll face two main enemy types throughout the campaign. The first are Wey-Yu’s mercenary squads, identikit bullet-fodder with the brains of wind-up toys whose presence lowers Colonial Marines to the levels of a Medal of Honor clone, complete with bad AI and no flanking capabilities. Gunfight areas are set up with obvious cover and little imagination, and it’s during these sections that Gearbox’s game hits its lowest points.The other enemy is the legendary Xenomorph itself, and the biggest mistake Gearbox make – and they aren’t the first to do so – is to assume that the titular bug is the ideal enemy for an FPS. Here’s the problem: the alien itself is a creeping, stalking predator that rarely kills outright. The propagation of their species relies on taking prey alive. In the movie they stage only two all-out attacks, the first against the auto-guns, the second against the strung-out survivors. Both have a purpose, and the second sees most of the remaining cast dead, wounded or taken in minutes. Translating a creature that can go from lethal stalker to full-on zerg should be easy in a game – but it isn’t in a shooter. Instead, the Xenos drop in front of you and charge, ready to be blown away with ease. When their AI does allow them to scale walls and use the ceiling to get the drip on you, it leads to them either ineffectively slapping you or a “mash E to live” moment that rarely changes. Invincible team-mates who you can shoot through don’t help the immersion either.Even when you’re outside, Colonial Marines feels like a corridor shooter. You’re never challenged to use the terrain or the environment, and barely need to use your brain to get out of any situation.  Two of the three “boss” fights are incredibly easy, but one is a nightmare given that the enemy AI is set to repeatedly charge you head-on. The new alien types, Boilers (who explode when startled) and Lurkers (who, well, lurk) add an element of ingenuity to proceedings but bring nothing special to the table. It’s just another example of how Gearbox have gone all out on nailing the look and sound of the universe, but completely failed to replicate the tension and complexity of the source material.Aliens: Colonial Marines contains four different Multiplayer Modes - Team Deathmatch, Extermination, Escape, Survivor. Each mode allows one team to play as the United States Colonial Marines and one team as the Xenomorphs. After the time limit has been reached, players switch side and play the game mode once more on the same map.As is now standard, playing either on online or campaign grants XP and raises levels, allowing you to customise your marine and alter his loadout to suit your style. For many, the multiplayer will be the saving grace, but it’s not without its problems. One issue is that some of the maps are too claustrophobic. In the campaign it’s acceptable; in multiplayer it’s not, as you’re often stuck behind a team-mate or a piece of scenery and you get nobbled by a plucky Xeno player. There’s fun to be had online but, like the campaign (even with its drop in, drop out co-op) it’s not enough to raise your pulse.Colonial Marines took me a little over 10 hours to run through on Soldier difficulty (including the DLC campaign), so it's pretty short story-wise. If you’re the sort who has to 100% every game, there are extra hours to be had in finding all the audio logs, dog tags and legendary weapons, but most will bang through the campaign in a few sittings and then play around in the multiplayer.VERDICT: A lot of people will want to hate Aliens: Colonial Marines, and Gearbox don’t do a lot to prevent that, but there are glimmers of a fine game in there. The story is hammy, but I was entertained for every minute that I played; the shooting mechanics don’t do the universe any justice, but those are the limitations imposed by the genre. That’s no excuse of course, but until someone realises that Aliens is not the perfect fit for the FPS genre that it arguably should be, this is what we’ll be stuck with.For dedicated fans this is almost a no-brainer, and there are moments that elevate above the throwaway dross that it occasionally stoops to become. An unarmed chase through the sewers and a tense (if quite easy) climax are highlights, and the multiplayer has legs, but if you’re looking for the definitive Aliens experience, you won’t find it here. Which is a shame, because there were times when I felt genuine goosebumps as I wandered the halls of Hadley’s Hope. Ultimately, though, this really is just another bug hunt.Rating: 6.5/10

content:
Posted: June 17, 2015
												A game that could have been so much more... Aliens: Colonial Marines had the right ingredients to do something great, an official license to use all the original material from the films and a studio developing it with a rich history in making action packed games.The results however are horrible. The initial and much talked about gameplay preview that was first shown turned out to be a glorified pre-rendered cinematic and the end result what we have now looks nothing like what was promised. The graphics are average at best and the game is ridden with bugs and glitches even after many patches.The story is crap and does nothing good with the original material. The gameplay seems uninspired and linear, the enemy AI is ridiculously bad and the so called co-op is downright laughable. I think the only thing that turned out okay was the sound and the music but even that can't help the complete lack of atmosphere and originality in this game.I honestly can't recommend this for any price. If you want to play a much better game that actually does something worthwhile with the original movie license, check out Alien: Isolation instead and just forget that this was ever made.

												It's not hard to see where this game has failed, I sincerily wanted it to be good. I'm a huge Alien(s) fan and I hoped to God that this game would be good, but gearbox really messed it up ( or did they ? ). After all, we will never know why this game turned out so horribly, maybe we will. I recommend this game only for >10 bucks/euros or lower. No more. Also, aside from the Bug Hunt DLC, don't buy any other ones, it's pointless since the matchmaking system is dead. Pros:>Amazing audio/sound track>Iconic locations from the movies (ex: Hadley's Hope, Sullaco)>Hicks is in it ( for me it feels awesome to battle xenos alongside people from the Aliens 1986 movie)Cons:>Awfull AI>Horrible story + ending ( don't even get me started on the final boss battle)>Overpowered marines + too much gear/ammo at once>Co-op/Multiplayer is pretty much dead (you only have to have a lot of friends to play this)>STUPID ALIENS (XENOS)>outdated graphics (for 2013 standards, AvP 2010 looks better IMO )If you find yourself in a steam sale and this is for under >10, get it. If not, avoid it at all costs. Alien: Isolation is going to come out soon, that game looks promising (hopefully).

number of helpful: 27 of 49 people (55%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 30, 2013
												Aliens: Colonial Marines (A:CM) was built to be a direct sequel to James Cameron's motion picture, Aliens. Despite bad reviews, I enjoyed A:CM, but I am admittedly an Alien fanatic dating from the original film. The game brings back Michael Biehn and Lance Henriksen to reprise their roles in the universe making it feel like an authentic Alien experience. However, A:CM feels like it should be a story-driven singleplayer game, but features multiplayer, player rankings and challenges that fit in as an afterthought. It should be noted that A:CM features a broke Steam Cloud that may result in saved game corruption as your ranking is not stored on Gearbox's servers.

number of helpful: 69 of 130 people (53%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 26, 2013
												8 out of 10: Worth buying on sale, but needs to be played co-op, and needs the Stasis Interrupted DLC in order to make sense of the storyThe bad rap this game got upon launch was well deserved, and I can understand why so many people are down on it.  I wouldn't let that stop you from buying it, though.  The big patch released by Gearbox really did help the graphics and AI issues a lot, and made the game much more playable.  I only played a bit of the campaign in SP, but found it pretty lackluster; overall it wasn't scary or even tense, and had nothing on the previous Aliens games.  But the game really started to shine in the co-op multiplayer.  It was actually a lot of fun working through the campaign with a couple friends, as well as the Bug Hunt DLC.  As for the story - a lot of people had problems with it, me included.  It really made no sense and had several glaring plot holes that actually made me mad at a couple points.  However, the Stasis Interrupted DLC actually did an admirable job of bringing the plot together and explaining the holes, and I ended up being pretty pleased with the story overall.  I don't know whether all that was originally planned, or whether there was some mad scrambling at Gearbox to try and explain things, but it's too bad you had to play through the whole game, then play the DLC just to have the story make any kind of sense.  All in all, it's worth playing if you have 2 or 3 friends and are willing to shell out for the DLC.

content:
Posted: May 2, 2015
												I bought this through the Humble Bundle store for $3.75, meaning that only 90% of what I paid for it went down the drain instead of 100%I bought it to play through it FOR SCIENCE! after having played it at launch with a friend. This recent playthrough is ten hours of my life I'll never get back, and yes, ten sounds like a lot, but it was really only so much because I kept dying from bugs and glitches, like xenomorphs clawing me through indestructible obstacles and suicidal mercenaries that charge me with explosives. Two years after release, its gone from a mostly broken and buggy, poorly designed game with terrible AI to a fairly broken and buggy, poorly designed game with terrible AI. Not quite as terrible as at launch, but a turd doesn't become any less of a turd just because you put a cherry on top of it, it just ends up being a waste of a cherry. All the hours spent patching this game and creating its DLC would've been better spent by Gearbox (or TimeGate, or whoever else really made the game) towards a project that could actually be saved.If you're thinking of getting it to screw around with friends in multiplayer with, don't. While it can be some fun that way, its a graveyard online and if you want a multiplayer Aliens fix you'd probably just be better off playing Killing Floor with the Aliens mod or some of the previous AvP games which actually have some occassional activity.If you're thinking of giving it to somebody as a joke gift, don't. It'd be cheaper and reap the same results to just mail a picture of you giving somebody the middle finger to the recepient, completely free if you email them.

number of helpful: 17 of 30 people (57%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 2, 2014
												The Short: If you like the movie (Aliens specifically), you will like (not love) Aliens: Colonial Marines (ACM).  Fairly generic shooter with a great movie tie-in, what can go wrong? Well, lots! A little buggy Ai, spawns and collision geometry can spoil some of the suspense that it does manage to drum up, but enjoyable enough for a few hours, for a few bucks (not retail price though!). Audio is a great help to the overall mood of the game and consistent to fans of the movie. The Long:I paid $10 for the whole meal deal, DLC's and all. Also, I am writing at time when all the extensive patches and fixes have been implemented. If you paid full price without the patches, my sympathies and your wrath probably is justified, that's a guess. With that in mind, the 2014 edition is enjoyable to play like a marine in the Aliens world. Weapons are what terran space marines expect, short the melee weapons. The gun fire is satisfying and shooting mechanic is spot on, would love to have more smart gun though :) Weapons upgrades are more like sidegrades for the most part, and is really more about personal preference and style of tactics of the player. I play more like infantry, so it's pulse rifles, battle rifles and shotguns..wait, that's all there really is in the game! Flamer is a special pick up weapon, as is the smart gun ;_;The Aliens themselves are well crafted and can catch you by surprise if you don't use your radar and terrain carefully. Alien animations are a bit jerky at times when they are transitioning to more complex transitions or moves, especially when they get into your melee region and the game is trying to decide which melee scenario to piece in (up close execution or 1 of the varied push backs) I played this on the hardest setting from the get go and found some parts challenging, but it was pretty easy for the most part.  The boss fights are a real let down, too easy or just brain dead, example: the lifter, punched with the left claw only....Big Alien Al down for the count as I punched it to the corner where it died in frightening death animation glitchies. Honestly, if the Aliens were faster and more deadly with the same numbers, the game would be almost unplayable because the Zeno's would be all over the place and will kill you in an instant even if you got a shot off due to the acid blood and lurking face huggers. Try the Killing Floor Aliens mod and you will understand what I mean, HoE will destroy or put on edge the most well honed of teams in the more confined maps. The environments are well put together and believeable to exist in the Colonial Marine world, some places could use a bit more polish, but it's all well presented for the most part. The level designs are pretty generic with some set pieces for bosses. Don't know what you are looking for if some find this game ugly or inconsistent with Aliens.If you are a fan, I recommend this game at a discount price. There are still some bugs that are unforgiveable given the patches and fixes in place (Aliens spawning infront of me, ok, i shoot it...then another spawns in the same spot...bad!), but they don't brake the overall game and atmosphere. ACM gives us a bit more back story to the events after Alien3 and what will happen in future stories, and that is maybe the best thing that can be said about this game.

Posted: July 2, 2014
												Where do I begin. First of all, I really REALLY don't understand all those bad Reviews, but luckily they come mainly from Normal people who obviously know nothing about different techniques to make games. The game is beautiful and couldn't feel more "Cinematic"It's about Colonial marines not Aliens so giving a bad review because you kill humans? Well Read some about the Colonial marines, there's a few good sources one of which is the old RPG game with the extra book "Technical manual"Basically , the Colonial marines do not fight Xenomorphs all day long, they actually do fight humans far more often.Also this is put as a Sequel to the 2nd Alien movie, and in my opinion for being a game like this Does it really well. Aliens was never really scary, it was an Intence thrilling Alien Action movie with some terrifying moments at the most.Who can honestly  say this game has not got that feeling of Aliens from 1986?  I think it do, Also the fact that you have to hold the movement detector and not have your gun ready makes it even more Aliens 1986 realistic. I've had great fun playing this game, I'm an Alien fan from childhood when watching the first movie and 2nd around 1986-87. The sounds in this game are incredible Cinematic as well, what do people complain about here? Play the 2nd Alien movie (Aliens) Listen to the chaotic scenes where aliens come from all directions and you'll have exactly the same feeling and sounds. The graphics are great with the Movie grain turned on (looks a lot like watching the film imo)I'm not sure in any way why people have actually given this such bad reviews, for me comparing it with Shooter games like this it's 9 out of 10  The only real thing i could point out as being maybe a tiny bit bad was the Animations from time to time. But I wouldn't give this game 1 out of 10 for that, like a lot of other people seem to do.Buy it, IF you're a REAL Aliens fan (2nd movie with Colonial Marines in it) Then you should love this one, if not well. :) I'm sure if you look deep in your mind you've seen a lot worse and given it much better rating then 3-4 out of 10Buy it, play CO-OP and feel the crazy action around you :) Cuz it's nonstop and it IS crazy cheers!

content:
Posted: September 30, 2016
												Pros: reasonably fun to play. Authentic to the films. You go to pretty much every location from the films that you can think of and would want to go. Some of the drama works. Challenging. Longer than any of the AvP games' Marine campaigns(and almost as long as them all combined. Add Stasis Interrupted and it is longer than them all combined), and does cool some things those don't. Solid MP customization.Cons: meh writing. Fan-fic-y plot. Characters are awkwardly and obviously designed as similar to the film's Marines. One major dumb wish fulfillment retcon. The campaign does slightly overstay its welcome. Still not all that well-made though it's no longer broken. Occasionally does break, especially the AI. MP is dead.My recommendation: if it's on sale... you love the first two Alien films... and badly want to play games in the franchise... consider it.

number of helpful: 5 of 7 people (71%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 14, 2015
												This game is so bad it gave me 4 different STDs previously unknown to science. Even ignoring the fact that the game failed to live up to any of its hype, or that they pulled a huge bait and switch with the demos and the actual game, the game itself is complete junk.1. The gunplay is clunky at best. It's very slow paced with little variety in the enemies you fight any any given time. The auto save function is also badly implemented and you regularly find yourself forced to go through several dice roll live/die encounters only to get cheap shotted at the last one and having to start the entire series over again. 2. Your deaths feel cheap - Rarely will you have a "good" or "fun" fight. Either you clean up the Aliens with very little challenge or they will over run you and you die in 1-2 hits. While this melee quick death mechanic is understandable you typically find it happening because the Aliens will glitch and ignore your pushback attack, or because a friendly NPC doesn't pull his own weight - leaving you to ration out your precious bullets while they stand in an empty corner waiting for something interesting to happen. Which brings us to -3. The AI is awful. You a regularly forced to rely on AI controlled partners who forget what their job is. Whether it's opening a door, covering you while you open a door, or sometimes even simply moving out of the way is often well outside of thier ability. The Aliens are equally glitchy. As previously mentioned they will sometimes  ignore your melee attack (often the only thing that will stop a quick death) or leap off of walls and just kind of forget what they were doing. The game is loaded with jump scares where a Xenomorph will leap out of a hatch and then loiter casually while they wait for you to kill them. They have a difficult time going through open doorways and it seems that the only challenge they pose is the occasional cheap death4. The game is ugly - Not a lot to say about this. The textures in this game are unforgivably bad. The Aliens have few animations which makes they look kind of silly when they're doing anything but wall running. It looks like they try to hide some of this behind a very distracting film grain but even that does little to keep the game from looking 10 years older than it really is. 5. The Story is terrible - Just... just terrible. While there are many nostalgic things to see and easter eggs to find you're better off just rewatching the movies because it's not worth the time to slog through the game to find them. The dialogue is ham fisted, even for action movie meatheads and much of the "Story" seems like a series of very poorly scripted events that make little to no sense  *Spoilers* Why would a trained Marine throw a grenade at a missile which is sitting near your only way out? Why would multiple umbilicals between the ships break for seemingly no reason? All of this is almost forgivable if the end of the game wasen't completely given away within the first 10 minutes if you have even the most basic knowledge of the Alien seriesTL;DR  No, just no. If this game goes on sale for two dollars, it's still not worth the time to play through it. Instead my suggestion would be to pop "Aliens" into your DVD player and just make gun noises at the screen during action sequences.

												This game is so bad it gave me 4 different STDs previously unknown to science. Even ignoring the fact that the game failed to live up to any of its hype, or that they pulled a huge bait and switch with the demos and the actual game, the game itself is complete junk.1. The gunplay is clunky at best. It's very slow paced with little variety in the enemies you fight any any given time. The auto save function is also badly implemented and you regularly find yourself forced to go through several dice roll live/die encounters only to get cheap shotted at the last one and having to start the entire series over again. 2. Your deaths feel cheap - Rarely will you have a "good" or "fun" fight. Either you clean up the Aliens with very little challenge or they will over run you and you die in 1-2 hits. While this melee quick death mechanic is understandable you typically find it happening because the Aliens will glitch and ignore your pushback attack, or because a friendly NPC doesn't pull his own weight - leaving you to ration out your precious bullets while they stand in an empty corner waiting for something interesting to happen. Which brings us to -3. The AI is awful. You a regularly forced to rely on AI controlled partners who forget what their job is. Whether it's opening a door, covering you while you open a door, or sometimes even simply moving out of the way is often well outside of thier ability. The Aliens are equally glitchy. As previously mentioned they will sometimes  ignore your melee attack (often the only thing that will stop a quick death) or leap off of walls and just kind of forget what they were doing. The game is loaded with jump scares where a Xenomorph will leap out of a hatch and then loiter casually while they wait for you to kill them. They have a difficult time going through open doorways and it seems that the only challenge they pose is the occasional cheap death4. The game is ugly - Not a lot to say about this. The textures in this game are unforgivably bad. The Aliens have few animations which makes they look kind of silly when they're doing anything but wall running. It looks like they try to hide some of this behind a very distracting film grain but even that does little to keep the game from looking 10 years older than it really is. 5. The Story is terrible - Just... just terrible. While there are many nostalgic things to see and easter eggs to find you're better off just rewatching the movies because it's not worth the time to slog through the game to find them. The dialogue is ham fisted, even for action movie meatheads and much of the "Story" seems like a series of very poorly scripted events that make little to no sense  *Spoilers* Why would a trained Marine throw a grenade at a missile which is sitting near your only way out? Why would multiple umbilicals between the ships break for seemingly no reason? All of this is almost forgivable if the end of the game wasen't completely given away within the first 10 minutes if you have even the most basic knowledge of the Alien seriesTL;DR  No, just no. If this game goes on sale for two dollars, it's still not worth the time to play through it. Instead my suggestion would be to pop "Aliens" into your DVD player and just make gun noises at the screen during action sequences.

content:
Posted: December 27, 2013
												Definitely not as bad as it's made out to be, thought it's not as good as it was hyped up to be, i played through with the recent patch on "Ultimate Badass" difficulty and i really enjoyed the experience. Being someone who grew up with the original AVP 1 and 2 on PC, i feel this adds some new elements to those past expereince and takes some away. Those that i feel were improvements were the ability to pull out your motion tracker instead of it being "built-in" to the hud, the graphics (obviously), the AI for sure, audio/atmospheric experience (Music, Gun sounds (Especially the "true to" movie M41-A), Alien sounds, and lighting). This game does however, as i said take away from some of the things that made the old AVP Marine campaign good and scary. I think the whole idea of having a team was a cool new expereince, but being forced to look out for yourself in the old AVP made it awesome, and scary. They could have done this by just minimizing the amount of campaign missions that you spend with your squad, and then toned down some of the combat encounters that you would otherwise die in without the help of your squad. I also feel that the old managment of your shoulder lamp battery was good and should have been kept and they could have made it more of a necessity by putting you alone in dark environments. Not only that but the flare system was good as well because it was another resource you had to keep track of. I know this one is more of a ridiculous thing to look at in most games today, but for games like AVP where you have plenty of cool weapons at your disposal, it's a shame you're limited down to 3 in your "hot-swap" tray whereas in AVP 1 and 2 you could have them all bound to keys "1-0". This is more of a nit-pick feature, but i also was disapointed in the ability to use doors to your advantage against the Aliens, because in AVP 2 there were a few times where you could do that and nothing beats the rush of knowing you have a creature who brings forth death right behind you and then you close the door right in their face (That might just be me though :) ). Overall the game is good and definitely not as bad as it's made out to be, i think most of the bad reviews came from people who never played the old games, or maybe i'm just a softy for the AVP franchise.

number of helpful: 7 of 11 people (64%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 11, 2013
												SO! This might be the most controversial game of the last 10 years! No joke! Moving right on! Developed by Gearbox, TimeGate and Nerve, A:CM's story is a true sequel to 1986's Aliens, produced by James Cameron (amazing film) and also Alien 3 (which was kinda sh*tty) and the story meets my expectations and actually exceeds them, although I need to be fair and say that the ending is a bit disappointing AND there was this major plot point that never really got explained in the game (How the hell did the Sulaco get out of Fury 161?). It could use a bit more work, but as a sequel to the movies, it works pretty well and it's quite enjoyable throughout the whole campaign, out of all the 4 Movies + this game...Colonial Marines might have the best story out of all 5, really! (let's face it, Alien(s) never had a good story to begin with... so... it's like a rotten apple in the middle of a pile of dog♥♥♥♥♥♥..)Gameplay: It's great! The sound of the Pulse Rifle just bursting away and the acid spewing from the Xenos is always great and the guns feel amazing! Just like I wanted them too! Some new guns were also introduced, something very risky and hard to pull off, but they nailed it, they feel like they have been there since the original movie! You will fight hordes of Xenos and PMC's throughout the game (the PMC's appear and are explained like in the 2nd level, and while I expected only to be fighting Xenos, the PMC's make sense in the story, surprinsingly!)- Acid doesn't damage you, though... WHAT THE ♥♥♥♥?!As for gameplay, I must also address the Xenomorph gameplay (they are only playable in the Multiplayer modes though). They feel much better compared to the Aliens from AVP2010, which felt very wonky and hard to control.The view is now 3rd person! F-I-N-A-L-L-Y!Every fatality you pull off and every swipe with the claws feel amazingly nice and it's alot of fun! Too bad the Multiplayer is *almost* dead (you can still find some matches occasionally).Graphics: Bad, the graphics are a massive disappointment, they look very different from the 2011 Demo and the Xenos (unlike in the Demo) like disappear after they die, something that didn't happen during the demo gameplay. The game, sadly, also has a few bugs/glitches. I beat the game twice (Soldier (which is normal) and Hardened, doing a 3rd now on Recruit (easy) to collect all the dog tags that are left (Missed like 3) and planning on doing a 4th playthrough on Ultimate Badass mode (it's the f*cked up mode, basically)) and I've witnessed 1 game breaking bug, where a door would just not open! Restarted the game and everything was fixed. Bugs, I found few but some...The most annoying was the Raven Boss battle, which involved the use of a PowerLoader. The Raven Boss battle has the Raven get stuck in some corners (which is the best part, just spam him with attacks xD) and some times teleport to the other corner of the arena. It's by far the worst part of the game, because of how extremely clunky it is!Sound Quality: Amazingly Stellar, the guns sound the same as in the movie Aliens (they used the sound files from the movie so, there's that), the voice acting is solid (for the most part), I found it engaging and the characters sounded decently emotional when they should (too bad the facial animations are sh*t so when they are happy and sad, they look the same, something from like 2006, but this is part of graphics, not the sound, so anyways...), the lip syncing is a hit and miss, sometimes it's great, amazing actually, and sometimes it's just plain bad, so there's that as well...I think I've pretty much covered everything (except what is the controvesy around this game, I'll post it in the comments for those who don't already know it...)To finish it off, Aliens: Colonial Marines is... *shocker* not a bad game! But it's not great either and this game could pull off a GOTY award, it really really could! But to my sadness (as a kind of Hardcore fan of the Aliens franchise), it's far from a GOTy contender.6.5/10, flawed on pretty much every aspect of it, it reeks potential, which btw, sadly isn't met. However! The fact that this game is REALLY FUN is undenyable imo. Thus the score...Flame away, ♥♥♥♥♥es! I enjoyed A:CM even though Pitchford lied his ♥♥♥ off about it. Unexcusable, true; but that doesnt mean it ain't fun. Like a janky space version of Left 4 Dead...kinda.(REVIEW EDITED TO FIX TYPOS)

content:
Posted: August 27, 2016
												I really do not understand why this game has such a bad reputation. These are the complaints and the facts.Complaints: "It's too much like COD." or "There are too many Weyland Yutani mercs." and  "AVP 1999 & AVP 2 were the best aliens games EVA." My response "And those game weren't like COD? It's an FPS, what the hell do you expect? I was a fan of both, however they too were typical FPS run and gun games, and AVP 2 Had allot of mercs as well in the marine campaign. ACM has way better graphics than both those games, looks and sounds more cannon and faithful to the movie Aliens, and the voice acting is pretty good and a hell of allot better than AVP 2. But I will admit the dialogue is a little silly at times and unrealistic, and some very dumbass statements were made by a few characters, I'll give the community that one, but is easily ignored and of little consequence."Complaints: "It was falsely advertised." and "The Game is buggy."  "The marines sound too much like COD talk." or "The story sucks and has plot holes."My response "I saw the steam trailer, and it was not falsely advertized, there was nothing in the official trailer that was not in the game. If people are referring to E3 demos and screenshots literally from 8 years prior to ACM's release. Give me a ♥♥♥♥ing break whiny candy asses. E3 (Which I did not see and could care less about) is not a finished product and in fact is a demo. As for screenshots of earlier development, ya I saw those and they looked alright at the time, but this looks better IMO. And those screens were from another developer who abandoned the project and left us fans hanging, so♥♥♥♥♥♥on those screens and the lazy ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s for teasing us all those years ago.  As far as being buggy, well I cannot add much to this because I did not purchase this game until the price came down and was already patched. I will not pay $60 dollars for any damn game no matter how much I want to play it. That price point is ridiculous, thus is the reason I haven't bought the last COD's or Deus EX HR yet. Won't do it, other things take priority. But there were a few bugs still, but not enough to break the game experience.  And the complaint that the marines sound like... well... ♥♥♥♥ing marines...?, is idiotic. And as far the story is concerned, Its more cannon than other Alien games, with the exception of Isolation. I could care less about a few plot holes because I have always wanted to explore LV-426, and this alone was a pleasure to experience. And the way they allowed the fan to do this was handled pretty well IMO. And this story was 100 times better then the abominations that are the subsequent movie sequels, Resurrection, AVP, AVP2. As well as the AVP 2 Game, way better story..no one can deny this fact."Last major complaint of the community is that the story was a little short and the Queen battle sucked. This is a matter of taste, as I thought it was about right, Isolation (Which is a great game) ran just a little long, but that is hardly a blemish. AVP 1999 was no different than this game (Spoiler) as you had to complete a few tasks to blow her out the airlock, and people say it is better than this game. I was a for sure fan of AVP 1999, but most of its praise comes from nostalgia, which is not a bad thing in of itself, but to say it is superior to this game is out right ridiculous. And also I think allot of people read some of the reviews and went in already♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥off and on the band wagon. And as for people saying they want a refund are just being melodramatic (Maybe not so much if they paid $60, but that's on them for paying that much for a damn game). In closing I enjoyed this game a little more than AVP 2010 (Marine campaign). And while I love Isolation extremely, it is simply a different style of game that matches the mood of the first movie, while this matches the second movie very well (Remember they were running and gunning in the Aliens as well). I've played through this game three times and I will likely do a forth. My only real complaint is the multiplayer, simply because I can't and never have played it (Servers are empty). I bought this at just a little over $20 but now is at $14 and is well worth it. I give it an overall strong 6.7/10, if that seems high it's because I am a super fan of the franchise, if I was a general gamer and not a strong fan probably a 5/10. If you're a fan of the franchise this is a must for your library.

number of helpful: 46 of 87 people (53%) found this review helpful7 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: July 26, 2015
												I think this game has been burdened by bad press so I wanted to try and up it's good name. At the time of its original release, the game was incomplete and many felt it had been falsley advertised graphically etc. I also feel sorry for the pre-order people who got somewhat cheated in that respect. That sucks - the lesson there though is, don't pre-order a pc game ever. However, having bought the game about 2 weeks ago for 5 pounds (inc DLC), I have yet to encounter any bugs or glitches -  Gearbox have gone back and done a huge amount of patching, around 10GB worth (much to their credit) - EXCEPT for the very strange one when you try to quit the game and for some reason steam keeps re-launching the game over and over....there are easy fixes for that problem though, so it's really not a big deal. Apart from that, the bugs all seem to be fixed and it runs fine for me.I have really enjoyed this game so far and I expected to turn it off straight away based on what all the other reviews say. But you need to realise that those reviews have everything to do with feeling 'cheated' on initial release and nothing to do with the quality of the actual CURRENT game. The graphics are actually CURRENTLY really nice; not next gen but nearly there - definitely top quality with awesome lighting effects. The strength of this game comes from how they have replicated the atmosphere and feel of the films through use of graphics and animation style - it's really authentic and true to Aliens -  and that is how the graphics succeed. It's not about technicality. If you love Aliens (the second film) this is definitely for you, as you get to go to many of the sick locations from the film and they are accurately portrayed.GOOD THINGS:The gameplay is really fun. If you wanted to be the marine, this is your chance. In honesty it's not perfect, but it's nearly there; Aliens limbs fly off when you shoot; your bullets feel like they connect well; the acid blood is well done; the sound of the guns - infact all the game sounds - are taken directly from the film so its absolutely great and authentic. It feels awesome firing that pulse rifle with its signature noise. Great selection of guns  espcecially with the dlc. The music is the same as the film which makes the atmosphere and experience really strong. The level art, escpecially in Hadleys Hope is excellent. Baddies can be blown to bits - I shot a dudes head off with HIcks' shotgun and loved it - and they die really well at times. Also the game has alot of style to its scripted and non scripted events! Solid voice acting.BAD THINGS:Things that let the game down are really minor and depend on how picky you are. For example some surfaces don't recieve bullet holes, some do. Some glass breaks, some doesn't. Many objects are static when they should have havoc or physX - but some do move and are destructible. Some dead bodies are identical to the next. Aliens corpses disappearing shortly after death. Generally it can feel a little rushed in places - moments when you think 'oh, they coulda done that a bit better...'FINAL WORD:It's a shame because it's only just short of being a perfect Aliens experience and it's as if they ran out of time - demonstrated by the rushed feel of identical dead bodies, surfaces that don't take bullet holes etc. HOWEVER DON'T LET THAT OR THE MINOR THINGS DETER YOU! You get so engrossed in the frantic slaying of xenomorphs that all these minor bad points really do fall into the background: they are over powered by everything good about the game. I urge you to try it but don't pay more than a tenner I would say. NOTE: For best experience, always fire from the hip as the iron sights make the gun look/feel like a toy - once you upgrade to laser sight this becomes easy and the shooting feels great again. This really is a strong game, with a few disappointing things to note, but it is by no means♥♥♥♥♥♥ if it was♥♥♥♥♥♥I would say because I have high standards....SO DEFINITELY PLAY IT! Especially if you are an Aliens fan! But again just don't spend more than a tenner.

content:
Posted: December 8, 2014
												Terrible game. Literally the only saving grace is Bug hunt mode which is a seperate DLC where you defend against Waves of Aliens in co-op. It's awesome and i highly recommend you buy the game just for this mode alone. Sadly with the main game within half of one level you're already fighiting waves of humans. What is this i'm playing? Call of Duty Alien Ops? Most of the core game has you fighting humans with some Aliens here and now thrown into the mix. There's literally no respect for the Aliens in this game they are mindless drones with bare bones AI. The tension is ruined by the fact you can carry 15 weapons stocked up with ammo. Seriously? In the movie all they had was a few pulse rifles a busted up Flame Thrower and a couple of Grenades. Here its easy mode though.Don't buy this game for the online because its dead, no one plays this game anymore, which forces it into a singleplayer only game. Now then, unless you have buddies who are willing to pay for this game, Then the mode you should play is Bug Hunt. Things the game does right is the Sound Design. The game Sounds awesome! And that's awesome. Also the Visuals are quite good. The game nails the look of the movies down to the bolts on the walls.Everything else is trash. I wouldn't recommend this game to anyone, You'd better spend your money on AVP2010 or AVP Gold. More fun and enjoyable and both games are made by a developer who actually care about the francise.

number of helpful: 10 of 17 people (59%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 25, 2013
												Aliens: Colonial Marines has gotten a bad rap, and justifiably so. But is it as horrible as people would have you believe? Not really. There are many worse games for sale. But fortunately, there are far more better games out there as well.Much of the uproar about the game was about how its graphics failed to live up to the pre-release trailers; on launch, the game looked noticably poorer in comparison. But even in that sorry state, the game was hardly a disaster on the eyes; in many areas, it looked equivalent in quality to other multi-platform FPS games. In a select few areas, the game was actually quite nice looking, in fact. Since then, the developers have released a four gigabyte patch which rectifies many of the game's visual faults and - while it will never be competitive with games like Metro 2033 or Crysis 3 - can easily hold its own against the Call of Duty or similar games. No, unfortunately, the problems with the game lay far deeper than the visual gloss. Almost every other area of the game was flawed, from the musical score, to the storyline, or the unimpressive AI and underpowered weaponry. Forget how the title looked; the game itself was simply not fun to play.The AI is flat-out laughable. Pre-patch, it was possible to walk up to one of the eponymous monstrosities and punch them to death. Even after being patched, it was not uncommon to see the dreaded xenomorphs of the franchise ignore targets to chase their own tails. They inspired no fear whatsoever. The human enemies were far more of a threat, but only because they could attack from range and thus had a greater opportunity to actually hit you.  The primary change made to the AI by the patch is that their attacks inflicted more damage, but the actual AI routines remain predictible.The story and setting are forgettable at best, and insulting at worst. It flat out contradicts the franchise's canon in a poor attempt at a surprise twist. The characters are uninteresting and the voice-acting was poor, despite the use of known actors such as Michael Biehn, who half-heartedly reprises his role as Cpl. Hicks from the movie Aliens. The soundtrack is utterly unnoticable, and failed to inspire any emotion or excitement whatsoever.I could go on. The animations of the characters - aliens and humans alike - border on the pathetic. The weapons lack the power we expect from guns that carry names such as "pulse rifles" or "smart guns", and anyway ammunition is in such short supply that you'll rarely get to use them to full effect anyway. The level design is linear and crowded, and - except for the rare setpiece - rarely offers anything appealing to look at. There's not enough variety in weapons or enemies to keep things entertaining, and most objectives are little more complicated than "walk over there". There are a few highlights - one level has you stealthing through a sewer of sleeping aliens - but this is the rare exception.Still, the game is not entirely hopeless, especially for fans of the franchise. Revisiting the (virtual) sets of the second movie has great appeal, and it was hard for me not to get excited when I crawled through the ruins of the Hadleys Hope colony, the ductwork of the Sulaco or visited the dead "Engineer" seen in both Alien and Prometheus. There were rare moments of terror and adrenaline rush when facing down a horde of xenomorphs. And I never get tired of hearing the scream of an alien or the chattering roar of the pulse rifle.Still, is that enough to save the game, much less recommend it? Sadly, no, on both counts. Aliens Colonial Marines has its moments but they are too far apart and too interspersed with ineffectual gameplay to make for a fun experience. It may not deserve the entirity of the wrath that has descended down upon it, but neither should it garner much praise.

content:
Posted: January 1, 2014
												This is not bad, but it's not good ethier. When a game takes this long to be made there should have been red flags up by now. Colonial marines is one of those games that people got really hyped for and well got their dreams crushed. The story feels like a bad alien fan fic with characters that are so memorable i forgot who they were after I played the game. hell the story is almost as bad as alien 3.The visuals are mediocre Some ok modelling and it does do the job well of recreating some elements of the movies, I can Admit I did like the designs of the new xenos which are more plausable than say well a winged xeno with fire breath or something. though the particle effects look so bad they even show jaggies and the pixels. sound fairs better, but not much the sound effects again do a faithful job recreating the feel of the movies. As for the gameplay well it's a fairly decent fps. The shooting is competant and shooting xenos CAN be enjoyable just good luck finding that. I do appreciate the retro fps elements like the healthpacks,carrying all the weapons and some exploration by finding certain guns and audio logs. the enemy ai despite what people will tell you *cough* angry joe are not that stupid infact they do what they should do attack the player hell sometimes the enemy was a major threat in some cases in my playthrough. the ally AI it's bad but it isn't a major problem unless you heavily rely on them which you don't. The multiplayer has it's moments but it isn't acceptional. Overall Colonial Marines is just an average fps. Was I dissapointed? yes Could it have been better? yes. I will say that gearbox flat out lying for this product was unforgivable. So yeah I think that people thought colonial marines was awful was because of the high expectations after all anything that goes in dev hell has to be awesome like too human. 5/10 it's not bad nor good just sort of average.

												You know honestly this game was not that bad. Do not get me wrong though it is not a great game by any means. The game does have poor textures in spots, bad AI, very short length, a dead multiplayer, and some unfair balance. Despite this there is some good here. If you are playing on the hardest difficulty(the only way to play this game) then the game can be pretty tense.If you like the liscense and you like fps then I suggest trying it on sale. I was able to get this game and all the dlc for like 80 cents on a discount Aliens bundle. I would say this game is worth about 5 dollars to play through. It is an average fps with a decent use of the liscense that will make this worth playing for a fan.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 20
												When this game was first released it was a buggy unplayable mess. TemplarGFX's ACM Overhaul fixed most of the game's major issues, so it's now far less buggy and far more fun. So my "thumbs up" vote assumes you immediately download and apply that mod (look on the forums for more info).The game is most fun in co-op. I got three friends together and we went through the main campaign and the DLC campaign, "Stasis Interrupted" and it was quite fun. Do note that the DLCs are no longer sold separately so if you buy the game you get everything, though I would definitely wait until it goes on sale which seems to happen fairly often.It's a first person shooter that verges on the "survival horror" genre as your enemies are very dangerous and you'll always be looking for scarce health and ammo. There's a variety of different enemies to fight in different tactical situations. Sometimes there are intense run-and-gun sections where your only goal is to survive while running from one area to another. Other times you'll be given "defend this area" missions and be able to set up auto-turrets to make your last stand. There are even a few brief stealth missions.The main enemies are of course the titular Aliens. They are extremely dangerous and can kill you almost instantly at close range even if you're at full health. They can also outrun you, spit acid, spill their acidic blood on you if they die too close, run on the walls and ceilings, come out of floor vents, and generally scare the hell out of you. You'll have access to a large number of weapons, some of which you'll recognize from the movies. The weapons have secondary fire modes and can be upgraded over time which keeps things interesting. You'll also have a motion tracker which can be very helpful as the aliens will constantly be trying to ambush you from every direction; however you can't have your gun and motion tracker out at the same time.The storyline is a continuation of the first two Aliens films. You'll revisit some recognizable areas from the films and even meet some characters from the films. The storyline is one of the strongest aspects of the game, the voice acting was generally good, and the music meshed well with what was going on. Graphics were good (WITH the Overhaul mod!). The scary atmosphere was superb; they really did a great job with setting the scene.Singleplayer is actually significantly harder than co-op because there is no one to revive you if you go down. You will be accompanied by AI teammates for most of the game, but their usefulness varies widely. Sometimes your AI teammates are able to dish out a lot of damage making a hard fight easy. Other times your teammates will sit around and watch unconcerned as you get swarmed and torn to shreds by aliens at close range. MULTIPLAYERIt's hard to find a good game. The "Bug Hunt" survival DLC was to me the most fun out of the multiplayer modes. You have to survive successive waves of enemies, and use downtime between waves to open up new areas and set up better defenses. BUGS:TemplarGFX's Overhaul fixes most of the bugs, but these three you'll probably run into...1. We did have some crashes in co-op only, most of which seemed to revolve around the flamethrower weapon, so we just stopped using flamethrowers and this problem went away.  2. The game automatically restarts when you try to quit. Run the game as an administrator or quickly click the X icon to close out the game restart.3. Quicktime events. Sometimes an alien will leap on you and a quick time event will start in which you have to press E or V to push them off and survive. The V event works, but the E event never does, making facehuggers actually one of the most dangerous enemies in the game. They are thankfully rare however.Overall I had a love/hate relationship with this game. It has brief moments of brilliance marred by moments of buggy stupidity that will make you lament at how great this game COULD have been. As it is now I can only say it's "good" not great, and can only recommend it to Aliens fans and those looking for an inexpensive survival horror shooter.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 19, 2015
												Okay, so if some of you pay attention to my reviews, you might notice that I reference this game a lot, but in more of a negative context. After writing my Alien: Isolation review and looking at how much I trashed this, I decided to speak the truth about Aliens: Colonial Marines.First things first - Colonial Marines isn't a horrible game, but it isn't quite great either.What it does do right is be a game about the United States Colonial Marines, as well as being a followup of Aliens. The story makes some, but not much sense, and the characters are like weak polyps compared to the cast of Aliens. Perhaps my favorite thing to make fun of is the recurring theme/phrase of "We don't leave Marines behind!", which I guess is supposed to sound heroic, badass and macho, but it sets up the pins for the ending to knock down. (The ending is actually really funny because of this, but I'm not going to spoil it.)The gameplay could most certainly use some third-party modifications from sites such as moddb.com, or any other sites that might have good mods for this game (in fact, message me and tell me if you find some good ones). The gameplay is beyond too easy, and as Angry Joe describes, if it weren't for scripted moments and moments where you have to kill all of the enemies to progress, then you "could completely run through entire levels in less than five minutes; ignoring Aliens along the way, never firing a shot, and still win." My recommended perscription is the "Survival" mod on the aforementioned website, since it makes the hardest difficulty a true challenge that made me die more times than Alien: Isolation did. The Aliens can potentially perform finishing moves on you at full health, and acid is absolutely fatal. (It also gives you a classic pulse rifle with the original appearance and a proper 95-round capacity.)Multiplayer is also pretty cool, since unlike Aliens vs. Predator, you can unlock mutations, perks, traits and stuff for both Marines and Aliens, who both level independantly of one another. And like in AVP, you are able to personalize both species; for Aliens you can do things like change the design of your head, the color of your carapace, and your fatality (do you want to puke acid all over his face, or his heart?), and for Marines it's pretty much like Make-A-Marine Workshop, "Where Badasses are Made" - different heads, voices, camouflage patterns, pouches, knives, helmet attachments, decals for your helmet, shoulders and chest, and much, much more that really can't be described perfectly.So if you want to leisurely shoot through sci-fi's most infamous serpent with acidic blood and spring-loaded jaws, or have a Call of Duty experience for a cheaper price, then this is a pretty good game to play; though if you want a great Aliens experience closer to the films, play all of the AVP games as well as Alien: Isolation.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 22, 2016
												The horror of being a Colonial Marine is real thanks to SEGA, above the criticism, Aliens Colonial Marines delivers a(n) (almost) solid experience. If you really want to find cons in this game then you'll likely find them and if you're a fps gamer then you'll probably find this game not-so-advanced in terms of gameplay, but the lover of the genre, the old school fps-type player and in a closer way the hardcore lover of the Alien franchise, cannot ultimately find this game uninteresting and will eventually give it a playthrough sooner or later. That's because Aliens Colonial Marines is a game that keeps intact the core atmosphere of Aliens, and given that you're able to close an eye at the occasional glitch and that you're not demanding too much in terms of intricate or extremely godmode fps mechanics, then you'll like this game. Afterall, you're the average Marine on your (not so) daily routine-job, trained to kill, that's true, but still partially green against a menance that's not human in form and mind. You will embark a semi-space oddissey revealing your true nature as a survivor, demonstrating that you're not that average afterall, but an extremely capable soldier if not a hero, should we consider the ethics. All in all, the story is good for a spin-off, if not for some forced innests and twists inside the canon that maybe were a bit hazardous. This game is deadly both in the reconstruction of all the stuff that we've seen in the movie, and in the idealization of new ideas and concepts about the setting. Elements and details such as weaponry and sounds are 100% loyal to Cameron's creature, and the same goes for the whole visuals, paying their tribute to H.R Giger and other artists.Pros:- Stays true to the movie- Old school adrenaline formula- Good atmosphere, tasteful setting, concrete believable sci-fi lookCons:- Sometimes it's glitchy- Not so appealing to non Alien(s) fans Personal comment:This game managed to realize one of my childhood dreams: to be a Colonial Marine (trapped) on LW-426 fighting hordes of aliens.
