content:
Posted: March 8, 2013
												Это крайне заурядный шутер: старомодный, некрасивый, неудобный и очень тоскливый. Нет интересных событий, нет зрелищ, нет постановки, нет умных тактических сражений, нет страха, нет атмосферы. Игра выглядит несовременно и неряшливо сделана, несмотря на детальную проработку. Физики оружия нет. Здесь можно увидеть, как вода подтекает из целой и невредимой трубы, ксеноморфы выползают из вентиляционных отверстий, за которыми зияет чернота, а персонажи иногда отказываются делать то, что велит им скрипт. Чужие не просто ведут себя глупо, они еще и нелогичны. Они выскакивают на свет, затем прыгают на стену, выползают на видное место и застревают там. Из врагов натурально падают ящички с гранатами, патроны и аптечки, по палубам «Сулако» разбросаны шлемы и бронежилеты. В кампанию можно играть даже вчетвером, но сюжет для этого совсем не предназначен. В результате получается глупость: там, где по сюжету в одиночной игре должны были быть двое морпехов, оказываются сразу пятеро. В игре четыре сетевых режима, из которых выделяется только «Спасение». Задача морпехов — пробежать из пункта А в пункт Б и выжить, задача чужих — помешать им и всех убить. Управлять чужими придется с видом от третьего лица, а анимация тут просто ужасна — нормально проползти через дверной проем уже составляет проблему, какие уж там скрытные атаки и молниеносные нападения. Карт для каждого режима только две. Моя оценка 6/10.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 25, 2013
												Aliens Colonial Marines. Having gone through the campaign, and experienced the multiplayer for a few hours, I feel like I can give my review/opinion of this title. Let's get one thing out of the way first. Everyone knows the amount of hate this game is having everywhere. Reviewers didn't like it, and players didn't like it either... Although i feel most of those players talking about how bad this game is, probably didn't even try it. The question everyone asks is this: Is A:CM really that bad? The answer my friends, is yes and no. This is a very straight forward, linear shooter. Objectives are simple, aliens are dumb (terrible AI in the sense that they always run at you, with no strategy other than eat your bullets), humans are annoying to deal with and you are incredibly overpowered with all the weapons you can carry with you at all times. The only way this game will challenge you a bit is on the Ultimate Badass difficulty. A lot has been said about the visuals, but having played this game maxed out my opinion is that the game looks good, if not great. There is the occasional low rez texture, but the PC version at least manages to look above average. The unreal engine is a well proven juggernaut in the games industry, so the engine is not the problem. The lazyness of the developers is, but only in some aspects of the game world. It could have looked a lot better (no out of the box Direct X 10 or 11 support... Gearbox what's wrong with you...), but as it stands this game looks ok, and in some parts it looks great.I feel the gameplay is a lot like COD. Depending on who you ask, it may be a bad or a good thing. In my opinion the gameplay is fine, the game is fast and the shooting mechanics are simple to master. Most fans of shooters like Crysis, Far Cry or Battlefield will more than likely hate the gameplay of Colonial Marines.It is a very simple game for today standards.Having said that, if you are an Alien fan, you will most definately enjoy this game, and possibly even love it. The details and fan service from the alien franchise are top notch. There are tons of references and visual cues from that beloved franchise. But the game itself falls flat in it's ambitions, and it is certainly not the Aliens sequel we were promised. The story is wonky and doesn't make much sense, but it's ultimately serviceable. Multiplayer is fun, providing you play with players from your own rank. It can be incredibly unbalanced due to the level up system, but stick with it and you will have some fun. In conclusion, i would only recommend this game as a must buy if you are a truly hardcore Aliens fan. The game is flawed, it lacks the tension from the Aliens franchise, and it won't scare you much, if at all. Some moments in the game do make you feel you are in the movie, but these are few and far between. If you are undecided about this game, or if you are a shooter fan, chances are this game will be too linear for your taste, and it is not much of a challenge. If you can try the game somewhere before buying would be best. I know most people are hating on this game, but I am having a great time playing it. It is a very decent shooter, but we were all expecting a great one... And great Colonial Marines is not. I would rate this game a 6.5 out of 10The Good-Environments true to the movies;-Plenty of fan service;-Some (few) aspects of the story-Co-Op;The Bad-Wonky AI at times-Unbalanced Multiplayer-Low quality textures in unexpected places;-Linear

												For the love of god dont buy this game. AI is so bad, both friendlies and hostiles. You really have no idea whats going to happen. Friendly AI is always in the way or stuck somewhere so you have to run back or restart the lvl. Guns feel weird, bad sound and just doesnt feel like a gun. Its like there is no feed back from it, just a pixel thing infront of you that fires bullets.There is no feeling in the game itself, after a misson a score board comes up and "LVL UP, UPGRADE, BUY THINGS TO YOUR GUN". In the middle of this horror war between the marines and the aliens, it just doesnt feel right. I did not play the multiplayer so yea, find it for 2£ and play for yourself, I am not going to!Update: After I refunded this game I bought it again for 3 dollars a year later. I heard a bunch of fixes was added. I can report that the game still looks crap (GTX970, i7 4790 quad core, 16 gig ram, 250gig SSD). Framerate drops occur every time you move into a new area, I can ussualy play in steady 60fps but drops very often to 30 and below. The enemys is still very weird, sometimes charges straight at you but for the most part they run around and dont do much. The friendly AI is a little bit better, still not good though. Very un-atmospheric.I dont really feel like I am a part of the world, just running around, leveling up and getting "LEVEL COMPLETED WOAAH" after ever misson. Just doesnt feel like an Alien game.

												5 out of 5 for all the right reasons.I have never reviewed a game before, but I'm going out of my way for this one because it deserves to be defended.The game is not mind blowingly spectacular. It's not a high end, maximum graphic type game.HOWEVER, what the game does have is gameplay that keeps you highly entertained and that's what I paid for.The COOP is perfect, arming 4 Marines in a war against Aliens and mercenaries. The weapons upgrade system is minimal but leaves you feeling satisfied when add new attachments and skins to your guns.The A.I. isnt terrible and on the Ultimate Badass it's quite fun with 4 people waging war against the Aliens.I do not have the DLC's however I am told they only make the game better than it already it is.Long story short, people give this game a bad rap because they are expecting a major title type game. number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 19, 2014
												I bought it so what? I love this franchise and don't judge! Even if most everyone else thinks this game is a piece of crap. I was among the many that stayed away because of the reviews and how much people felt cheated and lied to. After the patch, it became something different which is why I even considered forking over the $5 for this game. I will also admit that this isn't the same thing that was shown at E3, maybe a financial thing came up and they had to reduce things to be able to finish the product. Also, keep in mind that it wasn't just Gearbox that worked on this game, there were a few other studios who had their hands in as well funds more than likely had to be distributed evenly among the developers.I'm 27 years old and I was exposed to this franchise at a young age I remember being on the edge of my seat chewing on my nails because the movies were so intense.Now for the review. At first glance this game doesn't seem like much and most people need to be hooked in the first five minutes otherwise it's a flop or you have those that have played it for hours and hours and still feel cheated. In my case, that's not the truth here even though it kind of had a slow take off I will admit that I did get spooked a little bit even though the graphics are not top notch, but I don't care as long as the game has some sort of mechanic to make up for it. This game combines just enough intense moments, gun action, and Aliens that aren't as dumb as most people think to make up for the mediocre visuals, the new AvP wasn't that pretty either, but again visuals are not my primary focus when it comes to a franchise that I love. I personally think that they nailed the atmoshphere of the 1986 movie, the Aliens look great maybe just a little bit muddy up close, they feel real and can catch you quick if you aren't paying attention. There are moments where their AI literally stops making them a part of a shooting gallery with stationary targets. But when the AI does work, watch out! You'll be surprised.Now for the sound and music, just one word, WONDERFUL! Weapons, environmental ambience, screeches all sound legit, etc. Get a good sound system to really enjoy them.Would I recommend this game to a friend? Well, simple answer if they can see through the crap people claim about this game, sure. Otherwise it's not for everyone. It's always going to be a love to hate relationship with any game plain and simple.8 out of 10 for me, I'm pretty satisfied with it despite it's minor flaws. The truth is people, your beloved CoD, BF3/4, Halo, and anything else game related are not going to be 100% perfect and they won't always be what you want them to be. So, just play it and see for yourself.

												Aliens Colonial Marines ReviewI have to admit Aliens: Colonial Marines on the PC is actually not bad graphically, saying that I am writing this review after a few years since it came out with all the patches and update's.I have to say after playing the console version the PC version of Aliens:Colonial Marines is without a doubt the best version of the game what the game should of been like on release, I picked this game up for cheap in 75% discount sale, so I never felt like I was being cheated out something it was bargain buy.Biggest problem over all with the game is that the story is not logical and sometimes seems a little dumb at parts you got impression there was no passion behind the story they were developing game guess that what happens when out sourced and passed  along to as many dev-teams like they did. The game is fun to play: Campaign & CO-OP mode is excellent  which is the games strongest point where can jump in with a squad of friend and go on exenomorph killing spree.I would say campaign is probably the game biggest weakness but online Multi-player is fantastic and amazing fun it really does shake up FPS when you have to think about ambushing marines and using stealth and use your wit's to get a kill instead of running and gunning like you would in a (Call of duty match).Multiplayer - I highly recommend (Escape Mode) and playing as the (Lurker Alien) and also the (Spitter for Team Death Match) which has the ability to shoot acid blood into colonial marines face. I found myself going back  to online Team Death match - who ever made online mode well done because it's great fun shame the game was handled as poorly as it was becuase level designs has allot love put into them really does feel like you are on the world of LV-426.

content:
Posted: July 6, 2016
												At this point, everyone knows the lowdown on Aliens Colonial Marines. This is not a good game. It's a terrible game with a production so troubled it's legendary. It's a game built on lies and shady behavior. Yet I admit I don't despise this game as much as it's reputation impiles. I won't lie, I consider this game a bit of a guilty pleasure to be honest. I guess I'm such a fanboy of the Alien films that I can find a teensy bit of enjoyment. It does look and sound like an Aliens game. The sound design in general is one of the game's few good points. It does feel like an Aliens game to me, albeit an awful one. However, while I may find some stupid enjoyment from this game, by no means can I reccomend it. Honestly it probably is one of the worst games of the 2010's. Gameplay is by the numbers at best. The Xenos are barely in it. The main campaign is pitifully short. The AI is still very dumb, though better than on launch. Graphics as is are passable but nothing great. The story is ATROCTIOUS. Perhaps it's because I got this game with all the DLC post launch, patched and for like 5 bucks. I may find some joy here in a "So Bad It's Good" way but that is no reccomendation. Even with the admirable and impressive mod by Templar GFX the game is still not something I would reccommend. Just get Alien Isolation or AVP 2010. Or even the classic AVP 2000.

												Having bought this on pre order for PS3 and being utterly utterly disappointed/angry with it, im not entirely sure why I ended up buying it again for PC... oh hang on I know, it wasnt £40 anymore, it was £3. If you make the effort to read the community pages and mod this up (have a look in the .ini files, you'll find all kinds of gfx options that are locked out originally) you will probably find a bit of enjoyment here, particularly if you are an Aliens fanboi/fangrrrl. Multiplayer seems to still work decently as of Feb 2014 which is something I certainly couldnt say for the abysmal PS3 version. The last patch on PC also seems to have fixed a lot of the ludicrous AI issues that plagued it when it first came out, and if you apply all the mods correctly its not an awful looking game at all with Bloom / HDR etc enabled. It just makes you think "what if they had actually got their act together in the first place?" A missed opportunity for sure but worth a punt in the sub-£5 category and if you can be bothered to download a couple of the small mods and do some .ini file tinkering.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 19, 2014
												Going against the grain on this game. and giving it a recommendation. (In fact, I actually own it on  console just for the CE. Picked up the PC version for $1.99, because quite simply, I'm much better at FPS on a PC than console... The CE had to be mine, as I grew up a HUGE Aliens fan, as a kid of the 70s and 80s, and had to add it to my Aliens "display o' goodies")The game itself is far from great, but it's certainly not horrible, either. I didn't get to playing it before the giant patch they released, but what I have played is certainly passable. Graphics are decent, but I'm not a huge "graphics guy," as long as the gameplay is at least solid. And ACM is a game that delivers some decent gameplay. Much like Duke Nukem Forever, the game's greatest fault lies in all the hype and desire over years of public want. (Of course, Gearbox's famous "gameplay video" shown certainly created some ill will.) There's nothing here that does the game greatness, nor have I found anything that makes it truly falter, either. Sure, it feels and looks a little dated, but does that break it as a game? No. Are there some really fun moments? Yes. Is most of it just standard FPS fare that you can find in most budget titles? Yes.The use of the Aliens license is a double edged sword. As an Aliens NUT, there's some real fun when boarding the Sulaco and stumbling across Bishop's lower half, seeing the grating pulled up from where the Queen stalked a crawling Newt. It's fun walking through Hadley's Hope, entering Operations and seeing the aftermath of the Colonial Marine's last stand, from blown through ceiling tiles the Aliens swarmed through, to the floor where Hudson was pulled down to his demise. It's fun finding the sentry guns. Fun finding Newt's doll's head or the final resting place of PFC Hudson. You can tell there WAS, in fact, a lot of love for the Aliens saga thrown into this game.But, it also hurts it... Don't ask too many questions of how most of Hadley's Hope is still intact when a major plot device of the movie was how quickly they needed to leave before being vaporized. There are plot holes here you can drive a truck through, and Gearbox does the one thing I cannot stand... Introduce "new" types of Aliens w/ nary an explanation. (Maybe I'm being too critical, and I believe I'm just a touch over half way through the story... Perhaps there's some sort of explanation given at some point...) But if you're going to get the license and rally around how much you respect the fiction involved, please don't allow the inner fanboy to start throwing things in there just to throw things in there. (While the Xenos typically gather some traits from their hosts.... Alien 3s 4 legged variety being an example,) what the heck led to walking time bomb Aliens? If the game is going to be considered "canon," (as has been stated in interviews before the game's release,) PLEASE show it some respect and stick to the "rules." (Ummm... so only the Marines on the Sulaco carried pulse rifles with "extended" magazines? Even extended, in the game, it doesn't carry the 99 rounds featured in the movie. Feels like a forced way to add more tension when you need to constantly reload.) I would also make the suggestion to use this game with SweetFX and locate in their community a fanamde preset entitled "Aliens Colonial Marines Almost Demo." It makes the game look, IMHO, pretty great via presets, and adds a bluish hue consistant with the James Cameron film. If you're an Alien nut, you'll probably enjoy the game and many of its tributes to the classic while also driving you a little crazy as to some of the plot holes. I've found it to be good in nearly every category, but never crossing over into great. Everything is just... So standard.If you're just looking for a FPS, I couldn't recommend unless it's on a deep discount. The $1.99 I paid for it to play on a system I'm more comfortable with was a steal, as far as I'm concerned, even owning it already. Sadly, you can probably find other FPSs cheaper that offer the same experience... A mostly average shooter.In a score term, I'd have to give it a 65%... For an Aliens nut, that number may crawl into the low 70s, maybe 75. Regards,Doc8998

content:
Posted: September 24, 2016
												The game isn't actually too terrible. Just a few things here and there that make it a little unbearable.Story:The story isnt bad, a little vague at times and confusing if you haven't watch the movies, so I would recommend watching the movies if you havent seen it before you play. Only if you care about the story. If not, just go right on through and skip all the scenes.Graphics:They aren't bad for the year and even for now. Some of the textures though look like they came out of an old ps2 game as they are extremely pixelized.Sound:I really can't complain about the sound, sometimes it glitched I would be hearing things double.Gameplay:The gamplay is overall solid as long as you are playing as the marine. As a xenomorph it is completely skewed as I didnt why it was going certain ways as I was climbing.Achievements:This game to complete the achievements 100% you need 3+ people to complete it because of the challenges. There is also grinding for levels and kills.In the end I did enjoy the game playing with a friend, it had some solid moments where we laugh and had fun. Playing by yourself wasnt a complete joy but it was a small challenge when playing on the hardest difficulty.

number of helpful: 4 of 6 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 6, 2013
												Remember at the end of Shawshank Redemption when Andy makes his escape through the sewer pipe? How he crawls to freedom through 500 yards of♥♥♥♥♥♥smelling foulness and once he finally exits the pipe, he throws his arms up in the air and soaks in the rainfall? That scene pretty much sums up the Aliens: Colonial Marines experience. You spend about six hours trudging through a dull and repetitive FPS that's loaded with awful AI, unsatisfying gunplay, and poor writing. A truly tedious ride that lacks any real tension. But then you beat the final boss and reach the end credits. Happiness begins to pour over you. You realize that it's all finally over and celebrate by quickly deleting the game from your hard drive entirely. You feel like you crawled through a river of♥♥♥♥♥♥and came out clean on the other side.I'm just thankful that I was able to get A:CM for free after rebate, putting me out only the cost of a stamp. Now if only there was a way to get that six hours of my life back.

number of helpful: 4 of 6 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 28, 2013
												Don't believe the haters. Maybe it is more like an old-school shooter than the modern FPS we all know and love (loathe?), but who ever said that was a bad thing? I couldn't count the number of hours I've sunk into the Dooms and Quakes over the years (and their innumerable mods - yes, including Aliens Doom) and I'm having just as much fun now as I did then.  I didn't have any expectations of this game; never saw a demo, a preview, a screenshot, or an artist's impression of one of the developers having lunch between coding sessions.  I heard the bad press, but chose to ignore it and make my own mind up, and I don't regret the purchase for a minute.  I didn't get it until after the first big patch was released, so I can't vouch for what that brought, and it does sound like it addressed some of the initial criticisms.  So to be fair to those that were disappointed, I don't know what they saw on release day.  Maybe the criticisms were justified and maybe I wouldn't have felt the same way about the game as I do now if I'd bought it then. But I didn't, and with Steam's auto-patching, if you buy it now, you'll never see the Day 1 version either.  You'll only see what is by all accounts, an improved experience.  Do yourself a favour and check it out for yourself.  Make up your own mind instead of being a sheep and bagging the game without ever owning or playing it.  You won't regret it.

Posted: May 22, 2014
												(full review at bleedingedgegaming.wordpress.com)If you’re not an Aliens fan, steer your money away from this game.  If you have spent every day since the first time you saw Aliens wanting a REAL sequel, you have just found your favorite teddy bear in the attic.  This is sixty dollars you will never miss or wish you had back in your pocket.  Any one of the fanboy watercooler moments in the last half of this game is worth the sticker price to a fan.  Hell, if you have the PC version and the settings maxed, the guy who owns the original cast of the “space jockey” now has nothing you haven’t had.  He spent millions and you still got to climb on it anyway.  Since I fall in category number two, this once I am going to have to beat down every journalistic standard I normally adhere to.  This game does not deserve this score by science, but this is how my heart felt.8/10

number of helpful: 4 of 6 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 19, 2014
												Aliens: Colonial Marines Review (PC)IntroGoing into Aliens: Colonial Marines, I had huge expectations.  With a developer such as gearbox attached to the the project, hopes were high for this FPS release..  Fans of the Aliens series were promised a true sequel to the James Cameron classic, and gamers were promised a cinematic, intense survival experience.  Early gameplay looked very promising, but Colonial Marines disappoints on almost every front.PresentationThe campaign places you in the shoes of Corporal Christopher Winter, a member of a search and rescue team sent in to investigate the U.S.S. Sulaco after the events of Aliens.  The setup is decent enough, but the story is nothing special, but no doubt veteran Aliens fans will want to see it through.  The opening cinematic is where the game's problems start.  It contains frighteningly low res texture and some awful lip syncing.  This set the tone for the rest of my experience.  Even running on max setting on a gaming PC, the textures look more like a last gen title rather than a beautiful HD current gen title.  Some of the levels do however have the creepy atmosphere you would expect from an Aliens title.  In regards to the lip syncing, it's mostly terrible.  While the voice acting is good enough, the dialogue just doesn't match the facial animations.  One of the only aspects of the presentation I really enjoyed was the sound effects.  The iconic dreadful beeping of the motion tracker and sounds of gunfire are accurate to the movie, and fans will appreciate that.GameplayThe campaign follows a simple linear level design, and it becomes repetitive very quickly.   After only an hour of gameplay, the game falls back on existing FPS conventions instead of doing anything interesting.  The game fails monumentally to create any survival horror tension by constantly loading the player with loads of ammo.  However, in the sewer level, this mechanic is taken out, and it works much better.  When your guns and immense firepower are taken away, Your really feel vulnerable.  There are a couple of good scares that couldn't have happened if you had access to all your weapons.  It's a shame the whole game doesn't feel like this.  Another gripe I had with the campaign is the A.I.  Rarely have I seen a game with artificial intelligence so bad.  Even when playing on the hardened mode, xenomorphs run directly at you and do not approach any situation intelligently.  When the game puts you up against the infamous Weyland Yutani corporation, the difficulty spikes.  Guns guns take you down much, much quicker than any alien in the game can.  It needs some serious balancing.  If there is one place where the game shines, its in its multiplayer.  While the standard team deathmatch mode is in place, modes such as escape and extermination provide exciting online experiences.  Escape is a 4v4 game mode with four xenomorphs hunting down four marines moving from point A to point B, while extermination pits four marines in a confined position to hold out as long as possible against four xenomorphs.  The game modes are mostly fun, but the xenomorphs feel terribly underpowered and once again the marines are given loads of ammunition, taking away much of the tension.ConclusionIt's really a shame Aliens: Colonial Marines couldn't be better.  With a developer like Gearbox behind the title, many were given false hope that the Aliens License would finally be put to good use..  Long development times are responsible for many of the games problems.  With lackluster A.I., forgettable gameplay, and downright atrocious visuals, this title is a disappointment to fans of the Alien series and gamers alike.Final Score: 3.75/10http://justinmadore.tumblr.com/post/69131996514/aliens-colonial-marines-written-review-pc

content:
Posted: June 19, 2014
												I, like many others, had very high hopes for this game and waited years for its release just to find out it wasn't exactly what was promised. That being said, I just played through from beginning to end and thoroughly enjoyed this title. I originally bought it for PS3 when it released, played for less than an hour, then got distracted by God knows what. Since then, I almost forgot it existed (it is rather forgettable). Then I saw it here for $4.99 and was like "oh wow, that's right. That did come out last year". I couldn't find my PS3 version so I went ahead and bought it for my rig.As much as I hate the combat, a bulk of the story, the ENDING of all things, the unbalanced AI, and the lack of background for Winter, this Colonial Marines kept me playing and was just FUN.So it isn't as polished as most AAA titles. So it isn't up to snuff, even by 2012-2013 standards (and especially not 2014). So almost nobody was happy with it. So what? I enjoyed it enough on my own that I'm gifting a copy to my friend because he's as big an Alien fanatic as I am and co-op looks like a blast.I mean, come on. We've all done way worse with $5 than entertain ourselves for half a day.

number of helpful: 4 of 6 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 19, 2014
												Overall: 8/10Ok. I pre-ordered this game (for PS3), got the collectors edition, and bought the season pass day one. All told I spent $100 dollars on this game ($105 now that I have it on Steam as well), and I must say that I feel all of the negative reviews to be a little bogus. I have beaten the single player campaign twice via co-op and once by myself, and spent countless hours in multi-player. I have played this game alot.It is a good game, but not a great game. Maybe I was just lucky, but I have never had any of the glitches people talk about with this game, so its important to stress that they are not going to happen 100% of the time. I was really confused by all the glitch talk when the game first came out, to be honest, because nothing like that happened to me or my co-op buddy and we played through beginning to end on day one after going to the midnight launch. I've seen video, so I know they exist, but you are not guaranteed to see them.Second, game-play is very standard shooter fare. But then again, its a shooter. You shoot things. The Aliens come at you from all angles, and you shoot them. Alot like the movie. No idea what the complaint here is. The guns sound awesome, the aliens go down about how you would expect, and the blood even harms you. Seems pretty straight forward. I think alot of people expected a splash of blood to kill you outright like in the movies, but that would just be unfun, unless it was some higher difficulty setting or something. You are a highly trained bad♥♥♥♥♥and you feel like it. Definitely more of a Halo than a survival horror game, but its what I expected. Maybe if you expected horror, you would be disappointed, but I knew this was a shooter from the moment I pre-ordered it.Third, the attention to detail in the levels was cool. It was awesome to walk through the movie interiors, and everything felt like it should. Of course, according to plot the whole place was nuked, but this game is fan-service and nothing else about the plot makes sense, so why should this? I would rather have the fan-service moment and just enjoy it than ♥♥♥♥♥ about plot for a series not really known for its nuanced plots to begin with.To sum up, I think that this game was exactly what I expected, and delivered everything I felt I was promised. Of course I went in expecting an 8/10 and I got roughly an 8/10. Some people I feel were mislead by cinematic trailers (the bane of the industry) and the hype machine, but really, what else could a movie tie-in game go but mediocre. There have been less than a handful of good movie games, and this is definitely in that category. Go in with realistic expectations, and you will have fun and that's the whole purpose.

content:
Posted: December 30, 2013
												Well now that I've been playing gearbox's attempt at the aliens franchise for a year, yes I would say give this a shot. Even after it's bad press and flaws. I've been playing aliens games since the early 90s and this is by far not the worst game out there. Yes it has some flaws and some more after that, However it has come a long way since it's release last Febuary. On top of that the DLC "Stasis Interrupted" is not too shabby in explaining the events that led up to the game. Along with a throw back to Alien 3. The multiplayer is fast paced and I haven't gotten enough of it yet. So over all I would buy this just for multiplayer alone. It's not AVP classic 2000 but it's worth it.....I give this game as an alien franchise fan a thumbs up!

												Was pretty sad to see what happened to this game. It had the chance to be something big. But in the end fell short of it all. 												Now to be completely honest I understand why everyone is disappointed by this title,and well they should be.It is not as like they made it look at E3, at all.Now for the actual gameplay, well I actually kinda liked it.Its not bad and yes the AI is pretty clunky from time to time.Aliens run at you completely revealing themselves with no stealth factor and the WYU mercs are bullet sponges taking a bunch of damage and still being able to shoot back at you.I completed this game in COOP and played some versus which is pretty good,although the animations could be better.Critics have tore this game apart with negative comments and everyone else got on the bandwagon along.There has been numerous patches where some issues have been fixed so you wont be dealing with them.AI was never patched but there are a couple of mods that have reworked the game and made it much more enjoyable (TemplarGFX's mod).If you are an Alien fan,have played the previous games,and if you can look past some of the problems then I must say get this game.Its honestly not as bad as people say it is.It is meant to be a AAA title but it comes out as an average game and does a pretty neat job at it.My final verdict for this game would be a decent 7/10

												It took me a very long time to finally realize how terrible this game truly is. I give up.Aliens Colonial Marines fails on so many levels. The game has terrible graphics, it's dark, murky, washed out and visually boring. The gameplay is flat and lifeless. The story is god awful you swear Gearbox hired a 7 year old to write the script. Plot holes after more plot holes, treating the players as if they are stupid.Zero atmosphere, at no point did you feel the tension or fear for your life. If you didn't think it could get worse the MP matchmaking is completely broken. If you want to play you have to join a group of players and drop what you're doing to go play with them or else you'll completely miss your opportunity to play online. F--k Gearbox, what they did is unforgivable, they lied to the fans, nuff said. Only thing ACM got right was the sound effects and music, everything else was complete crap.Aliens Colonial Marines was made by unprofessional ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s who only care about getting paid and f--k what the fans want. 2/10.

Posted: April 18, 2016
												I love this game.  The graphics are pleasing even if they are a little dated.  Co-op story mode is always a good thing.  The sounds seemed to be pulled straight from the movies (love that pulse rifle burp).  The radio chatter drew me into the game and made the linear story easy to digest.  The difficulty is punishing yet felt fair to me.  When I made too many mistakes I paid the price and had to go back to the drawing board, but this made completion of a section much more satisfying.  All in all, the game has aged well (in my eyes) and was a real joy.

content:
Posted: December 8, 2013
												You hear the sound of wet vomiting splashing against a window, punctuated by the umistakably harsh weeping of grown men.  Somewhere, a dog is howling at an empty vase.  A large tick crawls out of a salt shaker, glaring at you with contempt.  Giant ants stumble drunkenly into walls and seemingly forget their purpose, they being to question the rationale of their existence.  A sweaty woman shoots paper flowers out of an automatic rifle.   An aircraft with no bottom slowly ascends into the heavens, only to be ripped apart by unseen forces, and then slowly falls, piece by piece as the chunks slowly dissolve into glowing green squares.  Your wallet feels lighter. Somewhere, Randy Pitchford is laughing.

number of helpful: 4 of 6 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 7, 2016
												This game is a mixed bag after it's horrible release, all the way to the current status with lot's of patches and DLC:s + graphics adjustments available to PC. However after many patches this game actually is pretty okay. Albeit the characters are shallow, Aliens still look and act glitchy and like puppets, although the enemy AI is improved somewhat. I'm not gonna lie and say this is a great game, it's not, but it's not the most awful game I've played either now with the patches. In a way I'm tempted to say that this is only for most hardcore fans but then again, it's exactly those who this game is most likely to disappoint due to expectations not going to be met. Maybe I would recommend this for someone completely unaware to aliens and who does not care for plot or atmosphere but is rather looking for simple shooter mechanics. I personally like some of the DLC maps and with friends it can be even fun. You just need to adjust your mindset for acm and absolutely throw expectations out the window.This game had a lot of potential and in a weird way it kind of shows through the ugly cracks.. You can see (at least with the mega patches) That there was somekind of genuine effort to save this game. There are so many nods to the franchise and touches here and there, which all would be AWESOME had the game not been halfassed in development. If this game had what Alien Isolation has this game would trump all over it. But it's the production values that let this puppy down. Everything feels unfinished or dated. The story feels rushed, unimaginative and hardly does justice to the films, even when it has the genuine characters and surroundings. Quite frankly, the story feels like it's written by someone who does not care for the movies or simply is untalented..-ADDED after playing DLC-Thankfully here is where the excellent Stasis Interrupted DLC comes in and saves this whole game for me. The story, the atmosphere, even the level design is on a whole new level when compared to the normal campaign! I couldn't believe what a difference! The dreadful story holes are explained so that the story of this ties way more smoothly to Aliens saga and ties it all into the ending of Alien 3 too. In a not too bad way I think, albeit still far from perfect. The AI too seems ways better or then it's the way the levels are designed that push the enemy to flank you and surprise you in new ways. At least in ultimate badass mode. The problem however is the shortness of the DLC in comparison to the already short campaign of the main game. However I must say that I find this DLC redeeming this game enough for me to change it's status from not recommended to a RECOMMENDED for fans! In the stasis you even get some of that character development that was dreadfully missing from the main game. You start to feel something for characters. It's basically a new game in the shell of the main game, however tying into it's mechanics and story arch. So the Stasis Interrupted DLC is GOOD in my books.. Obviously it's still limited by the technology of the original ACM so don't expect miracles, but there was effort to correct what could be done without rewriting the whole game. Sadly complete rewrite IS what would be needed for win.-DLC bit ends-Now back to the MAINGAME review:The other thing in MAIN GAME is the nonexistant character develompent which is closer to someone's home movie in direction and in complexity of character. Lousy voice acting, bad writing.. The Characters alone make this game a failure. Even if it had super graphics, the characters would♥♥♥♥♥♥you off. Something that ties in here with the characters is the AI which is broken, even with the patches it feels no good. Your guys will help you getting killed but DO NOT HELP you in any other way. It's not uncommon for O'neal to stand in your way, blocking door acces without shooting any enemies, while you begging him to let you through to get to cover from onslaught of bullets flying your way. This is definitely a game where friendly fire would be a good thing. O'neil needs to be capped off on many occasions..Or then he spouts embarassing commentary right out of a generic shooter while shooting at walls or crates even when the enemy is standing right in front of him. This game would be a better game if you'd be completely alone, rather than having your company ruin atmospehere and gameplay for you.Obviously that's not how this game was designed to be, as you are a colonial marine. But that's the other thing. They had the idea of making you a part of a 'team' but then they don't even give you team. For the most part it's just you and some other marine, making your 'colonial marine squad' a band of 2 all the time with some short exceptions. You never feel like a marine in the single player.The other 'marines' are puppets hanging in the background and having one animation or grunt. In one mission you had to search and rescue these other marines and they were completely lifeless and soulles like zombies when you rescue them. Not even eyes or mouths were moving when you save their LIFE, and then they disappear like the bodies do in the game so your'e left alone again. At least by modifying .ini values you can force the corpses to stay but in a way, why would you want that? It's better that they disappear from ruining your mood (irony)Yet for some inane bizarre reason I've grown to like this game somewhat. Maybe it's like those b-scifi movies that are so bad it's kind of good.. Or I'm just crazy.On pc there are ways to make this game look better graphically and I would say WAY better in terms of atmosphere and lighting so you only end up disliking the rest in the end. I think since I've adjusted the graphics so that the locations look cool and atmospheric is the reason why I like this game now, with all it's gut wrenching flaws. Since the locations are the only thing they nailed in making this game (as far as old ut3 engine allows) It's now bringing back memories from the movie. Also MP levels have great design and nods to the movies, even nostromo is there although not part of the James Cameron version of the movie. Now that I've said a few positive comments, it's time again to burst the bubble on this game. The aliens suck bigtime. They are like puppets with dumb AI and only resemble by fraction the scary killing beast they were in the movies. They remind me of a zoo simulation where apes are running towards you and jumping up and down, getting stuck on walls and whatnot or just standing there with their butts towards you waiting for you to cap them off. Also there is no interaction with them whatsoever. They seem not even knowing you're unloading a clip at them, there's no reaction until the death animation kicks in. It makes them feel autobots rather than the scariest beast in the universe. Although this too changes in the Stasis Interrupted DLC where I suddenly felt anxious about an alien encounter. They should have focused wholly on aliens in the main game and spare the troopers of Weyland Yutani corp. to the DLC because here THEY FIT RIGHT IN to the story. In a not as terrible way! The story is told and moved along better. And it's great how the frantic fighting between them and aliens is made in, allowing you to be a rogue surprise for both aliens and humans.Multiplayer is fun too, that's the good part I find with this game, the MP Escape missions for instance where your frantically trying to get to a rescue ship while battling hordes of enemies and your team tries to open heavy doors and stuff while combating their way and healing downed marines because there's safety in numbers is fun to me. These matches get hectic and with the original sounding soundtrack booming in the background your heartrate may actually start to rise out of something else than just frustration.This game is not fun straight out of the box but it can grow on you.

content:
Posted: November 10, 2015
												It's interesting, I watched the Angry Joe review when it first came out, and the game didn't look that impressive or anything, so I didn't feel like buying the game. However, I have now sense recently bought the game on PC on sale with DLC. And my thoughts? ...I think it's a really good game. Maybe it's the patches and DLC that really help the game. Because now we have the Bughunt gamemode, really great HD textures, and new maps to work with. Besides that, the music is great, the weapons are fantastic, the atmosphere is really good, and the campaign isn't that bad, hell, even Soldier difficulty now seems to be more difficult. The bughunt is great because now, you really don't know where an alien is coming. You pretty much HAVE to use the motion tracker and that really helped immerse me into the game's world more. Also, here's my biggest argument or praise is, please bare with me on this... the Alien AI. Again, maybe it was a patch, but the alien AI is fan-♥♥♥♥ing-tastic. They use the walls, climb on the ceilings like all the time, they hide into ducts and go under the floors, etc. They're AI is great. They really make use of their environment to their full advantage. So props to you Gearbox and SEGA for that.Try this game out and judge it for yourself. That's what I did. I think it's a really fun game. Is it worth $60? Hell no. Is it worth like $20 or 30$? Yes yes yes.

												Personally, I think this game is made worse by its critics than it really is. Sure it was garbage upon release but there have been major patches and the quality is acceptable if you buy it on sale. Besides that, Aliens (the 2nd movie) was obviously a spin-off of the first movie and is therefore much more action oriented. If you want some survival horror, go check out (the awesome) Alien Isolation. But that does not mean, that you can't enjoy the 6-7 hours of campaign in Aliens Colonial Marines. I understand that early buyers are frustrated, but buying it now on sale is absolutely worth it.I recommend it on sale.

number of helpful: 5 of 8 people (63%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 19, 2014
												So...aliens Colonial marines...due to the reviews and release horrors i put off on playing this game and rightfully so at the time.Now that 99% if not 100% of the patches have been deployed i decided to pick the game up and give it an honest chance. Now mind you my review is based off of going in expecting the ABSOLUTE worst (as all other reviews portrayed the game AS)i was...pleasently surprised...(angry mob before you hunt me down hear me out)Okay so this game is by no means what the hype led us to believe and from that point the game failed horrible however going in expecting the worse and keeping those reviews out of your head while playing, even you would be surprised. Ill just make my case in the pros and cons, and then finish in the wrap upPros:-design : All areas are very nostalgic and are wonderful recreations of the movie itself. the lighting (albeit nowhere near as awesome as the tech demo/reveal) is well placed and still presents an eerie feeling, especially in the sewers.-gun feel: the guns feel innacurate at times however you will quickly adjust and feel like a Bad @$$ gunning down the new and improved xenos with a smart gun, shotgun, or even the iconic pulse rifle. (ai has been sorta kinda fixed and the damage they do is...significant. a single xeno can get behind you and eff your armor and health up rather quickly and then jump away making it hard to deal with)-Voice Acting: the random banter in the audio logs can be funny, even the random bits with the marines are well voiced and provide some fairly decent...i wanna say immersion but...im gonna go with provides a decent experience and conveys each situation fairly well.-enemy design: The Xeno's are all very well designed including the new species. they look creepy as can be, even intimidating at times. The Raven mission has some of the BEST scares in the game and truly felt like what the entire game should have been. (aside from the bug during the boss fight when you reload the checkpoint)Thats all i can think of for the pros at the moment, onto the cons!Cons:-Over hyped: The trailers and playable demos at the press events/ conventions got us way over hyped and every single company behind it should be held responsible. blame does not lay soley upon one party in this situation. the devs shouldnt have released it in a broken state, they shouldnt have taken the tech demo/presentation out of the game, and of course the publishers should have used a Quality Assurance team to test the freakin game BEFORE it was released. there was no reason it should have been let out the doors in that state.-AI: both the marine, WaYu troops, and even the xenos  at times(although they seem to have been improved from launch) all have very horrible ai. at launch the xenos were a joke, thank god they fixed it (as far as i can tell, i see less of them standing around and more actually getting in my face tearing me a new one on Ultimate Badass (only difficulty woth playing) As for the Friendly Marine AI...ha...yeah just go in expecting to do everything one man army style. -Characters: a few characters shouldnt have been introduced the way they were, we should have been able to build up a relationship before we knew they were doomed and a specific character shouldnt have even been in the freakin game, they died in the movie.-gun feel?: as i said you will quickly adjust to the way the guns operate however only a few of the weapons are truly worth using at all. the pulse rifle is fantastic, both shotguns are great. smg, br, and even the ar are all rubbish so forget them. Also a personal gripe for me, i wanted to use the smart gun more often, the game wasnt complete easy mode with it (especially on UB difficulty) so i feel we should have been able to use it a little more often. some sections felt like it needed it more than others.-final boss: tense but at the same time a joke...its too easy once you figure out how to trick the ai (gee another ai problem, imagine that)Anyway, onto the wrap up!Aliens colonial marines is a good buy, especially at $15, however to truly enjoy the game, you need the stasis interrupted and the bug-hunt dlc's Those truly improve the game HOWEVER you should ONLY buy them on SALE!This game is hated on far too much, i have played way worse shooters in my life and the only reason people hate on this game so much is they gave into the hype, the company basically lied about what was in the game, and at release the entire game was a total joke. HOWEVER that has for the most part been fixed, atleast in my experience. People will be surprised if they approach this game while ignoring the hype. as i stated before, i came in expecting the absolute worst but...the game really isnt. its by no means the best game ever, it does not truly do the franchise justice, but it is a decent enough addition to any alien fans libray.This is an average game, a 5/10 on AJ's score system. It is worth a buy ON SALE ONLY, do not pick this game up at full price, the multiplayer is very dead now, so i cannot include that in my review.

number of helpful: 5 of 8 people (63%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 8, 2014
												I bought this game to be happyas the title was too catchy.Its developer was famous and dependablebut their product soon became expendable.I was not a hater, did not start a petitionbut simply purchased the collector's edition.The game started up, I began my journeyI soon found the story a big baloney.I hate you Gearbox, you let me downI wanted a game you could not get me, why?Poem aside, Colonial Marines is mediocre at best. Below bulletpoints are my findings which are based on the completed campaign (with almost all the achievements attained there save for the ones of the campaign DLC) and I must also mention no multiplayer session was found when trying to look for parties online for a possible coop campaign or team deathmatch.+++ The game looks and feels good. Yeah I know there are videos comparing the gameplay trailer and the actual gameplay footage and there was the lawsuit filed against the publisher or developer. In fact, they also blamed each other for this and Kotaku has an article of all this mess but it's just best to forget about it. Development took quite many years - this is one of those games that went through a development hell and as a result of this critics ripped the game apart.+++ I do believe the atmosphere is right there where it should be. The sound effects are all great and there are many areas borrowed directly from Aliens. You can traverse through Hadley's Hope, for instance, and if you are an Aliens fan you'll recognise some of the rooms, vehicles and even Bishop turns up as a vital member of your team.- - - Aaaaaaaaaaand pretty much that's it. Everything else is bad. The game gives you an awful lot of chance to fight the soldiers of Weyland-Yutani. I did not like where they went with the story. Fighting the xenomorphs is good but sometimes it seems awkward (i.e. glitchy) - especially the 2 boss fights with bigger aliens. And then you have the encounter with the queen which is a complete letdown. And all this in the name of a story that is meant to be canon... to bridge Aliens with Alien 3.- - - Again, we have a 6-7 hour long campaign which is not much. If they highlighted the greatness of story during advertising why couldn't they give us a longer adventure? You team up with some marines and go together which obviously is an indication of a coop campaign. It is not necessarily bad but the AI controlling our fellow soldiers is not that good. Sometimes they are a pain and they can spawn at certain points quickly once you have advanced the story. An upside is that they cannot be downed so you do not spend any time with reviving them. In any case, playing in coop mode is probably much better than alone.Colonial Marines was a letdown. The game has an excellent design and brings back a lot of memorable places / events from Aliens (not to mention the dog tags you are looking for or the so-called legendary weapons you can find e.g. Hicks' shotgun) but playing a tribute is not enough to create a decent game. It is a good homage but a mediocre game that should have been properly finished.

content:
Posted: November 27, 2013
												They said this game would look best on the WiiU. I am guessing what they were trying to say is that the way the game looks on the WiiU is as best as it's going to get. They KNEW it was bad.Before you decide to buy this game, I would advise you to take a careful look at the screenshots of this game on Steam or elsewhere. Looks good, right? Crisp, sharp, good lightening, decent textures. Well, that's not how the game looks. Either that, or they really did some good work on making the best possible screenshots to deceive the public.The fire looks terrible and so does the smoke, the explosions and the water. The textures up close date back to 2004 at least. The broken glass windows break into several small pieces when shot and disappear in mid air. The dead aliens disappear too in their puddle of blood within 4 seconds. It also says the game uses PhysX but I don't see it. I found out that the game is supposed to be using next gen lightening, but I didn't see it either. Actually, I know that cannot be true since this game uses DX9 and the 2010 AVP used DX11. Talk about taking a step back. You can't see your legs but at least you cast a show [with legs].......Courtesy of the Unreal Engine 3 that frankly won't die and that is being kept on life support at this point.There's no friendly fire, so when one of your buddies get surrounded by the xenos, then just spray left and right until the last xeno dies. There is no carefulness nor any meticulous shooting involved at all. The ammo is mostly plentiful but fear not! The melee button is there to save the day but more on that later.Paradoxically speaking the 2010 AVP's graphics excel these my a huge margin. I understand it's the different developer but damn! Regardless, both of these games are a far cry from AVP 2 which is still the best game in the "series" and possibly one of the best games ever made (retro-wise, at least).The physics are horrendous. The aliens look like they however when they crawl on the walls, but at least they can jump ahead once again (even that looks sloppy especially when they sometimes rotate 180 degrees mid air). When you step on their acid, you don't get hurt. When they rush, you just melee them (like in 2010 AVP) and see a nice little auto-aim animation even if you are six feet away. First you are here, and then you press the melee button and you are right in front of the alien, and the two of you are literally having a boxing match, which you will always win. Remember that from the movie? And when you play on the hardest difficulty and die you just start from the last checkpoint (unlike from the beginning of the level like in AVP 2). When you play without the cross-hair, the red cross-hair still appears when you are shooting the alien. Why? I don't want cross-hair and I don't want the in-built auto-assist either, I'm using a mouse, thank you very much.All in all, this game seems to forget that the aliens barely, if ever, attacked in force. They are cunning creatures that hide in the dark, that flank you, that surround you and then attempt to capture you alive if possible. What they do in this game is simply rush you from many directions. There is barely any tension involved. Any build up of anticipation for the next fire-fight is practically nonexistent, because in truth, the xenos are pretty easy to kill. I remember that in AVP 2 two Xenos could take you out on easiest difficulty in seconds. The solution for this game? more xenos. Oh, and don't forget about having to fight waves of human and droid enemies too. Remember THAT from the movie?Co-op doesn't save the day. There's barely any "Co-Op" to begin with. Just running around, getting into each other's line of fire, and trying to kill as many xenos for experience to use for your next gun, remember that in the movie? Remember the marines being all psyched for the next alien encounter?I also love it how Steam says it's a 20 GB game making you think that it's gonna be a huge game with rich textures, long campaign and decent multiplayer. However, when you start downloading the game, it only weights around 6-7GB. Watch out, I guess it's gonna be a short campaign! and then...game over, man. I am trying to be funny which is a self-defense mechanism since I have just shelled out $ 50 for this tripe.There are also bugs. Sometimes you see human enemy AI stuck. Then when you approach them they start shooting you. When you die and reload the checkpoint those very same enemy AIs are gone.In the very least, this is an arcade shooting game, with decent sound, where you get to shoot aliens, and people while upgrading your arsenal, err...right? If you want a better, longer, cheaper and much more interesting campaign, play the Marine Campaign in AVP 2 (2001).OR, you can wait until they finish that Crysis 2 -Aliens vs Marine mod which will probably be free anyway, so save your money, pickles.P.S. Spoiler or not, the scene with the Marine who decides to blow himself up with a grenade and endanger his friends as well as the ship was really stupid. Way to go, bro, take out your brothers with you."Semper Fi, do or die"I guess DIE. Welcome to DIE.

content:
Posted: March 4, 2015
												This game gets a lot of bad press, but it really isn't as bad as people make out. It can be a lot of fun in co-op campaign and the multiplayer is pretty good too with some interesting game modes and cool mechanics for the aliens to use.The story of the campaign is a little underwhelming, although the Stasis Interrupted DLC has a decent story and also helps to explain how Hicks got back to LV426. The main campaign all comes down to a final boss battle which is pretty awful and could really do with some modifications, but it's not the worst thing in the world.My least favourite thing about this game is the "boss battle" half-way through the campaign. You have to try and defeat this "Raven" with a powerloader and the mechanics to do so are completely broken. It takes a good few tries to pass this short section and it can get incredibly frustrating even on easy difficulties - it's the closest I've ever been in a game to breaking my controller.I've played through the game's campaign and multiplayer matches on PC and Xbox 360 and in my opinion the PC version is a lot better than the console release. This is most likely down to the big patch that released after the game's negative reception. The patch mainly worked on fixing graphical stuff, but I think it did do some tweaks to AI as well.The best thing about this game is a new mod (hence my updated review) by the name of "TemplarGFX's ACM Overhaul". A modder took it upon himself to spend months working through the config files of the game to rebalance weapons, improve LOD settings and fix up the AI and textures. Playing with this mod enabled, even in the early stages of its development, is a massive improvement to the core game mechanics as well as the graphical side of things. Xenomorphs are actually smart, using the walls and sneaking around instead of just leaping at you to attack. The W-Y soldiers are now easier to kill and are all independent meaning that as soon as one spots you, they don't all spot you. This makes gameplay much more fluid and can allow for you to actually approach sections with stealth making for some interesting alternative survival options. I'm very excited to see what else this mod will do (it's still in early access at the moment) and major thanks to the developer for improving the game significantly!TL;DR ... The game is good enough for co-op and can be a fun experience, but the best way to play is on PC with the new "TemplarGFX" mod which improves AI, textures and more. I'd still wait for a sale though.

content:
Posted: December 28, 2013
												*sigh* such potential thrown awayThe games not as bad as people make out i have played far worse, some just like to whine about everything for no reason - dunno perhaps it makes them feel better about their own pathetic livesbut it's not as good as it was hyped to be either, not by a long shot - it was clearly rushed out (ironic being it was what? 3 years late?)it goes from being really quite polished graphicaly to stunningly hideous in the blink of an eye - blood effects are rubbish, very cartoonish (think Borderlands blood splatters)Single player - Decent enough story and once i got use to the GFX jumping from good to bad and the lense flare blinding me alot of the time (think thats my GFX card more than the game though) i did enjoy itthe main let down for the single player is the AI stupidity - AI team mates would stand and watch while you get set upon by multiple enemies (their guns also dont seem to do any meaningful damage)the AI knows you are the player and so focuses almost entirely on youthe aliens walking past and ignoring your squad mates to get to you while you are trying to access a panel/console/door became annoying (stops the action when you are hit)aliens actually sneaking up on you hitting you then for some reason running away only to stop, turn and attempt to sneak up on you again....while you are looking and shooting at them?MultiPlayer VS - there isn't one, not really - the steam community keeps it alive sort of but joining games is a case of hunting through the community looking for a player "ingame" then joining his/her game directly (with no idea what game mode they are actually playing) the few MP games i have been in are very mediocre (almost CoDish) pretty bad hit location and a  team of half decent marine players will dominate making it frustrating for the other team (aliens take a bit of getting used to)Multiplayer CO-OP - This is where the game really shines for me and all the problems dont seem so bad, be it Bug hunt or the Campaign, CooP is good funI paid £15 total for the game + season pass and dont grudge paying that for it (glad i cancelled my preorder though)if you can pick it up for £10 including the season pass it would be worth it - at the time of this review my local Game store are selling the disk for £3 (well worth that!)6/10 from me - if they came back and polished the GFX and AI i would go up to 7 and if they sorted out the player search for MP possibly even an 8

content:
Posted: January 19, 2015
												Unfortunately this game has received a lot of bad publicity, mostly due to the way it was falsely advertised before release, which is a shame, because "Aliens: Colonial Marines", isn't all that bad.Pros:Simple shoot 'em up gameplay, In game challenges add a level of difficulty and sense of achievement.Gun customisation available.Storyline is interesting (Although the cinematics are pretty cringe-worthy)Co-op for up to 4 players on CampaignCons:AI behaviour is honestly terrible. If you're the type of person that'll be deeply disturbed by very unintelligent, artificial intelligent enemies, do not get this game.Multiplayer aspect is almost non-existent, which is ashame because it looks like it has a lot of potential. If there was actual online content, this would be in the 'Pros' section, as I'm sure it would be quite enjoyable.Slightly repetitive.If you're looking for a fun, simple shoot 'em up game, Aliens: Colonial Marines is a game you'll enjoy, but this game is worth no more than $10. If you're interested in this game, buy it when it's on sale.EDIT - I will however mention that the vast majority of players are going to dislike this game, especially the Alien fanboys, simply because this game came no where near close to it's expectations and promises. If you are able to look past what was expected and just shoot things with your mates, it doesn't turn out so bad after all. (okay maybe it does)

number of helpful: 13 of 24 people (54%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 28, 2013
												I'm saying yes to recommending this game with one very important caveat, you will most likely only enjoy this if you are a fan of the Alien series (this is supposed to be considered a direct sequel to Aliens) as I am. Even being a fan, the only thing I enjoyed about this game was the basic idea they had for the sequel. The story, at its core, had the potential to be amazing, but crappy dialogue (including voice acting) and a somewhat "rushed" feeling at the end kills what could have been an amazing story.As for gameplay, it is pretty much as generic as any first person shooter can get, nothing really revolutionary here. The enemies are weak, especially the aliens themselves. They die in a few bursts from your chosen weapon, even on the hardest difficulty level. If you shoot an alien point blank, the "acid blood" barely causes any damage at all. There are only a handful (and that is probably generous) of moments in the game where you are actually being stalked by the aliens, those are especially fun moments, as short lived as they are.In closing, if you're not a fan of the Alien saga then you probably will not enjoy this game in the least. If you are, then you will at least get a glimpse of what could have been, before it was butchered.

number of helpful: 21 of 40 people (53%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 28, 2013
												5 out of 5 for all the right reasons.I have never reviewed a game before, but I'm going out of my way for this one because it deserves to be defended.The game is not mind blowingly spectacular. It's not a high end, maximum graphic type game.HOWEVER, what the game does have is gameplay that keeps you highly entertained and that's what I paid for.The COOP is perfect, arming 4 Marines in a war against Aliens and mercenaries. The weapons upgrade system is minimal but leaves you feeling satisfied when add new attachments and skins to your guns.The A.I. isnt terrible and on the Ultimate Badass it's quite fun with 4 people waging war against the Aliens.I do not have the DLC's however I am told they only make the game better than it already it is.Long story short, people give this game a bad rap because they are expecting a major title type game. That just isnt the case here, but rest assured, it's a fantastic game and I'd pay for it again if I had a do-over. Highly recommend it to anyone looking for a highly addictive and action packed COOP game.

content:
Posted: January 13, 2014
												Aliens.......1986Review of Aliens: Colonial Marines for PC.Some games you either love or hate. Aliens: Colonial Marines is that kind of game. Made by Gearbox Software CorporationReleased in 2013 (EU: February 2013) ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Spoilers ahead. Aliens: Colonial Marines is a direct sequel to James Cameron film Aliens (1986) and takes you back to LV-426 where the Colonial Marines in Aliens were sent. You take the roll of a Marine, Corporal Christopher Winter, and you will discover what happened on the marine ship USS Sulaco and on the surface of LV-426. LV-426, 'fool moon of Acheron', the planetoid of Alien (1979) where the crew of the USS Nostromo discovered the remnants of a derelict spaceship and a fossilized crewpilot called the 'Space Jockey'. You will discover that 'The Company' ('Wey-Yu' or 'Weyland Yutani'), already mentioned in the film 'Alien' (1979), play a big role in the game. The game received a lot of bad reviews. Mainly because of its story, dated graphics and bugs and glitches. Many bad reviews were based on the view that the game didn't create 'the feeling' of being in the Alien Universe. This review will focus on four different parts: story and gameplay, graphics, sound and replayability. The conclusion will give a short summary. (tip: before you play this game, you should have seen the Alien films and/or played other Alien related games)StoryThe story of Aliens: Colonial Marines takes place after the film Aliens (1986) and before Alien 3 (1992). You are Winter, a Colonial Marine. ‘OOORAH!’ You receive orders from Captain Cruz: find out what happened on the USS Sulaco. A few weeks ago, contact with the Marines on LV-426 was lost. They were sent on the USS Sulaco. Together with a female, Leutenant Ripley, they were sent to investigate the colony 'Hadleys Hope' on LV-426. Build by Weyland-Yutani/Wey-Yu. Things go terribly wrong.The game starts with a message from Corporal Hicks, a Colonial Marine who survived the Alien attack on LV-426. Only a female called Ripley, a kid named 'Newt' and a synthetic named 'Bishop' survived. The rest of the Marines are K.I.A. Together with a private called 'O-Neal', you discover that the Company/Wey-Yu has its ties in many sectors. In the game you make use of many iconic weapons: Pulse Rifle, Smartgun etc. All from the Alien franchise. The game is a FPS ('First Person Shooter') in the Alien Universe. Due to its connection with the Alien franchise, you recognize many locations (and some characters) from the film Aliens. In the game private Peter O-Neal and (later) private Bella work with you together. The singleplayer campaign is about six to eight hours long: it depends on the difficulty. Unlike most other FPS titles, you can play with up to four players in singleplayer. This is a cool feature. Both singleplayer and multiplayer can be played with friends. In the campaign, you can unlock challenges to unlock cool skins and other features for your (online) characters. Artifical Intelligence The A.I. of the game is not that good. Enemies will sometimes stop in front of you or dont move at all. Your company Marines will not always fire on enemy targets. The best thing you can do is fully concentrate on your own character: dont depend on the firepower from your team. Enemies will rush and try to flank you. The complain that the enemy A.I. is 'bad' is just a lie: the difficulty of the game is responsible for the enemy A.I. Try the game on the highest difficulty setting (UB) and you will be surprised. The story of the game is good, its canon and fits into the Alien Universe. You can play the downloadable content to understand the whole story. MultiplayerIf you play multiplayer, you can play a lot of modes. This gives it a high level of (re)playability. The unique feature is to play as the Alien creatures. Rare aliens like the 'Boiler' and the 'Crusher' can be 'unlocked' to play on the different maps. In the different multiplayer modes, you can try and unlock different skins for your alien and for your marine character. In-game bugs and screen tearing in singleplayer and multiplayer.Yes, this is present in the game. Many reviews complained about the bugs and the screen tearing. Its a minus, but not a very big one. GraphicsMany reviewers said the graphics are 'crap' or at least 'very bad'. Indeed, they are not as good as 'Crysis 3' or other high-end PC games. Compared to 'AVP' from 2010, they are different, perhaps not as good on maximum, but 'good enough', 'unique' in my opinion. But why play 'Aliens' games to enjoy high end graphics? Its a game (and a movie) about a dark setting, with a focus on atmosphere and raw action. Not all gamers are born in 2013: they didnt know about high end graphics on their SNES but enjoyed and loved games how they are. Remember 'Aliens' came out in 1986. This is the second film, not the first one. This game represents that 1986 setting. When you come across LV-426 and the Derelict Spacecraft, you see the graphics are not that bad. They are just different with a unique touch. Its raining on LV-426 all the day and you see the water on your screen, the light effects are very nicely done in this game. You look up into the sky on LV-426 and you see vulcanic activity and smoke. The character models look not that good, but good enough. Better then average. Yes, you can go right through them, but is that 'crap'? The only thing that is a minus are the facial expressions: they are 'robotic' with no emotions at all. The Xenomorphs look good. They crawl and jump right toward your screen and bleed green acid. They have a 'better then average' level of detail. The enviroments look very good, from Hadleys Hope to the dark basement of the colony. Weapons look graphically 'good enough' and represent the different weapons in the movie franchise. SoundThe sound of this game is very good: its straight from the films. The sound of a firing Pulse Rifle, Smartgun, or Pump Shotgun represent the sound of the weapons in the movie franchise. The sound of the characters is good. The voice of Lance Henriksen is present in the game and other actors from the film 'Aliens' were responsible for the in-game voice sounds. The sound in environments is good. It gives you a sense of a dark place far from the earth. Desolated and abandoned. The sound in the colony is realistic: it gives the game a ‘dark feeling’. The Alien creatures scream just like in the movie. ReplayabilityReplayability of the game is high because of the many offline and online options. You can customize your weapons, create your own marine and create your online Alien creature. The game has many online modes to offer: TD, Escape, Survival, etc. Other downloadable content is available. ConclusionAliens: Colonial Marines is a game that is loyal to the Alien franchise. A FPS title, related to the film 'Aliens' from 1986 with 'action-horror' elements. Due to the multiplayer online feature, the chance to play the Alien creatures and the co-op feature in singleplayer, this game is fresh and innovative. Its just different then the most FPS titles like Call of Duty or Battlefield. If you are a FPS player with no interest in the Alien franchise, this game is 'average' to 'good' (6/10 or 7/10). If you like the Alien franchise, or played a lot of 'Alien related games', you know this game is not a bad game. If you are a big fan, just like me, you will love this game. If you haven't seen the Alien movies, go watch them first. ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------The good* Sound;* Atmosphere;* Co - op. Campaign can be played with friends. * Multiplayer modes.* Canon story. The bad* A.I. is not always consistent;* Some screen tearing and in-game bugs. VERDICT: 7 out of 10

												I don't get the hate for this game, the maps, the story, the mecahnics, everything about it is awesome. Overall the game makes a great replacement for ALien 3 and is definitely worth the time.
