content:
Posted: November 29, 2015
												Strangely enough, I kinda liked this game. It has so bad of a reputation, I thought I'm not going to list the pros and cons of the game in the usual way. Instead I'll try to write down the factors that mattered to me and - although by no means do I think this game is great, still - made it enjoyable. If you are similar to me in these regards, you might like the game too.I like the Aliens settings. In the movie I really liked the atmosphere, the gadgets (weapons, vehicles, the power loader etc.), the planet, the colony buildings, the Alien Queen and I could go on. Most of those things appear in the game. Some better (like the weapons), some worse (the power loader action scene was really bad and the Alien Queen bossfight was unrealistic, annoying and uninteresting) and some mediocre which I still think deliver an acceptable experience (like the planet itself, the colony building).There are some treats like the Derelict with the Space Jockey, which work really well in the game, as well as some lore about the Aliens, which although not much, still quite significant and I like when something new information emerges because it makes me feel there's progress in the whole story.I don't like it when the horror elements are dominant. (In movies or games alike.) I despise jumpscares, (I don't get freaked out easily, I just really feel that they are so cheap of an instrument), but I also don't like the experience of utter solitary helplessness either. I really like the concept of the game - you are in a horror environment, but you are almost never alone. You have AI buddies who help you a feel a little bit safer and braver and makes it easier to carry on. There is a part in the game where you are alone without any weapons - most Alien(s) fans like it the most. Well, for me, it was - although kind of interesting - too horror-heavy.The creators did try to put the story into the canon timeline. And I think it works. They wanted to come up with something that ultimately makes you visit places like the Sulaco, Hadley's Hope, the Derelict ship etc. and maybe not perfect or brilliant or unique, I think at the end of the day it's acceptable.The game has significant weaknesses too, likeGraphics is mediocre at best. As for me, graphic itself is not that important if the game is capable to deliver the appropriate atmosphere. But after the E3 demo, it felt a huge letdown.There are indeed too many missions where you fight against humans. Like, half of the time, you do that. Disappointing and most of the time, boring as well. Not to mention the game mechanic doesn't really shine here. As a vs human shooter, this game is really lacking.You can feel really disappointed at times. Like the famous Alien assault in Hadley's Hope with the sentry gun. Or the Power Loader fight. Those should have been some of the most memorably and best parts of the game. Failed really bad.The characters are neither memorable, nor likeable at all. You barely get to know them and in the end, you hardly care what is going to happen to them.And there are things that are up to debate in my opinion.Lack of smartgun play. There are time when you get to use this beaty, but those are few and far between. Yet, I can't help but feel this is due to the fact that it's was too powerful. It's an autotracking high-volume high-caliber machine gun. You just aim in the general direction of the enemy, pull the trigger and just see hordes of them splatter in every direction within seconds.The story is kinda generic, but I think it's not out of place at all. I felt it is believable.Overall in my opinion it's a slightly above average game with the redeeming factors making it worthy to experience it once.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 18, 2016
												I bought this game with my expectations very low as I was aware of the quality of this game before I purchased it. With that said, this game wasn't as bad as reviews would make you originally think, but it is definitely medicore - no doubt about it. Positives:-Sound effects are great, such as the pulse rifle.-Lighting effects and positions in the levels can create a moody atmosphere.-Alien models look good.-Movie locations recreated in-game look faithful.-Characters are okay, not great... but okay. Bella is annoying though. Gearbox tried to make O'Neal the player's companion but unfortunately they didn't give him enough dialogue to make him memorable. -Legendary weapons are a cool idea, and the game does have a few collectibles if that is your thing.-Some of the levels are fun and unique, such as the sewer level. Negatives:-The player fights more human enemies than aliens, which is stupid as hell.-AI is terrible! Aliens will take forever to react to you and even then they just mindlessly charge towards you without even taking alternate routes (such as walls or roofs). Sometimes aliens will just stand still while you blow their acidic brains out. -The gunplay is so boringly mediocore in this game, you literally just spray your weapons at enemies hiding behind cover hoping some of your bullets randomly hit. -Game is way too easy even on the hardest difficulty.-Level design is way too linear, you pretty much run at a straight line hip firing towards cardboard humans with no intelligence and repeat every level.-Fighting the big alien with the exosuit is a terrible experience. The aliens will run under your exosuit which causes the player to spin around at random that will kill you, over... and over... and over again. -Last boss fight is incredibly easy and is a bit of a joke.-Voice acting for the aliens character is laughable.-So many plot holes.-Team mates are completely useless, they shoot peas instead of bullets. They don't help at all. Overall, this game is incredibly mediocore. I would avoid playing this game unless you're a huge alien fan. Pretty much every other game featuring an xenomorph is better than this. I recommend Aliens vs Predator 1 and 2, Alien Trilogy, Aliens vs Predator Extinction and Alien Isolation. The gameplay is boring, the characters are boring for the most part and the story has more holes than O'Neal's brain. 4/10

content:
Posted: February 14, 2013
												This is a FPS game.(+) The Good:If and only IF you are a fan of the Movie Aliens like I’m, then this game will mean a lot to you, as they have captured real sounds and voice acting from the movie. Example, the Machine gun sounds strange if you did not see the movie. However, if you have seen the movie the sound would bring a smile to your face. Similar to the Alien sounds and eggs opening sounds and most of all the Radar beeping sound… other than that there is no positive points unfortunately…(-) The Bad:Unfortunately, the game has a LOT of issues, They simply focused on capturing the real sounds and totally neglected the fun factor! For example, you would think a game that got released in 2013 would have stunning graphics, well no it has maybe 2003/2004 graphics, the AI is as smart as a 3 year old, well maybe that’s an insult to 3 year olds, In the Campaign mode the game is missing a TON of the fun factor, and in the Co-Op Mode it is laggy and has a lot of issues this is at 50 Ping. The game feels boring after a while, you simply get that bad feeling that you just want to quit the game and go play ANYTHING else maybe solitaire even. Considering that this game is kind of like the Sequel to “Aliens Vs Predators” it does not match at all! They have simply taken a very fun and great game and smashed it into pieces…(*) The Ugly:Huge disappointment. Rating ( 4.5 / 10.00 )

You just aim in the general direction of the enemy, pull the trigger and just see hordes of them splatter in every direction within seconds.The story is kinda generic, but I think it's not out of place at all. I felt it is believable.Overall in my opinion it's a slightly above average game with the redeeming factors making it worthy to experience it once.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 29, 2015
												Strangely enough, I kinda liked this game. It has so bad of a reputation, I thought I'm not going to list the pros and cons of the game in the usual way. Instead I'll try to write down the factors that mattered to me and - although by no means do I think this game is great, still - made it enjoyable. If you are similar to me in these regards, you might like the game too.I like the Aliens settings. In the movie I really liked the atmosphere, the gadgets (weapons, vehicles, the power loader etc.), the planet, the colony buildings, the Alien Queen and I could go on. Most of those things appear in the game. Some better (like the weapons), some worse (the power loader action scene was really bad and the Alien Queen bossfight was unrealistic, annoying and uninteresting) and some mediocre which I still think deliver an acceptable experience (like the planet itself, the colony building).There are some treats like the Derelict with the Space Jockey, which work really well in the game, as well as some lore about the Aliens, which although not much, still quite significant and I like when something new information emerges because it makes me feel there's progress in the whole story.I don't like it when the horror elements are dominant. (In movies or games alike.) I despise jumpscares, (I don't get freaked out easily, I just really feel that they are so cheap of an instrument), but I also don't like the experience of utter solitary helplessness either. I really like the concept of the game - you are in a horror environment, but you are almost never alone. You have AI buddies who help you a feel a little bit safer and braver and makes it easier to carry on. There is a part in the game where you are alone without any weapons - most Alien(s) fans like it the most. Well, for me, it was - although kind of interesting - too horror-heavy.The creators did try to put the story into the canon timeline. And I think it works. They wanted to come up with something that ultimately makes you visit places like the Sulaco, Hadley's Hope, the Derelict ship etc. and maybe not perfect or brilliant or unique, I think at the end of the day it's acceptable.The game has significant weaknesses too, likeGraphics is mediocre at best. As for me, graphic itself is not that important if the game is capable to deliver the appropriate atmosphere. But after the E3 demo, it felt a huge letdown.There are indeed too many missions where you fight against humans. Like, half of the time, you do that. Disappointing and most of the time, boring as well. Not to mention the game mechanic doesn't really shine here. As a vs human shooter, this game is really lacking.You can feel really disappointed at times. Like the famous Alien assault in Hadley's Hope with the sentry gun. Or the Power Loader fight. Those should have been some of the most memorably and best parts of the game. Failed really bad.The characters are neither memorable, nor likeable at all. You barely get to know them and in the end, you hardly care what is going to happen to them.And there are things that are up to debate in my opinion.Lack of smartgun play. There are time when you get to use this beaty, but those are few and far between. Yet, I can't help but feel this is due to the fact that it's was too powerful. It's an autotracking high-volume high-caliber machine gun. You just aim in the general direction of the enemy, pull the trigger and just see hordes of them splatter in every direction within seconds.The story is kinda generic, but I think it's not out of place at all. I felt it is believable.Overall in my opinion it's a slightly above average game with the redeeming factors making it worthy to experience it once.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 7, 2016
												The first time I played this game was on a base in Afghanistan. A few friends and I rushed out to buy it for the console that we brought with us and when we got it started we absolutely hated it. The amount of bugs and other problems (including crashing the console!) ruined the experience and we couldn't enjoy it. We went back to CoD:BLOPS2 and never looked back.I bought the game two years or so ago on PC thinking that it had been fixed up by Gearbox - it hadn't. Only recently has a third-party modder (TemplarGFX on ModDB) taken a crack at it and now, finally, the game is getting to where it should have been from the get go.Here's the link:http://www.moddb.com/mods/templargfxs-acm-overhaul/downloadsWith the mod installed and the 'faster, weaker Soldiers' enabled the game finally feels like a proper Aliens experience. Partner AI has been dramatically improved, the enemy attacks are smarter, and the weapons actually feel like they have variety and character. There are still flaws (the cheesy dialogue, the plot with holes the size of a freighter, and areas where you can smell the missing content that was cut in the rushed production), but the game is much, much better. Buy it at a discount, install TemplarGFX's mod, and enjoy the experience.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 29, 2016
												I got this game when it was on sale for cheap a while back and finally decided to install it and play it now that I had some free time. I figured a few years since the grand thud that it made when it dropped should be enough time for things to be ironed out and the game playable.I was right and wrong.The straight game, on its own, is still bad. Graphics certainly look better, but nothing extraordinary. The voice acting is weak for the most part, with Michael Biehn totally phoning it in and almost sounding like he'd rather be doing anything else but this. He's better in Stasis Interrupted but not up to the level he should be. Lance Henriksen on the other hand is a consumate professional and turns in a good preformance as Bishop and Wayland.I didn't find the story as bad as a lot of people make it out to be, it's a very straight forward thing in most respects and they do a decent job of having enough mystery and question to have you going from place to place. There is still a bunch of dumb and contrivance throughout, though. You will need the Stasis Interrupted DLC to have a plausable explination why Hicks shows up towards the end. It still has the most horrible, underwhelming boss battle of almost any game -- no idea who allowed that through for a run-n-gun shooter, but they should be tossed out an airlock.As to the Stasis Interrupted DLC, I felt it was a decent expansion of the events that happen before the game proper take place. It's told in 3 chapters. The first tells the story of a woman named Lisbeth and has a very proto-Alien:Isolation feel to a lot of it. The second tells of a man named Stone who rescues Hicks and their attempted escape to Fiorina 161 and the third is Dr. Levi and Hicks running through the under construction lab facilities trying to get the word out about what's going on on LV426. (This is why you don't smack-talk your employees in front of them, Wayland). It makes Hicks' reveal towards the end of the main game less WTF and wasn't as horrible an explination as might have been. Totally worth a playthough.Since the online multiplayer is dead, unless you have friends to play all the extra maps with, are a completionist, or really like all the shiny weapons, there is no reason to get any of the other DLC packs.Now, what you will need, if you want to play this game and have it be the best experience it can be, is TemplarGFX's ACM Overhaul mod. I read about it first here and it was the reason I decided to actually play this game because it makes it, well, playable. It may also aid in stability, as I didn't have the game crash once on me in over 16hrs of playing.The graphical overhaul is a really nice feature, making it look much better than stock, but where it really shines are all the gameplay and AI enhancements. The Xenos become... well, terrifying. They will run up walls, along ceilings, retreat when fired on or wounded, sneak along, or just drop on top of you and slash you to pieces. They become fast, deadly, and will just wreck your♥♥♥♥♥♥ You will die in this game. Like, a lot. The soldiers become decent opponents, flanking and hiding from you, and not the hive-minded bullet-sponges they were on release. Best of all your team-mates become useful! Not perfect by any means, but not the absolutely useless♥♥♥♥♥♥they were before. They no longer get stuck in your way, blocking your progress, and will actually shoot enemies... most of the time.Oh, and big selling point: you now get the Smart Gun 5 times throughout the campaign instead of just twice and are able to make very satisifying use of it each time.If you own the game and haven't tried it since release, I'd say give it a go with the Overhaul pack. If you can get the game on sale for cheap and have been curious, same as well. The story still weak, the ending terrible, but the rest of it becomes a much, much more solid game more in line with what was promised of it on launch.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 2, 2016
												There are a lot of bad reviews of this game stating how it was a bug addled mess on release and how it failed to deliver all that the developers had promised. I am playing it three years later and it must of been patched as I have had no problems with it. The graphics seem fine if nothing amazing and I have no idea what was initially promised so I am rating this game purely on what it is, not on what was ecpected.If you are a fan of the films there are plenty of references and the tone and style of the story fit with the second film, the aftermath of which is delt with in the storyline here. It has been far too long since I played AVP 2 (have not played Isolation) to compare them fairly but this is probably not as good as that was although the graphics are a lot better (if prehaps not as imprived as they should be given the years between their development). A:CM is however far better than the original AVP. It can be difficult to hit anything at first but as with Dead Space you will become proficient at slaughtering monsters once you get used to how your character moves and responds to the controls.If I have a complaint it is the placement of some of the save checkpoints. At some points of the game you will reach several checkpoints within a couple minutes without any real challanging areas between them. Then at others, most notably towards the end of the first level, you will have to go through quite a bit of intense fighting before hitting the next checkpoint leading to a lot of replaying the same section. This put me off playing for several months but once past it it was not that dificult to beat again. I found the game, story and dialogue to be very enjoyable.Overall this is not a ground breaking or visually stunning masterpiece but if you like the films do not let all the negative reviews put you off, many of the complaints are either irrelevent to the actual gameplay or have been resolved since release. It is definitly worth getting next time it is 75% off, would not pay full price.

content:
Posted: September 9, 2014
												A game that deserves a lot more than it got. I absolutely loved the game and everything about. I pre-ordered the game, the only game I have pre-ordered or even spent more than $20 on steam and it was absolutely worth it! If you enjoy the Alien franchise and fun first person shooters this is the game for you.True the game is flawed and not perfect, and the multiplayer match finder is incredibly bad. However there is no greater thrill being one of four colonial marines with your friends in an abandoned starship watching your motion sensor beep at the oncoming aliens. Setting up sentry turrents, running out of ammo, losing squadmates along the way, welding doors. It's all a blast!My particularily favorite game modes are Escape, Survival and Bug Hunt. However due to the smaller player base now and the terrible match finder the first two game modes mentioned (escape survival) are almost impossible to set up.I do believe this game was rushed and I also do believe it could have been significantly better; however when I look at my steam library there are far and few games that jump out and scream play me on LAN night. Aliens Colonial Marines is an exceptional gem in the Aliens Universe and perfect for any avid fan.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: January 1
												I'm treading lightly here, for a number of obvious reasons and I'm probably going to get lynched for this review.Apparently this game was a mess on release. I never really had the misfortune of playing the unmodded, unpatched version. If you do happen to purchase or play this game, three things you absolutely must do. ...1 - Buy the game when it goes on sale, even with all the fixes it's still probably sub-par with what is acceptable. 2 - Download the Templar GFX ACM overhaul mod and modify the .ini files (Google it), it will turn the game into something a little more what it should have been.2 - Having followed the previous step, play the game with an open mind, play it for it's single player campaign and try not to jump on the herd mentality bandwagon, I'll explain why in a moment. There are a number of things you'll get out of this game if you're only playing single player. It holds true to the atmosphere in a big way, one thing they got right was those moments you look around and appreciate what they've created. Going to places in the Aliens movies (even though they shouldn't really exist anymore...) brings back those nostalgic feelings of watching Aliens for the first time. There are a few scripted moments which were done well also. Some people might find the graphics a little dated or rubbish but I had no problems, I mean heck, with my 200+ backlog of games on steam I'm still playing games from early 2000....So ACM was a real treat graphically for me. Soundwise....well who does'nt like the sound of a pulse rifle or shotgun? The sounds are beefy and pack some punch. I lost interest in the story or only vaguely followed it because I knew there were a ton of obvious inconsistent moments with the Alien franchise. It didn't help that I was thinking "oh here we go again, I've heard these lines in other games before". To be honest, the voice acting was ok but the dialogue was....cheesy and cliche. I was not impressed by the constant frame dips, despite my PC being well above spec, I'm not the only person with this issue though, you really need to tweak a lot to get this game running and looking nice.My personal opinion is that yes, I'd recommend this game but only when the above suggestions are followed. I did actually enjoy it.

content:
Posted: April 28, 2015
												After read many thumb down review, I .... hmm We decided to give it a try. (Again)FIrst lunch no problem at all,  The graphic look decent, HD texture and nice shader. Large world, Long play before loading new map. The sound effect is greats, classic from the movie. Team work is required but not much as L4D. Nice first person animation. Weapons to use is quite enough (As a Marine). We quite disapointed at first look on some weapons. Recommended you to find all legendary weapons, You will love the dev a little bit more (Straight from the movie). The AI is smart enough to kill us all 4 of us. (Ultimate Badass Difficulty). They can dodge, jump away, leaping toward you, surpirse you from behind and  more. We encounter no bug at all except friendly NPC stuck near elevator for about 30 second but only once. AI can lose thier limb too. Story line is fun and can be scary. Turret can be deploy in realistic way. And can you control the classic yellow loader robot like ribly does? Find out your self.This game worth 9 bux for us. 7/10   (still hoping for AVP3)We think Gearbox might run out of budget or some sort. This game can go even further.Well, if you like shooting alien with friend, support the dev and play it with your friend now.

												Well, i took the plunge and bought this game..more for a laugh really. Turned out much better than i thought. Not perfect though. Baring in mind This is after the big patch and only single player campaign. (plus got it for £2) I thought it was entertaining enough...plenty to keep you occupied. Visiting the old Movie sites like Hadleys hope, Sulaca and many more. Lots of weapons to use and upgrade. The story is so so, not that i really cared. Its all been done before but was playing this as a huge Aliens fan. To me the game DOES make you feel like your in the Aliens universe. Amazing sounds from weapons and aliens. The motion tracker is awesome but just having it on and listening ..you'll think your watching Aliens....although a pain when you have to switch back to gun before being eaten.  All in All i would recommend this game...even for those who arent major Aliens fans the games worth the steam price (even though i didnt pay it) and id go as far as saying better than a lot of other FPS games at the same price.

content:
Posted: December 23, 2014
												A lot of the complaints I have heard about Aliens: Colonial Marines were justified on release. Since then most of the issues that I am aware of have been patched. The Alien AI is better and very lethal. They like to run on the ceiling when you are destracted by their buddies and drop down behind you. I have died many times to this before I adapted. There are a few remaining issues but those are mainly minor irritants. The AI will still get stuck and get left behind at times, but when you reach the objective or checkpoint they teliport to you and carry on as normal. The price right now is $2.99 (80% off steam sale) and during this time it is more then worth the price. If you do decide to pick up the game I highly recommend buying Stasis Interupted. The DLC adds several more missions and gives explanation to what happened aboard the Suloco after it left LV-426 at the end of Aliens.

												Just a quick review.  I bought this for $5.  I've only played the single player mission up to mission 4.  It's really not that bad.  In fact, its quite a lot of fun.  For $5 its great.  It gets the adrenaline pumping, and is a lot of fun.  I think I would criticize the fact that there are so many cliches and locations from the film, but if you have a sense of humour you might find it vaguely amusing.  The aliens themselves are too weak, the AI isn't amazing, but they come thick and fast.  It's not an original game and its not as good as the original avp from 2000, but it is a lot of harmless fun.  Perhaps the game was released buggy, and of course its not up there in quality with the original alien franchise.  But I don't understand the haters.  I have played far far worse games in my life.  My score would be 3/5.  Fun but average.

content:
Posted: December 11, 2013
												Honestly I don't think this game deserves half the hate it gets. It's no masterpiece, but it has it's merits. Some of the levels are just fun, particularly 'The Raven' which had a good pacing for the suspence and was entirely focused on xenomorphs instead of the wey-yu. Gameplay is about what you'd expect out of a shooter, though I wouldn't be putting to much stock into your AI companions, to put it frankly they can't shoot worth a damn and when they do manage to hit something it's probably not the target you're wanting them to hit.The story is meh. Honestly they could have gone in other directions with it, and seeing as the DLC page spoils it for you anyhow  the fact that it's Hicks and not one of the other marines that may have not actually died on the planet makes me roll my eyes. That being said if you are looking for some mindless xeno blasting then the game will certainly feed that need. I'd recomend playing with friends at hardened or ultimate badass otherwise the enemy AI is only marginally better then your companions.I'll be honest I've not tried to much of the online component, but there aren't to many people playing so you're not likely to find a team unless you have friends.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 9, 2014
												I'm a big fan of Aliens-themed videogames. Two of my all time favorites were created by Rebellion software, Aliens vs. Predator on the Atari Jaguar and the first PC release of the same title. Both of those games are at the top of my Aliens list and over the years since then there have been quite a few Aliens games that failed to deliver the same level of atmosphere and excitement. The majority have been flops in my opinion. So I was skeptical when I heard about Aliens Colonial Marines. I found out about ACM shortly before it's release so I was unaware of it's long development cycle. I did not see early dev screenshots or short videos of in-game play which allowed me to keep an open mind about it.The storyline of ACM takes place almost immediately after the end of the film Aliens and it returns the player to a plotline focused around events on LV426. To me, this was pretty much a re-run on a plot since the first Aliens vs. Predator PC title also returned the player to LV426. The difference between the two however is AVP had a more interesting story that made sense and presented a much more plausible mystery. ACM's plot is heavily scripted with a large amount of character dialogue and cutscenes that aimed to make it more of a film experience than a game which becomes a little tiresome after a while. Thankfully your trusty escape key can bypass that noise and get you back into the action.ACM is restrictive as you progress through each area. You cannot explore much or find your own way, everything is blocked off which forces players through as if they are on a train track. I would have liked many sections of the game a lot more if players had the ability to take multiple routes or blunder your way to the next objective. Instead it feels more like an arcade light gun game where you are corralled into the next tough spot and have to blast your way out. It's tolerable and at times pretty fun but it could have been better. Graphically ACM got many bad reviews. I think this is partly due to people who were following the development of the game over a long period of time and were expecting something else than the finished product. Also, some players complained that the quality of the graphics looked like something out of the mid 1990's. That simply isn't the case. ACM looks awesome and really captured the look and feel of Aliens from the film. The Aliens themselves look very realistic. It is spot on and has some great effects. I have to conclude that people who think ACM's graphics are lacking and compare it to a 90's videogame probably weren't around back then and were born with a silver Pentium in their mouth.Overall I enjoyed the single player campaign despite the gameplay shortcomings and less than inventive story. Replayability was better than average due to being able to play through all the single player missions on co-op with friends as well as being able to increase the difficulty level to it's hardest setting. Ultimate Badass difficulty makes ACM more of an entertaining challenge to play. Once all that is finished though players will find themselves stuck with very poorly executed multiplayer choices and a majority of DLC content that is fairly dull. Of the DLC, Bug Hunt and Stasis Interrupted are the only two items to definitely get. The rest I would completely avoid. Here's why. The multiplayer server setup is completely broken. If you are looking to play Team Deathmatch, Survivor, or some of the other options available more than likely you'll be stuck waiting for 20 minutes without finding any players. Generally the system can't find anybody and will simply time out. You are better off 'friending' other players in the ACM community and linking up with them if you want to try to play those game modes.Bug Hunt offers the best multiplay option. It's a ton of fun and you will have to work together in a four person team in order to survive. Each of the three maps are well laid out with strategically placed drops of equipment and supplies. The catch to this is- you have to earn the ability to access them through kills. The more enemies you kill, the more loot you get. More loot means you can buy your way into a locked building or open up a crate full of ammo. Players will also fare better if they choose to pool their resources and cash together which is a nice touch. If you happen to have loads of space bucks you can gift some of it to a less fortunate Marine which will allow them to buy back in after being killed, or buy them a smart gun and toss it their way. Stasis Interrupted is the other worthy DLC. It is another single player campaign with the choice of also playing co-op. This add on builds the ACM story from a prequel timeline and explains more of the overall plot. Unlike the main single player campaign this has a bit more of an exploration feel to it and was not as restrictive which is a nice change of pace.Overall I think Aliens Colonial Marines is pretty good. Yeah, it has issues and some things could have been implemented better but I do enjoy this game. If you are a fan of the Alien franchise I say grab your body armor, light up a flamethrower and pick up a copy of ACM. It's bug stompin' time!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 25, 2014
												First of all I would like to say that I had this game pre-ordered almost a year before it had come out. But since a lot of PC games are hit or miss I decided to wait for the reviews before I picked up my game. After about a week of reading all of the terrible reviews I decided to cancel my pre-order and put it towards something else. As time went on I forgot about the game and that was that. Then the other day here on Steam I found the game on sale for $4.99, I decided to look into it and see if there had been any improvements since last I cared to look. I saw nothing positive really and basically the only reviews or information I could find were from the original release, there was nothing current that I could find. Then while searching, I found a video on youtube dated 2014, I decided to watch it and have this help me make my final decision. After just the first few minutes I thought everything looked really cool and it seemed to play exactly how I had hoped. Upon some more research I found out that they had released a 4gb patch back in august 2013 to address all of the issues, but at this time nobody wanted to bother to re-review it since so much time had passed. I decided for $5 it may be worth checking out. So I purchased a copy for myself and my 2 other friends also got copies for themselves. We got everything installed and waited for the weekend. I must also add that we are huge L4D2 fans and with the almost endless supply of user maps we have logged over 300 hours since it's release. We also play ARMA2 and 3, with at least that many hours if not more into ARMA2, Rainbow 6 and before they messed it up with the last release, Ghost Recon. So we have quite a bit of experience with co-op campaign games and know what we like and what we don't. So finally the day came, we each loaded up the game and I created a LAN Co-op Campaign game and my friends logged in. From the moment the cut scene was over I was pleased with what I saw, despite what the reviews had said I thought the game looked pretty good. I had everything cranked up as high as it would go and I was loving it. When I had to open my motion tracker and heard that familiar sound my heart began to race. Then once I saw my first alien crawling across the ceiling towards my team I knew I was hooked. We could not get enough of this fantastic game and after playing for 9 hours straight only pausing for food, we finished nearly 60% before having to stop and go back to the real world. I don't know if that 4gb patch actually fixed everything that was wrong with the game or if people were just being over critical, but I felt the $5 I spent was well worth it and I still would have been happy had I paid more. I only have a minor issue, but this can be said about a most games after I have gotten used to the modabilty and user maps of L4D2 and ARMA2/3...I wish the game was longer or at the very least had user maps available. Yes I know there is DLC to add on a few more maps, but I could easily see myself and my friends logging 300 hours with this game if there were the maps to support it. If you like L4d2 then trust me, I believe you will also like this. I would like to thank the publishers for what I think is an awesome game and if you had ever been interested in this game or saw the movie and would like to be a part of it then I think  you owe it to yourself to give this a shot and see how well they did.

content:
Posted: February 13, 2013
												Okay you people have obviously seen a few reviews already and have probably been turned away. I'm only saying this once ♥♥♥♥ the reviewers and their biased uneducated ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t. This game was made SPECIFICALLY to give you the feel of being in the 1980's sci-fi action film. That's EXACTLY WHAT IT DOES. From the iconic sound of the pulse rifle to the dark enclosed corridors of Hadley's Hope you get it all hell you even get to use the weapons of Hicks, Hudson, and Velasquez to kill as many Xeno's as you wish. If your big on the alien franchise like I am you will enjoy the game for the continuation of the story. The AI is a little clunky and could have used a little more tuning and the facial animations could have been a tad better but that doesn't ruin the fact that a fan of the series gets to experience LV-426 post film.Final Thoughts:You will enjoy the game if your a fan of the series and you know exactly what your getting into if you are unfamiliar with it go watch the movies THEN play the game.Overall 8.5/10 +The Aesthetics were spot on and what to expect from a true to context adaption of Aliens.+The USCM are still the most badass ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s in the galaxy+You get a few suprises in the story+4 player co-op=Theres a nice veriety of weapons but there could have been more-Enemy AI's aim is way to spot on and they are a tad dumb-Facial animations are a pretty sketchy-There are some minor clipping issues like Aliens walking through the floor on rare occassion mainly during the last fight

content:
Posted: December 1, 2013
												   To be fair, I am a RABID Aliens fan. My review will be slanted from the start. I collect books, movies, replicas and movie props from this film - though I love the whole series/universe, Aliens is by far the superior film. Is it a FANTASTIC game ? No, it isn't. Is it even a good game ? Not terribly. It isn't however; a awful as most of the reviews say.  You are a USCM Marine, you get to use every single iconic weapon in the movie. Though a MAJOR complaint for me was the HORRIBLE INACCURACY of nearly every weapon except the pump shotgun, the Service 9mm and of course the M56 Smartgun. (Hard to miss with IR tracking) The graphics are above average especially since the upgrade patch, and the game IS very atmospheric. Hadley's Hope and The Sulaco are recognizible right down to the name plates on the lockers. Lighting is low and creepy, never knowing where a xeno may pop up.   Bringing me to the story, THIS is why people I think are so upset. Many of the games flaws would have been forgiven... (Poor AI, Unfinished textures and serious issues with the NPC's) It feels thin, unimaginative and the ending is extremely ABRUPT and unsatisfying ! Many will be... WTF just happened ? Hick's inclusion while welcome to me I loved the character, but how they did it is just plain RIDICULOUS. They should have collaborated with Jim Cameron since this is considered cannon to the movies.   The "Stasis Interrupted" DLC is a HUGE improvement over the original game, absolutely terrifyingly atmospheric in places - I greatly appreciated that offering. All-in-all I consider Aliens: Colonial Marines absolutely crucial to my collection, however; with the source material available this game could have been a LANDMARK in gaming.    Overall The game was rushed, and mundane FPS shooter with wonderful graphics but a thin, non-existent story. The ending is abrupt and left wide-open to a sequel which I'm sure was the intention. The Marines look great, the iconic weapons are there... (Even if the you can't hit the broadside of a barn with the pulse rifle) The levels are dark and highly detailed with familiar places and feel to the movies. It's empty though put out to make a buck.If you are a Die-Hard like me ? The game is a must-have for your collection. BUY-IT !If you're looking for a state of the art FPS with top-notch mechanics and story not caring about the Aliens movie or franchise? Let this title float right under your motion-tracker...It's not as terrible as most of the reviews say it is...

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 19, 2014
												Been playing Aliens FPS games since the 90s right.  Remember that PC Doom 2 mod?  Alien TC (Stood for Total Conversion as they called mods that virtually replaced all game content with something new)  I believe this was the first 'Aliens' style FPS experience back in the 90s, then the Atari Jaguar had a good Aliens Vs. Predator game, but it was kind of hokey and not so atmospheric as the previous mentioned.  Buncha sprites bouncin around and weird view angles.  Basically what I'm trying to say is since I was 12 I've been enraptured by the idea of meshing the FPS experience with the Aliens universe.  I've played em all, and lots of multiplayer for each.  Sure this game had a few bugs, but the reviews it got were simply unjust and mostly from players that never really gave it a chance.  This is actually a hidden gem and the most complete and modern, well designed Aliens first person shooter experience you're gonna get. Playing the Coop with a friend, we actually felt like marines, one guy with a smart gun, one guy holding the motion detector, sharing quietly what the radar blips are saying.  All in the dark recesses of ships trying not to wake the bugs, or facehuggers.  Which you better shoot off your friends face quickly when it laches.  Anyhow it just works.  It was a solid game, the Aliens are terrifying for once as well.  Never had any horrible game bugs ruin my experience as they say.  The film grain issue was indeed bs though.  But its a beautiful game, ran well on my older PC even.

content:
Posted: June 20, 2014
												Can´t undersstand all the hating....I bought this game with season pass and in short: Its great!!!The details:Grafics: Unreal Engine. Enviroment is nice, Charaters a bit ugly but fully ok. I read a review that the ships internals are all look the same: "Man, why should a spaceship look different from room to room???"Sound: GoodHandling: Characters handle well.Difficulty: "Veteran" could be a bit hard. Starting with "soldier" in a single player campaign is hard enough for most players. If you play Coop Campaign you should raise the difficulty.Localization: German loc. has some funny points like "waldmannsheil" and the "ooorah" sounds a bit bored but it is ok. A few funny moments if u accept the "marines" style. Story: Good and fun to play. When i finished one of the ten (i think) chapters i was always willing to play the next. There are dozens of allusions to the movies (mainly Alien2) and lots of the story plays in the moviesetting. !Spoiler!: The appearens of "Hicks" is completly explained if u listen to the text at chapter seven.Playing: All weapons from the movies, which could be adepted to your playstyle. There are six epic weapons that could be found in the campaign. (And again) I read a review that the maps are so linaer: "Man, yes they are!!! If they are not you will found nothing in the game" (btw: They are quite big and if your NPC wont lead the way you will find nothing). Your only may is your motiontacker. This handy device shows you the way. A bit...and it makes no differnence if object are down or above you... MultPlayer: CoopCampaign and a few versus games. In MP you could fully customizes your Marine or Xeno Character. Really nice...Overall: Great game (by now). A lot of fun to play for Alien Friends and highly replayable if you have friends that play the game with you.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 25, 2014
												First of all I would like to say that I had this game pre-ordered almost a year before it had come out. But since a lot of PC games are hit or miss I decided to wait for the reviews before I picked up my game. After about a week of reading all of the terrible reviews I decided to cancel my pre-order and put it towards something else. As time went on I forgot about the game and that was that. Then the other day here on Steam I found the game on sale for $4.99, I decided to look into it and see if there had been any improvements since last I cared to look. I saw nothing positive really and basically the only reviews or information I could find were from the original release, there was nothing current that I could find. Then while searching, I found a video on youtube dated 2014, I decided to watch it and have this help me make my final decision. After just the first few minutes I thought everything looked really cool and it seemed to play exactly how I had hoped. Upon some more research I found out that they had released a 4gb patch back in august 2013 to address all of the issues, but at this time nobody wanted to bother to re-review it since so much time had passed. I decided for $5 it may be worth checking out. So I purchased a copy for myself and my 2 other friends also got copies for themselves. We got everything installed and waited for the weekend. I must also add that we are huge L4D2 fans and with the almost endless supply of user maps we have logged over 300 hours since it's release. We also play ARMA2 and 3, with at least that many hours if not more into ARMA2, Rainbow 6 and before they messed it up with the last release, Ghost Recon. So we have quite a bit of experience with co-op campaign games and know what we like and what we don't. So finally the day came, we each loaded up the game and I created a LAN Co-op Campaign game and my friends logged in. From the moment the cut scene was over I was pleased with what I saw, despite what the reviews had said I thought the game looked pretty good. I had everything cranked up as high as it would go and I was loving it. When I had to open my motion tracker and heard that familiar sound my heart began to race. Then once I saw my first alien crawling across the ceiling towards my team I knew I was hooked. We could not get enough of this fantastic game and after playing for 9 hours straight only pausing for food, we finished nearly 60% before having to stop and go back to the real world. I don't know if that 4gb patch actually fixed everything that was wrong with the game or if people were just being over critical, but I felt the $5 I spent was well worth it and I still would have been happy had I paid more. I only have a minor issue, but this can be said about a most games after I have gotten used to the modabilty and user maps of L4D2 and ARMA2/3...I wish the game was longer or at the very least had user maps available. Yes I know there is DLC to add on a few more maps, but I could easily see myself and my friends logging 300 hours with this game if there were the maps to support it. If you like L4d2 then trust me, I believe you will also like this. I would like to thank the publishers for what I think is an awesome game and if you had ever been interested in this game or saw the movie and would like to be a part of it then I think  you owe it to yourself to give this a shot and see how well they did.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 9, 2014
												I'm a big fan of Aliens-themed videogames. Two of my all time favorites were created by Rebellion software, Aliens vs. Predator on the Atari Jaguar and the first PC release of the same title. Both of those games are at the top of my Aliens list and over the years since then there have been quite a few Aliens games that failed to deliver the same level of atmosphere and excitement. The majority have been flops in my opinion. So I was skeptical when I heard about Aliens Colonial Marines. I found out about ACM shortly before it's release so I was unaware of it's long development cycle. I did not see early dev screenshots or short videos of in-game play which allowed me to keep an open mind about it.The storyline of ACM takes place almost immediately after the end of the film Aliens and it returns the player to a plotline focused around events on LV426. To me, this was pretty much a re-run on a plot since the first Aliens vs. Predator PC title also returned the player to LV426. The difference between the two however is AVP had a more interesting story that made sense and presented a much more plausible mystery. ACM's plot is heavily scripted with a large amount of character dialogue and cutscenes that aimed to make it more of a film experience than a game which becomes a little tiresome after a while. Thankfully your trusty escape key can bypass that noise and get you back into the action.ACM is restrictive as you progress through each area. You cannot explore much or find your own way, everything is blocked off which forces players through as if they are on a train track. I would have liked many sections of the game a lot more if players had the ability to take multiple routes or blunder your way to the next objective. Instead it feels more like an arcade light gun game where you are corralled into the next tough spot and have to blast your way out. It's tolerable and at times pretty fun but it could have been better. Graphically ACM got many bad reviews. I think this is partly due to people who were following the development of the game over a long period of time and were expecting something else than the finished product. Also, some players complained that the quality of the graphics looked like something out of the mid 1990's. That simply isn't the case. ACM looks awesome and really captured the look and feel of Aliens from the film. The Aliens themselves look very realistic. It is spot on and has some great effects. I have to conclude that people who think ACM's graphics are lacking and compare it to a 90's videogame probably weren't around back then and were born with a silver Pentium in their mouth.Overall I enjoyed the single player campaign despite the gameplay shortcomings and less than inventive story. Replayability was better than average due to being able to play through all the single player missions on co-op with friends as well as being able to increase the difficulty level to it's hardest setting. Ultimate Badass difficulty makes ACM more of an entertaining challenge to play. Once all that is finished though players will find themselves stuck with very poorly executed multiplayer choices and a majority of DLC content that is fairly dull. Of the DLC, Bug Hunt and Stasis Interrupted are the only two items to definitely get. The rest I would completely avoid. Here's why. The multiplayer server setup is completely broken. If you are looking to play Team Deathmatch, Survivor, or some of the other options available more than likely you'll be stuck waiting for 20 minutes without finding any players. Generally the system can't find anybody and will simply time out. You are better off 'friending' other players in the ACM community and linking up with them if you want to try to play those game modes.Bug Hunt offers the best multiplay option. It's a ton of fun and you will have to work together in a four person team in order to survive. Each of the three maps are well laid out with strategically placed drops of equipment and supplies. The catch to this is- you have to earn the ability to access them through kills. The more enemies you kill, the more loot you get. More loot means you can buy your way into a locked building or open up a crate full of ammo. Players will also fare better if they choose to pool their resources and cash together which is a nice touch. If you happen to have loads of space bucks you can gift some of it to a less fortunate Marine which will allow them to buy back in after being killed, or buy them a smart gun and toss it their way. Stasis Interrupted is the other worthy DLC. It is another single player campaign with the choice of also playing co-op. This add on builds the ACM story from a prequel timeline and explains more of the overall plot. Unlike the main single player campaign this has a bit more of an exploration feel to it and was not as restrictive which is a nice change of pace.Overall I think Aliens Colonial Marines is pretty good. Yeah, it has issues and some things could have been implemented better but I do enjoy this game. If you are a fan of the Alien franchise I say grab your body armor, light up a flamethrower and pick up a copy of ACM. It's bug stompin' time!

Posted: July 12, 2014
												Ok this is my first review and I am usually brutal with games. If I am not hooked in the first hour that is generally where the timer stops. When I first bought this game it was on special and gave up during the campaign second level, and thats where it sat, for ages, for a lot of the reasons well desribed in the many negitive reviews  Then during a super special I bought two extra copies and the DLC's only to be disappointed that no one plays multiplayer (and they still don't) BUT... in amongst the DLC is BUGHUNT. It is many times better than Alien vs Preditor "survivor" mode. There are 30 waves of Aliens and Enemy Corporate soldiers to burn, blast, grenade, smart gun, RPG, claymore, and one of my favorites the multi auto gun turret choke point to death. The catch is you earn money for kills which is spent on opening up steel doors, lifts, more ammo , more smart guns , etc etc and each wave shows it threat value as a percentage. 45-85% is easy as while you move about planning and deployed turrets. 110%-145% Aliens get brutal and you start taking casualties, unless you activate up to five suppressors around the map which reduce threat levels. Even so by level 30 gun turrets are glowing red, ammo is short supply and threat levels enemy numbers are well up. Sounds a little confusing but you can pass money about to get things open and achieved, set up turrets where you think is a good final stand, revive downed team mates , shoot aliens off them too. We even played through the co-op campaign and dlc levels to increase our gun options we can take into bughunt, which although fairly b.s. as most have described not as bad either and the second half is better than the first. DLC storyline.... omg  3/10Graphics.... enough said already 4/10sound.....yea its a pulse rifle 5/10campaign 3/10Co-op campaign 6/10co-op Bughunt 8.5/10 (negitives are); You need friends to play multi, sometimes the AI goes Awol, only 3 maps, and you are stuck with your two chosen guns for the whole 30 levels.Overall: I would have been f and c if I paid original price for this but if you see on super special with bughunt DLC have a crack with your mates. The first time we hit level 30 I don't think I stopped smiling :)P.S. How can you play 20-30-40 hours of this game and give a neg review. If I get 10 Hours from a game these days I consider that bang for my buck

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 9, 2014
												A game that deserves a lot more than it got. I absolutely loved the game and everything about. I pre-ordered the game, the only game I have pre-ordered or even spent more than $20 on steam and it was absolutely worth it! If you enjoy the Alien franchise and fun first person shooters this is the game for you.True the game is flawed and not perfect, and the multiplayer match finder is incredibly bad. However there is no greater thrill being one of four colonial marines with your friends in an abandoned starship watching your motion sensor beep at the oncoming aliens. Setting up sentry turrents, running out of ammo, losing squadmates along the way, welding doors. It's all a blast!My particularily favorite game modes are Escape, Survival and Bug Hunt. However due to the smaller player base now and the terrible match finder the first two game modes mentioned (escape survival) are almost impossible to set up.I do believe this game was rushed and I also do believe it could have been significantly better; however when I look at my steam library there are far and few games that jump out and scream play me on LAN night. Aliens Colonial Marines is an exceptional gem in the Aliens Universe and perfect for any avid fan.

												Well, i took the plunge and bought this game..more for a laugh really. Turned out much better than i thought. Not perfect though. Baring in mind This is after the big patch and only single player campaign. (plus got it for £2) I thought it was entertaining enough...plenty to keep you occupied. Visiting the old Movie sites like Hadleys hope, Sulaca and many more. Lots of weapons to use and upgrade. The story is so so, not that i really cared. Its all been done before but was playing this as a huge Aliens fan. To me the game DOES make you feel like your in the Aliens universe. Amazing sounds from weapons and aliens. The motion tracker is awesome but just having it on and listening ..you'll think your watching Aliens....although a pain when you have to switch back to gun before being eaten. content:
Posted: December 23, 2014
												A lot of the complaints I have heard about Aliens: Colonial Marines were justified on release. Since then most of the issues that I am aware of have been patched. The Alien AI is better and very lethal. They like to run on the ceiling when you are destracted by their buddies and drop down behind you. I have died many times to this before I adapted. There are a few remaining issues but those are mainly minor irritants. The AI will still get stuck and get left behind at times, but when you reach the objective or checkpoint they teliport to you and carry on as normal. The price right now is $2.99 (80% off steam sale) and during this time it is more then worth the price. If you do decide to pick up the game I highly recommend buying Stasis Interupted. The DLC adds several more missions and gives explanation to what happened aboard the Suloco after it left LV-426 at the end of Aliens.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 2
												I am willing to recommend this game to Aliens fans with enough imagination to make up for what this game lacks in pretty much every aspect. The biggest gaming disappointment of my life, this game is the buggiest (no pun intended), ugliest, waste of potential I have ever seen come from a AAA studio. I am so glad SEGA had the nuts to put out Alien: Isolation after this, or this definitely would've been the franchise killer. I heard a lot of people say multiplayer was the saving grace of this game, but I couldn't tell you since nobody plays, and why would they? If you really really love the Aliens franchise and you want a decent story to play through on co-op with a friend, I say go for it. It's hard to recommend paying even the Steam price for the game its just so horribly underwhelming. It has a decent weapon arsenal and progression system, with unlocks that carry over into multiplayer (but there is no player base so it doesnt matter) and some of the new Alien designs are cool, but this game is the lowest point of the franchise coming between AvP 2010 (a great game, go check it out), and Alien Isolation (also an amazing game), and possibly to blame for the lower than expected sales of Alien Isolation. Buy if your expectations are in check.P.S. The game is more fun on the hardest difficulty, but you have to turn it down when you reach a boss battle because those are 100% impossible on the hardest difficulty, not because they are challenging, but they are so mechanically wonky that you will constantly get stuck on something and die instantly or the mechanics are simply broken.P.P.S. Check out TemplarGFX's ACM Overhaul, it's a great mod and makes the game a lot better.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: January 1
												I'm treading lightly here, for a number of obvious reasons and I'm probably going to get lynched for this review.Apparently this game was a mess on release. I never really had the misfortune of playing the unmodded, unpatched version. If you do happen to purchase or play this game, three things you absolutely must do. ...1 - Buy the game when it goes on sale, even with all the fixes it's still probably sub-par with what is acceptable. 2 - Download the Templar GFX ACM overhaul mod and modify the .ini files (Google it), it will turn the game into something a little more what it should have been.2 - Having followed the previous step, play the game with an open mind, play it for it's single player campaign and try not to jump on the herd mentality bandwagon, I'll explain why in a moment. There are a number of things you'll get out of this game if you're only playing single player. It holds true to the atmosphere in a big way, one thing they got right was those moments you look around and appreciate what they've created. Going to places in the Aliens movies (even though they shouldn't really exist anymore...) brings back those nostalgic feelings of watching Aliens for the first time. There are a few scripted moments which were done well also. Some people might find the graphics a little dated or rubbish but I had no problems, I mean heck, with my 200+ backlog of games on steam I'm still playing games from early 2000....So ACM was a real treat graphically for me. Soundwise....well who does'nt like the sound of a pulse rifle or shotgun? The sounds are beefy and pack some punch. I lost interest in the story or only vaguely followed it because I knew there were a ton of obvious inconsistent moments with the Alien franchise. It didn't help that I was thinking "oh here we go again, I've heard these lines in other games before". To be honest, the voice acting was ok but the dialogue was....cheesy and cliche. I was not impressed by the constant frame dips, despite my PC being well above spec, I'm not the only person with this issue though, you really need to tweak a lot to get this game running and looking nice.My personal opinion is that yes, I'd recommend this game but only when the above suggestions are followed. I did actually enjoy it.

content:
Posted: July 1, 2014
												This game isn't the best game in the world; it has flaws, several of them in fact. The AI is pretty laughable; the graphics in game/cutscenes are early last gen. But what makes this game so bad is that the developers Gearbox (they made the Borderlands games, Half Life 1 expansions and Duke Nukem Forever) lied and over hyped the game to ridiculous lengths that the previewed game is nothing like the finished product (See E3 videos), the game much like Duke Nukem Forever (also done by Gearbox...) was in development hell for most of the last decade and became vapourware and a bad internet joke. However the finished product here does have a few redeeming qualities to it, it is enjoyable in co-op with friends, the campaign is pretty OK (nothing spectacular to write about), the multiplayer is great (the Aliens have a good control scheme) and the best part is that there is a Left 4 Dead esque co-op/verses multiplayer campaign that is great but is basic. The DLC is OK and is worth a look at (when the Season Pass is cheap).Pros:- Good gameplay (OK shooter).- Full controller support.- Good multiplayer and co-op game modes.- Easy Achievements.Cons:- Poor game package overall (since this is an AAA game).- Graphical not good, considering the E3 trailers on older builds looked better.- Crap AI.- Multiplayer scene is almost dead, despite it being a redeeming feature of the game.5/10TL:DR: Buy this game in a Steam Sale along with the Season Pass along with a few buddies and play through the Campaign/Multiplayer and have a few laughs.

content:
Posted: March 29, 2016
												Now I understand why Alien Isolation's sales were slow or poor.A lot of people were turned off of Sega's line of Alien games because of this game.  For those people who have refrained from buying Alien Isolation:  RETHINK IT...   AI is a superior game to a lot of games out there and it is more Survival Horror (like Outlast only better) than anything.Alien Colonial Marines is "imitation CoD" mixed with some of the older Playstation Alien games from the 1990's. Graphics wise you can see there is a mix of good and bad.   Some computer screens you come across look great.. others are so blocky and out of focus it makes you wonder if it were merely copied and pasted in a rush.The Multi-player, at least the co-op seems fun --at first.   Then you realize that even the Bughunt DLC requires 4 players... which is not good.   Should have been 2-4 per team.The A.I. for your allies in single player mode is awful.  You save marines...  and then some of them stand there like idiots instead of doing what they need to do like...  getting back to basecamp.The main story is not great and could have been done better...  there should have been more "helping marines live" so they can help you defend in certain spots later on (i.e the more you save the bigger the group you'll have later etc).Locking doors so you cannot run back and get the Auto-turret for one scene was not a good idea either.There were some interesting spots, like wandering around in the sewers against the elderly aliens (lol).... but even that entire scenerio could have played out better or scarier.I will say that I think some of the DLC's helped this game (I'm told Bughunt is good when you got enough friends to actually get it going)...   and the "Statis Interrupted" DLC was interesting.  Similar to Alien Isolation (perhaps like a rough draft of it)... where you are a chick and go around without weapons and find your way to point B...  All in all... this game could have...  should have been better.  Multi-player was not appealing at all.  Period.  Sega NEEDS TO LEARN how to set up Lobby systems.The lobby system in Mount & Blade: Warband, for example,  is EASY and not limited in what you can set up.  This game's multiplayer was a huge turn-off.I got one friend on here who has the game and we are trying to do the Co-op game and so far it's going okay ... but we don't have enough to do other multiplayer maps.  sigh.One final word to those who can still do patches:It is never too late to do a game over-haul patch.   You can fix some issues for the game and perhaps clean up some of the bugs.  Gearbox, this dud is on your reputation, not the company you tried to outsource to.You guys are going to have to live with all the negative reviews unless you can heed this suggestion and fix what you know needs to be fixed.Alien Isolation's sales... suffer because you guys dropped the ball.Fix your bugs please.

Incoming 
A Screenshot of Aliens: Colonial Marines
By: Friedmudkips ツ #FreeMilo




Aliens:Colonial Marines (ACM as I will be referring to it in this review.) is a First-Person Shooter developed by Gearbox Interactive,best known for their critically acclaimed Borderlands series, and published by SEGA.The game features both a campaign that could be played alone or with friends and a versus multiplayer mode(Though I will not be talking about MP at all as both it and the Co-op are dead and there is nobody to play with for now. I'll edit with that once I can find people to play with).Now with a strong company like Gearbox leading this charge into well-franchised territory what could go wrong? Well for starters,the game was originally announced in 2006 and was set to release in 2008. However, the developers delayed it so many times that the game ended up releasing in 2013. That is absolutely ridiculous for a game being made by a AAA company and published by a giant like SEGA.Also the fact that they made a game with so many flaws and basically unfinished parts shows me that they really didn't care about fans or the series but instead they just wanted to make a cash-in title. The developers also had law suits and infighting but for this review I am going to try to focus mostly on the game and less on the shady practices of the developers.


Sewers 
A Screenshot of Aliens: Colonial Marines
By: Friedmudkips ツ #FreeMilo




The singleplayer of ACM was honestly pretty bad due to the fact that most of it just felt. . . unfinished.The main story follows you,a marine named Winter, as you respond to a distress call sent out by the USS Sulaco. Then chaos erupts as you go into the Sulaco only to find it a xeno-ridden hellhole.As you try to escape,the umbilical connecting the Sulaco to the USS Sephora gets destroyed since one of the marines you rescued,Keyes,would rather blow himself up than be killed by the facehugger parasite inside him.The rest of the story is incredibly cliche with lots of "No marine left behind,Oorah to ashes"♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t.The final boss fight was the most depressing thing I have ever seen in my life. You're objective is to vent the Xeno queen out of the bulkhead before you reach the atmosphere and you all suffocate.There's no timer and the objective consists of avoiding the queen so you can flip 5 different switches,then lining her up in front of a chute and flipping another switch.Then there was the ending cutscene that was the most obvious and cheesy cliffhanger I have ever seen and left you  just sitting there like . . . really? The graphics are absolutely trash as well. They look like they just pulled the graphics straight out of 2008 itself. Multiple rendering issues where sometimes the game will just make you play with nothing rendered in,texture quality that makes the game look like its a bad oil painting,and character models that make Minecraft look good.The graphics are just such a letdown from a game so long in the making. The gunplay was actually pretty good and that was the main point I really enjoyed about the campaign. I would get lost in the adrenaline while fighting the bugs,not so much the humans,but I really liked the sections where you had to defend a certain point for a set amount of time. These segments would have you loading up and preparing before being overwhelmed by the xenos pouring over the battered ramparts.These were crazy fun and I loved the combat in this game overall. There's about 11 different weapons in the game,ranging from your standard pulse rifle all the way to a flamethrower or even a smart gun. Each weapon,save the flamethrower and smart gun,can be fully customized with a variety of different attachments like a magazine for your shotgun or a suppressor for your pulse rifle and there's even skins for each weapon. During the campaign you may find weapons with a star above them;these are legendary weapons and they're either weapons related to a character in the Aliens story or just an upgraded version of the normal weapon.There's a total of 6 legendary weapons and they cannot be upgraded at all but once you pick one up you can use it throughout all of your different playthroughs. All-in-all the weapon system is actually pretty decent;nothing new but in this sea of complete garbage it's nice to see even the smallest of diamonds.The Wrong Kind of Bugs


Something's Missing 
A Screenshot of Aliens: Colonial Marines
By: Friedmudkips ツ #FreeMilo




ACM has more bugs than I would believe possible in a single game. Sometimes the enemies will literally teleport from across the map or in the worst cases,appear from nowhere and strike you. I have had a section where I died and then respawned instantly without a loading screen in between. This made me unable to kill anyone and the enemies didn't detect me,they just stood there and I had to reload a checkpoint. Honestly I expect some bugs when a game is fresh out, but for a game supposedly in development for 7 years I have no sympathy for devs who literally filled their game with more game bugs than xenomorphs.TL;DRAliens:Colonial Marines is a poor game in almost every regard.Poor story,writing,graphics,and just about everything else under the sun.The only thing that made this even tolerable were the rare moments when it all comes together for a slight glimpse into what this game could have been.If you enjoyed this writing and want to read more of such reviews,check out my steam curator page at Mudkips Gaming

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 2, 2013
												I know what you are thinking: "Is he mad? Has the syphilis finally driven him over the edge?" Well, yes and no (I hope), but you should still consider this game despite all the negativity sourrunding it. Call this a "recommendation of spite". ACM isn't a game I would normally recommend. It isn't even a particulary good game by 2013 standards. (It would have been an excellent shooter by 2003 standards). But it is not the desaster people claim it to be. Not anymore, anyway. The game you will get now is not the game that got released back in march. They patched a lot of the biggest issues out of the game. Now, what makes the game special? Well, if you are part of the demographics that sports a y-chromosome you love the movie Aliens. You cannot "not love" this movie, it only means you haven't seen it often enough. Yet. And that game is just one long love letter/nerdgasm to the Alien franchise. The continued references to the movies are one of the biggest draws of this game. (mostly to Aliens, but also Alien, Alien³ and Prometheus. Which, btw are all the Alien movies ever made. No other movies were made. None. Full stop.) And they really did their homework. Sometimes even referencing stuff that was only in the script but never filmed. They even throw some nods towards the (most excellent) '90s Alien comic books (or graphic novels, as the fancy pants like to call them nowadays). This, combined with the unmatched sound effects and music of the franchise, makes this game a dream come true for the twelve year old in me that fell in love with the movie. Unfortunately, that is also just about it, when it comes to the good parts of this game. Combat is decent, but not spectacular. Level "art design" is perfect, right out of the movies, Level "gameplay design" is literally ten years behind. The story is not bad per se, but they overdo the nerdgasm part a pit in the end, shattering the suspension of disbeliev like the chest of XO Kane during dinner. The game is also very short, even if you are going collectables hunting. All said and done, I was very happy to check out the game despite the bad reputation, but I am also glad I only paid 10$ for it. TL:DR. An average shooter which plays (and sometimes looks) like it was made ten years ago. A must play for fans of the Alien franchise, but probably not worth the time and money for anybody else.

Overall not the greatest game in the world, but plenty of fun to be had.
