number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 28, 2014
												I am having a hard time about whether to recommend A:CM or not.If you consider what the game could have been, and what it was shown to be before its publishing, then no, you absolutely must not buy or play this game. Go watch Aliens instead... you will have a pleasant 2 hours or so. If you choose the game, you will probably waste more time on a completely average game with some rare high points and mostly lows. The story is very generic, has too few aliens and too much CoD-type shoot-outs. The graphics is so-so, though in 2013, I would expect character models to be a billion times better (even with the patches). The gameplay quickly turns into Call of Duty - Some planet with Monsters edition, minus the new ideas that you sometimes got in CoD. Overall, whatever could be messed up in the creative department, Gearbox managed to mess up. Thanks Randy Pitchford for repeatedly saying, how much you care.If you like shooters, and do not insist on having multiplayer (as nobody plays anymore, even though it was kinda decent in parts), this game may still be for you. It does not do shooting badly... only it does not do much else. If you like Aliens fan fiction, so much so that you do not mind not-so-good writing (a somewhat uninteresting story in the Aliens universe, if I wanna be generous to this game), this game might have some nice parts for you. Also, the expansion adds quite a bit. If you like sci-fis, and are bored out of your skull, and do not mind wasting some money to try this game, it is probably a better alternative than staring at your wall (depending on what is on your wall, of course).I am a huge fanboy of Aliens and was thoroughly disappointed by this game, and quite honestly, started to really hate Gearbox for making it like this. (Check the internetz for the stories around development, if you like.) The game may not be as bad as it looks for people who liked Aliens - you might get a few good hours of play out of it if you did not.In addition, the BugHunt multiplayer mode was quite decent, and for some time, it is fun to play the story in co-op as well. Unfortunately, these days nobody plays multiplayer so only consider this if you have friends who also have the game.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 16, 2014
												Enjoyed this game. I bought this game for cheap when it was on offer as I'd heard it had a lot of bad reviews and I wasn't prepared to spend a fortune on it but hey, £3 for a game that's single player, versus and 4 player co-op seemed like a good deal to me and it was. I enjoyed playing it with my mates co-op and within a few days of buying it we completed it but not because it was rubbish, because we played it with an open mind, made our own decisions about it and it was, for us, a good game. It has loads of aliens, of different types to blast into tiny pieces, some cool weapons and of course, the motion tracker from the films (which is very useful) and the graphics are pretty nice too.The co-op mode is just the single player story mode but with the addition of 3 friends playing along with you and the game was good fun, in parts a little challenging and can even make you jump when the aliens catch you off guard and appear from out of thin air, hiding in walls right in front of your face!I can only pick fault with one aspect of it from what I've played and that is simply the teleport system. When playing co-op if you wandered too far ahead from your team mates the game teleports them to you. Well, in theory thats what it's supposed to do but we discovered it would teleport you at random times! Sometimes if you were only a few feet from your team mates and there was no reason to, quite often it would do this whilst in a fire fight which was most annoying, yet at other points you could get almost half a level in front and it wouldn't teleport anyone anywhere. That was and so far is my only my pet hate about this game and once I've played it through some more I will update this review. This is a good game to play with friends from what I have played aside from the teleport system and I would recommend it to others.

content:
Posted: July 5, 2016
												When this game grows up it wants to be Alien Isolation, or possibly Tetris.  It's a pretty confused game.To be honest the game play is distinctly average.  Not in an acceptable way which means you should take a risk buying it, but in a "oh you bought it already,  don't cry....I'm sure you'll enjoy parts of it" kind of way.  If they made the uninstaller into a mini game I'd have been left with more of a fuzzy feeling about it.  This game is a classic example of a game which uses existing IP to sell a broken dream - it uses the Aliens name but by god it sullies it.I've played a lot of games over the years but this is the only one so far to give me motion sickness.  Yay, Colonial Marines...not so much throw your hands up in the air as throw your lunch up.Update:  I hear the game can be significantly improved with mods, although I haven't tried them because of the motion sickness and I also now have Alien Isolation which is as close to being in the film Aliens as is possible in a game.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 25
												TL:DR: Avoid! Avoid! AVOID! A buggy hell, crashes a lot, savegames get corrupted, profile reset, and no usable savegame system anyway. Good gameplay and nice GFX don't save this game.If any if the Steam guys reads this: REMOVE IT FROM THE SHOP PLEASE! Maybe they will fix the bugs then.I got the collectors edition, hoping it would be more stable than my "free test version" a few years ago, which crashed a lot. But this game is a buggy nightmare. The graphics are fine, the actual gameplay when playing in “Ultimate Badass” is good too. But in about one of four times I exit the game the progress is lost. Upon next start it shows "added X DLC" asks for setting the brightness, and I have to set up my controller config again. Just like when you fresh installed the game.It crashes constantly and those crashes can be very well reproduced. Doing the usual trick to backup "userdata\STEAMID\49540" to make extra saves does not work if you have any DLC, you will have to backup "steamapps\common\Aliens Colonial Marines\installscript.vdf" as well, or the game will reset your progress when trying to restore. This actually violates the Steam design. And even if you have several save-states that way you have to chance. If the would have made a decent savegame system it would have avoided a lot of frustration, but other things were more important.You also get the start-loop very often. You start the game, exit it, and Steam restarts it again. Especially annoying if the game crashes upon start. You must use countless workarounds to get a still dysfunctional game. And gearbox doesn't care S* to fix any of those bugs.

content:
Posted: January 12, 2015
												There is alot of fuss about this game, ive completed it in 8 hours time, and have yet to try out the "Stasis" DLC. But there is some nice things about this game and some bad ones. (yes ive read alot of the other reviews)Plus side ++++Locations, and movie "sets", seen in the films, which i think is quite awesome.+"Legendary" Weapons ( like Hicks' Shotgun) how awesome is that, quite if u ask me.. ;)+Squad members, yea well they do shoot at the xenomorphs, but have your gun ready just in case, aliens do tend to run straight for you, but least u get the kill right ;), (i did manage to save some bullets, one of the npc squad members took down a xenomorph all by himself, yes it can happen, smart guns ftw)+Weapons customization, that is quite nice, and the ability to change your weapon loadout on the run is awesome..+The story, is quite awesome aswell..+Certainly aint missing action..+Nice graphicsMinus side ----Wouldnt mind a longer campaign (i like "long" games)-BIG minus is, no Xenomorph campaign, that would have been awesome.-Bugs, very very few i encountered, among one was some of the sparks that wasnt "shown" correctly.-Well squad members not looking mean enough to get Xenomorphs attention, would help u getting a few breathers aswell.All in all i would give it 8.5/10And so i will recommend this if your an Alien fan :)

content:
Posted: June 7, 2014
												Honestly this game is better than I expected.  I was apprehesive to try this given the "bait and switch" gearbox pulled and the gripes with the AI and graphics, but actually I was pleasently suprised when I actually played it.  The aliens move more or less realistically and combat is actually pretty challenging.  My main complaint is the Ally AI as they have a tendency to move ahead too quickly and leave you hangning to take on hoards of Xenos on your own.  While this is very fitting to the nature of the Aliens film, it's frustrating in a game context because the AI is invincible and can barrell through a hoarde of xenos to rip a door and leave you a mile back trying to catch up.  Overall, I would reccomend this game, but by no means at full price.

												I'm going to do my best not to write a very long review, but i would like to say on a positive note that at the very least they saved my favorite character from the Aliens franchise from being killed in Alien 3, byadding this into cannon and explaining how someone else actually died in his place. Although honestly the restof this game was weak tea, I didn't buy the game to be an ultimate badass and fight..people :/ i bought this gameto play the role of an ultimate badass and take on hordes upon hordes of acid bleeding terryfying monsters fromthe abyss. I felt heartbreakingly disappointed with this game. In its own rite it has some pretty neat things..but it was not enough to save it. My biggest worry is that this will have stolen potential for the aliens franchise, and detercreators who actually have a desire to see Aliens Colonial Marines become what it was always meant to be from the very beginning, and i'm talking about it's first inception back in (i'm taking my best guess at remembering) 2004 when it wasplanned for the playstation 2.  In conclusion, i feel as though its worth knowing what happens here in ACM, but it's not worth paying for.  So with a heavy heart i am going to say i Do Not recommend buying this game. Borrow it from a friendor do some "force recon" if you know what i mean, but don't waste your money.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 29, 2016
												Now I understand why Alien Isolation's sales were slow or poor.A lot of people were turned off of Sega's line of Alien games because of this game.  For those people who have refrained from buying Alien Isolation:  RETHINK IT...   AI is a superior game to a lot of games out there and it is more Survival Horror (like Outlast only better) than anything.Alien Colonial Marines is "imitation CoD" mixed with some of the older Playstation Alien games from the 1990's. Graphics wise you can see there is a mix of good and bad.   Some computer screens you come across look great.. others are so blocky and out of focus it makes you wonder if it were merely copied and pasted in a rush.The Multi-player, at least the co-op seems fun --at first.   Then you realize that even the Bughunt DLC requires 4 players... which is not good.   Should have been 2-4 per team.The A.I. for your allies in single player mode is awful.  You save marines...  and then some of them stand there like idiots instead of doing what they need to do like...  getting back to basecamp.The main story is not great and could have been done better...  there should have been more "helping marines live" so they can help you defend in certain spots later on (i.e the more you save the bigger the group you'll have later etc).Locking doors so you cannot run back and get the Auto-turret for one scene was not a good idea either.There were some interesting spots, like wandering around in the sewers against the elderly aliens (lol).... but even that entire scenerio could have played out better or scarier.I will say that I think some of the DLC's helped this game (I'm told Bughunt is good when you got enough friends to actually get it going)...   and the "Statis Interrupted" DLC was interesting.  Similar to Alien Isolation (perhaps like a rough draft of it)... where you are a chick and go around without weapons and find your way to point B...  All in all... this game could have...  should have been better.  Multi-player was not appealing at all.  Period.  Sega NEEDS TO LEARN how to set up Lobby systems.The lobby system in Mount & Blade: Warband, for example,  is EASY and not limited in what you can set up.  This game's multiplayer was a huge turn-off.I got one friend on here who has the game and we are trying to do the Co-op game and so far it's going okay ... but we don't have enough to do other multiplayer maps.  sigh.One final word to those who can still do patches:It is never too late to do a game over-haul patch.   You can fix some issues for the game and perhaps clean up some of the bugs.  Gearbox, this dud is on your reputation, not the company you tried to outsource to.You guys are going to have to live with all the negative reviews unless you can heed this suggestion and fix what you know needs to be fixed.Alien Isolation's sales... suffer because you guys dropped the ball.Fix your bugs please.

content:
Posted: January 16, 2014
												Not as bad as everyone says. Sure, this game did have a lot of expectation to live up to, but in the end, it does pay tribute to the Alien franchise. You get to explore LV-426 and the U.S.S. Sulaco, you get to wield the U.S.C.M. arsenal, and not to mention, you get to mow down a bunch of aliens. Not to mention the multiplayer (If there are any people on the servers though) is FREAKING INSANE AND AWESOME. The DLC for this game great; there's a movie map pack containing multiplayer maps from the Alien movies themselves, such as the Nostromo or Fury 161. Then there's Bug Hunt, an awesome gamemode similar to that of Nazi Zombies from CoD. There's also a seperate campaign you can download that really pays tribute to Aliens.  Sure, the alien A.I. may not be as good as it should be, but it's improved a lot since the initial release of the game. My only complaint though is the levels you have to fight the Weyland-Yutani mercs. It's annoying, but it isn't bad enough to ruin the overall game experience. Overall, I give this game a 7/10.

												I had very high expectations when I played ACM for the first time. Those expectations were sadly not met. Yet I took my time for a playthrough.Here are my Observations:The Game features awesome locations, good voice acting, quality storyline and some very good graphic effects. You get to visit several locations known from The Prometheus/Alien-Lore, and you encounter several well known movie-characters. Weapons and Upgrades are a neat addition to the armament known from the movies. You get the chance to collect several "rare" weapons from the characters involved in the Aliens-Movie. Sound FX are awesome as well!The entire single player campaign can be played in Co-Op. What I did like:> Gameplay in most situations was fast paced, adrenaline pumping straight forward.> The Aliens looked very good; also the new (spoiler) Alien lifeforms fit perfectly into the lore.> The Maps/levels were as good as it gets for the limited terrain (A Colony on a Planet, and SpaceShips)> about 9hrs to complete the Campaign is enuf, yet not too much.> Awesome GFX & SFX> Coop Campaign.What I did not like:> Sometimes, the AI was pretty dumb. Counts for friendlys standing in your way as well. > Repetitive gameplay> The beginning full of scripted sequences; something I personally do not like.> Bossfights were borderline stupidOverall I will recommend this game. Its been great fun!

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 22, 2014
												Note before review: I have only played the fully patched version and only on utlimate badass difficulty.Review:This is a good game, dont let the exaggerated reviews influence you, those were before the patches and mostly on consoles, its a fun game that recreates a lot of the Cameron`s film ambient, gamers looking for an experience similar to Alien should look for the upcoming Isolation title.The props are well modeled, locations too, the aliens are correct size for the second movie.I really think some people should watch the movie again, memory plays tricks.Its of course not without flaws, theres some a.i. mistakes, not unlike many other titles, including AAA ones. On multiplayer there are a few, for example there are blackouts and teleporting even when you are close to your teammates, i am assuming due to checkpoints, so its not that often in a campaign episode but its there.Graphics are ok, to me (and im biased because i like the franchise a lot) they are not on par with the effects from the latest AAA  titles, but good enough and they do give the feeling of the movie (except for the missed opportunity with dyniamic lightning), its important to note that the framerate is smooth (on an i5 3500k and GTX 670)  The regular pulse rifle is not exactly like the one in the movie, though the differences make it look a little more functional, if you look at the movie again, they will look a little bland, not like you remembered,  but you will soon unlock hudsons pulse rifle, and that one is just like the movie ones.Its an enjoyable game specially for fans of the franchise, and you should ONLY play it on ultimate badass difficulty, without a hud and no screen sights, it makes the moments in the game a little tighter.The AI isnt exceptional but the lurker aliens are enjoyable.I think a lot of reviewers should update their reviews for the PC version, the Aliens franchise (i mean the 2nd movie) is great for a thrilling FPS, they should keep doing and improving them.And please do something about the story in future games, thats a point were i coincide with the reviews, its extremely bland and shouldnt be canon, it barely serves to frame the game's episodes, a good story would have helped a lot.I would have loved to play inside the Sulaco when it came down. with all the aliens butchering everyone and going against the clock to evac it.another note:Gearbox should fix everything they told they would fix, at least to make up for the misguiding videos.one last thing:PLAY ITDont be like everyone else repeating a lousy review and it has a very low price from time to time (got it for $5 iirc), a lot of people are just repeating bad comments like a bad meme, and its certainly not true, its a good, enjoyable game that needed patching and Gearbox did misguide gamers with their videos, but its still an enjoyable game.

content:
Posted: January 16, 2014
												Not as bad as everyone says. Sure, this game did have a lot of expectation to live up to, but in the end, it does pay tribute to the Alien franchise. You get to explore LV-426 and the U.S.S. Sulaco, you get to wield the U.S.C.M. arsenal, and not to mention, you get to mow down a bunch of aliens. Not to mention the multiplayer (If there are any people on the servers though) is FREAKING INSANE AND AWESOME. The DLC for this game great; there's a movie map pack containing multiplayer maps from the Alien movies themselves, such as the Nostromo or Fury 161. Then there's Bug Hunt, an awesome gamemode similar to that of Nazi Zombies from CoD. There's also a seperate campaign you can download that really pays tribute to Aliens.  Sure, the alien A.I. may not be as good as it should be, but it's improved a lot since the initial release of the game. My only complaint though is the levels you have to fight the Weyland-Yutani mercs. It's annoying, but it isn't bad enough to ruin the overall game experience. Overall, I give this game a 7/10.

content:
Posted: June 18, 2014
												Aliens Colonial Marines. Much like Duke Nukem Forever, its impossible for hardcore gamers to not instantly recognize the name.  Much like DNF, Colonial Marines has been in development for a very long time, since 2001 to be exact. Time would witness the game's stunted, postponed, and delayed development over the course of many years. Fans of both Aliens and Shooters would hold out an incredible amount of hope and patience for the release of a game that was sure to please everyone considering its long development cycle.That was a mistake we are all guilty for.After many screenshots, trailers, magazine articles, and interviews the game finally landed into our hands, was it worth the wait? Was it anything we expected it to be? Not exactly. From the beginning it was already evident that Colonial Marines suffered through a painful development process, with plenty of outsourcing, rewriting, and clashes between multiple developers working on it. The final result is a game that misses nearly every mark it should have struck perfectly, and leaves fans of the franchise and avid gamers with a feeling of utter disappointment. Every single thing about the game failed to please. This game is no doubt bound for the $2 bargain bin steam sale, and even then, is not worth the price of admission.THE GOOD:> Multiplayer is suprisingly decent (despite nobody playing it)> Enviroments are somewhat interestingTHE BAD- Horrific writing - Terrible Voice Acting- Lifeless and unlikable characters- Atrocious AI that charges you blindly- Shockingly bad ending- Dated Graphics- IS SUPPOSED TO BE OFFICIAL CANON- Boring Cutscenes/Setpieces- Aliens arent scary or threatening in the slightest- Everything Else THE UGLYThis is what we were promised. The game dosent look/sound/play anything like this. AT ALL.


YouTube™ Video: Aliens: Colonial Marines - Gameplay Demo Walkthrough 

			Views: 655,309		

			__Gameplay Part Only__. Developer: Gearbox Software. Publisher: Sega. Commentary by Randy Pitchford, President of Gearbox Software http://forums.gearboxsoftware.com/		

 BOTTOM LINE:Even if you are a hardcore fan of both the franchise and shooters, this game will disappoint in every way. You might be thinking to yourself "Its gotta be good for a few laughs, right?" No. You'd be better off spending that money on a pack of gum. But if you decide to go ahead and get it anyway, be prepared to recite the famous lines of the film its based on:


YouTube™ Video: Game Over Man, GAME OVER! 

			Views: 2,208,384		

			One of my favorite quotes of all time by Bill Paxton, from the movie "Aliens" ©1986 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment. All Rights Reserved.		

1/10 Abysmal.

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 17, 2014
												I like the Alien movies... well at least two of them, I also like first-person shooters, and I also like the idea of being stuck in space with some unknown aliens trying to kill you... and despite how much I like those things, this game manages to fail on just about every level so hard that it is almost impressive.In Colonial Marines you play as a marine (Obviously) named Winter, as a team is sent to investigate the Sulaco that is hovering somewhere above the planet LV-426, this game is set after the events of Aliens but before Alien 3, and the marines are looking for Ripley, Hicks, and the other missing marines, along the way they find Aliens (Shocking I know) and Weyland-Yutani mercenaries aboard the ship. As for the plot it actually has promise, given that this game was worked on by writers from Battlestar Galactica and is considered canonical in the Alien series would give one hope, sadly however as you play the game the way the story unfolds and the events that take place are subpar at best, without spoiling anything here I will say that by the end you will be shaking your head asking what exactly went wrong, from the disjointed emotions conveyed with below average voice acting even from the bigger names in the Alien franchise history that come back, to the sloppy and plot hole filled writing that in many ways make it seem more like Alien fan fiction then anything else.But enough about the story lets talk about the gameplay! ...It blows, the shooting feels clunky, none of the guns seem at all accurate and while I know that might be due to the guns in Aliens lore being kind of bad in the first place, when I attach a red dot sight to a gun and aim down it, I expect my bullet to go where the dot is, not below it, or to have the sight swimming back and forward enough that you actually are more accurate when you fire from the hip, and in the end none of that really matters because the enemy AI feels like it took the short bus to work, the Xenomorphs act more like giant bugs and rush you, though you can counter this by backpedaling as they are not really faster then you are, and will not try tactics like attacking from your sides except for the rare times when they throw hunters at you and even then they are easily bested.You will see Aliens running into the walls, failing about, blowing up, and otherwise acting more comedical then scary or threatening, but that is only part of the game, because luckily you get to fight human mercenaries as well, in an Aliens game... lets let that soak in for a moment.Overall this game just... bad, the multiplayer is not counted in all this due to no one in their right mind playing it, the game is littered with bad DLC, and the core gameplay and plot fails as both a regular game and a piece of fan service and I recommend staying as far away from this one as you can.Game Over, Man.

content:
Posted: February 27
												A game so bad it could bring a lawsuit against the publisher and developers? Yes.However I wasnt around for the what is most common into days gaming world... a bunch of bugs and poorly rushed out games that offer and say they will shock and awe and then do a 180 and enrage and offend on release day.Aliens colonial marines had a pretty bad debut, but in the years past its now an OKAY game. There is a mod for the game called the ACM Overhaul its up to version 4.5 with a 5.0 promised sometimes soon, the mod makes the aliens harder, very hard and much harder to kill, it can upgrade this OKAY game experience to a GOOD one, by tweaking the graphics, altering the dumbfounded AI and messing around with the weapons recoil, accuracy etc.I mostly played the game without a mod and found it too be okay for an FPS game, what it really does well is tell the story of Cprl Hicks and some of the after events of the 2nd alien movie - Aliens. If you wanted to relive a movie - this is as close as you get, the people involved in this games creation did do the story justice and create the atmosphere of the Aliens movie.The FPS action was nothing special, but with the aliens sneaky rogue attacks and ability to flank and otherwise spring good surprise attacks it keeps you on edge. I found the weapons were somewhat clunky non modded, especially the two non legendary shotguns, but mostly the weapons had put down power and were fairly accurate. However using the primary fire only on these guns would be boring, some weapons offer up to 3 different alternate fire options and the options do differ enough from each other to consider for uses in strategic moments.The challenge system of this game can be staggeringly harsh, you get low kill number quest for easy things and high kill numbers for hardEST things. Like having to get 25 claymore kills - you only get 1, and finding ammo for them is rare. So you either have to keep restarting an objective over, or if your lucky to ever even play multiplayer - get 25 kills there. The challenges are not well thought out in order, so you could need to be level 20 for  the 15th challenge, or in MP you could need to grind out 4 levels on your xeno just to get the next challenge to unlock because the skill required for it is at 14, and you were at 10. I have 100% completion on this title: i had a friend who also has the game so we were able to complete the MP challenges. But if your going it solo, the Multiplayer is dead (as of 2/27/17) I have yet to actually find a game online with anyone for the entire duration I have played this game. (57 hours) Let it be known that the Kill 2 in one challenges can be completed in MP with just 2 people, the sentry turrets when deployed count as a person, so in the few kill 2 by 1 attack challenge weakening the turret and standing a marine next to it, and they both perish is considered two kills. There are many good challenge and collectible guides for ACM that will explain where it is best to grind out challenges.The final word on ACM from my experience is that if your an Aliens fan, and wanna go relive the Aliens movie, this game is really well setup to do so, if your an FPS player who likes to slay monsters and aliens there is some okay carnage to be sought here. This game was suppose to be a A++ title at release - even now its more like a B+ title. As some of the people who reviewed this game at its release, after its huge patch that fixed alot of things, and after the ACM Overhaul mod, have said - "while the patch and the overhaul mod have helped ACM tremendously, you can only polish a turd so much."Getting 90% achievements on this game leaving out the 5 or so MP achievements is about 4 playthroughs. If your not 60 by then, just do the final mission (Home) on the Ultimate Bad As_ difficulty - its about 2850xp for 5 min of play.Stay Frosty Marine

content:
Posted: August 27, 2014
												Aliens Colonial Marines is a masterful experience, and here is why:Perfection. That is the only word for it. Aliens colonial marines is a masterpiece in every sense of the word, from the art style, to the graphic fidelity.Indescribable, that's how I would but the audio. Take the gauss rifle, or the voice acting, for example, all bring eargasm's galore.Let's talk about the game play for one salty ♥♥♥♥ing second, it's amazing 10/10. The gun play is unrivalled, no other game could ever compare to this majestic ♥♥♥♥ing artwork.Even though its god bad reviews, this is only because everyone is so ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ jealous. The devils at Valve have hired many individuals to negatively degrade this smegma-filled joy ride.Oh don't even get me ♥♥♥♥ing started on the level design. Take for example, the unforgettable spash-ship levels, that provide the authentic aliens experience every fan of the franchise longs for.Forget about Halo, forget about gears of war, COD, TF2, Battlefield, all of 'em. They all pale in comparison to the epic♥♥♥♥♥♥train that is Aliens colonial marines. No-body could truly comprehend how amazing this game was, so they tossed aside it brilliant story and game play in favour of these inferior games.Solid plot line, if not better. I think anyone can feel satisfactory for paying full price for this ludicrous display, and I doubt anyone can keep a straight face when trying to talk about the issues with the game.However, the game does have dlc, which further raises the price if you want the full experience, but this isn't the developers fault, this is just to capitalise on this majestic ♥♥♥♥ing experience.It's a true marvel, a wonder of the 21st century. I have never experienced such masterful perfection, never before have I adored such a game.That's all I got to say about this hidden gem of a game, but if you want my true opinion on the game, just read the first letter of each "paragraph".

content:
Posted: September 25, 2014
												When I was 10 years old, I saw on TV news about this "ALIENS" movie and thought it would be something like Star Wars that I loved so much. My father, not sure why decided to take me to the movie theater without telling me absolutely nothing about the story. In Brazil, Aliens movie was rated PG13. Once the movie started and me and my sister were absolutely terrified with the fist chest burst in Ripley's nightmare, we were not prepared to later on, when all Colonial Marines were trapped with no ammo, except for Hick's shotgun, flamethrowers and two smartguns, I remember being totally scared and saw my father's amuzed grin when my sister, almost crying in fear, had asked my father to leave the movie theater.This may sound absurd right now because, Aliens are not scary anymore. And one of the reasons to make such good movies like  Alien (1978)  and Aliens (1986) feel like a bad joke is because of games like ALIENS: Colonial Marines.I was really excited when I heard about a A:CM game which would have a very minimal HUD and have very realistic scenes, just like the movies or even more. Heard that they had contracted the same artist that designed some of the movie sets. It was like a dream. I would finally experiment what was to be in a Colonial Marine shoes, struggling for my own survival.Low ammo, nowhere to run. Totally outnumbered.Movie spoiler alert, do not read if you did not watch the movie.But wait ... If I remember well, the atmosphere reactor, which is a HUGE nuclear powered structure, BLEW UP in the end of ALIENS, and the blast was so huge that the shockwave caught up the dropship they used to escape.So ... the history is already broken. But since I wanted to live the same experience in the movie, it was not too bad(Still it made no sense why would there be any xenomorphs alive, the Queen was expelled in the airlock)There are so many plot holes in this game. They even tried to come up with a explanation on how the Sulaco either never left LV-426 or came back from Fury 161(The planet of Alien3 movie).Story is bad, I can mention one guy you find cocooned in Sulaco, that really does have a sense of duty. He wishes to complete his mission to find and retrieve Sulaco's data computer (to find out what happened), he is not sure what is going on with him, but he does knows that something wrong is bound to happen. This guy is a hero, isn't he? He could have been, but instead, when you're hauling♥♥♥♥♥back to the ship, the chestburster inside him starts to rip his way out, and this wannabe hero does the most illogic thing. He pulls out a grenade inside the umbilical that serves as a connection between the two ships and blew it killing some other marines in the process.IT DOES NOT MAKE ANY SENSE!!! Things start to go downhill very fast till the end, which is not a end, but may become a "proper" end in the DLC, which I'll be sure to never ever play.This game is absolutely different from what Gearbox showed us in "work in progress" in E3 and every other advertisement about A:CM. Usually when regarding WIP, we expect things to get better instead of becoming worse like it seem to have happened.Maybe if I didn't expect anything from this game, I would consider it worth of 10usd or less. But since it is a major let down, and it seems that gearbox used the budget they had for A:CM to other purposes, I WOULD NOT SPEND EVEN A PENNY ON THIS.Seriously. I sworn to never ever buy anything from Gearbox again. They will not have my money, since they don't show a single gesture of respect towards gaming community.Some folks might say "wait, you're talking about the make of BORDERLANDS!!!", and yep that's them. And this is no place to talk about it, but Google for "Code Hunters" and you will find that Gearbox have no limits in wrong doing. They do whatever the f*ck they want to earn money, even if it is illegal.Also, check out the current news for legal dispute that involves Sega and Gearbox regarding A:CMhttp://www.polygon.com/2014/9/3/6102035/sega-gearbox-lawsuit-aliens-colonial-marinesThis is shameful. Sega won't take the blame alone, as they point that Gearbox is the one who totally disgraced what was supposed to be the best game experience of Alien Franchise. Let's hope Alien Isolation fills this gap.Thanks for reading!

This is the worst decision anyone has ever made in the entirety of human history. I wish I was being dramatic.

I think anyone can feel satisfactory for paying full price for this ludicrous display, and I doubt anyone can keep a straight face when trying to talk about the issues with the game.However, the game does have dlc, which further raises the price if you want the full experience, but this isn't the developers fault, this is just to capitalise on this majestic ♥♥♥♥ing experience.It's a true marvel, a wonder of the 21st century. I have never experienced such masterful perfection, never before have I adored such a game.That's all I got to say about this hidden gem of a game, but if you want my true opinion on the game, just read the first letter of each "paragraph".

content:
Posted: August 3, 2016
												A game sullied by its very poor quality upon release, A:CM has received a somewhat infamous reputation for being...well...rather rubbish.  That said, time has moved on and so the price has come down and patches have been released along the way.  And you know what? Its actually not that bad for a "tenner".At first, the companion-ai is what gets you down; My bandana-bearded chum, "O'Neill", has this habit of getting stuck...usually found running blindly into a wall, unable to catch up with you unless "beaming to your location" if you are separated by a certain distance.  He also seems to disappear ahead of you...like he is the Flash? "Right, matey shall we go  now  - WHERES HE GONE NOW?!" - which reminds one of the situation at the supermarket when an old dear has "lost her husband" for the uptenth time. Also, close combat is confusing as you either need to press "E" or "V" which becomes frustrating durning a criticial encounter with a bug - can we not just have one or the other, please?  Last and probably most dissapointing is that weapon selection doesnt seem to go beyond the third numerical key...but I think that might just be me overlooking something...The thing that won me over, was the bit where you are stripped of your weapons and you end up evading the bugs with a bit of stealth and cunning, which is admittedly basic in comparison to Alien Isolation's superior artificial intelligence, but ultimately A:CM actually delivered a genuinely scary-but-fun experience, but without punishing the player for merely laying low, for which 'Isolation was guilty as hell.  It was in this part of the game where the player gets a taste of what it was like for poor Newt, and somehow, the faults of the game become niggles as you finally accept A:CM for what it is: a blatant excuse to return to Hadley's Hope, slap a large bug around his slobby-chops with an awesome Power-Loader and give those smug Company-bums a damn good thrashing.Still rough around the edges, but with the patches and at a budget price there is some fun to be had with Colonial Marines.  Just dont pay more than £10 for it!

number of helpful: 4 of 7 people (57%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 14, 2015
												Now, I'm going to start by stating my credentials so that people know I'm not blowing crap out my ears.I have 45 hours on this game. I have gone through the hassle, yes, hassle, not challenge, of unlocking the "State of the Badass Art" Achievement on this game for defeating it on the hardest difficulty level. I've even managed to play some multiplayer before it became an abandoned wasteland. I was one of the fools who preordered it and I continued playing it after the update to the graphics that finally came.That taken care of it's time for the actual review.Don't waste your money on this steaming pile of horse manure. Even if it's on sale.What we were promised as a community was bloody brilliant. It was graphical, intense, and it looked beautiful. Constant motion, brilliant graphical design, and made by companies that were well-known for good games. What we got I would've excused if it wasn't so falsely advertised and if it was made by an indie developer. Not after all the beautiful "In-game" footage and the screenshots and hype-building.When I first got the game I was carried by the hype and I even defended the game based off of my belief that most people disliked it purely because the motion-tracker was something you had to pick up and not something sitting in the HUD like in AVP2010.I own up to that and apologize to everyone for that. Which is more than I can say for the people responsible for the lie that is A:CM. If I could I'd refund this game and use the money on a different one but I can't.The AI is buggy and slow and unresponsive and that's just the Marines.Aliens sit out in the open practically begging to be shot.There's enough ammo and such laying about that it makes challenge a thing of the past and the fact that your sidearm has infinite ammo redundant. Not to mention you can ALWAYS switch weapons with anything you've unlocked so if you do manage to spray-and-pray your way through your Pulse Rifle then you can just open a menu and trade it for the SMG.Difficulty level is a joke. The AI doesn't get harder you just get a bit weaker and in the case of the "Ultimate Badass" difficulty it just means you don't have a HUD. Boss fights are hysterical and only ever difficult because of spam not actual challenge.The graphics level, compared to what we were promised, is something I'd expect from an Indie Dev, but they don't falsely advertise. The graphics are buggy and low-detail. It's almost funny in a sad way how easy it is to tell the difference between an alien and alien hive wall goop, where they should be blending perfectly. And this is all the static graphics not the motion graphics. Explosions are crap and nothing I can believe in. The characters at least don't clip into their parts like they did before the update. The ragdoll physics are.... sickening.Oh, lest I forget, you spend more time in Call of Duty style shootouts with Wey-Yu personnel than you do actually having a horror experience fighting or running from Aliens. Well done Game Devs you made another run-and-gun Shooter.I'm going to stop now and finish. Don't waste your money. Buy a good game like Isolation seems to be. Or AVP2010.

number of helpful: 5 of 9 people (56%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 6, 2013
												You know something strange is going on when serious reviewers on mainstream media sites sound like they're channeling Yahtzee when reviewing a game.  It's a strange case of expectation vs reality.  When a game fails to meet expectations, it gets ripped to shreds for the tiniest flaws that people would find amusing in other games and ends up with a much worse rating than a game that was expected to be bad and is an entirely worse game.By now everyone's heard the rumors about the turbulent development of this game.  It's obviously a tale of project management gone seriously wrong with the game being put on hold for years and later passed onto another studio.  The most amazing thing I've heard however is that just 9 months before release, Gearbox got the game back from Timegate, threw most of it out, and started over.  That's pretty amazing if you ask me and I doubt any other studio could pull it off.To the game itself:  The campaign is a reasonable length, pretty standard these days.  Served with a heavy dose of fan service, some people may like it more than others.  The story's more of a stretch than Alien 3, wedging itself in there in the realm of cinematic impossibility.  Voice acting's a mixed bag but the writing is terrible and there's plenty of cringe-worthy lines.  The campaign is fully coopable as well, but the coop feels a bit tacked on with a couple of noname marines tagging along with the main character, and the game teleporting people to the leader when someone walks 5 feet ahead of the group.That said, the gameplay is pretty good at least.  It's fun shooting xenos and even the Wayland-Yutani goons who come after you to cover up their horrifying experiments.  The xeno animations may be a bit wonky so they don't quite move or act like aliens should, but they'll still rip you to shreds if you aren't paying attention.  Your AI partners are pretty useless, mostly firing blanks and getting in the way (not that that's anything unusual) though some people have more trouble with this than others.Multiplayer on the other hand is a bit of a mess.  It's wildly unbalanced, with marines having a huge advantage at lower levels and being able to level up through single player and co-op.  The marines even get a fully automatic shotgun that can kill most xenos in one shot.  After the aliens level up and get certain upgrades, suddenly they can take 8 shots from the same gun without dying and dominate the marines.  The game uses peer-to-peer matchmaking so lag is always a problem and the third person control of the aliens is beyond awful.  Wallclimbing barely works and is pretty much useless except for climbing up onto high points to spit at the marines with the spitter.  Some of the modes are somewhat fun at least.I think the best way to sum up this game is to say it's disappointing.  After watching the E3 demo from a couple years ago and then playing the first level in the real game yourself, it's hard not to be mad about what the game could have been.  The graphics went from top of the line to couple-years-ago-average to work on consoles and took all the atmosphere along with it.  It makes me wonder if things might've been different if the game had come out next year targeted for the next generation of consoles.Bottom line: Disappointing but still better than Call of Duty.

number of helpful: 5 of 9 people (56%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: May 18, 2016
												Being a huge Alien fan I was suckered into preordering this game for the xbox 360 back in the day. Everything you have probably heard about this game's quality is true. The graphics are nowhere near as stunning as they were portrayed to be in the early tech demo and the promotional screenshots (although the huge post launch patch did improve them vastly). The Alien and human AI (both your partners and enemies) gargles galactic balls, as either group often gets hung up in door ways or on props. The shooting feels very underwhelming, as most weapons lack an appopriate oomph, and aside from the pulse rifle they all are very underpowered damage wise. There is absolutely no atmosphere or tension in this game, save for one borderline genius level around a quarter of the way in. It's sad to see that a game that just came out a few years ago was unable to conjure up the same exhilaration and tension that AvP2 was able to over a decade ago. If you shop online frequently and love Aliens/tolerate or like Predator, then I highly recommend Aliens Vs. Predator 2, the game not the terrible movie. That game has a brilliant intertwining campaign told from 3 different perspectives, as well as genuine terror and tension, combined with sharp gunplay and mechanics. Very little fluff either, which Colonial Marines packs in en masse. I would avoid this game unless steeply discounted, and even then you probably will be disappointed unless you download the recent overhaul mod a dedicated fan released. Better quality work in a free mod than this corporate produced turd.

Again I played many (not all) hours of this game on my wall through a projector, THE DETAIL is out of this world!!! Try it, I am so blessed with that!  I can't say it enough! There definitely have been many published comments about the quality of this game (even a lawsuit between Gearbox & Sega), but, I am so excited with the upcoming game I was satsified enough to let it wet my appetite for more. Even thinking of replaying my AVP through! Another game that reminded me of this genre or series (Aliens) was ALIEN RAGE, a lot like this game, a worthy quench for more of this sort of thing indeed! Ok, ok, this review is slanted on the single player mode (for which I personally endure FPS-mode-games), there is also a multiplayer mode with DLC and maps for that. If that's your thing you'LL find it in this game too! PEOPLE GET READY!!  :-)

content:
Posted: June 22, 2015
												The problem with a great deal of negative press surrounding a title such as this is I almost decided to pass on getting it 2 years after release at a price of under $4.00. I'm very glad I did get it, because as a fan of the original films A:CM says "you're a marine, here's your hardware, and btw - none of that 'hold your fire' bs the original squad had to deal with." Weapons free - time for a bug hunt! You've got all the tools of the trade: pulse rifle, shotguns, pistols, flamethrowers, and yes, the famed smart gun. Everyone's heard the negatives - it was too expensive and buggy as hell... well I played through the campaign with a full four-marine squad of friends and family and had a blast. Apparently its been patched up enough to be playable. Sure, I'd have loved for it to have decent graphics and writing but that doesn't make this a bad game. Re: gameplay, the aliens sometimes sneak up on you by moving silently and other times attack head on. I'd have preferred better use of acid to up the danger levels of interacting with the beasts. The human enemies were rather boring placeholders for "non-alien enemy x" but whatever. Perusing the DLC I decided to skip everything except for the "Stasis Interrupted" campaign pack, which also allows for co-op with a prequel to the main story involving an assortment of survivors and good old Cpl Hicks. TL;DR Being familiar with the films probably would aid your appreciation of the game. In the end its about being a US Colonial Marine and hunting bugs. Get some!

number of helpful: 7 of 13 people (54%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 4, 2014
HIGHLY RECOMMEND.Recommended. On the fence. Play it when hell freezes over. Avoid like the plague. It's honestly not that bad BUT there is a fair share of problems: -Low resolution textures from 2006 with a crappy grainy filter -Non existent special effects (e.g. explosions)-Awkward animations-Budget voice actors -Incoherent plot -Questionable AI. Impressed me at times by hiding or running away. Other times they froze up and stood still. -There's no balance in difficulty. On normal, some of the human enemies can kill you in 2-3 hits in half a second.-Gearbox dropped support for this game immediately (SHAME ON YOU). This includes multiplayer support and SHIFT codes. (As of October 4, 2014 - the latest patch has yet to fix any of problems.)If you think this won't bother you, then I recommend it. There is decent core gameplay and they also managed to tap into some of the nostalgia from the movie. Otherwise try the 2010 remake of Alien vs Predator or Alien: Isolation and forget this game ever existed. I personally would be lying if I said I didn't enjoy a few segments. They did put a smile on my face. Unfortunately the game had unparallel hype and failed to live up to any of it. I went in expecting nothing and came out neutral. As of right now, I'd give it a 6/10  - an average game with technical difficulties but set in an incredible universe. A mod could easily fix most of the problems and alter the score to an 8/10 but that's hoping for too much. That being said, it's not the worst thing ever so don't be fooled by the negative reviews - I've played a bunch of crappy games in my day but this isn't one of them. Strictly generic with technical problems.

number of helpful: 15 of 29 people (52%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 6, 2014
												So this game received a lot of flak when it came out. In this review, I have to admit that I didn't follow the progress, I wasn't familiar with the E3 footage, and I didn't play through this game until November 4th - 6th, 2014; well after it was released and patched up.It's not a bad game by any means. The graphics are good, though a lot of the textures (particularly monitor screens) seem really low resolution. I'm not a big fan of the "constant AI companion" model, but it suits the movie, and I thought it was interesting that games are finally achieving what "Daikatana" was supposed to do.I liked the environments and the general story (some of the dialogue sucks, though the actors are doing their best with it). The challenge level was about right for me.I remember a lot of people complained about the "blind aliens" level. I thought it was an okay part of the game. They're not just randomly blind and stupid- they're basically "damaged" by radiation. It's a gimmick that serves gameplay rather than story, but nothing too bad. A lot of the aliens did attack with the "walking approach for a hug" move, but again, it didn't ruin the experience too much for me.Big pros; I think fighting alongside Hicks is real childhood wish fulfillment for people who grew up with the movie. It was great to see his character come back and kick♥♥♥♥♥ and I'm grateful to Michael Biehn for reprising the role (even though he said it was a miserable experience).Was it worth the prepurchase price I paid for the game? I am not sure. I think it's definitely worth $14.99 to any fan of the Aliens movies though. Maybe this game fell flat as a first person shooter to a lot of people, but I think it does a pretty good job of creating a cinematic experience for a player to enjoy for a few hours.

number of helpful: 18 of 35 people (51%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 12, 2013
												Another example of the Alien franchise going in the wrong direction, as the once survival horror franchise takes another step closer to being a modern military shooter. There is little this game has to offer besides generic linear shooting, short campaign and gives off all the signs of a rushed incomplete product. While there are few moments that give off the Alien horror feel and tension, they are short lived and you  soon find yourself fighting against and alongside awful AI again.The single player campaign simply emphasizes the numerous issues within the game. As well as soon questioning which product you bought. After the first level of killing aliens you will soon find yourself fighting mercenaries for at least fifty percent of the game or more. The game offers no originality or twists to combat while still finding it almost impossible to match up to even some of the most basic shooters on the market. There is a scene in which the game takes a stealthy horror approach however this very short experience is soon over before you find yourself back in the same combat situations you have been for the past two to three hours. Many aspects of the game offer the accuracy of detail for the Alien franchise such as accurate pulse rifle sounds and map design that respects the original designs from the Alien films. Other areas simply express the laziness of the development team as the iconic smartgun simply has the identical sound of the pulse rifle, which as many Alien fans will know do not sound the same.The voice acting and storyline are both very poor, with voices just sounding unconvincing and out of place , while laughable dialog just makes cut scenes a painful chore to watch. Many times during the dialog the characters lips will become completely out of synchronization with the voice over. Characters will also often seem very stiff and lack animations, and at some points they will simply skip an animation which has just clearly just not being put into the game. One boss simple does not even have any attack animations, it simply walks around in circles and if it touches you, you find yourself on the floor for no reason missing a health bar.The poor voice acting and animations make it difficult to take characters seriously or develop any bond to them, this is made even worse by the awful artificial intelligence of your team. You will often find your team shooting the walls, standing still or walking around in circles very confused during combat, it would have been much better if they simply removed the teammates from the game completely. If you were left alone instead of frequently listening to O’niels bad dialogue, it would greatly improve the experience. The enemy AI does little to inspire as well, as many aliens will simply slowly walk up you in the open and never use speed or wall running to help them, while bosses simply spend more time struggling to navigate the terrain.If you are playing this, I would suggest co-op instead of single player, this by far improves the gameplay when you bring friends along. As more players join the game, the number of aliens and health of enemies increases to try to balance the game, however some areas especially against enemy infantry or not scaled. This often leaves situations such as four players walking through narrow corridors and killing two or three poorly armed scientists in each room and many players having nothing to do for around half an hour. There is no class system in co-op but simply an increased number of players, an area that the game could have looked at to improve the co-op teamwork involved.Multiplayer seems to have the most work put into it, with many customization upgrades for not only the marines but also for the aliens. It also offers more variety then the older Alien games with multiplayer, with new classes for the aliens to use in more effective ways such as a spitter or crusher aliens. It can be frustrating at times, as the aliens seem to have such little health issues with lag and controls means you may often die and be confused of what happened and why. Playing as the marines adds much more tension then the single player campaign has to offer. The motion sensor has use and often fuels the paranoia for the marine team trying to stay alive. These tense and exciting moments can soon be lost however, when you find aliens lagging then suddenly you are on the floor dead and the poor and sometimes none existent animations make this even more confusing. The multiplayer will unlikely have a long life, with many upgrades available within one or two days of playing multiplayer will soon lose interest to the majority of players with the lack of content.With a season pass DLC already available on the steam store for 30$, for future DLC, I question how they feel its appropriate to charge for more content for this game while its clearly unfinished and lacking content in the main game. With many people disappointed with the DLC released for borderlands 2 made by Gearbox, I have little hope that we will be impressed and find our moneys worth within future DLC content. Personally I feel that the future DLC should be free, considering how much content that was promised before release simple is not there, but that isn’t how business works.Pro:Most areas live up to the lore of AliensFour player drop in/out co-opMultiplayer that can sometimes provide the paranoia fueling Alien experienceSmall customization features and upgradesCons:Poor dialogue and voice actingPoor animations, sometimes none existentPoor visualsNo real boss fightsDreadful enemy and team AIGeneric combat that struggles to meet up to even the most basic shootersLack of class system for co-opNo re-playability for the campaignMultiplayer can be fun, but has little to offer in the long termMy verdict is that you should avoid this game under all circumstances. There is little to be gained to playing this poorly executed shooter, while it may appeal to some of the Alien fans, and those into modern military shooters, it still is poor in every single aspect. Simply put, everything this game tries to do, other games do better as it just feels terribly outdated and unfinished. If you really want to purchase this product still, I would advise waiting a few months for a sale or the price to drop, I can’t imagine it will retain full price for very long.

Posted: October 23, 2014
												This game doesn't deserve all the negativity it gets. I played it originally on console when it first came out so I've seen this game in it's worst form. Then when I eventually got it again on Steam I looked up some tweaking to improve A.I. and it made all the difference. On console the xenos would just run towards you with open arms, accepting their fate, but on pc they were on the walls, sneaking behind, lunging from all over. Pros:- You get to play as a Colonial Marine. (M41-A Pulse Rifle...need I say more?)- You get to visit the Sulaco.- You get to visit LV-426 and view areas in the movie where our characters took their last stand. (Even the floor was damaged where Hudson was pulled under)- Legendary weapons for fanboys to get excited over.- Everything from the atmosphere, music, and sound effects are spot on. Cons:- It was not the Alien game we were all hoping for.- A.I. by default isn't the best (nor the worst) but that can be fixed with mods/patches.- Ending felt rushed.Being  a fan of the series I would say this game is worth a try. It goes on sale quite often and if you can pick it up with a friend it's a good co-op play session.As a game (co-op): 7 / 10 As for the nostalgia: 10 / 10

number of helpful: 21 of 41 people (51%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 30, 2014
												Aliens: Colonial Marines was conceived with access to some of the film’s original creators and even designated to be official canon by the corporate stewards of the franchise. It has “legit” written all over it, but while there’s ample gore, acid blood, and the persistent modulating whine of marine pulse rifles, film’s nerve-wracking tension just isn’t there. For all the attention paid to the source material, it just doesn’t feel like Aliens.The best way to describe the gameplay is merely “standard.” The shooting is what you would come to expect from Call of Duty: aiming down the sights of a gun, shooting enemies and throwing grenades. It’s all there and never really feels different from any other shooter. Players will be pitted against both Xenomorphs and human mercenaries. The story falls short throughout the campaign. The voice acting consists of poorly written dialog and uninspired performances. The final payoff to the entire game is underwhelming, and questions are never really answered. It got to a point where I just tuned the story bits out.The lighting effects and visuals do look good in some areas. The animations, on the other hand, are very clunky. The enemy AI is just plain bad in many cases. Of course, that doesn’t stop them from being deadly. The multiplayer has different modes that put two teams against each other.Most players would think it would be more enjoyable to play the Aliens, but the Xenos are a clunky mess. Aliens: Colonial Marines is a mixed bag.It seems to have the right set up for a decent Aliens game with the presentation and look, but due to the boring story and clunky enemy AI, there is no tension or exciting action. The co-op is probably the best way to play, but players need to choose a higher difficulty if they want any kind of a challenge. The competitive multiplayer feels unbalanced.Aliens: Colonial Marines is so riddled with problems and boring stretches that it can be painful at times.I would only recommend this game to hardcore Alien fans.Overall 5/10.

content:
Posted: November 21, 2016
												Puh, rating Aliens Colonial Marines is not so easy. Many things seem to disappoint, yet the atmosphere kept me playing it till the end.The Graphics of the game are okay, not really bad, but also not really beautiful. But in comparison to Graphics of the demo and the gameplay material which the producers published before the release it is quite disappointing. You can clearly see the downgrade. The Campaign is only about 6 hours long, at least I finished the game so fast and I didn't rush any parts of the game. I even died a couple of times because I stupidly thought the AI colleagues would be supporting me. So the AI is not your friend, but you have at least the possibility to play the whole campaign in Coop. I only did this for a short while, but I got the impression it is a lot more fun than alone. There are also Multiplayer Versus Modi, but you need to make an appointment with some players, because otherwise Multiplayer is practically dead. Some other flaws were annoying clipping errors and a couple of bugs both inside and outside the game. At least the one outside the game (After you finish an endless loop of restarting the game is beginning) you can fix easily by activating the "run as administrator" mode. The point where you have to give the game credit is capturing the atmosphere of the second alien movie. You visit a couple of familiar places and that Bishop and Hicks return in the game is a nice addition. The gameplay mainly plays like a standard shooter, so you rarely have any feeling like a horror movie. The Action is fun and you can enjoy the gameplay, but there are also couple of better games in this area.   Pro:-Alien atmosphere-More fun in CoopContra:-Graphics downgrade-Mostly stupid AI-Clipping Errors and Bugs(-Too Short campaign ?)Result: Colonial Marines is not a really bad game, but also far away from being really good. If you just want a good Alien- or a good Horror-game I can strongly suggest Alien Isolation, it is really great and in nearly all regards way better than Colonial Marines. And if you just want a good shooter, there are many better ones. So I am not really sure who this game is for. As an fan of the movies I had some fun with it, but the downsides were pretty heavy. So my final score is maybe a bit too optimistic, but I cannot recommend this game generally for players. 5/10

content:
Posted: January 11
												So, WOW. What can I say about this game? Dear lord. What an experience. What an experience!Basically, if you came to see 'Aliens: The Movie: The Game' then you probably came to the right place. Sort of. Except not really. Honestly, where Aliens was smart (and it wasn't even that smart), Colonial Marines is dumb, where Aliens built tension, this game just says "OKAY ROOM CLEAR MOVE ONTO THE NEXT ROOM WHERE YOU KILL GUYS", where Aliens had a deliciously well-written story and characters, this game has none of that.Yeah, I guess, I mean, at least there's the nostalgia trip! On occasion! Like three times total! Did you wanna see the space jockey? Well you damn well will (albeit with some certain qualities missing)! Did you wanna see Hadley's Hope after the fact? Well, you'll see that too! Sort of! Some of it! Yeah. That's pretty much it. And you know what, Hicks and Bishop are both in this game, which is awesome, excepting the fact that you're going to have to suffer through about 80% of the game just to get here.So you know what, whereas I actually started off by thinking this game isn't so bad, hey I might even recommend it, I'm sorry, the majority of the game is just so bad that I'm afraid I can't. I don't really know how to describe it, because literally everything just feels rushed and low quality - if you really want a good Alien game, I can recommend Aliens vs Predator (2010), it's an infinitely better polished game.I mean, this game, Colonial Marines was just rushed out the door way, way too fast, it just simply wasn't ready to be released in 2013, and the publishers or whoever was at the top clearly didn't notice this, or care. So, sadly I can't recommend this. It's just not fun.

content:
Posted: October 31, 2013
												Putting all the controversy about how this game was produced aside, this game has some good and some bad points.The games combat is simple, since it's basically a run-n-gun game. However, you'd expect there to be a cover system of some kind... there isn't. Your AI allies and the enemies will use cover like in CoD or Mass Effect, but you can only crouch behind things for cover, which is ineffective to say the least. Also, while you'd expect there to be limited ammo for any kind of weapon, the only really limited ammo is for the alt-fire weapons, as you barely run across any, sometimes going an entire mission w/o finding any. Also, you have constant access to EVERY weapon you've found/unlocked (not to mention wahtever addons/upgrades you've gotten), and can swap them out at any time during a mission, which, to me, makes no sense. Had they made it so that you only carried 3 weapons and a grenade, but could only swap them out and change their upgrades at the start/end of each mission, that would have been better.Now, may have said that the AI has been fixed, and to a degree it has, but it can still act funny at times. However, every games AI has moments like that, so you can't really fault it as much as you could before. The only gripe is how some Xeno's behave, only one type behaves like you'd expect, hiding, striking and then running off to hide again.I'd heard there were graphics problems, but honestly, when I played a friends copy back when this game was released, I didn't really notice any. So whether or not the huge 5gb "patch" fixed them as people claim is something I can't confirm or disprove.As far as the game's atmosphere goes, for the most part it does capture the Aliens world. When run at the suggested brightness, it's hard to make out much that isn't either already lighted, really close to you, or lighted by your flashlight (which has a very limited range. Emphisis on VERY). So most Xeno's will blend in quite well. One the other hand, instead of the tight, confiend quarters of the films, you have far more open spaces here, which can kill the overall feeling of fear as you have to run across open spaces to get from point A to point B. One of the major good points for this game is that, despite all the initial bad press, there is still a decent multiplayer community here on Steam for this game. Also, the Co-Op is fun; grab a few friends and have a blast playing the story missions or just go multiplayer and kills Xenos (or Marines if you prefer). Now, with all that said, the current non-sale price of $20 is still kind of high, given that this game is nowhere near what most people expected it to be. If you can catch it on sale for 50-75% off, don't be afraid to pick it up (and maybe the Season Pass, too).

content:
Posted: February 23, 2013
												I removed my recommendation for this game.  All in all, I'm not filled with rage over this release the way some people are.  I like the graphics, I've had fun with the gameplay co-op with my fearless forever adventure buddy.  I'm glad I got it, I'm glad we're playing it.  But this game could have been a LOT better, and should have been.  For such a long wait, they owed us a far better story with much more attention to detail.  The shortcuts taken in this game are unforgivable for such a major title.  Aliens: Colonial Marines should not be applauded, nor the studio rewarded for their effort.  I actually wish I'd pirated this game instead of paying for it.  I pre-ordered this game after seeing E3 "in-game footage" that later turned out to be a complete fabrication, and nothing like the finished product.  This represents dishonesty on the part of the publisher, and many of the publishers involved here have earned a black mark in their reputation from me.I will NOT be buying Borderlands 2, because credible scuttlebutt indicates that Aliens got shortchanged in development due to focus on BL2.  I vote with my dollars, and I will be quite wary of future offerings from Gearbox - if I buy any at all.

												//The following is multiple excerpts from a journal recorded by a lost Marine on the VLV Steam spacecraft, only recently discovered on a backlog cleaning. Viewer discretion is advised.\\AUG 30th, 2013: Wow! Colonial Marines is 75% off! I know how much hate it's received, but.. I gotta see this for myself.AUG 31st, 2013: The multiplayer is decent. Not anything special, but it's fun. Different alien classes, different weapons and tactics for the marines.. frequent level-ups and weapon attachments to unlock. Not that bad at all, and I've only touched team deathmatch.OCTOBER 5th, 2013: I finally... I finally jumped into the single player. I don't know the time. How could I? After playing this game, it's amazing that I still have my sanity intact. Only 30 minutes played, but that was... that was a challenge I wasn't expecting.It all started fine, man! Sure, the graphics weren't great, but it was a cool start. Just walking down that space hallway, then it happened. I found that guy, wrapped up in some weird organic mush on the walls. I started to pry him off.. and an alien jumped me! It freaked me out.But that wasn't the problem. It.. it ran away. My motion tracker told me it was around the corner, but I couldn't see anything! I reloaded my gun and carefully tip-toed down the hall.. AND THERE IT WAS MAN! JUST SITTING THERE FACING THE OPPOSITE WALL! I screamed and threw my controller down, running out of the room in a panic-- if the very first alien had AI as awful as this, what did that mean for the rest of the game!?OCTOBER 6th: I tried again. I killed the beast and continued playing. We got to the hangar and that was a pretty cool scene. Marines yelling and having to defend the doo--oh.. that.. alien... oh, oh God. The animation on it locked up! IT SLID RIGHT AT ME THROUGH THE OBSTACLES IN THE MAP! OH GOD, OH GOD NO HELP ME JESU-- //transmission lost//NOVEMBER 1ST: ABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORT

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 29, 2013
												First of all, I just have to say this, Alien Colonial Marines is not the bad game most meta critics talk about. Aliens Colonial Marines' actually a very good and solid game.Another important aspect about the negative reviews is that most if not all are written for the console version of Aliens: Colonial Marines. The PC version is on all fronts way better. (Graphics are much better, no bugs, and solid fast controls)And just to make a stand here. The gameplay and missions is the way it should be. We're taling about Aliens (Not Alien); so that means the 2nd movie and more precise: Colonial Marines. Intergalactic Warriors. They fight, they kill and they die. And they do that a lot. And that's what you get with this game. It's based upon Aliens and the Colonial Marines in an all out war for survival. You don't need to fear, because you got hightech weapons and you ain't got time to bleed.Graphics:The graphics are far more than adequate, they're close to, if not already, top nodge.Sound:The music is just the way it should be..Alien..a bit creepy, but cool. Nothing wrong with that. The weapons and other sound effects are just fine and help a lot to immerse the player.Gameplay:Ha, yea, well, that's a different thing. The controls are perfect, everything works the way it should. No problems there. But..game falls with the quality of your gaming buddies.Aliens Colonial Marines provides a full Co-Op campaign (Even 2 with the dlc) But, the way you enjoy the campaign or the Co-Op Bug Hunt maps all comes down to your buddies.Are your buddies egocentric teenagers? Please, play solo, you'll have a better experience with the A.I. than with them.If you and your buddies can't get that special Alien feeling because you know jack sh*t about the lore, then the game fails.Combat isn't really that hard during the campaigns, which isn't bad,because it allows you to enjoy the story in full length and talk about it with your friends. (Or joke about). Me and my crew enjoyed the campaigns and we played it more than ones, just for the fun of it.Okay, now the most interesting part..Bug Hunt. Yes, I know, been there, done that, lame... NOT. Not with this game. Bug Hunt  makes you work together, because on your own you're nothing but prey, the next snack for your xenomorph friends.By killing you earn credits. With creadits you stock up on different types of ammo and or weapons and armor. Not to forget first aid. I think I've put 15+ hours or so in Bug Hunt alone, so that makes me a nut or just a prove of concept concerning this game mode.Besides just playing away you're also able to modify your weapons, look and voice. Depending on what and how many dlc's you've got for this game.Still, if you're not sure if this game is good enough for you you should think about the following. This game has been designed by the people behind borderlands. A top nodge FPS Co-Op RPG. Now translate that over to Aliens Colonial Marines, without that many role playing parameters "et voilá". That gives you a good picture of what you get by buying this game.

												A disappointing take on Aliens. I figured that maybe the bad rep the game gets is undeserved, but no: the combat is an abomination of a Call of Duty clone (right down to fighting generic Weyland "terrorists"), the story falls flatter than old soda, and the classic Aliens charm is ultimately wasted. It's so bad that even the last Aliens game (Aliens Vs Predator) was better.The only way I'd recommend this game is if you're intending to play it just to see how bad it is.

content:
Posted: November 25, 2013
												Alright, so, I actually enjoyed this game. Not in a "Oh man, this game is like the Citizen Kane of games", or even the "This game is pretty good technically". I liked this game because it was an "Aliens" game, and as a fan of Alien, that's why I bought the game (I actually have the collcetors edition). If you're a diehard Alien fan, you'll smile a few times throughout this game. You'll love the sound of your M41, you'll get excited the first time you climb into a Loader, and you'll squeel when you see some of Alien's iconic scenes recreated for you to fight in.Now, is it *good*? No, not at all. The sounds were glitchy, the graphics were sub par, and the story was pretty dumb. If this game went on sale for $5, I'd recommend it, but not for any more money than that. It was a fun experience to have, and I'm not worse off for having played it.
