content:
Posted: October 10, 2016
												Almost 4 years later I decided to try out the game again and see if maybe it wasn't as bad as I remember.I was wrong, I was so wrong, it's somehow WORSE than I remember.The graphics are terrible, like REALLY bad, the textures are muddier and the AA is somehow even more disgusting than I remembered it being. I seriously sat for 3 whole minutes waiting for the textures to finish loading before I realized that this is as good as it's going to get.The story is just bad fanfiction; this isn't even with respect to the Alien franchise, even as a standalone experience this is just bad. Half-baked romantic plot between two NPCs that I couldn't feel more apathetic about, lots of people talking and 'stuff' going on even thought for the most part it always feels like nothing is actually happening, and for some reason the devs felt the constant need to drop in easter eggs everywhere in the place of actually having any original plot; instead we get "Hey remember when this happened in the movie! That was cool huh!" every 20 or so minutes. If that wasn't bad enough the ending basically is nonexistent, all this "stuff" we've been doing that didn't really go anywhere and then all we get is an "ok it's over now", I half expected "You're Winner!" to pop up on the screen.The gameplay is basically just your crappy modern shooter with aliens thrown into the mix, literally. You get shot at by dudes, aliens who act like dudes without guns run at you arms spread wide for a hug only to be mowed down so that the dudes can continue shooting at you while you shoot back with weapons that feel unsatisfying and underpowered.I think everyone gets one of these kind of games eventually, the kinds that makes you stop pre-ordering games forever and turn into a huge critic for every purchase you make. This was definitely that game for me, I haven't pre-ordered a game since and I do not plan to for....well...the rest of eternity sounds nice. The blatant bait and switch that went down with this title has pretty much ruined that concept for me, great job there Sega, I'm sure that's a super sustainable business model.Either way I honestly wouldn't pay any amount of money for this game and would probably have to seriously contemplate over the idea of getting it free, so just don't bother it seriously is not worth it, I still regret buying it myself after almost 4 years and I often contemplate getting steam support to remove it from my library just so I don't have to think about it anymore. I'm honestly surprised that it's still on Steam at all, I guess Sega has to get their money back from that lawsuit somehow, that's probably why there is so much overpriced DLC.TL;DR: Go look at Alien: Isolation if you want an Alien game. Alot like the 4th movie, lets just forget that this one exists.

content:
Posted: April 13
												I'm not angry at the game, I'm just disappointed.It's a big budget title from a competent game developer but it feels like a very very indie production.The story is forgettable without highpoints and surprises (including some plotholes and movie retconning for "Aliens" and "Alien 3"), the overall visual quality is lacking, the music feels bland, the nostalgia-moments from the movie feel hastily placed and fail to impress. It's like a giant arrow pointing at former glory while someone shouts at you: "Remember this from the movies? Isn't this the best game ever?".The sound effects (mainly gun sounds and alien noises) are good, the voice acting on some parts is ok. Michael Biehn and Lance Henriksen sound bored and/or annoyed most of the time, the other voice talents are ok/good.For the gameplay: It's a shooter, plain and simple, you run along the given corridor, press a bunch of buttons and shoot aliens and corporate mercs complete with a progression system which unlocks new guns and gun decals. The pacing is somewhat slower than for example "Call of Duty" which is not a bad idea.Sadly, the level design are very generic and the scripted events fall flat for most parts.The weapons are ok, there aren't just that many (assault rifles, shotguns, machine pistols, occasionally flamethrower and smartgun). For more nostalgia they added 6 "legendary" movie weapons which can be collected and differ slightly from the standard ones. It is almost infuriating that the coolest weapons are DLC but then again the extra guns aren't needed for anything other than some variety in shooting.As enemies there are the mentioned aliens and mercs: 2 types of mercs (standard and heavy) and 3 types of aliens (including facehuggers). There are some more alien races which are only used as bosses, so they don't really count.The general lack of variety of enemies wouldn't be so bad if the A.I. behind them was any good.Mercs run for cover and shoot back at you. That's it. Aliens fall from the ceiling and run at you from all directions to claw you. Sometimes they run around in stupid circles. That's it.The only reason why these enemies pose even a slight threat are there numbers. When one alien falls from the ceiling, 3 to 5 fall down behind it. Go around 2 corners and repeat until the end of the level. It feels like design from a very very old shooter. There is no suspense or horror, especially since the first alien gets introduced after 3 minutes.Lastly the DLC, mainly "Stasis Interrupted": More of the same "gameplay" like the main game minus the progression system.It may be fun as a co-op experience. But then you would have to buy the game twice which I cannot recommend.If you are looking for original "Alien" feel, play "Alien: Isolation" instead - it has its flaws but it's very atmospheric.If you are looking for the best shooter + "Alien" combo, play "Aliens vs. Predator 2", it's still the best.

content:
Posted: July 23, 2015
												I picked up Aliens: Colonial Marines for a couple dollars when it was on sale, I’m pretty big fan of the movies and I enjoyed 2010’s Alien Vs. Predator, so I thought, “Why the hell not?” I started it up and since then, I’ve really enjoyed it. I was then very shocked to see all the negative reviews for this game, because it really doesn’t deserve them. Many people complain about the poor story, and no it’s not an extremely rich and exciting story, but it’s a fairly decent at least. And plus, you don’t play an Alien game for the story. Others complain about the poor dialogue and voice acting, again it’s not Oscar-worthy, no, but it’s not anything to hate the game over. Another thing that some mention is the lack of horror. Aliens: Colonial Marines is capturing the feel of the movie Aliens, and the movie itself focuses on the action portion more than the horror aspect, so you shouldn’t be surprised to see more action than horror in a game based on an action movie.Aliens: Colonial Marines is an entertaining shooter game with a decent story, a good action element while still implementing some feel of horror. For the most part you are lurking around tight corridors and close quarters with Xenomorphs hiding in the shadows, waiting to strike. Just how an Alien game should be. And it just gets better if you add in some of your pals to fight alongside you. You can unlock and customize weapons such as a Pulse Rifle, Pump Shotgun, Battle Rifle, and more. You can use these guns in both Co-op/Solo campaign and online multiplayer. The game also has some references to the movie, such as finding Newt’s doll, finding and using Hudson’s Pulse Rifle, and few others. If you feel like you’ve gotten everything you’re going to get out of the game, check out some DLC’s. I strongly recommend Stasis Interrupted. It is its own campaign explaining the events leading up the main campaign, and explaining the events in-between Aliens and Alien 3. There are a few other to look at as well. I’m not asking for you love the game, but at least give it a chance, don’t just look at the reviews and expect crap. Also, actually play a decent amount of it before judging it so harshly.

content:
Posted: October 20, 2015
												Prior to playing the game, I read many negative reviews which seemed to judge the game rather harshly.  I think maybe the game was hyped up prior to release and maybe disappointed people relative to what they were expecting.  Also, I think a lot of bugs existed that have been fixed prior to me playing the game.I had a pleasant experience with the game.  It feels like a pretty solid shooter, and the weapons upgrades and customisation adds a little bit extra to the shooter experience.  The attention to detail in the level design is superb, and the banter between characters helps make the game more immersive.  The cliché storyline and corny dialogue, for me, was something I could laugh at and added to the overall enjoyment of the game.  The Stasis DLC campaign also had some very cool missions, letting you take the perspective of three additional characters.Minor complaints - The player movement felt sluggish, making it frustrating when surrounded or when being charged at by the Xeno Crushers. - The lighting in the game was either pitch black dark, or so glaring bright that you couldn't see anything in front of you, adding some strain to your eyes. - The ally AI, though well-designed in some ways, would often behave strangely, such as trying to shoot enemies through walls or solid objects.

content:
Posted: November 22, 2014
												I got this since it has come down heavily in price since it first came out and while I was harsh on it when it first came out I can see it in a new light. It's not a bad game by any means but it is rather bland and adds nothing new. If anything it's a cookie cutter FPS game.The story line is all over the place and laced with plot holes. If anything the DLC even adds more rather than fixing some. Also these shooty shooty bang bang type dudebro marine type games really miss the whole point of the alien series at heart.However the game has been patched since it's problematic release in 2013 which fixes a lot of issues and with the help of mods you can really polish things up and bring it a little closer to the demo. I'd recommend the cilitbng pack, ENB/Sweet FX mods and Aliens Survival Experience. There's also some great add ons and multiplayer mods that really overhall the experence for online play with more in the pipes.I do think gearbox should have put out an SDK or modding tools to win back some of the playerbase as well as trust but thats wishful thinking anyway.If you are a diehard fan of the alien series you may get some enjoyment out of this, patched up and with some mods it can be fun and it's not badly priced as well.positives*Fairly decent FPS game.*Multiplayer can be fun.*With some mods it can be polished up a bit.*Good price.*It does capture some elements of the second movie.Negatives*Textures are really meh at times.*Storyline is a mess and full of plot holes.*Can be bland at times and really drags out.

content:
Posted: February 17, 2013
												If groping around in dark tunnels filled with creepy stuff trying to kill you is your thing, then this is a game for you. Lighting is really dim, so all the fun can be very hectic and scary. The game is  more like an interactive movie - very scripted and linear, and unnfortunately it feels very dated. It has been greatly simplified since the “demo”. The bots are unbelievably stupid and alien AI is non-existent. The graphics are very simple. The good news is, you don't need a powerful PC to run it, the bad news is that everything is very reminiscent of a game from five years ago. I think the most disturbing issue with this game is that Gearbox knew full well that it wasn’t a great game and decided to play crafty by trying to boost pre-sales without allowing the press to review the game.  A tactic that has enraged fans.  Recommended?  People waiting for this game will no doubt be very disappointed, but the fact remains that it’s still fun to play, especially in coop mode. It’s not that bad , but it most certainly is not a great and is very much over-priced. Wait for it to come down in price before you buy it.

content:
Posted: January 11, 2014
												Aliens: Colonial Marines, why in the world would anyone recommend this game? Well we have to downgrade our expectations.I would recommend this game if the following things are in order.1) The game is on sale for 5,- or less2) You are a big fan of the Alien franchise3) You pretend the game was made in 20044) You have just watched Aliens 2 and are in the moodLock yourself up, put on the 5.1 surround sound, light a candle and play this game with the film grain overlay on.The singleplayer campaign is better than Call of Duty Ghost, it is lineair as hell but you are not fighting from cutscene to cutscene. This was something which I enjoyed as it felt like I had more freedom (although you don't have any at all). The exploration in this game is also very very low. Several times I found a nice looking secret, but I hit an invisible wall. There was potential for secrets here. The only exploration has to offer is a hidden full armor pick up. The legendary weapens aren't hidden at all but in plain sight. They had the options to make nice secrets but they didn't. It's a recurring feeling the game gives.The story, something which should have been important as it is canon, is sadly very lazy written and doesn't take big risks at all. There was only one moment which sparked my enthusiasm, but for a campaign of several missions long that is not enough. The few cutscenes made in the campaign are terribly done, it looks like it was cutting edge in 1998. One positive thing I like was the level design. You can see and feel that there has been put in a lot of love in them. The architects really do deserve a pat on the back for this. It's just a shame the graphics are such a let down. pros- Alien fans might enjoy it.- Level Design is good.- Better gameplay than Call of Duty: Ghosts.- They are patching things up.cons- Terrible graphics (it's really not ok).- Lazy uninspired story.- They need to patch things up.

content:
Posted: March 14, 2016
For £2.49 in a -75% sale this is an alright gamePros-The graphics can be good but can also look like grey potato-The lip syncing is funny to watch-Game is hilarious with friends-Multiplayer has a very small active community-Cheap as chips-Xeno models are pretty cool-Gun models are perfect-Marine and Xeno customisation for multiplayer is amazing-Game is worth £2.49-Friendlies can kill enemies-Has butt-quenching moments-Has a neat progressive challenge system-The Crusher and Boiler are both very fun to play as in multiplayer-Multiplayer's community is okay, you won't get idiots shooting teammates or swearing obscenities down their mics-The DLC doesn't add anything desirable-They were creative with making the Spitter, Crusher and Boiler as well as all the heads for the Xenos and their skin colours-Walking around so that a boiler chases your friend is hilarious-Lighting is often excellent-I joined a match on multiplayer and dominated-There's a nice mod in the community forums to stop the game restarting upon exitingCons-The game is pretty easy regardless of difficulty once you get used to it-Multiplayer can have connectivity issues with other players, the ping can be high-Can take a while to find a match (5mins of searching usually)-DLC-Game is not worth £9.99-Story is crap-Campaign forced too many references to the Aliens movie-Friendlies deal very little damage and often get in the way of explosive fire-The challenges can be very stupid and difficult if you don't have a friend with the game to cheese them-Multiplayer can be very unbalanced-"WINTER, MOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOVE" x50 -Some weapons use repeat sounds that cut out when firing (firing at times with no noise)-Aliens with human skull faces look dumb as all hell-Animations are recycled and don't fit in some areas-Being able to throw facehuggers off of yourself with one hand is wrong in every sense of the word-Lip syncing is atrocious-The red dot on the sights is off from where the bullets are going to hit-Laser sights often don't even point to the dot presented at the center of the screen-Characters are annoying, obnoxious and ugly-All female face and voice customisation is crap-No one can have the "Friends of Gearbox" emblem for multiplayer unless they got it years ago-Game reopens after closing like it doesn't want you to leave or something-The only viable gametype in multiplayer is TDM-The campaign is literally impossible on the hardest difficulty unless you have friends for the "Raven" fight-Human characters have no facial expressions other than the "poker face"Overall the game is actually worth the price of £2.49 and is enjoyable, I wouldn't recommend it at full price however, Hope this review helped you! Even though I'll get this review thumbed down cause ♥♥♥♥♥ are constantly going to the reviews of this game and down thumbing and good reviews regardless of even playing the game.

content:
Posted: November 7, 2015
												Bad game indeed. Feels like 90's shooter at places and not in the fun way. Then it has some non-fun generic modern shooter mechanics. Iron sights, which are not very useful against Aliens that jump around a lot, regenerating health, limited available weapons picked from larger selection. Even when you do have a larger inventory of weapons (only in the DLC, I think), you are forced to go through a clumsy menu to assing them to "primary" and "secondary" slots instead of just having all the weapons in 1 - 9 keys like in old times. Must have made it that way for the controllers or something.Graphics are bad. It's also dark and murky probably mostly to hide its badness. It certainly doesn't make it more atmospheric. It just killed me many times because I couldn't see what was going on. The AI teammates could see and shoot the Aliens, of course, but they are fairly useless even as baits because the enemies mostly single you out. Can't rely on them. Might be little better as co-op, but I don't want to inflict this game to my friends. Don't know how the multiplayer is. It's a ghost town.The Stasis Interrupted is DLC is actually almost decent. The story is little better, a prequel to the main campaign. There was some neat encounter design that managed to startle me a couple of times. Even reminded me a bit of the much better Alien: Isolation. Of course nowhere near as good, but improvement to this game. It degenerates towards the end, though.I got this game at huge discount and still made myself to play through it "because I paid for it". I do stupid stuff like that sometimes. Don't get this game, but if you do, get the DLC as well. It almost makes the game worht it.

content:
Posted: January 11, 2014
												Aliens: Colonial Marines, why in the world would anyone recommend this game? Well we have to downgrade our expectations.I would recommend this game if the following things are in order.1) The game is on sale for 5,- or less2) You are a big fan of the Alien franchise3) You pretend the game was made in 20044) You have just watched Aliens 2 and are in the moodLock yourself up, put on the 5.1 surround sound, light a candle and play this game with the film grain overlay on.The singleplayer campaign is better than Call of Duty Ghost, it is lineair as hell but you are not fighting from cutscene to cutscene. This was something which I enjoyed as it felt like I had more freedom (although you don't have any at all). The exploration in this game is also very very low. Several times I found a nice looking secret, but I hit an invisible wall. There was potential for secrets here. The only exploration has to offer is a hidden full armor pick up. The legendary weapens aren't hidden at all but in plain sight. They had the options to make nice secrets but they didn't. It's a recurring feeling the game gives.The story, something which should have been important as it is canon, is sadly very lazy written and doesn't take big risks at all. There was only one moment which sparked my enthusiasm, but for a campaign of several missions long that is not enough. The few cutscenes made in the campaign are terribly done, it looks like it was cutting edge in 1998. One positive thing I like was the level design. You can see and feel that there has been put in a lot of love in them. The architects really do deserve a pat on the back for this. It's just a shame the graphics are such a let down. pros- Alien fans might enjoy it.- Level Design is good.- Better gameplay than Call of Duty: Ghosts.- They are patching things up.cons- Terrible graphics (it's really not ok).- Lazy uninspired story.- They need to patch things up.

content:
Posted: November 25, 2013
												Alright, so, I actually enjoyed this game. Not in a "Oh man, this game is like the Citizen Kane of games", or even the "This game is pretty good technically". I liked this game because it was an "Aliens" game, and as a fan of Alien, that's why I bought the game (I actually have the collcetors edition). If you're a diehard Alien fan, you'll smile a few times throughout this game. You'll love the sound of your M41, you'll get excited the first time you climb into a Loader, and you'll squeel when you see some of Alien's iconic scenes recreated for you to fight in.Now, is it *good*? No, not at all. The sounds were glitchy, the graphics were sub par, and the story was pretty dumb. If this game went on sale for $5, I'd recommend it, but not for any more money than that. It was a fun experience to have, and I'm not worse off for having played it.

content:
Posted: February 18, 2013
												Feb 13 2013Aliens: Colonial Marine. First impressions when launching - there is hope for something smooth and cold about the screen that first launches before you press to play the game. The intro begins and the facial animation seems a generation behind. I work my way into the ship and computer consoles aren't even readable - Duke Nukem era! Graphically this may have been toned down to provide smooth play even on lower end machines. I hope for a graphics overhaul in an upcoming patch or that the GIGS of data somehow includes it. My little handheld motion detector has proven mostly useless so far .... [this was 20 minutes of play, SP campaign]Continued: Saw a few glitches with terrain during the next bit of single player. The audio seems ok enough, but having a hard time with the level of detail that's really needed to immerse yourself in the SP experience. The scripted AI for some of your fellows seems a bit weak and most of the time aliens ignore your AI side and come for you. The co-op with friends and multiplayer must be the saving grace of this title. As is, so far, 5/10 for average but certainly not stellar.

content:
Posted: February 14, 2013
												This game is janky as hell. I was so hyped up and such a fan. Seeing the end result of this really makes me wish they just gave the project to someone else or canned development of Borderlands 2 to focus on this. (And I enjoyed my time with Borderlands 2, but I'm a way bigger fan of Aliens)Like, holy♥♥♥♥♥♥what happened Gearbox? The single player campaign is sort of a mess. ♥♥♥♥♥♥ AI and awful textures. Everything feels so rushed. (it probably was) Also an unanswered plot hole introduced by the game. What in the world? This game really could have been so much more...Multiplayer is slightly buggy but for the most part quite fun to play and probably it's only redeeming quality. You can customize your loadouts and appearances, although loadout customization for Marines isn't anything special outside of changing your gun's alt-fire. I just like being a Colonial Marine. Give this a month or so and I predict multiplayer to be mostly dead unfortunately. Time will tell.There is a lot of other stuff that people give this game♥♥♥♥♥♥for like.... new alien breeds, weapon modifications like reflex sights and voice acting, which you know, to each their own, but didn't bother me. In fact I think it's really just people nitpicking, but whatever. Either way this game is still... not good as a whole product. It's not like the worst thing ever, but it's probably around a 4-5/10 score overall.Everyone is ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ on this game and in a way, rightfully so (This game got hyped up like crazy by Gearbox) but as an Aliens superfan, I still enjoyed my time with this game. It's a shame that this game is in such shambles because I fear this might mark the end of Aliens video games (not counting Aliens vs Predator, but ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ I don't care about Predators and would rather they drop that franchise)If you are a Alien superfan (particularly if you ever had any interest in extended universe stuff), consider getting this at a very cheap sale price, otherwise you may want to pass.

content:
Posted: January 9, 2014
												Overall 3/5Dated textures. Jerky animations. Clipping models. Convoluted storyline. Bugged cutscenes. Terrible lighting. Horrible hit detection, especially in multiplayer. Bugged enemies, and animations. Multiplayer is a little more polished, with a wide range of appearance customization (my favourite,) for both Marines and Aliens. All Marine weapons are customizable, in skins, accessories, and secondary fire mechanics…But many of the options are repetitive between different guns, leaving the decent sized weapon roster feeling small and bland. Entire fight scenes, missions, and scenarios in trailers and screenshots are missing, or unfinished…One level worth playing, variation of Alien strains, and the fact that I’ve been a fan of the series since I was itty bitty are the only reasons I enjoyed the game at all.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 29, 2013
												Rating: 4/10There is too much to be said about this game. If you haven't heard already, Aliens: Colonial Marines maybe one of the biggest failures this year. While the graphics aren't so terrible, and the environments are beautiful, the gameplay of this work resembles what would be an Aliens game made by Infinity Ward and Activision. Yes, this is the Call of Duty of the Aliens franchise. The player is put in the role of Cpl. Christopher T. Winter, a grunt in the USCM. The entire game is an investigation mission that is full of plot holes and paradoxes that conflict with the story from the films that are even acknowledged within the dialogue, but pushed aside by unjustified reasons. If you are not a super fanatic like some, or if you have not seen the movies, the plot in this game may not be so big of a deal.In the single player gameplay, you'll find that Call of Duty feeling being revealed in that first, your enemies aren't really xenomorphs at all, they are just lemmings in Halloween costumes. They don't behave anything like a xenomorph really does or how they did in the demo (which is entirely absent from the actual game), being that they hardly use the walls or ceilings as strategic surfaces, and they just run at you not trying their gift of natural stealth at all. This calls for some strange thoughts later on when you realize that you've just mowed down over two hundred of these things that killed a squad of twelve marines without losing many numbers other than to automated turrets. It's also due to the stupidity of these enemies that even a new player could go through the whole campaign on Ultimate Badass mode without being very challenged. Second, only three levels of the ten are spent fighting aliens, in the game of the Aliens title. Why is this? Because the other six are focused on fighting Weyland Yutani mercenaries. It really breaks down to being three levels of xenomorphs, three levels of mercenaries, three that are a mix of the two, and the rather disappointing boss "battle" level at the end. The replayability is nearly pointless, as there is no choices or different outcomes to be experienced, and so the only benefit is going back is for achievements (much like Call of Duty), and to complete single player challenges to unlock marine customization pieces.I can really only award points to the competitive multiplayer game modes. The weapon and character customization of the player's multiplayer marine and three aliens gives some fans one of there virtual fantasies in being able to do so, and on top of that the aliens are acutally difficult as they should be when controlled by other players. The maps are well constructed and the game modes are entertaining, so it deserves good points there, but the multiplayer just cannot make up for the rest of the game. I would reccomend buying this game on a sale if you have the patience.

Posted: February 3, 2015
												Now, I'm saying this from the perspective of a hardcore fan of the Alien MOVIES (there's been a ton of paraphernalia lousily related to the seies, but it has convoluted the story beyond comprehension. And don't get me started on the Aliens vs Predator thing...), which I only count to be: -Alien-AliensThe Third one was terrible (who in the flying hell came up with Hicks' death? He -or she- should be hanged by his/her intimate parts!) and the fourth was so lame that its only saving grace was Sigourney Weaver.Yet, this game... it's a complicated business.----------Gameplay-------------Your standard FPS: you are part of the most badass soldiers of the universe (the United States Colonial Marines -OOORRAAAH!!-) and you have to kill the evil ones (slimmy, sneaky, ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ic, Xenomorphs) with all the weapons at your disposal (including the iconic and beloved M41A Pulse Rifle). Aside of a few interactions which you only trigger by pressing E in the right moment, there's no deviation to this formula. The Challenges make it a bit more fun, but most of them are piece of cake to complete. ---8/10-------------Graphics---------------Average. At best. Definitely a extreme downgrade from what we were shown at the E3 all those years ago. Still, if you are like me you don't look for photorealism, but rather the amount of detail put into the environments. And it's all there: the famous locations of the movie are recreated to the milimeter (or milimetre, if that's the word used in your country), and those which are supposed to be destroyed by the movie events are made to still look on par with the Universe's graphic style. One of the things people object the most is HOW DID HADLEY'S HOPE REMAIN SOMEWHAT INTACT THROUGHOUT THE NUCLEAR-LIKE EXPLOSION?! Well, if the thing was built with the same metal as the starships like SULACO, it makes absolute sense. But that's just me using logic, don't account for it. One probem I did have with graphics, but it concerns the graphic engine more, I guess: the Xeno's animations are laggy. In one moment they are hanging in the ceiling and at the next they have teleported back to the ground. Their running animations are... funny, too, and there are a few bugs here and there when the Xenos come out from the vents... like getting stuck in the entrance... but none of these are game-breaking bugs at all, I guess it's just a thing that naturally happens when you have a character wth too many joints and animation points, but I could be wrong. Also, the character's faces remain stiff even during dialog (most notable in Stasis Interrupted)  and their lips sometimes don't move during in-game dialog.  ---7/10--------------Singleplayer----------Campaign is, in a few words... lacking. It's not bad, at any rate, but it's way too short, you are just barely warming up to it and then... boom, it's over. The ending hints at a sequel, but with the bad ratings this game (unfairly) got, I doubt that will be happening anytime soon. Sadly, there's also a problem with dialogs: they get to be boring and bland at times, almost like the script-writers didn't bothered to double and triple-check what they had just written, and the actors just didn't know how to make those lines work. Furthermore, there are some plotholes in the story that you can only fill doing two things: collecting the audio logs scattered throughout the campaign AND buying the Stasis Interrupted DLC campaign (or going to the AVP wikia and read the game's plot). The plus side is that it rolls back the awful mistakes made with the Universe's plot in Ali3n and Resurrection and they came up with a really good way to un-kill Dwayne Hicks, although Stasis Interrupted SHOULD HAVE BEEN IN THE BASE GAME FROM THE BEGINNING. ---8/10---------------Multiplayer-----------In one word? Dead. Not completely, but finding a match is a long and boring process that'll surely frustrate you. To get around this, do as I did: befriend complete strangers that share your liking for this game, they'll maybe even begin to grow on you. Once you get into the actual multiplayer, you'll find that it's a battle between two completely different and asymetric sides: the long-range, automatic fire-power wielding Colonial Marines, and the melee-proeficient and sneaky Xenomorphs. Both sides have their own advantages, and the amount of firepower laying around in the maps seems to favor the Colonial Marines, while the map layout in itself and the plentiful sneaking spots favor the Xenos when it matters. This doesn't take away the fact that Xenos appear to be more favored than the Marines, which forces the players on the Marines' side to rely in teamwork to hunt down even a single Xeno oponent. If you don't like competitive game modes then there's the 4-player coop campaign, in which you and your friends can replay the standard and SI campaigns. The best feature of this is that if you are already playing the campaign solo your friends can join anytime in the middle of the match. Sadly, like I said, you'll definitely need friends to enjoy these modes fully, because otherwise you'll get frustrated by the matchmaking. ---8/10---------------DLC----------------Mediocre at best. The Bug Hunt DLC (again) SHOULD HAVE BEEN IN THE BASE GAME FROM THE BEGINNING! The only DLC worth acquiring is Stasis Interrupted, for the sake of storytelling. From then on? SEGA's desire to rip us off with unworthy DLC is apparent to even the greatest dimwit. ---4/10---------------Overall--------------It could have been better, but this game is not bad at any rate. Considering its history, and the development cycle it went through, it's not a surprise that the final product didn't live up to the hype it had built up. However, in an of itself, the game is very, very solid, just a bit rough around the edges. Sadly, this might be the last we'll hear from Colonial Marines, since the bad rep it unfairly got will surely affect any decision concerning a sequel. Fingers crossed that they decide to give it another go, and that Gearbox learned from the mistakes it made. ---7/10---

												Personally, I feel like this game deserved slightly better reviews than it recieved by major critics, yet at the same time I can understand their low ratings.  While this game is a lot of fun, it felt like it was lacking in certain areaas.   The Multiplayer can be a blast, but the single player isn't as engaging as I expected. content:
Posted: January 21, 2014
												I should have known better than to fall for the hype of a licensed game, even if the intellectual property was invented years ago.  Colonial Marines didn’t have to be perfect, it just had to be ok, the prospect of 4 player co-op story is always enough to keep a game afloat if it is at least half way decent.  Aliens is boring with awful A.I and uninspired gameplay, inspired by the wonderful films from the 90s.  The biggest shame of all is how many times I tried to play it for the sake of completion and couldn’t find anyone online to play with.  In short, the community is a totally dead and the game is sub-par at best.  Should you buy this?Not even in a steam sale unless you have 3 other friends willing to help you lower the bar.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 11
												So, WOW. What can I say about this game? Dear lord. What an experience. What an experience!Basically, if you came to see 'Aliens: The Movie: The Game' then you probably came to the right place. Sort of. Except not really. Honestly, where Aliens was smart (and it wasn't even that smart), Colonial Marines is dumb, where Aliens built tension, this game just says "OKAY ROOM CLEAR MOVE ONTO THE NEXT ROOM WHERE YOU KILL GUYS", where Aliens had a deliciously well-written story and characters, this game has none of that.Yeah, I guess, I mean, at least there's the nostalgia trip! On occasion! Like three times total! Did you wanna see the space jockey? Well you damn well will (albeit with some certain qualities missing)! Did you wanna see Hadley's Hope after the fact? Well, you'll see that too! Sort of! Some of it! Yeah. That's pretty much it. And you know what, Hicks and Bishop are both in this game, which is awesome, excepting the fact that you're going to have to suffer through about 80% of the game just to get here.So you know what, whereas I actually started off by thinking this game isn't so bad, hey I might even recommend it, I'm sorry, the majority of the game is just so bad that I'm afraid I can't. I don't really know how to describe it, because literally everything just feels rushed and low quality - if you really want a good Alien game, I can recommend Aliens vs Predator (2010), it's an infinitely better polished game.I mean, this game, Colonial Marines was just rushed out the door way, way too fast, it just simply wasn't ready to be released in 2013, and the publishers or whoever was at the top clearly didn't notice this, or care. So, sadly I can't recommend this. It's just not fun.

												So firstly I picked this up cheap in a Steam Sale and secondly I only played it in Dec 2014. As a result most of the complaints about it being pricey and buggy didnt apply as they seem to have patched out any problems the game had. PLayed great, looked awesome and the aliens were numerous, fast and totally in keeping with the later movies.Only did the single player run through and while the ending was a little weak the journey there was a lot of fun.Is this a great Alien game? No. You want Isolation for that. Is it a great Aliens game? Yeah. Seen people complain the game makes the aliens into cannon fodder.... sorry, James Cameron did that with the film.Bottom line it's a good shooter and if you're a fan of the movies there's a lot of cool stuff to check out and recognise. Stick it on your wishlist, nab it next time it's on sale.

number of helpful: 3 of 6 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 11, 2014
												Aliens: Colonial Marines, why in the world would anyone recommend this game? Well we have to downgrade our expectations.I would recommend this game if the following things are in order.1) The game is on sale for 5,- or less2) You are a big fan of the Alien franchise3) You pretend the game was made in 20044) You have just watched Aliens 2 and are in the moodLock yourself up, put on the 5.1 surround sound, light a candle and play this game with the film grain overlay on.The singleplayer campaign is better than Call of Duty Ghost, it is lineair as hell but you are not fighting from cutscene to cutscene. This was something which I enjoyed as it felt like I had more freedom (although you don't have any at all). The exploration in this game is also very very low. Several times I found a nice looking secret, but I hit an invisible wall. There was potential for secrets here. The only exploration has to offer is a hidden full armor pick up. The legendary weapens aren't hidden at all but in plain sight. They had the options to make nice secrets but they didn't. It's a recurring feeling the game gives.The story, something which should have been important as it is canon, is sadly very lazy written and doesn't take big risks at all. There was only one moment which sparked my enthusiasm, but for a campaign of several missions long that is not enough. The few cutscenes made in the campaign are terribly done, it looks like it was cutting edge in 1998. One positive thing I like was the level design. You can see and feel that there has been put in a lot of love in them. The architects really do deserve a pat on the back for this. It's just a shame the graphics are such a let down. pros- Alien fans might enjoy it.- Level Design is good.- Better gameplay than Call of Duty: Ghosts.- They are patching things up.cons- Terrible graphics (it's really not ok).- Lazy uninspired story.- They need to patch things up.

content:
Posted: March 31, 2014
												Quite possibly the biggest pile of♥♥♥♥♥♥♥I have ever played.I bought this wretched pile of horse manure in a sale for £1.99 months ago. I only installed it a few days ago. Let me tell you folks, I wish I had never bothered. I wish I would have spent that change on a decent game. In fact it would have been more entertaining to throw the money out of the window and watch tramps chase the coins down the street. Dodging cars and punching each other in the face as they seek out the money for a pint to quench thier alcohol problem. That would be better than playing, or even witnessing this awful waste of a franchise. This pitiful excuse for a first person shooter. It's bad on so many levels that I dont know where to begin.How about the fact that the graphics are like something from 2001? It looks and runs like balls. It's got a ♥♥♥♥ing film grain filter that looks worse than the ones from Silent Hill 2 on ps2. Oh Shades you might say, but that's to make it look more eighties. No it's not, it's to cover up the fact that the graphics are awful. The textures are♥♥♥♥♥♥ The guns look worse than those in Doom 3. A ♥♥♥♥ing nigh on 10 year old game. In fact the whole of Doom 3 looks better than this piece of♥♥♥♥♥♥ And plays a whole lot better too.At the begining of this turgid by the numbers travesty you witness a sequence clearly designed to remind you of an awesome scene from Aliens. But instead of having control of your marine, and actually being able to walk around the ship, you are locked in a first person cut scene as your commander rabbles on at you in a poor copy of the movie scene. This happens time and time again. Sets and action sequences designed to play on your nostalgia. Hey, there's Hadleys Hope. Is that the bit of floor Hudson got pulled through? Hey that's cool, I've found Vasquez's dog tags for no apparant ♥♥♥♥ing reason. The thing is the movie was perfect. When you put these great sets or little reminders of the movie in all it does is remind you how terrible this game is. Yea, Gearbox you dumb ♥♥♥♥s, I have Aliens on DVD. Don't make me watch your version of events! Now, the only bit i enjoyed was the one part where you hide from a blind alien in the sewers. It was basically Amnesia with a Xenomorph and was really well done it must be said. Compared to the rest of the game it's like a bunch of gorrila's throwing♥♥♥♥♥♥at a wall until one of those bits of♥♥♥♥♥♥somehow turned out looking like the Mona Lisa. The rest of the time you're shooting Aliens who act ♥♥♥♥ all like the film. Instead of doing cool♥♥♥♥♥♥like pulling you into vents or ambushing you they just appear and run straight into your gunfire.You have to cover your dumbass buddy every five minutes as he hacks/fixes/scratches his♥♥♥♥♥♥ While waves of suicidal non-acid blood xenomorphs run right for you. Sometimes he has to cover you while you hack/fix/scratch your♥♥♥♥♥♥and it's even worse as he can't hit a ♥♥♥♥ing barn door.And you know what? Do you know ♥♥♥♥ing what? The worst thing is that most of the damn time you're fighting ♥♥♥♥ING HUMANS. They may as well have called it Marines: Colonial Marines.You think the Alien levels are bad? The Alien levels are like having cancer. It's bad but you're getting Chemo. You get cured (which is going to the next level) So to celebrate you hire a hooker. You then find out that hooker had AIDS! And you didn't use protection because you're ♥♥♥♥ing stupid. But even that is not as bad as playing this.

content:
Posted: January 29, 2015
												Rating: 6.5/10 Recommended only at 5$ and underOverview: First Person ShooterThe Good:+Play within the alien universe spread across 11 levels. Each level taking place in some part of the movie universe.+Multiple weapons that can be upgraded by leveling up and completing challenges+Great use of lighting and atmosphere+Great music and sound effectsThe Average:Human AI, they are not particularly good but not horrible either.  Lots of glitches, nothing too severe but enough to distract me from the overall experience. The most notable one is when I hit a checkpoint in the level and my npc allies magically teleport infront of me. Things like that really take you out of the overall experience Overall the graphics don't stand out to much compared to other FPS games on the market. The story is held back by some poor dialogue.The Bad:- The first major problem is the alien AI. Its just so basic. They charge at you ignoring any npcs firing at them. If they do attack any of your allies, once you get within range they will ignore them completely and charge at you again.  - There is no tension or suspense in a game that is trying to be about tension and suspense. The reason for this is because every enemy encounter is just wave after wave of aliens attacking making your motion tracking obsolete. In the very first level you fight wave after wave of enemies. Rather than building up to this moment they just get it out of the way early on leaving very little room to build upon later on in the game. Personally I would rather have much less enemies however make each enemy encounter more engaging. In the entire 10 hour experience I never really felt threaten or frightened by any of the aliens because they were so predictable. - The game has a few enemy types and you will be fighting 2 enemies for the majority of the game, human soldiers and aliens that rush you. - Probably one of my biggest annoyances with this game is the frustrating deaths. Health gets too low and aliens can one shot kill you, add in some annoying bugs and the frustration level starts going up fast, then you add in some bad checkpoint placement and you have a recipe for a very frustrating game. If I didn't force myself to beat the first level I may have stopped altogether. - Multiplayer community is all but dead and the match making in this game is atrocious. ConclusionIt's not that this game is objectively bad, IT IS playable in its current form however the game is average. In today's market a FPS game cannot be just average and expect it to do well. Like most average games, this game misses so many opportunities to make it good, the underlying foundation is there but no ideas are taken a step further to make the game better. At times I felt like I was playing a call of duty game with an alien remap but with worse combat scenarios. Only buy if you can get this on discount.

content:
Posted: March 30, 2015
												A game overlooked by many, Aliens: Colonial Marines has always received very mixed reviews. As far as I can tell - based on my current experience of the game - most of the negative ratings are unfounded. The game in question is very different from many of its' predecessors in more ways than one; the versus system being perhaps the most outstanding factor. (My only other experience of a game from this series would be Aliens vs Predator, and I can only speak from personal experience, so this may be a little biased.) The combat system is on a whole different scale, from a style which verges on a fighting game (Aliens vs Predator) to a game which provides a lot more flexibility through the use of multiple different loadouts and classes for both aliens and marines. The flexibility of Colonial Marines is not limited solely to the combat choices available however, there is also a large variety of aesthetics available (too much in some cases - when am I going to need four survival knives? I'm not General Grievous) including different emblems, tones and camouflage to set yourself aside from your team mates. It is my belief that the majority of negative ratings have stemmed from the fact that this product was majorly over-hyped and falsely advertised before release; this game was made out to be something it most definitely was not, and if it had advertised itself as the game it actually became then it may have received a much warmer welcome.I would say that Aliens: Colonial Marines is definitely worth the pocket change, if not for the customisation then for the large variety of combat styles made available to the aliens (boilers, spitters, soldiers, crushers and so on). Worth it!

content:
Posted: November 22, 2014
												I got this since it has come down heavily in price since it first came out and while I was harsh on it when it first came out I can see it in a new light. It's not a bad game by any means but it is rather bland and adds nothing new. If anything it's a cookie cutter FPS game.The story line is all over the place and laced with plot holes. If anything the DLC even adds more rather than fixing some. Also these shooty shooty bang bang type dudebro marine type games really miss the whole point of the alien series at heart.However the game has been patched since it's problematic release in 2013 which fixes a lot of issues and with the help of mods you can really polish things up and bring it a little closer to the demo. I'd recommend the cilitbng pack, ENB/Sweet FX mods and Aliens Survival Experience. There's also some great add ons and multiplayer mods that really overhall the experence for online play with more in the pipes.I do think gearbox should have put out an SDK or modding tools to win back some of the playerbase as well as trust but thats wishful thinking anyway.If you are a diehard fan of the alien series you may get some enjoyment out of this, patched up and with some mods it can be fun and it's not badly priced as well.positives*Fairly decent FPS game.*Multiplayer can be fun.*With some mods it can be polished up a bit.*Good price.*It does capture some elements of the second movie.Negatives*Textures are really meh at times.*Storyline is a mess and full of plot holes.*Can be bland at times and really drags out.

content:
Posted: December 10, 2014
												So firstly I picked this up cheap in a Steam Sale and secondly I only played it in Dec 2014. As a result most of the complaints about it being pricey and buggy didnt apply as they seem to have patched out any problems the game had. PLayed great, looked awesome and the aliens were numerous, fast and totally in keeping with the later movies.Only did the single player run through and while the ending was a little weak the journey there was a lot of fun.Is this a great Alien game? No. You want Isolation for that. Is it a great Aliens game? Yeah. Seen people complain the game makes the aliens into cannon fodder.... sorry, James Cameron did that with the film.Bottom line it's a good shooter and if you're a fan of the movies there's a lot of cool stuff to check out and recognise. Stick it on your wishlist, nab it next time it's on sale.

content:
Posted: June 19, 2014
												~THIS GAME IS NOT FOR EVERYONE~Despite the crazy hype and controversy surrounding this game the only big playing points for getting this game is A) Multiplayer Mode and B) If you’re a big fan of the Aliens franchise. If neither interests you then this game is not for you.The single player campaign is average at best, while co-op is slightly better (you still have AI teammates following you around to progress the story) and reminiscent of Left4Dead with xenomorphs instead of the undead.  The story is weakest compared to other games in the franchise, which makes some changes to the Aliens storyline (Then again anything after Alien 3 is a sloppy mess). The upside is weapons, perks, and equipment you setup in multiplayer carry over into single player, making for more diverse gameplay.Multiplayer is where the fun is at, wtih the many game modes that add all the excitment that the campaign is missing, with CoD style customized equipment loadout, perks, and weapon customization. But despite multiplayer being is greatest strength, it is also it’s undoing as finding a game can take a long time if at all, depending on how many people are on it.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 19, 2014
												I tried to like this game, since I love the Aliens world. Problem is this game feels like it was made by people who never once watched the Aliens movie. Even on easy I have to dump 20 rounds into an alien with my AI teammate to drop just one. What happened to 10mm caseless, exploding roungs? Oh, that's right, no one making this game watched the movie. Then they might have realized that the pulse rifle doesn't have 40 rounds, but 99 rounds and the bullets explode. Guess it's supposed to make it more intense by dropping bullet damage and magazine count or something. The pulse rifle feels like any other SMG you've used in any number of FPS games. You could drop this gun into CoD and not feel like you're firing future tech, but current tech. Another game in the long line of Aliens universe games that can't get the Marines right. If you want the aliens feel, then you need overwelming odds. Put more aliens on my screen.For a little refernce in the Aliens movie, LV-426 is occupied by 70 families. That gives us between 140 and 210 aliens easily. Which in 1986 they couldn't show these massive amounts of aliens with the special effects at the time. Which is why you only saw a couple of aliens on screen at any given time. Yet the feel/narrative was that the marines were facing overwelming odds. One day a game developer will actually watch the the Aliens movie and take notes about the universe before making a game. This game is not it.

content:
Posted: June 26, 2014
												I understand why some did not like this game, I personaly did not care for any of it that strayed unbelievably far away from what it was supposed to be based on story wise, Like fighting other human forces, there was enough to deal with Alien wise there was no need for that side tracking.   But even that was tolerable over the stupid section venturing through the sewers sneaking by mutated husks of Aliens, with no weapons! That section totally blew chunks! There was absolutely nothing like that in any of the Alien movies or games.  Sometimes the AI in the single player game was useless when relating on those accompanying you, sometimes they were beneficial sometimes they could even lead you into trouble.  Now that I've covered the things I did not like, I am recommending this game simply because of all the Alien games I've played, this was not the worst and at times it is rather enjoyable.  However do not pay more than about 5 bucks for it through a steam special sale, you cannot beat it for 5 bucks.  The smartgun auto targeted perfect for me as I read some had problems with it but I had none.  If you haven't played it and you are an Alien vs Predator game fan from wayyyy back, you'll probably like it as well.Edit: January 9th 2017,  I really do absolutelely love some of the levels in the game as I have played through it a few times now I truly love the Smart Gun the little bit you actually get to use it is worth replaying those levels.   I also like the fact after playing through you do not loose your weapon upgrades you keep them.   A couple of tips, if you have access to the double barrel shotgun don't use it, it takes too long to reload, and don't even pickup a flame thrower that weapon is totally useless it will get you killed.   Hudsons Pulse rifle and the main pulse rifle you acquire completely maxed out are excellent for the hord type of Alien attack, Hudson rifle only fires bursts so you have to get used to it, rolling back and forth between those 2 weapons can save you in an intense situation.   It is faster to change weapons than reload, just be sure you did not forget to have the weapon you switch to fully loaded.   Sometimes it is nice to go back to games you've already played and play them again, and that's what I'm doing with this game right now!

content:
Posted: March 31, 2014
												Quite possibly the biggest pile of♥♥♥♥♥♥♥I have ever played.I bought this wretched pile of horse manure in a sale for £1.99 months ago. I only installed it a few days ago. Let me tell you folks, I wish I had never bothered. I wish I would have spent that change on a decent game. In fact it would have been more entertaining to throw the money out of the window and watch tramps chase the coins down the street. Dodging cars and punching each other in the face as they seek out the money for a pint to quench thier alcohol problem. That would be better than playing, or even witnessing this awful waste of a franchise. This pitiful excuse for a first person shooter. It's bad on so many levels that I dont know where to begin.How about the fact that the graphics are like something from 2001? It looks and runs like balls. It's got a ♥♥♥♥ing film grain filter that looks worse than the ones from Silent Hill 2 on ps2. Oh Shades you might say, but that's to make it look more eighties. No it's not, it's to cover up the fact that the graphics are awful. The textures are♥♥♥♥♥♥ The guns look worse than those in Doom 3. A ♥♥♥♥ing nigh on 10 year old game. In fact the whole of Doom 3 looks better than this piece of♥♥♥♥♥♥ And plays a whole lot better too.At the begining of this turgid by the numbers travesty you witness a sequence clearly designed to remind you of an awesome scene from Aliens. But instead of having control of your marine, and actually being able to walk around the ship, you are locked in a first person cut scene as your commander rabbles on at you in a poor copy of the movie scene. This happens time and time again. Sets and action sequences designed to play on your nostalgia. Hey, there's Hadleys Hope. Is that the bit of floor Hudson got pulled through? Hey that's cool, I've found Vasquez's dog tags for no apparant ♥♥♥♥ing reason. The thing is the movie was perfect. When you put these great sets or little reminders of the movie in all it does is remind you how terrible this game is. Yea, Gearbox you dumb ♥♥♥♥s, I have Aliens on DVD. Don't make me watch your version of events! Now, the only bit i enjoyed was the one part where you hide from a blind alien in the sewers. It was basically Amnesia with a Xenomorph and was really well done it must be said. Compared to the rest of the game it's like a bunch of gorrila's throwing♥♥♥♥♥♥at a wall until one of those bits of♥♥♥♥♥♥somehow turned out looking like the Mona Lisa. The rest of the time you're shooting Aliens who act ♥♥♥♥ all like the film. number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 11
												So, WOW. What can I say about this game? Dear lord. What an experience. What an experience!Basically, if you came to see 'Aliens: The Movie: The Game' then you probably came to the right place. Sort of. Except not really. Honestly, where Aliens was smart (and it wasn't even that smart), Colonial Marines is dumb, where Aliens built tension, this game just says "OKAY ROOM CLEAR MOVE ONTO THE NEXT ROOM WHERE YOU KILL GUYS", where Aliens had a deliciously well-written story and characters, this game has none of that.Yeah, I guess, I mean, at least there's the nostalgia trip! On occasion! Like three times total! Did you wanna see the space jockey? Well you damn well will (albeit with some certain qualities missing)! Did you wanna see Hadley's Hope after the fact? Well, you'll see that too! Sort of! Some of it! Yeah. That's pretty much it. And you know what, Hicks and Bishop are both in this game, which is awesome, excepting the fact that you're going to have to suffer through about 80% of the game just to get here.So you know what, whereas I actually started off by thinking this game isn't so bad, hey I might even recommend it, I'm sorry, the majority of the game is just so bad that I'm afraid I can't. I don't really know how to describe it, because literally everything just feels rushed and low quality - if you really want a good Alien game, I can recommend Aliens vs Predator (2010), it's an infinitely better polished game.I mean, this game, Colonial Marines was just rushed out the door way, way too fast, it just simply wasn't ready to be released in 2013, and the publishers or whoever was at the top clearly didn't notice this, or care. So, sadly I can't recommend this. It's just not fun.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 3, 2015
												Now, I'm saying this from the perspective of a hardcore fan of the Alien MOVIES (there's been a ton of paraphernalia lousily related to the seies, but it has convoluted the story beyond comprehension. And don't get me started on the Aliens vs Predator thing...), which I only count to be: -Alien-AliensThe Third one was terrible (who in the flying hell came up with Hicks' death? He -or she- should be hanged by his/her intimate parts!) and the fourth was so lame that its only saving grace was Sigourney Weaver.Yet, this game... it's a complicated business.----------Gameplay-------------Your standard FPS: you are part of the most badass soldiers of the universe (the United States Colonial Marines -OOORRAAAH!!-) and you have to kill the evil ones (slimmy, sneaky, ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ic, Xenomorphs) with all the weapons at your disposal (including the iconic and beloved M41A Pulse Rifle). Aside of a few interactions which you only trigger by pressing E in the right moment, there's no deviation to this formula. The Challenges make it a bit more fun, but most of them are piece of cake to complete. ---8/10-------------Graphics---------------Average. At best. Definitely a extreme downgrade from what we were shown at the E3 all those years ago. Still, if you are like me you don't look for photorealism, but rather the amount of detail put into the environments. And it's all there: the famous locations of the movie are recreated to the milimeter (or milimetre, if that's the word used in your country), and those which are supposed to be destroyed by the movie events are made to still look on par with the Universe's graphic style. One of the things people object the most is HOW DID HADLEY'S HOPE REMAIN SOMEWHAT INTACT THROUGHOUT THE NUCLEAR-LIKE EXPLOSION?! Well, if the thing was built with the same metal as the starships like SULACO, it makes absolute sense. But that's just me using logic, don't account for it. One probem I did have with graphics, but it concerns the graphic engine more, I guess: the Xeno's animations are laggy. In one moment they are hanging in the ceiling and at the next they have teleported back to the ground. Their running animations are... funny, too, and there are a few bugs here and there when the Xenos come out from the vents... like getting stuck in the entrance... but none of these are game-breaking bugs at all, I guess it's just a thing that naturally happens when you have a character wth too many joints and animation points, but I could be wrong. Also, the character's faces remain stiff even during dialog (most notable in Stasis Interrupted)  and their lips sometimes don't move during in-game dialog.  ---7/10--------------Singleplayer----------Campaign is, in a few words... lacking. It's not bad, at any rate, but it's way too short, you are just barely warming up to it and then... boom, it's over. The ending hints at a sequel, but with the bad ratings this game (unfairly) got, I doubt that will be happening anytime soon. Sadly, there's also a problem with dialogs: they get to be boring and bland at times, almost like the script-writers didn't bothered to double and triple-check what they had just written, and the actors just didn't know how to make those lines work. Furthermore, there are some plotholes in the story that you can only fill doing two things: collecting the audio logs scattered throughout the campaign AND buying the Stasis Interrupted DLC campaign (or going to the AVP wikia and read the game's plot). The plus side is that it rolls back the awful mistakes made with the Universe's plot in Ali3n and Resurrection and they came up with a really good way to un-kill Dwayne Hicks, although Stasis Interrupted SHOULD HAVE BEEN IN THE BASE GAME FROM THE BEGINNING. ---8/10---------------Multiplayer-----------In one word? Dead. Not completely, but finding a match is a long and boring process that'll surely frustrate you. To get around this, do as I did: befriend complete strangers that share your liking for this game, they'll maybe even begin to grow on you. Once you get into the actual multiplayer, you'll find that it's a battle between two completely different and asymetric sides: the long-range, automatic fire-power wielding Colonial Marines, and the melee-proeficient and sneaky Xenomorphs. Both sides have their own advantages, and the amount of firepower laying around in the maps seems to favor the Colonial Marines, while the map layout in itself and the plentiful sneaking spots favor the Xenos when it matters. This doesn't take away the fact that Xenos appear to be more favored than the Marines, which forces the players on the Marines' side to rely in teamwork to hunt down even a single Xeno oponent. If you don't like competitive game modes then there's the 4-player coop campaign, in which you and your friends can replay the standard and SI campaigns. The best feature of this is that if you are already playing the campaign solo your friends can join anytime in the middle of the match. Sadly, like I said, you'll definitely need friends to enjoy these modes fully, because otherwise you'll get frustrated by the matchmaking. ---8/10---------------DLC----------------Mediocre at best. The Bug Hunt DLC (again) SHOULD HAVE BEEN IN THE BASE GAME FROM THE BEGINNING! The only DLC worth acquiring is Stasis Interrupted, for the sake of storytelling. From then on? SEGA's desire to rip us off with unworthy DLC is apparent to even the greatest dimwit. ---4/10---------------Overall--------------It could have been better, but this game is not bad at any rate. Considering its history, and the development cycle it went through, it's not a surprise that the final product didn't live up to the hype it had built up. However, in an of itself, the game is very, very solid, just a bit rough around the edges. Sadly, this might be the last we'll hear from Colonial Marines, since the bad rep it unfairly got will surely affect any decision concerning a sequel. Fingers crossed that they decide to give it another go, and that Gearbox learned from the mistakes it made. ---7/10---

content:
Posted: February 18
												This game is a hidden gem hiding in plain site. Yes I just said that. I am curious to see how critics respond to the game now? After all the bug fixes and graphical updates it has come a long way. It also doesn't hurt that the dlc explains and expands upon what was done in the main game. Rendering any plothole arguements mute. If you are a fan of Aliens you should like this collection. There is plenty of fan service. I recommend playing on ultimate badass difficulty for both the main campaign and dlc campaign for your first playthrough. You may run into some minor technical issues. If your chosen in game resolution refuses to stay upon relaunching, then just simply adjust the setting everytime you launch the game. Takes like 3 seconds. If your game restarts upon quitting then set it to run as administrator. Here is a post i made about the issue.File explorer - Local disk (C:) - program files (x86) - Steam - steamapps - common - Aliens Colonial Marines - Binaries - Win32 - right click ACM (mouse must be directly on top of the letters) - select properties - compatibility tab - Check Run this program as an administrator - click apply - and click ok.Now the game should no longer restart upon quitting.Is the game perfect? No, no game is perfect. Is it worth it if you're a fan of Aliens? Yes. I recommend having the ingame film grain setting on as it adds alot to the visuals.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 19, 2013
												During the last 6 months, the FPS genre has been on excellent form, thanks to Borderlands 2 and Far Cry 3. Sadly, compared to those games, ACM is terrible. The story is as basic as you can get. Weyland Yutani do something stupid, Aliens get loose, Marines kill them while trying to escape. There's a subplot about saving a Marine, but the player is given no reason to care about succeeding. In fact, because the dialogue is of the over the top stereotypical military jarhead variety, I actually found myself wishing they'd all just leave/die so I could fight alone. The levels are entirely linear, even during outdoor planet surface sections. There is some decent weapon variety, and an attempt at an upgrade system, but the complete lack of enemy variety renders this pointless. I only switched from the standard pulse rifle when I ran out of ammo. Squad/enemy AI is so bad that at times its actually funny. I cant even recommend this on a sale. Check my screenshots for more badness :)

content:
Posted: September 7, 2015
												I'm a bit confused why everyone hates this game so much?  Maybe because I got it way after its release so all the patches and what not have fixed whatever problems there were.  The game itself is a fanboy's absolute wet dream, having watched Aliens about a milion and 2 times I love all the references.  The gameplay is a bit twitchy but to be honest I've always hated the UT3 engine with a passion.  Its a crap engine, especially for FPS games.  The weapons are perfectly modeled and the sound effects are straight ripped from the film.  I actually find the Aliens themselves way better than previous AVP games as the don't move like ants and when you shoot them they don't just shatter into pieces.All in all an awesome movie licence with great atmosphere and tons of upgrades and silly addons for your weaponry.  The biggest downside is : UT3 Engine, so twitchy and overall never works properly.  And Gearbox. I HATE borderlands, even bought the retail game of the year edition and hated it so much I wanted to use it as a drink coaster, so I'm actually GLAD that other companies took over and finished the game.Its like playing the movie.  All I need is Bill Paxton saying "Game over man, game over!" when I die.

content:
Posted: January 10, 2014
												+ Nice atmosphere+ Nice movie inspired weapons+ Pretty awsome collectibles+ Very impressive recreation of original movie locations+ Nice story (though weird retcons)+ You can play campaign with your friends+ Movie acurate sounds and soundtrack+ New weapons, that feel very "Aliens" - Aliens are not all that terrifing- You can't play campaign with PUG with less then full group- Companions feels really stupid in combat- It takes some time to find you a multiplayer match- Nobody plays survivor, escape or extermantion anymoreAnd there are some weird things I do not know If I should take as + or - ie. (minor spoiler alert)There is a lots of fighting versus other humans (WY company) - it is interesting, at least lore-wise but perhaps it would be nicer to have more aliens instead, altough If I remember, fighting WY is in pretty much every other Alien (vs predator) game... As stated earlier, there is weird retcon, which is really not necessary, though personally I liked it...Overall: This game is NOT great, but it is good. It does not deserve the treatment it gets most of the time. It have decent graphics, decent story, decent enemies... so it is... well decent, to say the least... or most? If you are Alien fun, you should play it, if you're not you can avoid it and you won't miss anything. So my final verdict is... 6.5/10

												The co-op might be considered fun, if you're in an extremely generous mood.  Unfortunately, you'll still be left with the feeling that you were cheated out of your money as it's clear that this game was very poorly planned and executed by all parties involved with its development.  The further you advance through the game, the easier it is to see that they progressively cared less about delivering a quality product and more about simply meeting their deadline.  It's not unlike a 10-page essay written by an extreme (but slightly charming and able) procrastinator who uses double-spacing and 16 pt. font to make it look like a 10-page essay, and then proceeds to forget to check the spelling and grammar.It's likely that this game will leave you feeling quite bitter, since you can catch glimpses of all the potential that this game had which is, in the end, all completely wasted.

content:
Posted: December 17, 2014
												This review is for single player and coop. [Steam, or whoever, please stop ruining games by making Russian language only for certain regions. Just because some Russians live in my country does not mean we do not speak English and will tolerate piece-of-sh***t translations and dubbing; Spent lots of hours searching on forums on changing this game's language - no option in settings].This game is actually much better than its scores and completely worth the $2/$3 that it cost during the sales. It has been fixed and having finished the stasis interrupted dlc and first three chapters, I did not encounter any bugs mentioned in reviews (such as the funny one on rock paper shotgun), so they must have fixed a lot of things. Even if I see an alien stuck into the ceiling, I will assume that is realistic too because if one is coming out of walls and ceilings, there is a chance they could get stuck (especially with a full stomach).Graphics: Maps are well-designed, cut scenes are okay and aliens are not bad (not that different from Dead Space 3 when you come to think abou it). It helps to remove the film grain, turn down brightness and crank up all the settings to max (with sync frame on). The flashlight is a bit weak. 7/10Controls: at first they are a bit clunky and it is hard to learn how to switch between weapons but after some getting used to, they are okay. The tracker is very very useful to track the aliens in the dark. Checkpoints really suck, in some places you have to run through things until the next checkpoint. 8/10Sounds: Voice acting is okay and not terrible in fact; can't expect marines to sound like TV presenters; they should have normal voices; environment sounds are alright too; everything works well in my 5.1 surround sound set-up. Aliens sound better than Halo CE grunts. 8/10Story: story is average but enough to keep the game going; helps to play statis interrupted dlc first. 6/103D: I am playing this game in 3d using tridef's AVP profile; there are some slight fluid lines when you aim down the sights but with the laser sights on it does not matter much. 8/10COOP: Tried it in coop campaign with a friend and the story and cut-scenes are well integrated into gameplay. It does not feel like empty maps (as some co-op games feel nowadays). 8/10

number of helpful: 5 of 10 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 23, 2015
												I picked up Aliens: Colonial Marines for a couple dollars when it was on sale, I’m pretty big fan of the movies and I enjoyed 2010’s Alien Vs. Predator, so I thought, “Why the hell not?” I started it up and since then, I’ve really enjoyed it. I was then very shocked to see all the negative reviews for this game, because it really doesn’t deserve them. Many people complain about the poor story, and no it’s not an extremely rich and exciting story, but it’s a fairly decent at least. And plus, you don’t play an Alien game for the story. Others complain about the poor dialogue and voice acting, again it’s not Oscar-worthy, no, but it’s not anything to hate the game over. Another thing that some mention is the lack of horror. Aliens: Colonial Marines is capturing the feel of the movie Aliens, and the movie itself focuses on the action portion more than the horror aspect, so you shouldn’t be surprised to see more action than horror in a game based on an action movie.Aliens: Colonial Marines is an entertaining shooter game with a decent story, a good action element while still implementing some feel of horror. For the most part you are lurking around tight corridors and close quarters with Xenomorphs hiding in the shadows, waiting to strike. Just how an Alien game should be. And it just gets better if you add in some of your pals to fight alongside you. You can unlock and customize weapons such as a Pulse Rifle, Pump Shotgun, Battle Rifle, and more. You can use these guns in both Co-op/Solo campaign and online multiplayer. The game also has some references to the movie, such as finding Newt’s doll, finding and using Hudson’s Pulse Rifle, and few others. If you feel like you’ve gotten everything you’re going to get out of the game, check out some DLC’s. I strongly recommend Stasis Interrupted. It is its own campaign explaining the events leading up the main campaign, and explaining the events in-between Aliens and Alien 3. There are a few other to look at as well. I’m not asking for you love the game, but at least give it a chance, don’t just look at the reviews and expect crap. Also, actually play a decent amount of it before judging it so harshly.

content:
Posted: February 19, 2013
												During the last 6 months, the FPS genre has been on excellent form, thanks to Borderlands 2 and Far Cry 3. Sadly, compared to those games, ACM is terrible. The story is as basic as you can get. Weyland Yutani do something stupid, Aliens get loose, Marines kill them while trying to escape. There's a subplot about saving a Marine, but the player is given no reason to care about succeeding. In fact, because the dialogue is of the over the top stereotypical military jarhead variety, I actually found myself wishing they'd all just leave/die so I could fight alone. The levels are entirely linear, even during outdoor planet surface sections. There is some decent weapon variety, and an attempt at an upgrade system, but the complete lack of enemy variety renders this pointless. I only switched from the standard pulse rifle when I ran out of ammo. Squad/enemy AI is so bad that at times its actually funny. I cant even recommend this on a sale. Check my screenshots for more badness :)
