number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 20, 2014
												Never before in all the years I've been playing video games have I ever played something so ludicrously disappointing. If you're expecting to find the game promised in the E3 demos, you won't find it. That wasn't the game at all; this is, in all reality, one of the worst video games I've ever played.STORY:In terms of Alien lore, this game does fairly well. The story fits and makes sense. However, it is ruined by multiple groan-inducing plot twists and a face-palm ending. Characters are little more that emotionless puppets that offer no emotional value. The one character that you're actually intended to like has such a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ AI that you end up hating him the most out of everyone. The worst part, however, is the character that Gearbo brought back from the dead: Hicks. Yes, everyone, they brought back Hicks, even after we SAW HIM DIE in Alien 3, he came back, with the most horrible explanation for his return of all time. Even the DLC that was supposed to explain how he survived wasn't enough to to fill the plot hole left in the wake of the third movie.GRAPHICS:For a game of this generation, the graphics are absolutely unacceptable. It looks like a game developed in 2005. There are literal ♥♥♥♥-loads of screen tearing throughout the game, which is only worse on the console, ambient lighting and dynamic shading seem to have been thrown out altogether, textures are misplaced or completely absent altogether, and the worst part is the fact that the game requires higher PC specs that Crysis. I can run Crysis 3 at Ultra settings while still keeping a fairly good frame rate, yet I can barely run Aliens: Colonial Marines on the lowest graphic options available without awful screen lag. The only two things I can give props to for this game's visuals are the environments and the xenomorph designs. The environements, from the rocky hills of LV426 to the Alien hive below Hadley's Hope, the game makes you feel like you truly are in an Aliens movie. The xenomorph designs (assuming your PC can run max graphics) are beautifully flawless, detailed body designs all the way to the saliva on the fangs make the xenomorphs look beautiful. GAMEPLAY:This is possibly the worst part of the game. First of all, the xenomorphs are weaker than my five year old cousin. They run at you like idiots and attack with weak, meaningless maneuvers that leave you laughing at their stupidity. An unconceivable amount of glitches make the xenomorphs act like mental ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ that have no idea what they're doing. The game on its highest difficulty feels like I'm playing Call of Duty on recruit. Which brings me to my other point: the game is JUST LIKE CALL OF DUTY. The generic CoD gameplay takes you out of the action and makes you bored, you literally fight more human enemies than xenomorphs, and the mediocre run and shoot gameplay grows dull after the first mission. Even worse is that the motion tracker is virtually useless. Remember the AVP games where the motion tracker was your closest ally? Well, in Aliens: Colonial Marines, it might as well be a roleplaying tool. You can go through the whole game without ever using it. You don't need it at all, mainly because the xenomorphs are almost always at predictable spawn placements, are painfully slow, and hardy ever crawl on any other surface aside from the ground. That is indefinitely the worst part of the game.MULTIPLAYER:The multiplayer takes a delightful turn for the better. With extensive customization options for the humans and xenomorphs, players can truly personalize who they are on the multiplayer battlefield. Combat for the xenomorphs is quite unique and fun to toy around with, but I feel like they're very weak in comparison to their human adversaries. Maps are beautiful and have a great, asymetric flow that fits an Alien game. The only real downfall is the small amount of people that play it.VERDICT:Aliens: Colonial Marines is a lie. A big, fat, horrible lie. The E3 demos were never part of the game and were later revealed to only be computer-animated CGI. For a game that was in development for 6 years, it's insulting to be given such a piece of worthless trash. If you're an Aliens fan, stay away from this game. It will literally make you hat the series. If you want a good Aliens title, just play AVP 2000 Classic, AVP2, or even the AVP from 2010. Colonial Marines wasn't just the biggest disappointment in gaming history. It was one of the worst games ever mad.

number of helpful: 5 of 10 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 19, 2013
												Knowing full well that the majority of the community at large looks unfavorably at a game doesn't stop me from trying it for myself and just taking in the experience, whatever it's worth. People say Duke Nukem Forever is horrible, but I loved it. People say Sniper: Ghost Warrior and Homefront were bad; I found good in them. Everyone is different and I believe if you formulate your life around other people's opinions, you lose your sense of self. Furthermore, berating someone for liking something you don't or disliking something you do like only demonstrates your own insecurity.I actually enjoyed Aliens: Colonial Marines for the most part. Now this isn't a grade A quality game by any stretch, but the atmosphere was good, voice acting was respectable, and the story was almost decent. I'm not a huge Aliens fan, but when you pit marines versus a superior foreign species, how else can it play out without flat killing all the humans outright? I guess I wasn't expecting an Aliens versus Predator type matchup. The only thing that really got under my skin was the horrible lighting reflections throughout the game. I went so far as to install one of the popular mods to improve the issue, and while it was better, the graphics were still absolutely painful at times. The gameplay itself isn't impressive; just a generic first person shooter, although the weapon upgrades spruced it up a little bit. The game also occasionally crashed for me, but I suspect it may have been due to the installed mod.Certainly it's disappointing when you have a name like Gearbox attached to this title and you know what they are capable of, but the game is no worse than those other titles I mentioned. I enjoyed it for what it was, but I didn't set my expectations to a point where disappointment was the only outcome. Good bargain bin stuff for sure.

content:
Posted: June 27, 2016
												When this game was released I only read / heard bad things about it, especially that it seemed to be an unfinished product. Well, I can't really say anything about how things were before but I'm pretty sure that they were true since this game was heavily bombarded with negative reviews. Either way, there's this friend of mine who happens to be a hardcore Sega fan (even more than I) and he said that we should give it a try someday. Then there's this other friend of mine, who's always saying that everything is crap, this game included. I was actually surprised when he sent us a message someday saying that we should actually give it a try. I thought to myself: "Well, if he's saying this, there really must be something about it, perhaps the flaws were fixed". Now, I can't talk much about the single-player campaign because we've played cooperatively. Either way, it was certainly a very fun experience. The graphics are ok, as for the soundtrack I can't really say much because I had to keep the volume low. The story itself tries to estabilish a link with the main plot of the movies but you know, when I'm playing with my friends I rarely pay attention to the details, so I didn't really care for what was going on. Overall, if you're looking for a quick game to play with your friends without any kind of commitment, go for it, I recommend it.

content:
Posted: March 26, 2014
												//The following is multiple excerpts from a journal recorded by a lost Marine on the VLV Steam spacecraft, only recently discovered on a backlog cleaning. Viewer discretion is advised.\\AUG 30th, 2013: Wow! Colonial Marines is 75% off! I know how much hate it's received, but.. I gotta see this for myself.AUG 31st, 2013: The multiplayer is decent. Not anything special, but it's fun. Different alien classes, different weapons and tactics for the marines.. frequent level-ups and weapon attachments to unlock. Not that bad at all, and I've only touched team deathmatch.OCTOBER 5th, 2013: I finally... I finally jumped into the single player. I don't know the time. How could I? After playing this game, it's amazing that I still have my sanity intact. Only 30 minutes played, but that was... that was a challenge I wasn't expecting.It all started fine, man! Sure, the graphics weren't great, but it was a cool start. Just walking down that space hallway, then it happened. I found that guy, wrapped up in some weird organic mush on the walls. I started to pry him off.. and an alien jumped me! It freaked me out.But that wasn't the problem. It.. it ran away. My motion tracker told me it was around the corner, but I couldn't see anything! I reloaded my gun and carefully tip-toed down the hall.. AND THERE IT WAS MAN! JUST SITTING THERE FACING THE OPPOSITE WALL! I screamed and threw my controller down, running out of the room in a panic-- if the very first alien had AI as awful as this, what did that mean for the rest of the game!?OCTOBER 6th: I tried again. I killed the beast and continued playing. We got to the hangar and that was a pretty cool scene. Marines yelling and having to defend the doo--oh.. that.. alien... oh, oh God. The animation on it locked up! IT SLID RIGHT AT ME THROUGH THE OBSTACLES IN THE MAP! OH GOD, OH GOD NO HELP ME JESU-- //transmission lost//NOVEMBER 1ST: ABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORTABORT

content:
Posted: February 20, 2014
												Never before in all the years I've been playing video games have I ever played something so ludicrously disappointing. If you're expecting to find the game promised in the E3 demos, you won't find it. That wasn't the game at all; this is, in all reality, one of the worst video games I've ever played.STORY:In terms of Alien lore, this game does fairly well. The story fits and makes sense. However, it is ruined by multiple groan-inducing plot twists and a face-palm ending. Characters are little more that emotionless puppets that offer no emotional value. The one character that you're actually intended to like has such a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ AI that you end up hating him the most out of everyone. The worst part, however, is the character that Gearbo brought back from the dead: Hicks. Yes, everyone, they brought back Hicks, even after we SAW HIM DIE in Alien 3, he came back, with the most horrible explanation for his return of all time. Even the DLC that was supposed to explain how he survived wasn't enough to to fill the plot hole left in the wake of the third movie.GRAPHICS:For a game of this generation, the graphics are absolutely unacceptable. It looks like a game developed in 2005. There are literal ♥♥♥♥-loads of screen tearing throughout the game, which is only worse on the console, ambient lighting and dynamic shading seem to have been thrown out altogether, textures are misplaced or completely absent altogether, and the worst part is the fact that the game requires higher PC specs that Crysis. I can run Crysis 3 at Ultra settings while still keeping a fairly good frame rate, yet I can barely run Aliens: Colonial Marines on the lowest graphic options available without awful screen lag. The only two things I can give props to for this game's visuals are the environments and the xenomorph designs. The environements, from the rocky hills of LV426 to the Alien hive below Hadley's Hope, the game makes you feel like you truly are in an Aliens movie. The xenomorph designs (assuming your PC can run max graphics) are beautifully flawless, detailed body designs all the way to the saliva on the fangs make the xenomorphs look beautiful. GAMEPLAY:This is possibly the worst part of the game. First of all, the xenomorphs are weaker than my five year old cousin. They run at you like idiots and attack with weak, meaningless maneuvers that leave you laughing at their stupidity. An unconceivable amount of glitches make the xenomorphs act like mental ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ that have no idea what they're doing. The game on its highest difficulty feels like I'm playing Call of Duty on recruit. Which brings me to my other point: the game is JUST LIKE CALL OF DUTY. The generic CoD gameplay takes you out of the action and makes you bored, you literally fight more human enemies than xenomorphs, and the mediocre run and shoot gameplay grows dull after the first mission. Even worse is that the motion tracker is virtually useless. Remember the AVP games where the motion tracker was your closest ally? Well, in Aliens: Colonial Marines, it might as well be a roleplaying tool. You can go through the whole game without ever using it. You don't need it at all, mainly because the xenomorphs are almost always at predictable spawn placements, are painfully slow, and hardy ever crawl on any other surface aside from the ground. That is indefinitely the worst part of the game.MULTIPLAYER:The multiplayer takes a delightful turn for the better. With extensive customization options for the humans and xenomorphs, players can truly personalize who they are on the multiplayer battlefield. Combat for the xenomorphs is quite unique and fun to toy around with, but I feel like they're very weak in comparison to their human adversaries. Maps are beautiful and have a great, asymetric flow that fits an Alien game. The only real downfall is the small amount of people that play it.VERDICT:Aliens: Colonial Marines is a lie. A big, fat, horrible lie. The E3 demos were never part of the game and were later revealed to only be computer-animated CGI. For a game that was in development for 6 years, it's insulting to be given such a piece of worthless trash. If you're an Aliens fan, stay away from this game. It will literally make you hat the series. If you want a good Aliens title, just play AVP 2000 Classic, AVP2, or even the AVP from 2010. Colonial Marines wasn't just the biggest disappointment in gaming history. It was one of the worst games ever mad.

number of helpful: 5 of 10 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 19, 2013
												Knowing full well that the majority of the community at large looks unfavorably at a game doesn't stop me from trying it for myself and just taking in the experience, whatever it's worth. People say Duke Nukem Forever is horrible, but I loved it. People say Sniper: Ghost Warrior and Homefront were bad; I found good in them. Everyone is different and I believe if you formulate your life around other people's opinions, you lose your sense of self. Furthermore, berating someone for liking something you don't or disliking something you do like only demonstrates your own insecurity.I actually enjoyed Aliens: Colonial Marines for the most part. Now this isn't a grade A quality game by any stretch, but the atmosphere was good, voice acting was respectable, and the story was almost decent. I'm not a huge Aliens fan, but when you pit marines versus a superior foreign species, how else can it play out without flat killing all the humans outright? I guess I wasn't expecting an Aliens versus Predator type matchup. The only thing that really got under my skin was the horrible lighting reflections throughout the game. I went so far as to install one of the popular mods to improve the issue, and while it was better, the graphics were still absolutely painful at times. The gameplay itself isn't impressive; just a generic first person shooter, although the weapon upgrades spruced it up a little bit. The game also occasionally crashed for me, but I suspect it may have been due to the installed mod.Certainly it's disappointing when you have a name like Gearbox attached to this title and you know what they are capable of, but the game is no worse than those other titles I mentioned. I enjoyed it for what it was, but I didn't set my expectations to a point where disappointment was the only outcome. Good bargain bin stuff for sure.

content:
Posted: September 7, 2015
												I'm a bit confused why everyone hates this game so much?  Maybe because I got it way after its release so all the patches and what not have fixed whatever problems there were.  The game itself is a fanboy's absolute wet dream, having watched Aliens about a milion and 2 times I love all the references.  The gameplay is a bit twitchy but to be honest I've always hated the UT3 engine with a passion.  Its a crap engine, especially for FPS games.  The weapons are perfectly modeled and the sound effects are straight ripped from the film.  I actually find the Aliens themselves way better than previous AVP games as the don't move like ants and when you shoot them they don't just shatter into pieces.All in all an awesome movie licence with great atmosphere and tons of upgrades and silly addons for your weaponry.  The biggest downside is : UT3 Engine, so twitchy and overall never works properly.  And Gearbox. I HATE borderlands, even bought the retail game of the year edition and hated it so much I wanted to use it as a drink coaster, so I'm actually GLAD that other companies took over and finished the game.Its like playing the movie.  All I need is Bill Paxton saying "Game over man, game over!" when I die.

number of helpful: 3 of 6 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 2, 2014
												First off I'm giving this game a thumbs up but not because it's good, it's not that good, considering that the game only got released last year it looks about 4-5 years out of date (which apparently it is cause it took so long to make), the storyline is not that great and the voice acting (especially from Hicks) is pretty terrible. The reason I am giving it a thumbs up is purely because of how much the game has improved since it was released. The Alien AI is now pretty good bar a few times where they seem to stop a few metres in front of you for a few seconds before they attack again, also they seem to at least attempt to get behind you or climb walls and ceilings to avoid your fire. Unfortunately the only time they jump into vents and stuff seem to be all scripted events. There were even a few moments when the Alien's genuinely scared the crap outta me and the sewer mission where you had no weapons to defend yourself was pretty terrifying, I just wish they had used that a little more.The sound design is also very good, the weapons all sound like they should and so do the aliens. The level design is decent as well, moving from spaceship to planet to colony to alien ship and back again kept the experience quite fresh and interesting and kept the story moving forward at a decent pace.So for me the major flaw here is the graphics quality, it does look very old for a 2013 game and I wouldn't consider spending more than a tenner on it but if your like me and wanted to play it just to see if it was as bad as everyone has been saying then I think you will be plesantly surprised.I would rate this as a 6.5/10 but would have been much higher if the francise had been given the love it deserved.

												Great game! lotta peope disagree but i have played pretty much every Alien/Aliens game made either on PC, Ps2/Ps3 and Xbox/Xbox 360.... gotta say, this game is just fantastic, honestly i think most people are just butthurt because the Multiplayer aspct of the game is not as balanced as it should be, for example, alot of the multiplayer maps are open spaces, and unless the aliens team works together, they will just get merced every time, meaning PvP is mostly geared towards Marines... but the story aspect is just amazing.... games like THIS are not ment to be purchased strictly for PvP, but for the story aspect, and the fact the entire story can be played with friends, just makes it that much more amazing ^.^ the only disappointment for this game however is the aliens AI.... yeah there are some WTF moments were they will stalk you and eventually kill you... but other then that its like flys to a bug zapper... they just walk up to you until you kill them XD but i noticed something, if your playing Co-op with friends, they dont do that, they act and react to your movements, stance and firing lines, something most people wont ever notice because they complain about the story being better singleplayer.... meh.... i think its better multiplayer, gives the game more of a Marines feel and not a DOOM feel <.< overall i give it a 9/10 deducting 1 point simply because of the AI in single player.Futhermore I would like to state something not part of my review, I find it funny how the "Butthurt" gaming community attempt to de-rate good reviews by stating they was unhelpful, thus attempting to hide all the good reviews so only the negative ones show up on the general reviews board.... typical and pathetic...

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 3, 2016
												First, a couple of disclaimers - this is the first modern game I've played in a good 20-odd years, so I have nothing to compare this to. I'm also a HUGE fan of the Alien franchise, so I'm liable to like anything that has anything to do with it. I even enjoyed Alien Resurrection and the AvP films at least enough to own them and rewatch them now and again. That said, perhaps it's just my naivety as a gamer and/or my fanboy status for the subject matter, but I've had an absolute blast with this game. It captures the spirit and feel of Aliens superbly, and I find the story to be a most worthy insert to the universe as well. For the gameplay, I find that it's found a near-perfect medium of difficulty, where it's hard enough to present a reasonable challenge, but not so hard that one just gets frustrated and playing the game ceases to be fun. The replay value is very high to me, and just because one knows what is going to happen does not give you too much of an advantage when playing through the game again. Although this also counts as a strike against it for realism, the fact that you carry your entire arsenal with you at all times does make the game more fun, because you can try playing through with a variety of weapons. This can make parts of the game a lot easier or a lot harder, depending on what you want.In the interest of providing a rounded review, I will acknowledge the game's shortcomings as well. There are at least 2 major holes in the plot, with the first being the fact that the aliens will readily attack a character who is carrying a chestburster, something that has been well established in the franchise that they will not do. Secondly, Hadley's Hope (though magnificently capturing the feel of the second film!) doesn't seem a whole lot more damaged than it was in the movie, despite being at ground zero for a 40 megaton nuclear blast.Much ill has been spoken of the game's AI, and while it certainly isn't perfect, I feel most of the flaws are compensated for in other ways. For instance, while the individual alien has been made rather less formidable than one would expect, their swarming and ambush tactics keep them a legitimate threat. Crushers are especially poorly controlled. Their resilience should have made them one of the most dangerous castes, but once you learn how they operate, they become a very minor obstacle. The aliens are noticably biased towards attacking you even if an NPC is closer, unless you are supstantially farther away or out of line of sight. Your NPC companions seem to carry far weaker weapons than you, because what might take you say 10 rounds from the pulse rifle to kill takes an NPC several clips of sustained fire. Their performance at staying with you is also highly inconsistent - sometimes they will happily take the lead and flush out hidden enemies (a very helpful thing, since the NPCs cannot be killed), and other times the game REALLY wants you to take on a particular challenge alone, because your NPCs absolutely will neither lead nor follow you until you have completed a particular task. They will also sometimes completely ignore an alien that is attacking you.The fact that you carry your entire arsenal with you at all times was an opportunity to use weapon/ammunition management as part of the game, but on all stages and difficulty settings, the game is extremely generous with ammunition replenishment. I've never had any specific weapon stay dry for more than 10 minutes or so.Last but not least, there is one specific part in both campaigns where, on UBA setting at least, the game IS too hard, and one ends up just wanting to skip it. Fortunately, the scene in the primary campaign is at the very end of the stage, and once you've beaten it on any difficulty setting, you CAN just skip it, and the scene in the DLC campaign is the final scene in the campaign, so they don't disrupt the gameplay too much.Despite those flaws, I love this game, and I absolutely do not understand why it gets trashed so much. If you're an Aliens fan, I'd call this game a must-have!

content:
Posted: November 26, 2013
												After hearing about the horror stories of the release I was cautious to buy this game. As a fan of previous alien games I decided to give it a shot anyway. Downloaded a 9gb patch which was about the size of the original installation. Loved the game. A lot of the issues I had read about have been fixed. Lighting could have a lot more darker patches, menus could have minor improvements, and every now and then an aliens glitches. But none of this breaks the game. Multiplayer community is more or less dead. And the motion scanner function results in humans standing behind traps waiting to be attacked. The scanners unlimited battery unfortunately prevents stealth attacks. I would highly recommend buying if you enjoy coop shooters. It has up to 4 player coop campaign with auto-balanced number enemies & the Bug Hunt DLC is similar to COD zombies but with aliens and far superior as you can buy back in upon death. It has nice weapons espec the Sharp stick dlc which is a sticky grenade launcher. Also dont like the ingame chat with more than 2 people. Using Razer Comms easily fixes this issue.TLDR:Good coop game. Worth buying with bug hunt when on sale.

number of helpful: 6 of 12 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 6, 2016
												An average first person shooter. The graphics are decent and consume fair resources at medium quality, but sometimes get stuck, has easy and quick solution: pulse Ctr+Alt+Del, then Esc. Other bug reopen the game, close the Steam window to avoid it. A gameplay bug makes almost impossible to pass the ending of level 5 at highest difficultly. There are other bugs, like collision errors of objects or corrupt save files, degrading the game. A pitty.Mechanics is simple. Player can run, jump and crouch, carring all his weapons with some ammo, but is abundant. The armour is not very effective, but there are many replacement parts. The combat is fast, because damages are powerfull, the explosives can kill instantly. The player can acomplish challenges to upgrade his weapons, by kill enemies or find collectibles.There are a limited autohealing system, the medkits can not carry, but are easy to find. There are not a stealth system. Player has companions, but their IA is unpredictible: sometimes are very contributors, but many other times they dessapear to going too forwards or backwards.The enemy AI is common: humans take coverages and then advances, the Aliens attacks directly from its hidings. All things, scenaries are taken from film of the title, with great similitude and detail. Mapping is lineal. The plot fits with the story of film, and not wonderful but neither bored. The game is injustly underrated by the exigencies of hardcore fans of last generation graphics and multiplayer modes, but its true that bugs deserve downgrade the game in rankings. The 2 main campaigns for Marines and humans are short, even with downloable content, about 20 hours to reach half of achievements in normal dificultly. Only to buy in bundles or with high discounts.

content:
Posted: January 30, 2016
												Don't Purchase this for multiplayer unless you have a few friends who are willing to join.The game was reviewed with poor scores in various places - this is a liner first person shooter set in the aliens universe.Weapon options are fairly basic - Auto Assult Rilfe (Pulse rifle), Burst Assult Rifle (Assult Rifle), Sub Machine Gun (SMG), Sniper Rifle (Battle Rifle), Two Pistols (Minimal difference) and a few legendary weapons (Movie Weapons) The graphics are not at a Crysis level of detail, however there is plenty of detail on the guns, characters & aliens.The sounds of the weapons that can also be found in in the movies sound close enough in my opinionI have seen some videos & pictures showing of the glitchy nature of the game  - I did not notice anything while playing through singleplayer.If you enjoy stuff form the aliens universe and you can find the game for about $5.00 then you can get a reasonable amout of value out of this game.

number of helpful: 4 of 8 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 26, 2013
												Game is a solid 3/10The A.I. is a total joke, the graphics are sub par and the story is predictable and weak. Save your money.Although not nearly as bad as everyone made it out to be, this game is still not worth your money. It's A.I. is incompetent to the point that aliens will simply run in a straight line right at you, and then quite often turn around at the last moment and run away, only to repeat the process, or get stuck on something and begin their silly dancing. The script writing is quite poor and in some areas is game breaking, since some of the marines know nothing about these aliens, and yet seconds later will address them all by name and know their every move, at one point, a "fellow" marine blows himself and you up with a grenade because he was a millisecond away from death, after an alien had already burst from his chest. Speaking of marines; they are a complete burden as allies. Usually always standing in doorways preventing you from walking through, and never help in a fight, despite having an arsenal at their disposal. The graphics were so misleading and borderline criminal. The game as advertised was nothing like the game received, which is another reason the game was too harshly reviewed. I cannot recommend this game to anyone, especially since the marketing practice that was used for the release of this game was so shameful, criminal and filled with lies.

content:
Posted: November 25, 2013
												I don't think I've ever played an Aliens game that wasn't Aliens vs. Predator. Except for Aliens Doom. Aliens Doom might be better than Aliens: Colonial Marines. It's not that it's a bad game, it's just not the most exciting game. It feels like it fails to capitalize on the franchises strengths, which are being spooked by aliens that ♥♥♥♥ing kill you, and watching your friends die all around you. The aliens in this iteration are not very lethal, and they rarely manage to kill anyone except some unnamed scientists. If it weren't for the dead bodies scattered around, you'd be hard pressed to tell that the aliens are killing anyone at all. They just seem to be bothering people.And there's a lot of dumb stuff in this game, even for a video game. Zombie aliens that explode. An ending that goes nowhere. A pointless cameo that fails to explain or justify itself. I mean, Aliens: Colonial Marines isn't the worst game I've ever played, but I'd probably be pretty unhappy if I'd bought it on release for $60. And I'm playing it post-4GB patch that apparently improved the graphics but not much else.

number of helpful: 11 of 23 people (48%) found this review helpful34 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 27, 2015
												First off: This is the best game i've ever played, the people that give it a bad review don't understand. The AI isnt terrible, they're thoughtful. When you see your allies/enemies just standing there, they're not being stupid, they're thinking about their lives and the current situation they're in. When you die right in front the AI and they just stand there and look, its because they care about you so much to the point that they're petrified when they see you in that state, but when youd die, they completely blame it on themselves and think about it for the rest of their lives. This game is rich in lore, i mean have you guys even looked at the enemies? They're all wearing baseball caps, so obviously they're going to the space baseball game that week, and they're all diehard babe ruth fans. If you guys even read the Alien manga (like i did), you'd know completely about the space baseball game, and the baseball cap epidemic, which includes the southern astronauts from Texas that invade space stations after their favorite team loses.         Second: The gameplay. The gameplay soars far above the likes of Far Cry 4 and Gta V. The gameplay is so innovative, because its unfair. Developers nowadays are too afraid of critics to make it unfair, making games boring and too easy. But Gearbox, Wayforward, Timegate, Nerve, Check Six Games, and Demiurge knew that if they had to make a quality game with innovative gameplay, they would have to push their players to the limits, by making them die every 2 seconds when they start to actually feel safe and start to have fun. In this game, Aliens will use their colors to their advantage, hiding in the dark to strike at the perfect time, forcing you to really use your wits to put them down. Enemy humans will flank, and use other strategic positionings to try to take you down, but if you play smart, you should be okay, though it will be difficult, because of the innovative gameplay. Your allies are some of the most helpful and smart AI's i've seen to date. Their personalities and storylines are so interesting and full of life, sometimes i forget that they're AI and not players online.             Third of all: The storyline. In this game you play as a colonial marine named Winter, as he and his partner crime Shaquille O' Neal, fight through hordes of aliens and baseball players. WInter's backstory is so rich in detail, and honestly its one of the most well thought out stories i've ever seen. Speaking of great stories, we have the space baseball players, and the touching story of the baseball epidemic that will leave you at the edge of your seat, and in tears as you have to put down hundreds of these poor infected people, segments of fighting these people will leave you at a moral crossroad. All of these people were just coming to a space baseball game, but were infected by a virus, known as the baseballitus disease. Every day countless people are infected with this disease, making them go crazy and try to kill other people with guns, when all they wanted was to watch some quality baseball, the best sport in america. So now you should know that this game is worthy of the game of the century award from president Obama himself.I rate this game a full 10/10, and you should too.

content:
Posted: July 27, 2014
												Overall, the worst game to come from the Alien franchize.  The single-player campaign unfolds exactly like one could expect from an unfinished, obvious cash-grab from an incompetent design team. Textures resemble something you would expect from the Doom 3 era, except, somehow worse, featuring both a dull and jagged visual experience. The sounds, although familar to those who enjoyed the film series, lack a certain punch, this coupled with an uninspired, dredfully acted voice acting ensemble. The story arc is also sure in infuriate those true movie fans who respect the authenticity of the Alien Universe. In fact, voice actor Micheal Bein sounds as if he is forced at gunpoint to deliver this hot mess. On a postive note, fun can be had in small doses during online co-op mode, where two can experience the almost comic like deliver of awful, nearly on rails gameplay and insane visual bugs. The first chapter of the DLC "Stasis Interupted", is actually a good plot. It intelligently features an everday civilian (non-hero),  making the experience almost feel believable and emotional. It is a small gem in a bucket of sand but to those who absolutely has to finish every "Alien" game, you can look forward to that bit before it panders back to the land of mediocrady. 5/10

content:
Posted: October 26, 2015
												I played this game "post patch" and enjoyed it. I can't speak to how it played on day one, but I found it worked fine on my system. The graphics could have been more polished. The pulse riffle sound was on point. The Aliens do make "rifle fodder" and are pretty much running at you like heat seaking missles, but when I watch "Aliens" the movie it's not too different. The motion tracker was a nice add on, really useful in multiplayer. As for the story... It was a better than Alien3, Resurrection, and Prometheus. Last time I checked there hasn't been a good "Alien" story in the last 30 years so I wasn't expecting much here. Having played all the DLC now, I can say Bughunt is must. Bughunt is the best mode in the game, and a blast to play in co-op. Stasis Interupted is the section of the story they cut out to sell you as DLC, it helps tie everything together. The games campaign is not 1 star nor is it 5. It's a decent 3. Bughunt & multiplayer are the best modes, I rate them a 4 out 5. Match making is broken, so you'll need to friend up, or find a group that plays. If your a fan of Aliens, catch this one on a Steam sale. The game plus DLC for $7 or $8 is a good time.Here are some helpful links for getting the most out of the game.Aliens: Colonial Marines | Bug Hunt	GroupHow to fix the "neverending" relaunchFix defaulting to the wrong resolution Visit our Currator Page

content:
Posted: June 2, 2015
												I imagine that a lot of the people who still speak ill of A:CM when the subject comes up have either never played it, or played it on release after paying full price for it and never touched it again. Yes, I'd be angry too if I'd paid 50-60 EUR/USD/GBP for it on release. But the game's been out for a couple of years now, and it's had around 8 Gigs of patches since then, and I'm telling you that now, it is in fact A Good Game. According to Steam, I've played it for almost 15 hours, normal difficulty, SP campaign and Stasis Interrupted DLC only. (If you want MP, check the Steam forums for a dedicated community who coordinate their activities). And in all of that time, I never witnessed anything game-breaking, or even immersion-breaking (and it is very immersive). It didn't even crash on me.Worst I can say is that sometimes my fellow marines ran ahead and left me alone in the dark (!), and that sometimes, if I got ahead of them, I'd catch a glimpse of one blatantly teleporting in behind me. (Even Alien: Isolation has a teleport debate). I would also tell those who cry about a weak story or plotholes that they're being hysterical. When you read ranting comments questioning where the Aliens came from, just remember that it was Hadley's Hope that blew up, not the derelict (duh). Yes, the dialogue is salty and laden with action-movie cliché – but that’s perfect! Coupled to an intriguing story are solid shooting mechanics, supremely satisfying weapons (and an ace RPG-lite weapon-upgrade system). The sound effects are spot-on; the iconic sound of the Marine Pulse and Smart rifles are almost worth the price alone.Speaking of which, now, in 2015, A:CM is more than worth it at 15 Euros, and if you can get it at around 5, you're golden. Don’t listen to the Angry Internet People, try it for yourself. P.S. Get the Statsis Interrupted DLC - it's almost a whole new game, tells a fantastic story that is even more relevant given that a) Fox has declared it canon, and b) Neil Blmkamp will be touching on something similar in his new Alien film.

content:
Posted: December 3, 2014
Hard Game To Review6 Hours. I just want to repeat that, because I want you to take this journey with me: 6 hours. A friend and I played through the entire campaign. The cost of admission to get the game? 80% off. If this game had been released in 2003 for the normally asked price, it might be a good value. Did I enjoy it? Immensely, but not for the reasons that one normally enjoys a game. So, it's a good game, then? It depends on your definition of good. If you like things to be so horribly broken out of the box that it's hilarious, then yes, this game is fan-freakin'-tastic. If you set out to play a game where all of the characters have the same facial expression all the time like Vin Diesel in a Fast and Furious movie, a ridiculous soundtrack that does not fit the Alien franchise whatsoever (It would fit in a Star Wars game, though!), sound effects that make no sense whatsoever, and better yet, voice acting that also makes no sense whatsoever...then this game gets an A+ rating. All of these things are available in huge buckets. It's a veritable cavalcade of frivolity and laziness. I wonder how many hours the unpaid design and programming interns at Gearbox put in to making this awesome, unintentionally hilarious game. I say unpaid, because I imagine this was also used as their capstone project to graduate with their associate's degree. How about some specifics? Sure! The animations of the Xenomorphs look absolutely ridiculous. Cute, almost. The sounds for the Xenomorphs are, quite literally, stock sounds of cats manipulated a very small amount. None of it is terrifying, and ruins the terrifying concept of the franchise. The game is claustrophobic, in a bad way - half of the game is running backward to do something. Invisible walls are there, and then they disappear (which is a situationally ironic statement to make) after doing some entirely arbitrary action. Bad AI? There is no AI, everything moves on a track. It is patterned. Either that, or the AI is so poorly programmed that it seems this way. I spent 15 minutes laughing at the queen not being able to reach me in a corner, but breathing heavily and whipping her tail, a lot like my dog does before knocking something off of the coffee table in my living room!Unintentionally hilarious, that's the best I can come up with. Did I enjoy it? Yes. It was so ridiculously bad that I couldn't help but enjoy it. Whether this was Gearbox's or Sega's fault is beyond the point, all they would have to do is change all of the marketing to call it a parody and they would do grand. It's definitely a parody of the Aliens franchise! I've seen a lot of reviews that say they would only recommend it for hardcore fans of the franchise. Nuh-uh. No, because I'm a hardcore fan of the franchise, and have been from a very young age, and I exclaim that this is the worst thing to happen to Aliens since the AVP movie came out in 2004 - and I loved that movie for the same reasons I love this game. 6 hours. Including half hour breaks while still in game, including bathroom breaks while still in game, including meals, cigarettes, and taking my dog outside.... while still in game. You're looking at a good, solid 4 hours of game here wrapped up in a budget title with AAA packaging. If you're all about some achievements - go for it, you get one for starting the game, and then you get one for starting a campaign! Then you get one for firing your first bullet, for getting facehugged, and for laughing out loud at how ridiculous it is. But it's not all hilariously bad. No. What the game gets right, it gets really right. I actually liked the feel of the weapons and the actions of them. As long as I ignored the completely arbitrary upgrades that make absolutely no difference, I thought they were great! I also thought that the inconsistent use of punctuation, capitalization, and plot helped add to the experience and, overall, made my 80% off purchase well worth it. I wish I knew whether or not H.R. Giger would feel avenged or offended, since he was horribly ripped off after the first Alien movie, continually. Avenged because of the fact that this game makes everyone involved in its production ridiculous, other than him, or offended, that they would take his concepts and do everything they can to make them seem as ridiculous as possible. 6 hours. 5/10 overall. Not recommended unless you REALLY like unintentional parodies and hilarity. If you've been playing too many great games lately, pick it up! if you've been playing a lot of bad games lately, I would suggest skipping it. If you're a fan of the franchise, I would suggest that you refuse to connect this with it in any way. Replay value: ...Actually kind of high. I want to see if at any point ANYTHING makes any sense. Actually, no, I take that back, I want my 10 gigabytes of hard drive space back. Also, Vin Diesel rules. I don't want it to seem like that comparison was made in an attempt to insult Vin Diesel, but his facial expression never friggin' changes. Also, i'm going to go ahead and say I recommend this game. I know I said I didn't...but, still, I kinda do.

content:
Posted: July 28, 2013
												If you liked Alien Trilogy on Playstation 1 and the Aliens vs Predator games on PC, then you'll probably like this game as well, although the production value is fairly lower here. It's also filled with CoD-like missions (kill a lot of soldiers... while being a soldier, lol). This game has not much developer soul it in. It feels as if they were like: "Hey, we have the brand name, it doesn't really matter what we put behind it." The whole game feels like a mod for Duke Nukem: Forever, albeit this has higher resolution textures and better looking models/maps and stronger voice acting. The base game's final maps and the story DLC's final maps have the same thing in common: they are both horribly stretched out. Even with that fact, finishing both stories on the highest difficulty didn't take more than 8 hours altogether. It has some nice moments here and there, but it consists of more boredom and grinding than excitement. I really liked the sound effects though - as far as I know they had the original sounds from the movies to work with, so that's not a credit to the developers, but a credit to the original sound artists. So to sum this up, I'm not telling you to avoid this game, but don't listen to all those horrible critics. There have been many patches already so Colonial Marines deserves a chance. This game is a freak of nature, to be exact, a freak of the dark side of the game industry. Play it and judge it yourself, don't let others tell you how you should feel about it.

content:
Posted: March 6, 2015
												A:CM is a hard game to review.  The level of intense controversy surrounding the game's release was enough to sully its reputation and earn it the moniker of one of the worst games ever released.  Quite frankly, that's a lot of nonsense.  If anything, A:CM's unwise debut enraged gamers and forced them to overlook a relatively solid FPS that tried to be an official sequel to its movie namesake.  I won't get into that, but I would wager that if the E3 demo never existed, gamers would have been far more lenient towards A:CM's final release.  The biggest problem with A:CM lies not in its graphical quality, but the play mechanics themselves.  It adheres to an outdated FPS approach to weaponry, health and regeneration, and (most shockingly) the A.I.  When I first played this game, enemies would casually moonwalk right into my weapon fire.  It was literally that bad.  Alien A.I. seemed better, and this managed to efficiently knock me out of any sense of immersion.  Graphically, the game was subpar, but this has since been fixed with the automatic update which adds MUCH better shadowing and lighting.  The game now looks and feels like the Aliens game it should have been, but there's still much content and quality that was only glimpsed in the infamous E3 demo.  Said update also helped out with the enemy A.I.  It's not on par with the newest FPS shooters, but at least enemies aren't slightly animated cardboard cutouts with a block of wood in their heads.  A:CM's biggest misstep lies in the story.  It's an attempt to bridge the gap between Aliens and Alien 3, and in that regard it starts off right, but as the story progresses, it becomes more implausible and disappointing.  The "Stasis Interrupted" DLC even tries to explain how Hicks was never in his cryotube during the events of Alien 3, but the big reveal made me wince.  I just didn't buy it.  There were, however, many memorable moments in the game, most notably being caught in the Hadley's Hope sewer levels and having to stay totally quiet (while unarmed) while emaciated aliens stalk the area and pass right by you.  There's also a terrifying chase sequence where one must continually close and seal doors with a super-alien hot on your tail.  I even liked traversing the haunting corridors of the derelict spaceship, now tainted by Weyland Yutani research personnel.  In other words......it wasn't the terrible experience I'd been told it was.  A:CM is mired by imbalance issues and some bad writing, but I refuse to call it a write-off, because I simply don't feel that it is.  It's a generic (and sometimes bland) FPS shooter tied to a really great license, and does a decent job with it, but only barely.

												AI is a joke.  Maps are so subpar its hilarious.  Half the alien "scares" are just generic and often mistimed jump scares. Multiplayer was its only redemption, only its buggy and prone to exploits.Hell you can disable the entire alien team's aspect of stealth by equipping the easily obtained smart scope for your rifles. Just pull it up to have your instant alien alertness picture. The MP scene is largely dead, unless you organize in the forums you aren't going to find any matches within an hour.TL;DR: cash in on popular IP and overall betrayal of trust by Successful Developer.

number of helpful: 5 of 11 people (45%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 14, 2013
												Ok so I want to start by saying that yes I have been butthurt by pre-orders before but I really don't feel that way at all here. I think marketing , hype and game journalisim killed this game before it was even out of the gate. I personally did'nt play any demos for it, and I never saw any game footage prior to launch, and have had no bugs at all  so I can't defend those arguments. What I wanted was an awesome squad based and co-op based multiplayer and that's exactly what I got. The xeno gameplay and control mechanics are brilliant and sooo much better than AVP (2010) .  The maps are tight for both xeno and marine gameplay, and the weapons and attacks are fun to play with and experiment different customizations. The single player is basically Call of Duty in space, and I gotta tell ya that I'm more than ok with that, as long as the backdrop and story are in this universe. I'ts not a perfect game by any means , but its a rock solid shooter and offers a great change-up when playing as xeno. It's not GOTY but it sure has earned more respect than it's gotten. I will be playing this as long as there is a MP community. (yup I bought the season pass too) Update:After a few years the mp community is still active in the form of Bughunt. It's amazing DLC and there are game mods that fixed the issues with the Alien AI and graphics that people complained about.

number of helpful: 5 of 11 people (45%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 6, 2015
												OK so basically, I am writing this review as a hardcore fan of the Alien Sagas and as a gamer obviously… There has been much negative talk throughout the last couple of years about Aliens: Colonial Marines, but in this review I hope to give readers an honest opinion, not one made out of anger… Also… my review might divulge some minor spoilers, but nothing too drastic that would ruin gameplay… and one more thing… I only just purchased and finished the PC version recently which would explain my low amount of hours… I own the Xbox 360 version since the day before release, and finished it at least 4 times on each difficulty and again for collectibles… OVERVIEWSo we play the role of one of the Colonial Marines that was sent to investigate the Mayday message sent by the marines who landed on LV426 and engaged numerous Xenomorphs on Hadley’s Hope, 17 weeks ago… Almost straight away the game is into the action with numerous Xenomorph aliens and human enemies alike… Half way through the game, it produces a level that slows down the pace as a sort of intermission which I thought was quite good, and once that level is over, it’s straight back into more action and keeps the pace all the way to the end...Now we know that Gearbox promised the Alien fans something quite different from the Youtube videos and it was quite unfortunate that alien fans got their backs up over this… Those that did give it a try compared the game to its advertised state on youtube rather than its ACTUAL state… I’m not saying fellow reviewers are wrong… but they reviewed the game for what it could have been and not by what it is…So I’ll begin with the bad and end on a positive note…THE BAD1>	The AI – Omg this was horrible, the Ally NPCs that assist you throughout the game constantly get in your way, right into your fire… now there is no friendly fire but if you have the game set to anything above recruit difficulty, bullets are a lot more less frequent and the enemy are a lot more vicious and let’s face it… when a team mate gets in the way… it’s frustrating!! On many occasion the friendly AI would block the doorways or corridors (on day one release) but they have since fixed this quickly and cheaply by turning off the player to NPC collision so you can walk through them now…2>	The AI of the enemy is smarter than the Allies, however, the Xenomorphs tend to just head for you not anyone else… There is no sneakiness with the Xenos… in the movies they grab people from ceilings, walls, floors, airducts, grates and dark shadows… yes they tend to come out of those places in the game, but there is no sneaky strategy to it… they see you… they head for you!3>	Aiming is very very stiff I find myself fighting it half the time like some sort of aim-assist is on which makes head shots a little more difficult than usual… and the Iron sights on the rifles are fkn terrible… I personally suggest using the laser sight… although the laser beam on the gun and the actual laser dot don’t even line up half the time… if you aim with the dot and not the beam… you’ll be sweet as pie!!THE NITPICKING1>	The Xenomorphs dead bodies cheaply disappear in a bubbling acid bath, the game is completely linear, why they couldn’t leave the bodies where they lie until they reach the next area is beyond me… Perhaps they got lazy or it was an optimization thing.2>	The use of the mech loader was very short, as well as terrible… The movement was just all wrong… you used to hear the ‘Doof… doof… doof….. vrrrrrrrr errrrrrr whirrrrrrr’, big steps and slow stiff movement… this thing feels like it’s had something inserted in it’s robo ♥♥♥♥♥♥… and it takes really small quick steps like it only weighs 100 kilos….and….. no welder like the one Ripley used on the Queen…. Wtf??3>	The M56A2 Smart Gun complete with 600 rounds of 10×28mm High Explosive Armor Piercing caseless rounds… sounds impressive doesn’t it…. Too bad you only get to use it twice in the WHOLE game… They should have made it so when you finish the game, you unlock Vasquez’s (or Drake’s) Smartgun to walk with throughout the whole game… feeling like an unstoppable bad♥♥♥♥♥4>	Attention to detail with characters… during a point in the game you will notice that you, Bella and O’Neal are really dirty due to the amount of fighting and running around you been doing… then there is a cutscene where you can barely see their tattoos… as soon as the cutscene is over and you continue in the same level just moments after the timeframe of the cutscene… characters are absolutely spotless clean again as if fresh out of the shower???? There are plenty of other ‘little discrepancies’ that don’t really matter… but I just thought ‘Did anyone even QA test this game all the way through??’THE GOOD1>	Excellent level structure which pay homage to the franchise… The attention to detail with the environments is brilliant, now I truly know what it feels like to be a Colonial Marine walking into a trashed Hadley’s Hope… the environment consists of lots of bullet holes, acid burns, wires and pipes, rubbish, airducts, vents etc etc… Everything you saw from Aliens is in this game… except obviously the atmosphere processors where the hive was in the movie… The detail in the environments really sets the mood for the game.2>	Great storyline – Apart from the slight inconsistencies, they managed to link the movie storyline appropriately with the game’s storyline… 3>	The sound was absolutely amazing, if I didn’t know any better, I’d say the whole sound bank was used from 20th Century Fox’s archives… The Pulse Rifle sounds especially good.4>	Weapons were really good and customizable to a certain extent… the Pulse rifle was my favourite and they even went into detail that if you held the trigger down… there would be inconsistent gaps in the auto firing just like on the movie…5>	Graphics are a lot better than ppl think… one thing to do is turn off the early 80’s style grain unless you really like it… there is nothing wrong at all with the graphics… and all the models look great.... maybe just crank up the anti-aliasing a bit! LOLVERDICTI give this game a 7/10… It loses 3 points because of my main concerns being the stupid artificial intelligence, the cheap fixes and/or lackthereof, hardly any QA (Quality Assurance) testing as the product was being developed and the obviously sloppy development process which saw many potential good parts being omitted from the final product… also I might add that since there was that big disappointment to so many, the company should have issued the ‘Stasis interupted’ DLC for free… I still haven’t played that yet…If you are a fan of the Alien Universe…. Then definitely grab this game… don’t pay any more than $15 USD… I bought it for a bargain $3.75USD :D

number of helpful: 4 of 9 people (44%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 17, 2015
												Despite the negative reviews, this game is actually pretty good and worth playing if your a fan of the Alien movies. It takes place just after Aliens (the second movie) but has a new set of characters on a different mission, however Hicks and Bishop from the second movie both appear as supporting characters and they are both voiced by the actors that play them in the movie (Michael Biehn and Lance Henriksen) which is pretty awesome.The plot is above average, but it is really just there so that the action has reason to play out. The action is great however and the gameplay and controls are good (despite what some users have said about messed up controls). The aliens in the game are well done and there are a good variety of them. The graphics are good but they could easily have come from a game made ten years ago. On the downside, there are one or two glitches every so often (however they don't prevent you from moving forward in the game) and sometimes the AI is a little buggy and it occasionally affects the gameplay in a negative way. Also the game just suddenly comes to a halt and just ends  unexpectedly, in a weak and uninteresting way and it may make you angry.Overall, I would recommend this game because, despite its flaws, it is a lot of fun and the multiplayer is well thought out and very enjoyable. 6.5/10.(Additionally, the game does a good job of being scary; particularly when you get to use the Alien radar machine which detects Aliens closing in on you and makes a beeping noise which gets faster and faster the closer they get).

number of helpful: 4 of 9 people (44%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 26, 2015
												They're coming out of the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ walls! Colonial Marines was a game I followed the development of after the first announcement. Hell, I think half the gaming community in the world were patiently awaiting Colonial Marines for three long years with bated breath. Would Colonial Marines be THE Aliens game? Could we finally relive those tense silver screen moments many of us saw well before we were truly old enough to watch something like Aliens? In short, yes but Colonial Marines defiently falls short of what was promised and what was hyped over those three years. I wanted to like Colonial Marines. I really did. And in a sense it has been enjoyable. I've been playing it on co-op with mates and it's been good. The biggest gripe I guess from all of us has been the story itself. The story starts well enough. You're a Colonial Marine that is woken from cyro, the last of your regiment. Everyone else has been enjoying the corpse party aboard the Sulaco and came face to face with the Alien menace. Many a Marine has been lost and used to increase the enemy ranks. But this is just another day in the Corps. You strap up your armour, tie on your boots and throw on that brain dome of a helmet and slap a magazine into your rifle. We've got ourselves a bug hunt. The opening is enjoyable and exploring the Sulaco is a feast for the eyes of the avid Aliens fan. And the first mission is what you  expect, kill the Aliens, save your friends and try not to get hugged... Then the game introduces our friends from Weyland Corps, building us a better future by all of a sudden amassing an army of PMCs. I wanted Colonial Marines to be like the movie, low on ammunition, low on allies but with an abundance of enemies. I just wanted to walk those corridors with my motion track glued to my face waiting for that dreadful contact tone... Overall Colonial Marines is a game worth playing as an Aliens fan alone and is an enjoyable game when played with mates. However, as a shooter Aliens doesn't bring anything new to the table but it doesn't have any real short falls in terms of a basic shooter.

number of helpful: 4 of 9 people (44%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 30, 2015
												I honestly don't see why this game gets such a bad rap.  I love this game!  I played it a lot for the PS3, and still love it so much that I just had to get it for Steam.It's a bad♥♥♥♥♥FPS based on Aliens - the second (and best) movie in the Alien saga.  If you're a fan, you'll appreciate the story and overall content the game has to offer.  The guns are awesome!  You can use the Pulse Rifle, shotguns, submachine guns, flame throwers, etc.  You can even get some of the weapons customized to the space marines in the movie!  My only complaint is that you can't use the M56 Smart Gun (Vasquez and Drake's giant machine gun) for very long.  You only use the bullets already loaded, and that's it.  It's like getting the Star in the Mario Bros games.The graphics are good enough.  They aren't phenominal, but they aren't as bad as a lot of people make it out to be.  I've also read comments from nit-pickers saying it is a "corridor shooter".  I mean yeah there are many corridors but that was also the case in the movie... so I don't really see why it's an issue.There is only problem with this game - it's hard to find people to play with online!  The game will not set you up with people to play with, you have to go to the forums on Steam and add people manually and invite them to your game.  It was a pain in the♥♥♥♥♥at first, but I'm glad I did it because I found a lot of cool people to play other video games with.  So the problem turned into a solution I had for finding more Steam friends!Get this game, I highly recommend it!  As I am typing this, there is a HUGE sale on all Sega games.  This game and the DLC will only cost you a couple of bucks!!  Well worth it!

content:
Posted: July 14, 2016
												This is actually my third playthrough.I bought this game on X360 first and played the campaign in coop. I did not have any serious bugs at that time and even though it looked s**t in comparison to the PC version now, it was still enjoyable when I disabled the annoying music.The PC version has better visuals, more FPS, and the only bug I got so far is that the game constantly restarts itself when switched off. Kinda annoying.Having said that, it is a very pleasant coop experience, singleplayer ain't bad either. The problem is, people had high hopes for this game, with SEGA's unfortunate promises. It's not bad, but apart from the co-op campaign (which I think supports even more than just two players) and some fun modes in multiplayer (if you can persuade a bunch of friends) the game is pretty average.Only get it with a discount, and it is far better when played with a friend. Personally, I completed the campaign alone first and it was fun for me, but if you are a very demanding gamer you might want to pick up something else instead.P.S. Oh, and there are some great mods online that are said to seriously upgrade the game both in terms of AI and visuals. I haven't checked those, though.

content:
Posted: October 18, 2014
												Well I enjoyed a bit playing this coz of the fact I did finish this game despite all the hates and negative criticism.  It's okay for me but not as much like and love that I did on my most love games. If I am to rate this game maybe 6-6.5 out of 10.Pro: - There's aliens.- Variety of weapons and customization- There's coop multiplayer which honestly I love to play sometimes.- I think the Statis DLC is a good one.- It's cool when you use ACM custom settings.. (v1.11c) and SweetFXCons:- I find it hard to feel the tense and atmosphere throughout the game. There are few moments I felt that while I was playing it.- The graphics kinda so so using in-game settings. (You can tweak it to be like on the demo using SweetFX and ACM custom settings.. (v1.11c).- Not so hard even on hard mode except on bosses sort which takes time to kill- Hard to find anyone on multiplayer to play with if you don't have friendsBest played with headset, ACM custom settings.. (v1.11c) and SweetFX enabled. Making it much more like the original atmosphere from the E3 shown E3 demo. Don't ever play this game using in-game default video/graphics settings as it feels like empty graphics quality.Do I recommend it? Mmmmm I dunno I'm confused, lol. But if you're an Alien fan sure is highly recommended. If you're a casual gamer worth picking up at a the most bargain price during sale. number of helpful: 3 of 7 people (43%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 4, 2014
												I'm not certain I can say much more than what has already been said about this game in the past, but I feel I must warn people who are looking for that "Aliens" movie feeling.Let's face it (no pun intended), we have all been wanting a good co-op Aliens game, but appart from some Aliens vs. Predator games it hasn't really ever happened. This game was supposed to be it, only to fall flat on its face before the finishing line. At its core you have a simple sci-fi FPS game, although the gunplay is simply not good at all and boring. The guns either handle a bit awkwardly or are simply boring to shoot. Yes, you have an Aliens game where the guns feel bland and boring to shoot! I don't even know how you can wrong here, but apparently it did. The AI which could have made this game fun too is bad too, and it isn't uncommon to see aliens simply standing still without doing anything for no reason at all. The story is also horrible and shocking in a bad way. I don't want to get into too many details as it hurts too much, but other than making it seem as if Alien 3 and 4 didn't happen, it is just a flawed and badly written story which seems to have only purpose; Marketing as voice actors from the original movie were cast for some voiceovers. It is just tacky and bad. When the game was released you would have expected some good grahpics to add atmosphere and so on. Somewhere along the way after their E3 showcase this was completely forgotten, and we ended up with a game that looked a couple of years older than what you would have expected. However, a few fractions of levels hints of what the game could have been, but sadly failed to deliver.As a fan of the Alien franchise I really wanted to like this game, but no love for the franchise can help this game being good.

content:
Posted: June 29, 2015
												Warning, only get this game if you are buying it cheap and for the DLC pack "Stasis Interrupted". It will be especially dissappointing if you have played the AVP series too.The game also has a really annoying bug (no not the alien), which will see you exit the game from the menu only to return to steam and see it auto-launching again from stream? I mean that's a unique feature and good way to increase the hours played, particularly if you expected the simple exit button to exit and not restart the game :) In order to stop it restarting you have to kill it before it gets to the loading image.Aside from that the game is pretty much lost in what it is trying to be. Scripted sequences that are under baked, horrible lead and supporting characters and boring goals. There was controversey on the release of this game with the art having been beefed up for some sections of the showcased demo, even if that art was great in the game it would not make up for the some of the other areas where the game fell down.Redemption can be found in the beauty of some well lit smoke filled corridors and rooms along with some epic sound design.. I mean who doesn't love the sound the marines guns from this franchise?However, I can't recommend this game standalone, you really need to get it on sale with the DLC I mentioned above.

content:
Posted: September 2, 2013
												It's not all bad: moving and shooting is basically competent, most of the minute-to-minute stuff in the levels was decent but linear. Some visual design aspects were nice, collectibles were neat, and the stealth level is really cool.But it's mostly a terrible game. The weapon upgrading system is shallow, weapon variety sucks, combat design is awful and consists of waves of identical boring enemies coming after you, graphics are hit-and-miss, the boss fights are awful (the first boss fight is actually the more tedious, frustrating, stupid boss fight design I've ever seen in a game. Seriously.) The game is built around cover combat but there's no cover. There are almost no interesting setpieces and the levels aren't labyrinthine or fun to move around to make up for it. Damage feedback is poor, QTEs, boring object interaction, etc. The game uses very poorly made checkpoints. Lots of checkpoint -> long walking section -> tons of combat -> long walking section -> combat -> checkpoint, so if you die near the end you repeat stuff that wasn't necessarily hard, just long and boring. I'd say dying and repeating added 3-4 hours to my playthrough on Hard.The story, characters, and dialogue are all obnoxious and incomprehensible. If you're an Alien fan, there's a massive event that retroactively changes the plot of Alien 3. If you're not an Alien fan, this is nonsense. The game makes no sense. By the end of the game I still couldn't tell most of the main characters apart and I didn't have a clue why characters were angry and at who and really what was going on.If you want to play a good game, don't play this. If you want to play a bad game that's bad-good, this is more bad-frustrating. I wouldn't expect much joy to come from this. It's not the worst game ever made. I'd give it a 4 or 5/10.

content:
Posted: December 27, 2013
												Did you watch the movies? Did you watch them again after seeing the "famous" E3 gameplay demo? Did you hope for a good aliens experience? Hah! You can hope all you want. Hope in this case is the mother of fools.This game is completely washed off from all the tension, horror, screams and jumps that accompany all the movies and all previous games based on the franchise. Bland lighting effects, bland particle effects and super bland aliens movement. The animations are probably the last nail in the coffin. All bugs sneak (Ye, right), jump, move and attack in such a dreadful, uninspired motion that it hurts to watch it. It is good to kill them though. It makes you feel that you put them out of their misery one burst at a time. The story at first seems to be interesting since it is set between Aliens 2 and 3. Sadly, it is the same old story as in most Aliens games. We have the evil Weyland-Yutani corporation trying to domisticate the Aliens using myriads of innocent people as hosts. One of the Marines gets infected and you will try to save him (You don't need to guess how it turns out). There is some bla bla abou Hicks but you see him first at the intro cutscene and then...well then he will make an appearance. Dunno what exactly will it be since I have to go through 3 more levels to complete the game...wouldn't count on much though.Save your cash, buy only if heavily discounted and when there are other friends you will play it with. It has 3 player co-op campaign. People really paid 60$ on launch for a game that lasts for max 7 hours? Pre-ordered it? Bah...poor guys...
