content:
Posted: February 8, 2015
												Played till the end because of the story. I'm a fan of the franchise, and for those who wonder, you get to meet some characters and familiar places from the movies, and you get to hear that distinguishing sound of that weapon that immediately tells you it's an Alien universe. In more depth, the setting is just after the events of Aliens (2nd movie). You are the search and rescue team on a mission to find out what happened to the last search and rescue team (inception?). This time the enemies are not exclusively Aliens. Typical army behaviours "shoot first, ask questions later" leads the story to quick extermination of anything that is alive and moves, from both your side and the enemies'. Childish grudges drive the majority of the squad. Through out the story you get to be around 4-5 named characters, your superior officer, and some other marines. Although you feel exactly like the main character in Aliens, outnumbered and impulsive, your superior officer keeps on referring to hundreds of heads he is responsible to "get off that rock". I'd say the ending is a bit cliche, but oh well.Graphics are good. Dark setting, textures seemed high rez enough. Good uses of lighting, mostly. Details are close to accurate as the movies, environments easily recognizable, but used multiple times though out the story. I did not notice any major changes between different visits to the same settings. They did however introduce new "species" of aliens, with different abilities.Mechanics. Well... um... mediocre. From marines bugging on ladders, to aliens moving though the walls, this game has it all. Some environments provide points where you just stand and cannot be attacked by the enemies, makes it a bit less thrilling. Marine movements and animations are in good standing, apart from facial animation during cut scenes and speaches. Alien movements are less polished. Felt mechanical at the very least, with strange movements in unnatural manner (Aliens? unnatural movements? are you listening to yourself?). AI in this game is at the lowest standing. Everything and everyone is going straight for you, everytime. 10 other marines in front of you? shooting at the creature point blank? you chill in the back choosing another weapon? Guess what? They love you and want a hug. And while on the subject of other marines in the front, it doesn't seem like they have any health bars or anything, they can stand in the middle of the field, getting fired upon, zerged by everything, but yet go like /care and carry on. But if you get to show up from behind a crate on the other side of the map, boom, headshot.Overally I believe the game could have been better. But I got it on winter sale, after the "major" update. So I can't complain. Haven't played the multiplayer yet.

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 25, 2013
												ORIGINAL REVIEWDo I really need to say?--------UPDATED REVIEW [April 10th, 2015]Christ, I really didn't say much back then, did I?tl;dr at the bottomBut in all seriousness, everyone at the time knew of the bad press surrounding this game, and for good reason: with what Gearbox had showed the public through trailers and promotions, ALIENS COLONIAL MARINES looked like a fantastic Aliens title that could potentially expand and add to the lore.The cooperative gameplay looked intense and we all couldn't wait to jump into the boots of the Colonial Marines.I was one of the unfortunate suckers that pre-ordered the game and were horrified to find an incomplete and barely-functioning game that held little semblance to the one we were promised. We felt cheated and had, with some even going so far as to file lawsuits.Since then, the game has been patched and updated somewhat. For laughs, an online friend decided to pick the game up for cheap, and I played with him, finally completing the game for the first time.The graphics have been updated and look much better than the visuals at initial release, but are still mediocre at best. There are tons of screen-tearing moments, assets moving through one another, and sometimes seeing through walls like I'm Superman. Though the environments are sometimes decently-crafted, it's hard to tell as entirely different structures somehow look the same. Half the time I couldn't tell where I was and had to open my motion tracker to find where the objectives were.The AI is absolutely brain-dead, no other game's AI can hold a candle to ALIENS COLONIAL MARINES (except for Ride To Hell: Retribution, perhaps). Your AI comrades either lag miles behind or run forward with reckless abandon, and you'll either have to wait minutes for them to catch up to doors only they can open, or you'll have to run down corridors shooting all the xenomorphs they've triggered.The enemy AI doesn't fare much better, with xenomorphs running around like chickens and human fighters moving like robots. Also, you fight a lot of humans in a game about aliens. Kind of strange, isn't it? And with very few variations in enemy types, combat feels nothing more than campaign padding.The story is dreary and actually feels like it is disrespecting the source material, rather than enriching it. The entire cast is poorly performed and character actions feel nonsensical and pointless. The little references to the original Aliens movie feel token and hokey, with so-called Legendary weapons found in random locations that don't tie in with the film. I really don't know what else to say. Honestly, my friends and I had a laugh playing the game, but we still found some fun in it; the gameplay wasn't the most stable, but we still enjoyed fending off waves of xenomorphs while defending a hack, and there were moments where I felt tension and a need to hurry.Ultimately, new updates couldn't save this game. If you and your friends pick up the game for cheap, you might have a decent time with it. But ALIENS COLONIAL MARINES is a game best left to rest. Though it's far from being the worst game I've ever played, it's also far from being a great one.-------tl;dr+Locales feel authentic+Xenomorphs, in certain scenarios, are terrifying to deal with+Nice personal gun customization+Somewhat enjoyable coop experience, where you feel more badass fighting with friends at your side-Unimpressive graphics, poor presentation-Gameplay is unstable at best, as are assets-AI is shoddy and unreliable, both as an enemy and ally-Story is boring and slow, characters unlikeable-Homage to source material feels shallow and disrespectful-Sound is buggy and awful-Guns lack accuracy, especially gun sights-Bosses and enemies are easy to glitch and exploit-Ending is unbelievably awful, completely flacid

												If you are looking for a great game to play with awesome AI, great character development, and amazing Aliens, DO NOT BUY THIS GAME.    Aliens CM is the worst Alien game I have had the chance to play, and I have played them all. This game is seriously not worth the money even on a discounted price. The graphics are subpar, the AI is honestly worse than games made 15 years ago, AI pathing is atrocious, and the Aliens themselves are just bullet sponges that offer virtually no content to the game. content:
Posted: December 27, 2013
												Did you watch the movies? Did you watch them again after seeing the "famous" E3 gameplay demo? Did you hope for a good aliens experience? Hah! You can hope all you want. Hope in this case is the mother of fools.This game is completely washed off from all the tension, horror, screams and jumps that accompany all the movies and all previous games based on the franchise. Bland lighting effects, bland particle effects and super bland aliens movement. The animations are probably the last nail in the coffin. All bugs sneak (Ye, right), jump, move and attack in such a dreadful, uninspired motion that it hurts to watch it. It is good to kill them though. It makes you feel that you put them out of their misery one burst at a time. The story at first seems to be interesting since it is set between Aliens 2 and 3. Sadly, it is the same old story as in most Aliens games. We have the evil Weyland-Yutani corporation trying to domisticate the Aliens using myriads of innocent people as hosts. One of the Marines gets infected and you will try to save him (You don't need to guess how it turns out). There is some bla bla abou Hicks but you see him first at the intro cutscene and then...well then he will make an appearance. Dunno what exactly will it be since I have to go through 3 more levels to complete the game...wouldn't count on much though.Save your cash, buy only if heavily discounted and when there are other friends you will play it with. It has 3 player co-op campaign. People really paid 60$ on launch for a game that lasts for max 7 hours? Pre-ordered it? Bah...poor guys...

content:
Posted: March 17, 2015
												Personal Rating: 4 of 10There are many reviews out there stating the game is piled with bugs and crashes your system. I played this recently and encounter no such problem on my machine running on Windows 7 except for a couple of minor bugs.However I cannot rate this game any higher nor recommend it either as it is somewhat dull. Gameplay is very much a generic Run 'n Gun FPS with ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ A.I. Graphics are just swell and the sound effect and its track are nothing of the extraordinary. Most of the time you will be accompanied by an AI teammate and he carries a Smart Gun which does not require any ammo but still needs manual aiming. He will empty a couple of rounds towards a container where the enemy is hiding while standing in the open. It is clear that the developers simply increases the damage dealt by the enemies to provide the otherwise zero challenge game. There is this one time when I snuck behind the enemy when he was working on the computer. When he noticed me, he went rampage with hands held high towards other computer and start working on it again.Tonnes of collectible in the game but non provides any fun since you won't be bothered with the story that has no character development. The unique weapons are no different from the standard issue ones except for large clip but it does not come with the upgrades making them useless.Multiplayer is dead so I could not experience it nor try out the co-op gameplay and Aliens.This game was removed from Steam for a period of time and I thought I was lucky to purchased it beforehand but after playing it I wished I was permanently removed even from my library.

content:
Posted: January 23, 2015
												I bought this after the big patch, and at a large discount, so that flavors my review somewhat.  Also, I enjoyed the Alien movies, but I am not bothered about the plot consistencies between the movies and the game.  They are not documentaries, after all.  I am having fun with this, graphics are fine for me, as I don't watch trailers for games or movies, they all tend to give you inflated expectations.  The inane sound bytes from NPCs' are amusing for a bit, then start to get irritating after a while.  The thousandth time I hear 'watch the ceiling'  was about enough.Ran well for me, taken as another space-super marine-save the world shooter, it was fine.  If it hadn't had the iconic tie in, and so much hype,  It would have been a lot better received.*A lot of the people unhappy with this are the poor souls who pre-ordered.  Don't do that, please.  Then they already have your money, and a lot of the pressure to produce is gone, like Early Access. {cough '10 years after ' cough}  I have never went into a car dealership and given them 20 large for next years model before it's built, and I won't do it on a small scale either.

content:
Posted: April 2, 2015
												That is how I love FPS games!Its kinda old-school FPS with some well designed maps and a lot of action. There are different alien types and quiet a few weapons to pick from. Shooting the aliens is very fun and requires some skill. The game uses checkpoints instead of quicksaves but it works pretty well, all checkpoints are placed just right. I had to repeat some parts (playing on veteran difficulty). But so far it was never unfair. If I died I just got more motivated. This is how a good game should be designed! The graphics are totally ok, after some bad reviews I expected the game to look bad - but it does not! Although I had graphic and AI glitches in some maps. The sound and music is very good too.The story so far does not suck me in very much. But it is very close to the whole Alien franchise.8/10

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: January 25, 2016
												4/10"Play this if you're loyal to the franchise as it's not too terribly bad... but I wouldn't buy it unless it was HEAVILY discounted, even then i'd probably prefer it as a gift. If you want a true to the franchise ALIEN game, go get Alien: Isolation, Its wonderful!"Figured that I would make this game my first review that way barely anyone will see it to care about the fact that my opinion of this game differs from mostly everyone who has reviewed this game, as I don't think it's "that" bad of a game, although it isn't all that great. As a long-time "Alien" franchise fan, I have played any and all games related to this universe that I could ever possibly get my hands on, and that being said, this is not by any means the best game related to the franchise. It has alot of issues that should of been resolved before release, and were completely ignored well after even up until now. I like to say that this game had potential to be on par with Alien Isolation, which I feel it could have been if given the attention that Alien: Isolation got. Sadly, this game got overwhelmed by bad reviews so quickly that noone really cared to even try and fix what was wrong. It saddens me to see what could of been such a great game go to waste, but thankfully we got Alien: Isolation and hopefully they'll use what made it such a great game to give a game like this another try. In conclusion, I'd only buy it if it were heavily discounted and you REALLY REALLY wanted to play it... Otherwise, get Alien: Isolation instead...

content:
Posted: July 25, 2015
												"Look up at the stars, and not down at your feet.  Try to make sense of what you see, and wonder about what makes the universe exist.  Be curious." -Stephen HawkingWithout further delay, here is my review for Aliens: Colonial Marines.Gameplay: Smooth.  Think about that word for a minute.  Then I want you to buy this game, load it up, and watch in awe as that word takes on a whole new meaning.  The action sequences in this game are so tense, one time I accidently flung my mouse into the air and it came crashing down onto my monitor causing me to pay $400 to get a new one.  I would gladly pay double to re-live the experience again.  Watch out for faces in the forest and stay away from the alien spaceship, hehe.  Smooth is not an adequate word to describe the feeling I have in smacking aliens with fluid controls and smooth gameplay. As a famous philosopher once said: "All roads lead to Rome."Verdict: I give this 9/10, because it's so smooth. Excellent use of aliens. Good job Gearbox for giving us this amazing game.Note: this game is currently in beta, but that just goes to show you how smooth this game is.***This review was written using a key provided by the Developer for review purposes***

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 26, 2015
												Worst part of the game is the graphics.  In game is nothing, nothing like the pictures on the store.  I knew they would be different, but not so vastly different.  It seems like it is bait advertising.  Thats with maximum settings for everything on a good Nvidia card.  There is an occasional second or two in some of the cut scenes that look like those pictures, but that is it.--------------Single-Player--------------Game is somewhat fun as a very average FPS.  There are worse.  Not many.  The plot is pretty good but there are some moments that conflict with a characters behaviour a short time earlier.I am a huge sci-fi and Alien universe fan which is probably its only true redeeming factor.  If it wasn't Aliens related then I wouldn't pay for this.  As it was I bought it at a very low price.The AI is bad.  Your team-mates are for the most part useless and occasionally a problem.  The enemy alternates between completely hopeless to absolute crack shots.The bugs (software not alien) are bad.  Objects will suddenly appear and dissappear in random locations (e.g a team mate character is in front of you, then suddenly the same one is behind you, and then back in front.  All while you do nothing.)  You can walk through many things.  Aliens and teammates walk through you as well.  There are lots of invisible walls.  The characters aren't animated very well to a scene.-----------Multiplayer-----------Tried it.  Took too long to find a game.  Not sure if it is because of my locality, but that doesn't seem to be a problem with most other games.----------Overall----------This would have been a pretty good game, back in 2006.  There is nothing innovative about it and in fact many things are a step back from other FPS released around the same time.

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 27, 2015
												The game is entertaining enough and gives you the opportunity to live out everyone's fantasy of being a Colonial Marine. Recommend you buy this when it's on sale with the Statis Interrupted DLC, which is a prequal campaign that deals with some plot holes in the main game (the DLC is actually better then the main game, surprise!). None of the other DLC is really worth buying. The game has multiplayer, but there is no active player base so this is pretty much a single player only experience. The 4GB has made the game better since launch, fixing bugs and improving the graphics. The only good thing I can say about this game is that it's a decent enough experience if your a big Aliens fan and want to run around places like the Sulaco or Hadley's Hope.

content:
Posted: January 5, 2016
												Colonial Marines is a great Alien horror / shooter that has a Doom 3 feel to it.  The levels and settings feel great, and the story isn't terrible.  This game does suffer one thing in particular, and that is one of the worst ally AI's in a game.  It's very possible to have an ally be stuck in the corner of a room while you are facing hordes of deadly aliens that can already be enough of a challenge on it's own.  Probably the only other downside would be a mini boss fight against an Alien Queen that seemed not only lacking, but very vague and unclear on how to fight with the machine it gave you.  As well as the AI that didn't do squat around you.  If it weren't for the AI this would be a great game with awesome story and AI interactions.8/10

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 24, 2013
												Never have I been so disappointed with a game like I have with Aliens: Colonial Marines. The disappointment is up to par with the ending of Mass Effect 3, which saddens me greatly because I am a huge fan of the Alien franchise. I was extremely happy to see that a canon Aliens game was in the making and after 6 years this pile of junk was released. For people who haven't been up to date with this game you may ask: It can't be that bad, can it?Yes, it can. It IS that bad. With false advertising and the out-sourcing made by Gearbox, this is a product that went completely FUBAR. The graphics are outdated, the game looks incredibly bad and the cut scenes are terrible. The single player story is 5 hours short and stupid (especially the twists). It's also a generic shooter with incredibly bad AI. Your AI teammates keeps missing their shots, shooting into walls AND standing in front of turrets when they shouldn't. They sometimes stop following you and suddenly morph to your location when you reach checkpoints. Even the 3+ gigabyte patch couldn't save this game.What they got right, however, was the Alien queen and the music in the game. The music is actually superb and I was happy that at least SOME Alien-feeling was present in the game since 40 minutes into the game it feels more like a really bad Call of Duty copy. A plus is that you can play co-op campaign, however, it's an easy game so you probably won't have much trouble if you're two (let alone four) playing the game. I also heard that the multiplayer is where the game shines but since I am not into multiplayer I never tried it.This is one of the worst AAA titles that I have ever witnessed. You are better of playing the 1999 Aliens vs Predator game than this one. But it does have co-op and it can bring a few laughs because of the horrible design of the marines and aliens (and the game in general). Don't buy this at full price. Buy it on a -very- cheap sale. You'll thank me.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 10, 2014
												AHHH, I gave this game a thumb up... I must be mad!? Let me explain how that "happened" after all those bad reviews that game received. I did read a lot about that game before I bought it so I was warned and my expectations were, frankly, quite low. I was only interested in the singleplayer-campaign so this small review is all about this, I didn't try coop or multiplayer. I did play the most actual and patched version, so the game may be more stable and slightly more pretty now than the earlier ones most of those bad reviews were about.The game is a straight firstperson-shooter without a good story (how many FPS-games have that anyway?), without state-of-the-art graphics (the game looks like 2006 or 2007, but that is not that much of a surprise considering the long development-time and the aging unreal3-engine which was used) and you have no freedom in movement apart from some rooms the hidden dogtags or legendary weapons are in. But the game is solid! Acceptable atmosphere, a lot of dark places, many many aliens and (yes, to many) human soldiers to shoot at. The music ist nice with strong references to the original soundtracks of ALIEN and ALIENS and the mixture of outside and inside-levels works. I would not call the developers lazy just because a few levels are reused...On the bad side are the forgetable characters (but how many FPS-games have memorable ones?), unoriginal gameplay and weak KI. But on "hardened" difficulty the Aliens are quite deadly even being that "dumb". All in all this game is by far no masterpiece and the licence is capable of much more. But for a weekend it IS ok and worth a few hours.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 13, 2013
												Aliens: Colonial Marines was had a rough time. It was panned by the critics and decimated by the public. Despite this (and because I love Aliens so much), I decided to give the game a fair shot and go into it open minded. At first, I was really enjoying the game, it's atmosphere, the sound design of the classic weapons, and... well that was about it. It was a lot of fun fighting the aggressive xenomorphs but the plot takes a crazy turn and you end up fighting humans for a large, almost half, of the time. It was a decent shot, but the game just couldn't keep my interest. The checkpoint system isn't the best, which makes the cheap, almost instant deaths when fightning the humans with guns a whole lot worse. Sadly, I didn't bother to finish the game's campaign. I loved the first couple hours, and there are a few great moments scattered about after that, but just not enough.2.5/5

content:
Posted: July 20, 2015
												I really want to enjoy this. I have probably the largest bias towards Alien games in the world, and want to defend this game to the death. But I can't.It's a clunky, extraordinarily average and generic shooter with an Aliens skin. There is some nice fan service here and there, like visiting Hadly's Hope and seeing all the sights from the movie, which are very well done from a design point of view. But the game feels really sluggish, the shooting mechanics are boring, and the entire campaign is extremely linear, and STILL buggy after two years.If it was on sale, maybe consider it. But this is really poor form for Gearbox.

content:
Posted: November 28, 2013
												There is not much really to add to this game that hasn't already been said. So this is simply a testament that all thenegative things you heard aboput this game is true. It is not only the game and its mechanics that are poorly done, it is also how they have handled the source material and how they seem to have missed all the extended universe material already out there. The game itself is a mess between a bad shooter that feels very dated and sloppy. The "feel" simply isn't there and the immersion is totally broken since you at any time can swap weapons, get notices about upgrades and whatnots.The aliens are usually straight chargers and the only scary bit is if you sometimes miss one of them popping up out of the blue. This game is so bad, it isn't even fun in a bad way. It is a shame they released this game and it is IMO a shame what they tried to do to teh ALIENS storyline.Fans deserved better.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 28, 2013
												First off, I need to say this: I'm not a hardcore aliens fan.But I do love that franchise.This said, this game is very bipolar when it comes to itself; there are moments where you will curse its name for being so stupideasy, so cliché, so linear, so... everything that can be wrong with a game, really, save crashing.And then, there will be moments that you will ask yourself "Who made this section and why weren't they in charge of the entire bloody game? This is FANTASTIC.".And then, there will be a few moments, far between, where you'll nearly♥♥♥♥♥♥your pants in fear and/or surprise.There isn't much to say about ACM that hasn't been said before; the way I like to say it is that it's a game of extremes.What it does well, it does extremely well and what it does wrong, it makes an epic failure out of it.The story is nice, but cookie-cutter.The humans are just a big "WHY did you think this would be a good idea?" question for the developer.The graphics are okay at best.The co-op is amazing.The AI is completely stupid.Multiplayer is well thought out.The game is way too easy.The ending is a HUGE letdown.I don't care that you're saying "there will be more in DLCs"; I didn't pay to have the right to a DLC! I paid to get a game.And with 4-5 hours worth of single/coop play, I shouldn't have to pour more money in this thing.The savings grace?I played this game on day 1 with a friend of mine who's a HUGE Aliens fan and we were both new to the game. He made the experience completely worthwhile.So, unless you have a friend who's a huge fan of the franchise and never played the game and wants to play with you (and 2 other friends), don't really bother with this game. Otherwise, do it. Best fun and laughs you'll have had in a long time.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 24, 2013
												Never have I been so disappointed with a game like I have with Aliens: Colonial Marines. The disappointment is up to par with the ending of Mass Effect 3, which saddens me greatly because I am a huge fan of the Alien franchise. I was extremely happy to see that a canon Aliens game was in the making and after 6 years this pile of junk was released. For people who haven't been up to date with this game you may ask: It can't be that bad, can it?Yes, it can. It IS that bad. With false advertising and the out-sourcing made by Gearbox, this is a product that went completely FUBAR. The graphics are outdated, the game looks incredibly bad and the cut scenes are terrible. The single player story is 5 hours short and stupid (especially the twists). It's also a generic shooter with incredibly bad AI. Your AI teammates keeps missing their shots, shooting into walls AND standing in front of turrets when they shouldn't. They sometimes stop following you and suddenly morph to your location when you reach checkpoints. Even the 3+ gigabyte patch couldn't save this game.What they got right, however, was the Alien queen and the music in the game. The music is actually superb and I was happy that at least SOME Alien-feeling was present in the game since 40 minutes into the game it feels more like a really bad Call of Duty copy. A plus is that you can play co-op campaign, however, it's an easy game so you probably won't have much trouble if you're two (let alone four) playing the game. I also heard that the multiplayer is where the game shines but since I am not into multiplayer I never tried it.This is one of the worst AAA titles that I have ever witnessed. You are better of playing the 1999 Aliens vs Predator game than this one. But it does have co-op and it can bring a few laughs because of the horrible design of the marines and aliens (and the game in general). Don't buy this at full price. Buy it on a -very- cheap sale. You'll thank me.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 17, 2013
												Dont buy this at all in full Retail Price, save your money. Only get this if its on a steam sale. I would recomend that you should spend $7 or less on this.  This game had potential but  Gearbox outsourced most of this game while they where busy with Borderland 2 and Sega failed BIG time to keep an eye on this release. When the game first came out it was buggy as hell. Your AI teamates just stand there while Aliens eat you to pieces.  The only saving grace is that Multiplay is somewhat fun and Single Player Coop drop in or out.  Singleplay campain is meh also short like 5 hrs to 6 this is on hard mode by the way.  As an Alien Fan you might enjoy this. I did, for example the Aliens sound just like in the movies with their hissing and whines. The good old motion detector was always fun/cool to use. It was pretty disapointing in what Gearbox promised to release, when this came out. Just search a youtube comparison of Gearbox Aliens Colnial Marines Demo video and compare it to the released one. You'll see a huge diference and why this was a big let down.Again Only get this on the cheap and if your looking for another Aliens fix, this game is just that. Im not saying that the gameplay is crappy, shooting Aliens is fun, but it was a big let down.  The game  Aliens vs Predator made by Rebellion plays and looks better then this game and it came out 2010, now that tells you something right there.Update: Also only grab the dlc on the cheap too.  The new singleplayer DLC Stasis Interrupted campain is slightly better but not worth full price in my opinion, so get that on sale as well.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 17, 2013
												It's been a while since a hotly anticipated game has eventually received as much flak as Aliens: Colonial Marines. And yeah, the game's admittedly not that great. Somewhat dated graphics, very basic run-and-gun/hunt-the-switch mechanics and AI issues could not stop me from occasionally actually enjoying the game, however. I especially liked the initial bits in Hadley's Hope, which were quite atmospheric. But let's be honest - The game doesn't really stand on its own, and holds together just because of the strength of the Aliens franchise. I wouldn't recommend the game at full price, but it's a decent enough diversion if you get it cheap.

content:
Posted: January 10, 2015
												After the first few nerve racking scenerios it does improve.  For 5 Buck it is recommended.  Stays nerve racking but I think that tones down some also.  I'd give it a 6 out of 10 stars.   I think there is noticeable improvement in your overall ability to survive as you level and I would not say it is merely skill related.  It eventually gives you a reasonable variaty of missions which keeps it interesting.  I think the tracking device need an instruction manual.  It might be obvious to some perhaps but it doesn't seem to make sense to me.  I often seem to walk all around without spotting a thing and when I'm right on top of it.  It usually jumps me from somewhere.  It is annoying that with every hit you have to find the target before you can even fire.  Basically disorients you in the game as well depending on the person I'm sure.  It picked up though so I cant complain.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 2, 2014
												A turgid mess. For all it's sins as played out by the media I really enjoyed Duke Nukem Forever and saw a lot I like, from the combat mechanics to the level design. I can't say the same thing about Colonial Marines. The biggest issue is the lie Gearbox produced about them being 100% dedicated to the Aliens franchise lore. They outsourced the game to a lesser experienced budget game developer whilst stating they were the ones working on it. As well as putting out footage of a game that didn't exist whilst promoting it. The story is terrible, with some of the worst an level writing I have ever witnessed. The AI for the aliens is horrible. They will get stuck on walls, stand still in front of you and do nothing at times or just come barreling toward you down a corridor and straight into your pulse rifle. Saying that, it doesn't seem as bad as you'll spend most the game fighting human mercs anyway. In fact you spend more time fighting humans than Aliens in an Aliens game. Go figure. The game had 1 redeeming section which was the Hadleys Hope area where you could walk around the movies set but in context of the films canon it doesn't make any sense for it to still be standing. I will never take this game as canon because doing so requires to many stupid leapes of faith and coincidinces over explained film lore. Horrible game that Gearbox  should be more worried will damage their repuation than Duke Nukem ever would.EDIT: Upon viewing the store page there are still screenshots being used from the early E3 demo that the game looks nothing like. Absolute false advertising of this trash game.

content:
Posted: January 9, 2015
												The short: Feces. The long: After playing CA's excellent Alien: Isolation to 100% I expected a painful experience but not this bad. I did not have hype for it at release because Gearbox's Borderlands 1 I found boring, extremely repetitive and underwhelming by the end. This game however is an embrassment to game design, the fans of the series and consumers. How someone says that this is a good buy on sale even with the patches is beyond me. It broke Steam by restarting the program everytime my friend and I tried to quit. It kept restarting for me even after restarting Steam and completely restarting my PC. Not more than three missions in during coop it gave my friend the Blue Screen of Death. After that we had enough, we both uninstalled it and refuse to acknowledge its existance. Screw you Gearbox & Randy "Liar Extraordinaire" Pitchford for dragging our PCs and one of our favorite franchises through the mud. It will take a mountain of good games to want something of yours again.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 11, 2015
												Do you remember that scene in Alien Resurrection where a failed Ripley clone is begging to be killed? That's what this game made me feel like.This is a prefect example of what happens when you take a great IP, and squeeze out a lazy cash-grab game concept. The only thing more offensive then it's terrible game-play, lazy level design, horrible AI, fan-fiction grade writing and the least likeable squad mate in recent gaming history is that it's considered Alien cannon. The xenomorphs are stupid and never pose a real threat. There's almost no tension at any point in the game. It feels like a checklist of things that had to be included into an FPS were lazily thrown tacked on. Oh and you fight humans for half the game. Go ahead, re-read that sentence, at least half of the combat in Aliens Colonial Marines is against other humans.The only things this game got right were art direction and sound direction. It fails at literally everything else.Like- It looks like an Aliens product-It sounds like an Aliens productDislikes-EVERY THING ELSETLRD: It's terrible, go play classic AvP instead.

content:
Posted: July 23, 2015
												I bought this game a week ago when it was on sale along with AVP, and let me be the last to say, this game sucks. In fact, it is in the worst state it has ever been in right now.If you are looking to buy this game for the multiplayer, DO NOT BUY! Barely anyone plays this game anymore, and for modes like Team Deathmatch, it seems to require all slots in order to play, which is near impossible at this time. I was lucky to see one person show up. Also, the co-op online campain is ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t too. If you are looking to play a specific level on a specific difficulty, good luck my friend. To this date I have never found anyone show up to play with me after several attempts. This is very disappointing because I was really looking forward to the multiplayer modes this game had to offer. The campaign is not nearly enough to justify the purchase. The AI is crap, especially for your assigned partners when you play offline, and the death screens are just confusing. Sure, there are some fun sections to be had in the game. Such areas include using the smart gun for 5 minutes, finding legendary weapons, and the great survival horror level near the middle of the game.Overall, what am I telling you that you haven't already heard for the past two years? This game sucks, and now it sucks more than ever. I feel robbed even at a discounted price. If you want a good marine game that is shorter, try AVP. It is cheaper and a much better experience than A:CM. If you are big into survival horror, Alien Isolation masters it, check that one out.

content:
Posted: June 19, 2014
												Ignoring the technical issues...Ignoring the poor level design...Ignoring the graphics being not great...Ignoring the fact that all the advertising for the game was kind of a bait-n-switch using footage from a better looking version of the game...It's impossible to ignore the fact that the game is uninspired and doesn't really even make sense. You could have made this game with the Sulacco (the best part of the game) and had it dock automated on a station and then the station got infected. You could have made a story that made sense. There's no reason to go back to Haley's Hope, which would have been wiped off the map with the massive explosion of the Atmosphere Processor that went thermo-nuclear at the end of Aliens. It makes even LESS sense that the Atmosphere Processor itself still exists.The game just doesn't make sense, and is boring. What a waste.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 23, 2014
												This is one of those titles that I found more enoyable on PC than on console.  Although it still isn't the game that was originally shown and yes we were all misled, its far from "Worst Game ever".In the PC version the Aliens have a better AI and I find myself dying a lot even on the easiest difficuly, the Aliens now climb up walls and ceilings and sometimes they sneak up on you (None of this is in the console version)The graphics while not the best I've seen, they make the game feel like the movie its based off, and there's a lot of authenticty here, so there's no ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t "Exclusions" or retcons to the story here.While I do admit the inclusion of shooting humans is somewhat strange given the source material, however shooting Aliens would have evemntually gotten boring pretty quickly, so in a way I'm happy human enemies are in this game, but I do agree that they should have only been in one or two levels.One thing that would have made this game great is an Alien campaign, as cool as it is to rev up that Pulse Rifle, it'd be nice to see things from their side for a change.AVOID the console version.Pros: Shooting feels satisfying, Alien AI is much improved over the console versions, authentic throughout, Pulse Rifles Cons: Still suffers on the visuals, no Alien Campaign, lack luster end boss fight.

content:
Posted: June 20, 2014
												Bought this under the 75% off sale, played it through ultimate badass first time round then uninstalled it upon completion.Sadly, A:CM is unrecommended for playing due to the fact that, there are some areas in the game which makes you wonder what the game designers were thinking when coming up with concepts of boss fights, areas to defend and really mundane level design. The worst part is objectives involving humans, there is more human combat than xenos. The AI is bad, by that I mean you can just locate the way points and headshot pretty much anything. The fight with the Raven vs you in a powerloader has to be one of the worst midboss fights ever played, really just involves spamming the left mouse, no means of skill involved. As for the final queen boss fight, well it was a waste of time. Again on the AI side, the game includes a marine to follow you about, this kind of eliminates the fear factor, you are with a meatshield that can not die. Though does fractional damage to the Xenos and pretty much a useless AI to have around, shame that cant be disabled as it's part of this story which again is weak.Another annoyance is the scripted events and switch pressing animations, really not needed yet it becomes fustrating when you are told to pull a lever whilst you are under attack, though yes you will get hit whilst stuck in these animations.The graphics, models and character animations have a 2009 era feel to them.Looking beyond these mishaps there is some nice settings, the view of LV426 is nice, the weapons are sound and it is a lot of fun getting to use Colonial Marine weapons, shame the Smartgun is seen as a special gun than a weapon you can carry about with you.Pros- Nice settings of the game(LV426)- Get to use Colonial Marine weapons- Recommended for play in Ultimate Badass mode only to get the best experience (warning Raven boss fight in this mode will be fustrating!)Cons- Multiplayer is now non-existant (bad rep for this game has buried it)- Single player plot sucks/Characters are boring, no character depth (It will get annoying when you keep hearing the characters during the fmv sequences saying "We dont leave marines behind" ok I get it!)- Invisible barriers in areas where you could possibly investigate- Scripted Events and Animations for certain pressing/pulling switches- Poor/annoying boss fights- Poor AI - Not scary! :(General Zod's Final VerdictIt is a♥♥♥♥♥♥game but! best it to get it on a sale ie 75% or even better 90% off if it ever happens, the game is a half baked attempted at an Aliens game but just misses the mark completely. A:CM does deliver well on the marine weapons which are fun to use and I think thats it's only selling point it has now, I would have priased the weapons more but the Smartgun has been deprived from the marine's arsenal as a special weapon which is a real shame, would have loved to have used it more! There are some scary moments(sewers level) but only lasts for about 15mins after that its gone.You are better off playing AvP2010 as the graphics on that are a lot better and the Xenos on there will give you a better fight.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 8, 2014
												Ok so Aliens: Colonial Marines conception was a bit rocky, we had the years of would it? wont it?  yes? no? then we had a demo that for all intents and purposes burned that acidic hole through our hearts... like we always wanted from an Aliens game... Yes Aliens: CM was THE game to make us feell like Hicks, Hudson, Ripley, Vasquez etc.... and yes I know we got a burn that wasn't as acidic as we all hoped for... the game wasn't as it was supposed to be on the demo... but tell me what game truly is? and with SEGA involved are you really that surprised? but none the less... this game despite such a shady birth... and homecoming...this game does actually bring things to the franchise that, other Aliens games do not...Attention to detail for one.... the level design, especially on the Sulaco and LV-426 for example, the detail is phenomenal, you can actually walk round the level and recognize parts of where Ripley, Newt and the Marines were and where Hudson took his final stand before being ripped under the floor... you can see the previously welded doors where they made their escape... everything left where it was when they left... even on the Sulaco... the downed Dropship, abandoned APC, and Crawler..... its all there... yes there are bugs (pardon the pun) but there is a lot of enjoyment this game has to offer too.. and a lot of support by the community.. you may have heard "oh dont play this game you can fight hoards of Xeno's without worrying about taking damage.... it just doesn't feel difficult!"ok I hear that and raise you the SurvivalV2 mod, found here http://www.moddb.com/mods/aliens-survival-experience/downloads/survival-experience-v2 changes the pulse rifle to 95 rounds fully auto... use clip extension to put to 99, adds movie damage and changes fire rate & damage for Smart Gun and Sentry Guns, also adds Xeno damage consistant with Movies... ACID actually hurts.... no health regen... get spat on or someone shoots a xeno near u and it explodes next to u your armour is gone... more details found on the site....the Bug Hunt mode also a great addition, and a missed opportunity to be fair, but still a great addition... but yes I know you are going to complain about the Mercs, again simple solution turn em off... http://www.moddb.com/mods/aliens-survival-experience/downloads/no-more-mercs-lurkers-onlyno-dino-headsweldthis mod removes the Mercs, allows the lurkers, tries to take off the dino head xeno's but doesn't.. no mercs part and weld/cut doors....can create choke points with this which can add more intensity to the games... also there is a mod to replace the Mercs with Boilers.... all these and the graphics mods available all done via the modding community... and might I add without the SDK so far... you have to admit once you try or even retry the game that they add far far more and make the experience so much more I highly recommend giving this game a chance... as many reviews or oppinions around will be so final, and damning do your selves a favour... try it your selves if you dont want to pay much for a copy try it on http://www.play.com/Games/PC/4-/5233983/Aliens-Colonial-Marines-Limited-Edition/Product.html?searchstring=aliens+colonial+marines&searchsource=0&searchtype=gameall&urlrefer=search&strefer=gameall&searchfilters=s%7baliens+colonial+marines%7d%2bc%7b362%7d%2b at least you can say what's a couple of £ happy hunting people :)

												Cleared this on hardened offline, would have been more enjoyable if the game was polished.-The lack of godframes is astonishing, get killed without even being able to do anything.-All weapons aside the shotguns are useless, accuracy is undeniably bad on every rifles aside the semi-auto and even this one fails at time.-AI on your team would be okay if their weapons could do actual damage. number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 18, 2014
												I've had my heart broken several times in my life. Once, on Christmas Day 1989, I eagerly ran downstairs and gasped at the sight of what was clearly a crudely but lovingly wrapped skateboard. A skateboard that I had wanted ever since I had seen Marty McFly cruise through the streets of Hill Valley as a stowaway behind an unsuspecting SUV driver. A skateboard with a custom deck, with artwork that would cause my fellow skaters to shout "rad". A skateboard whose wheels would send me gliding across the streets as I headed for the nearest half-pipe. A skateboard of majestical proportion.I grabbed it, and with shaking hands and a heart beating against my chest, I tore that festive wrapping as hard as I could. Through an intricate web of sticky tape, ribbon and ever expanding wrapping paper, I dug through. Years later, I wondered that this is what Andy in The Shawshank Rdemption must have felt like as he dragged hinself through the tunnels. My own redemption was in sight. My prize was near. Finally, the last shred of packaging fell away to the floor. And there it was... a plastic skateboard from the local store. With stiff plastic wheels. And a picture of a clown on the deck. That's what playing Aliens: Colonial Marines felt like.
